hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשִׁים וָשֵׁשׁ כָּרֵיתוֹת בְּתוֹרָה: הַבָּא עַל הָאֵם, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת אָב, וְעַל הַכַּלָּה, הַבָּא עַל הַזָּכוּר, וְעַל הַבְּהֵמָה, וְאִשָּׁה הַמְּבִיאָה הַבְּהֵמָה עָלֶיהָ, הַבָּא עַל אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ, וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אָבִיו, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, וְעַל אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אִמּוֹ, וְעַל הַנִּדָּה.
human_translation: thirty-six in the Torah excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ]. One who engages in sexual intercourse with mother; or with the wife of father, or with daughter-in-law. who engages in intercourse with male [ hazekhur ], or with an animal; and a woman who brings an animal upon her one who engages in intercourse with a woman and her daughter, or a married woman. one who engages in intercourse with his sister, or with his father’s sister, or with his mother’s sister, or with his wife’s sister, or with his brother’s wife, or with the wife of his father’s brother, or with the wife of his mother’s brother, or with a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Thirty-six transgressions in the Torah. One who engages in relations with his mother, with his father's wife, or with his daughter-in-law; one who engages in relations with a male, with an animal, or with a woman who brings an animal upon herself; one who engages in relations with a woman and her daughter, with a man's wife, with his sister, with his father's sister, with his mother's sister, with his wife's sister, with his brother's wife, with his father's brother's wife, with his mother's brother's wife, or with a menstruating woman.

hebrew_text: וְהַמְגַדֵּף, וְעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְהַנּוֹתֵן מִזַּרְעוֹ לַמּוֹלֶךְ, וּבַעַל אוֹב, וּמְחַלֵּל שַׁבָּת, וְטָמֵא שֶׁאָכַל קֹדֶשׁ, וְהַבָּא אֶל הַמִּקְדָּשׁ טָמֵא, וְהָאוֹכֶל חֵלֶב, וָדָם, וְנוֹתָר, וּפִיגּוּל, וְהַשּׁוֹחֵט, וּמַעֲלֶה בַּחוּץ,
human_translation: And One who blasphemes and worships an idol, and one who gives of his children to Molekh and a necromancer, and desecrates Shabbat. And one who is ritually impure who ate sacrificial and one who enters the Temple ritually impure; and one who eats fat, or blood, or left over from an offering after the time allotted for its consumption [ notar ], or an offering that was sacrificed with the intent to consume it after its designated time [ piggul ]; and one who slaughters and offers up outside
llm_translation: The one who blasphemes, and one who worships idols, and one who gives his seed to Molech, and a necromancer, and one who desecrates the Sabbath, and one who became impure and ate holy things, and one who enters the Temple while impure, and one who eats forbidden fats, blood, leftovers, or disqualified sacrifices, and one who slaughters, and one who ascends the altar outside the Temple.

hebrew_text: וְהָאוֹכֵל חָמֵץ בַּפֶּסַח, וְהָאוֹכֵל וְהָעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וְהַמְפַטֵּם אֶת הַשֶּׁמֶן, וְהַמְפַטֵּם אֶת הַקְּטֹרֶת, וְהַסָּךְ אֶת הַשֶּׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה. וְהַפֶּסַח וְהַמִּילָה מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: And One who eats leavened bread on Passover, and one who eats or performs labor on Yom Kippur. And one who blends the oil and one who blends the incense and one who applies the anointing oil And the Paschal offering and the circumcision, positive mitzvot.
llm_translation: The one who eats leaven on Passover, and the one who eats and performs labor on Yom Kippur, and one who smoothes the oil, and one who smoothes the incense, and one who anoints with the anointing oil. And Passover and circumcision are positive commandments.

hebrew_text: עַל אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת, וְעַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת, וְעַל לֹא הוֹדַע שֶׁלָּהֶם אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, חוּץ מִן הַמְטַמֵּא מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא בְּעוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: For these liable karet for its intentional and a sin offering for its unwitting And for their unknown a provisional guilt offering, except for one who defiles the Temple, or its consecrated items because he is to a sliding-scale the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: On these sins one is liable for intentional violation - excision, and for unintentional violation - sin offering, and for their unknowing violation - a guilt offering is pending, except for one who renders impure the sanctuary and its holy items, because it involves ascending and descending, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַמְגַדֵּף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תּוֹרָה אַחַת יִהְיֶה לָכֶם לָעֹשֶׂה בִּשְׁגָגָה״, יָצָא מְגַדֵּף שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: even the one who blasphemes, as it is stated “You shall have one law for him who performs the action unwittingly” excluding blasphemes, as he does not perform an action
llm_translation: The sages say: Even the blasphemer, as it is stated: "One Torah shall be for you, for one who does something unintentionally" (Numbers 15:29), excludes the blasphemer who does not perform an action.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִנְיָינָא לְמָה לִי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁאִם עֲשָׂאָן כּוּלָּן בְּהֶעְלֵם אַחַת – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: Why do I tally Rabbi Yoḥanan said: that if one performed all of them in one lapse of awareness, liable for each and every one,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, minyana, l'mah li?" Amar Rabbi Yochanan: "She'im asa'an kull'an b'he'elem achad - chayav al kol achad v'achad." English translation: "Gemara, what is the practical application for me?" Rabbi Yochanan said: "That if one performs all of them in one concealment - he is liable for each and every one."

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, הָא דִּתְנַן: אֲבוֹת מְלָאכוֹת אַרְבָּעִים חָסֵר אַחַת, מִנְיָינָא לְמָה לִי? שֶׁאִם עֲשָׂאָן כּוּלָּן בְּהֶעְלֵם אַחַת – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: And furthermore, that which we learned primary categories of labor forty-less-one; why do I tally that if one performed all of in one lapse of awareness liable for each and every one.
llm_translation: And come, this that we learned: the forty less one primary labors, what is the count for me? That if one performs them all in one heave offering - liable for each and every one.

hebrew_text: תּוּ, הָא דִּתְנַן: אַרְבָּעָה מְחוּסְּרֵי כַּפָּרָה, מִנְיָינָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: furthermore, that which we learned four who have not yet an atonement Why do I tally
llm_translation: Behold, that which we learned: Four who are lacking atonement, what is the count for them?

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, דְּאָמַר: חֲמִשָּׁה הָוֵי, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: גֵּר מְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה עַד שֶׁיִּזָּרֵק דָּם עָלָיו, אַהָכִי תְּנָא אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: to exclude of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, who says there are five As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: A convert one who has not yet an atonement until the priest sprinkles blood on his for this teaches four,
llm_translation: To go out from Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, as he said: Five should be, as it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: A convert is in need of atonement until blood is sprinkled upon him. Thus it was taught: Four.

hebrew_text: תּוּ, הָא דִּתְנַן: אַרְבָּעָה מְבִיאִין עַל הַזָּדוֹן כִּשְׁגָגָה, מִנְיָינָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: furthermore, that which we learned four who bring for the intentional as the unwitting Why do I tally
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tu, ha di'tnan: arba'a mevi'in al hazadon kishgaga, minyana lema li?" English translation: "Come and hear, as we have learned: Four bring upon intentional transgression unwittingly, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן – לֹא נִיתָּן זְדוֹנָהּ לְכַפָּרָה, אַהָכִי תְּנָא אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: to exclude of Rabbi Shimon. As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: The intentional oath on a deposit is not given for atonement for this teaches four,
llm_translation: To go out from Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught, Rabbi Shimon says: The oath of the deposit - its intentional violation does not allow for atonement, as it was taught by another Sage: Four.

hebrew_text: תּוּ, הָא דִּתְנַן: חֲמִשָּׁה מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד עַל עֲבֵירוֹת הַרְבֵּה, מִנְיָינָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: furthermore, that which we learned five bring one offering for several transgressions, Why do I tally
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tu, ha di'tnan: chamisha mevi'in korban echad al aveirot harbeh, minyana lema li?" English translation: "Come and hear: Five bring one offering for many sins, what is the count for?"

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנָא סֵיפָא: נָזִיר אִם נִטְמָא טוּמְאוֹת הַרְבֵּה, וּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּגוֹן דְּאִיטַּמִּי בִּשְׁבִיעִי וְחָזַר וְנִטְמָא בַּשְּׁבִיעִי, וּמַנִּי? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: נְזִירוּת דְּטָהֲרָה, מִן שְׁבִיעִי הוּא דְּחָיֵיל עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: because wants to teach the latter clause: a nazirite if he became ritually impure with several of ritual impurity. And you find this, where he became ritually impure on the seventh and, again became ritually impure on the seventh And whose It is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who says the naziriteship of purity, takes effect on from seventh
llm_translation: Due to the fact that he wants to teach the conclusion: A Nazirite, if he became impure with severe impurities, and she forgot, for example, that he became impure on the seventh day and then returned and became impure on the seventh day, and what is the law? It is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: The purity of his Naziriteship, it is from the seventh day that it strengthens upon him.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי תֵּאמַר רַבִּי הִיא, כֵּיוָן דִּנְזִירוּת דְּטׇהֳרָה עַד שְׁמִינִי לָא חָיְילָא עֲלֵיהּ, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: As, if you say Rabbi Since that naziriteship of purity does not take effect on until eighth how can you find these
llm_translation: If one were to say, "It is according to Rabbi," since the Nazirite vow of purity does not apply until the eighth day, how does one find support for it?

hebrew_text: אִי דְּנִטְמָא בִּשְׁבִיעִי וְחָזַר וְנִטְמָא בִּשְׁבִיעִי – כּוּלַּהּ חֲדָא טוּמְאָה אֲרִיכְתָּא הִיא.
human_translation: If who became ritually impure on the seventh and, again became ritually impure on the seventh all these are long ritual impurity.
llm_translation: If he became impure on the seventh day and then became impure on the seventh day - it is all considered one prolonged impurity.

hebrew_text: וְאִי דְּנִטְמָא בַּשְּׁמִינִי וְחָזַר וְנִטְמָא בַּשְּׁמִינִי, כֵּיוָן דְּיָצָא בְּשָׁעָה הָרְאוּיָה לְהָבִיא בָּהּ קׇרְבָּן, חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא.
human_translation: And if who became ritually impure on the eighth and, again became ritually impure on the eighth Since he left at an appropriate time to bring offering, liable for each and every Rather, conclude from it is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And if he became impure on the eighth day and then became impure again on the eighth day, once he has gone out at the appropriate time to bring a sacrifice, he is liable for each and every one! Rather, learn from it that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds this way.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי וּמַאי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְקִדַּשׁ אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא״ – בְּיוֹם הֲבָאַת קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּיוֹם תִּגְלַחְתּוֹ.
human_translation: What Rabbi and what Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? As it is taught and he shall sanctify his head that same day” to the day of the bringing of his offerings, the statement of Rabbi And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says to the day of his shaving,
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi and what is the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? As it was taught: "And he shall consecrate his head on that day" - on the day of bringing his sacrifices, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: on the day of his shaving.

hebrew_text: תּוּ, הָא דִּתְנַן: חֲמִשָּׁה מְבִיאִין קׇרְבַּן עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד, מִנְיָינָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: furthermore, that which we learned five bring a sliding-scale offering, Why do I tally
llm_translation: Behold, that which we learned: Five bring the offering of a burnt offering and descend, what is the source for this?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: נָשִׂיא כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן. חֲמִשָּׁה לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר: נָשִׂיא מֵבִיא שָׂעִיר.
human_translation: because as the latter clause teaches, king is like five, to exclude of Rabbi Eliezer, who says a king brings a goat,
llm_translation: From the fact that it teaches in the latter part: "A leader, like them." Five to exempt from the ruling of Rabbi Eliezer, who said: "A leader brings a he-goat."

hebrew_text: תּוּ, הָא דִּתְנַן: אַרְבָּעָה אֲבוֹת נְזִיקִין, מִנְיָנָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: furthermore, that which we learned four primary categories of damage: Why do I tally
llm_translation: "Come and hear what we learned: Four primary categories of damages, what is the count for me?"

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, דְּאָמַר: שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר אֲבוֹת נְזִיקִין הֵן. וּלְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, מִנְיָינָא לְמָה לִי? לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, דְּאָמַר: עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה אֲבוֹת נְזִיקִין. וּלְרַבִּי חִיָּיא מִנְיָנָא לְמָה לִי? לְאַפּוֹקֵי מָסוֹר וּמְפַגֵּל.
human_translation: to exclude of Rabbi Oshaya, who says There are thirteen primary categories of damage. And according to Rabbi Oshaya, why do I tally to exclude of Rabbi Ḥiyya, who says: There are twenty-four primary categories of damage. And according to Rabbi Ḥiyya, why do I tally to exclude an informer and who renders piggul ,
llm_translation: To investigate from Rabbi Oshaya, who said: "Thirteen fathers of damages they are." And for Rabbi Oshaya, what is the source? To investigate from Rabbi Chiya, who said: "Twenty-four fathers of damages." And for Rabbi Chiya, what is the source? To investigate from Masor and Mefaggel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: שֶׁאִם עֲשָׂאָן כּוּלָּן בְּהֶעְלֵם אַחַת – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: The Master said that if he performed all of them, in one lapse of awareness, liable for each and every one,
llm_translation: Master said: If one does them all in secret - he is liable for each and every one.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא פָּטוּר לִגְמָרֵי לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי כׇּל אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה מִכֹּל הַתּוֹעֵבֹת הָאֵלֶּה וְנִכְרְתוּ״. אֶלָּא אֵימָא: עֲבַר חֲדָא – נִתְחַיֵּיב חֲדָא, עֲבַר כּוּלְּהוּ בְּהֶעְלֵם אַחַת – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת!
human_translation: Granted, you cannot say entirely exempt, as it is written: “For whoever shall do any of these abominations, shall be cut off But say transgressed one he becomes liable one transgressed all of them in one lapse of awareness is liable only one
llm_translation: In truth, exempt completely you did not find, you said, as it is written: "For whoever does any of these abominations shall be cut off." Rather say: If one transgressed - he is liable for one, if he transgressed all in one concealment - he is only liable for one!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְכָךְ יָצְאָה כָּרֵת בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ – לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: for this karet with one’s sister singled out to separate
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Therefore, karet came out in his sister - to divide.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי, אֵימָא: אֲחוֹתוֹ דִּפְרַט קְרָא – נִיחַיַּיב חֲדָא עֲלַהּ, וְכוּלָּן כֵּיוָן דִּבְהֶעְלֵם אַחַת – לָא נִיחַיַּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת!
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye objects to this: say: his sister, which the verse detailed he becomes liable one for it, but all once in one lapse of awareness he becomes liable only one
llm_translation: Rav Bibi son of Abbaye strongly challenges her: say: his sister that Scripture specifies - he is liable one offering, and all since they are concealed one - not liable except one!

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי, מִי לֵית לֵיהּ הֲדָא דְּתַנְיָא: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהָיָה בַּכְּלָל וְיָצָא מִן הַכְּלָל לְלַמֵּד, לֹא לְלַמֵּד עַל עַצְמוֹ יָצָא אֶלָּא לְלַמֵּד עַל הַכְּלָל כּוּלּוֹ יָצָא.
human_translation: And according to Rav Beivai bar Abaye, does he not that which is taught Any matter that was included in a generalization, but was singled out to teach was singled out to teach not about itself but to teach about the entire generalization.
llm_translation: And for Rav Bibi son of Abbaye, who does not have this that is taught: Anything that was included and went out from the inclusion to teach, not to teach on its own went out, but to teach on the entire inclusion went out.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? ״וְהַנֶּפֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר תֹּאכַל בָּשָׂר וְגוֹ׳״, וַהֲלֹא שְׁלָמִים בִּכְלָל הַקֳּדָשִׁים הָיוּ. לָמָּה יָצְאוּ?
human_translation: How so? “But the soul that eats of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings But weren’t peace offerings included in the sacrificial why, they singled out
llm_translation: "How so? 'And the soul that will eat flesh, etc.' But weren't peace offerings included in the category of holy items? Why were they excluded?"

hebrew_text: לְהַקִּישׁ אֲלֵיהֶן: מָה שְּׁלָמִים שֶׁהֵן קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ וְחַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן – אַף כׇּל שֶׁהֵן קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן, יָצְאוּ קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת!
human_translation: to juxtapose to them, Just as peace offerings that they are consecrated for the altar and liable for them so too, all that is consecrated for the altar, liable for them excludes consecrated for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: To compare them: Just as the Peace Offerings, which are sacrifices of the altar and one is liable for them - so too, all sacrifices of the altar, one is liable for them, except for the sacrifices of the Temple Chamber!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב בִּיבִי: בַּר מִינַּהּ. לָאו מִי אָמְרַתְּ הָתָם יָצְאוּ קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת?
human_translation: Rav Beivai said to apart from that didn’t you say there excludes consecrated for Temple maintenance?
llm_translation: Rav Bevai said to him: "Son of a heretic." Did you not say there that the consecrated items of the Temple courtyard have exited?

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי: מָה אֲחוֹתוֹ מְיוּחֶדֶת שֶׁהִיא עֶרְוָה וְאֵין לָהּ הֶיתֵּר בְּחַיֵּי אוֹסְרָהּ, אַף כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לָהּ הֶיתֵּר בְּחַיֵּי אוֹסְרָהּ, יָצְאָה אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ הֶיתֵּר בְּחַיֵּי בַעֲלָהּ!
human_translation: Here too, just as one’s sister is unique that she is a forbidden relative who cannot be permitted during the life of who prohibits her, so too, any who cannot be permitted in the life of who prohibits her. excludes a married woman, who can be permitted in the life of her husband,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Talmudic text: Here it is taught: Just as his sister, who is forbidden and has no permission in his lifetime, if he marries her, his wife, who has no permission in his lifetime, she is permitted to go out from her husband!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָה וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי כׇּל אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה מִכֹּל הַתּוֹעֵבֹת וְגוֹ׳״, הוֹאִיל וְכָךְ הִקִּישׁ הוּא, הוּקְשׁוּ כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת כּוּלָּן לַאֲחוֹתוֹ: מָה אֲחוֹתוֹ חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, אַף כֹּל חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yona said and some say Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua: The verse states: “For whoever shall do any of these abominations, Since this is a juxtaposition, all of those with whom relations are forbidden are juxtaposed to one’s sister, Just as one’s sister liable for her alone, so too, all liable for alone.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yonah, and some say Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua, said the verse: "For whoever commits any of these abominations, etc." Since he has made this comparison, all the forbidden relationships are all liable to his sister: Just as his sister is liable to him by herself, so too all are liable to him by themselves.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּאָמַר: חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת בִּכְלָל הָיוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצְאָה כָּרֵת בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ – לְדוּנָהּ בְּכָרֵת וְלֹא בְּמַלְקוֹת,
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Yitzḥak, who says: those liable karet were included in And why was karet one’s sister singled out to judge it, of karet and not of lashes.
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Yitzchak who said: Those liable to karet were included, and why did karet come out in his sister - to judge her with karet and not with lashes.

hebrew_text: לְחַלֵּק מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״וְּאֶל אִשָּׁה בְּנִדַּת טוּמְאָתָהּ לֹא תִקְרַב״ – לְחַלֵּק עַל כׇּל אִשָּׁה וְאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: From where does to separate He derives from “And you shall not approach a woman as long as she is impure by her menstruation” to separate for each and every woman
llm_translation: To divide a portion for him? It was derived for him from "And a woman in her impurity shall not approach" - to divide upon every woman and woman.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי, תִּיפּוֹק לְהוּ מִ״וְּאֶל אִשָּׁה בְּנִדַּת טוּמְאָתָהּ״! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. אֶלָּא כָּרֵת דַּאֲחוֹתוֹ לְמַאי אָתָא? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְחַלֵּק עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ וְעַל אֲחוֹת אָבִיו וְעַל אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, let them also derive from “And a woman as long as she is impure by her menstruation.” Yes, it is indeed so. But for what karet with regard to one’s sister come? require to separate with his sister, and with his father’s sister, and with his mother’s sister,
llm_translation: The sages said, "Let him come out of 'and he shall not defile himself with his sister, a woman in her menstrual impurity'!" This is not what they said. Rather, what is the case of one whose sister comes? He needs to distinguish between his sister, his father's sister, and his mother's sister.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי לְמָה לְהוּ לְחַלֵּק? הֲרֵי שֵׁמוֹת מוּחְלָקִין וַהֲרֵי גּוּפִים מוּחְלָקִים! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: לְחַלֵּק עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אָבִיו וְשֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Why to separate these Aren’t they separate categories and aren’t they separate bodies, Rather, say to separate with his sister who is his father’s sister and who is his mother’s sister,
llm_translation: These, why to them to divide? Behold names are divided and behold bodies are divided! Rather say: to divide regarding his sister who is the sister of his father and who is the sister of his mother.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, הָא מִילְּתָא מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִן סֵיפָא דִּקְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֶרְוַת אֲחֹתוֹ גִּלָּה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak, from where does he this matter? He derives from the latter clause of the verse, as it is written: “He has uncovered his sister’s nakedness”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak, this matter indicates to him? It emerges to him from the end of the verse of Scripture, as it is written: "He uncovered his sister's nakedness."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, ״אֲחֹתוֹ״ דְּסֵיפָא דִּקְרָא מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ
human_translation: And the Rabbis, “his sister” in the latter clause of the verse, what do they do with it? They require
llm_translation: The Sages: "His sister" in the latter part of the verse, what does it do for him? It is needed for him.

hebrew_text: לַאֲחוֹתוֹ שֶׁהִיא בַּת אָבִיו וּבַת אִמּוֹ, לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין.
human_translation: to his sister who is his father’s daughter and his mother’s daughter, to say that one does not administer punishment on inference.
llm_translation: To his sister who is the daughter of his father and the daughter of his mother, to say that they are not punished by the law.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, סָבַר: עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: יָלֵיף עוֹנֶשׁ מֵאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak, maintains one administers punishment on inference. And if you wish, say derives punishment from warning,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak holds: punishments come from the law. And if you wish, say: punishment is more severe than warning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא שְׁנֵי לָאוִין וְכָרֵת אֶחָד – חַלֵּק חַטָּאת בֵּינֵיהֶן. וּמַאי הִיא? מְפַטֵּם וְסָךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״עַל בְּשַׂר אָדָם לֹא יִיסָךְ וּבְמַתְכֻּנְתּוֹ וְגוֹ׳״, כָּרֵת אֶחָד, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר יִרְקַח כָּמֹהוּ וַאֲשֶׁר יִתֵּן מִמֶּנּוּ עַל זָר וְנִכְרַת מֵעַמָּיו״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Hoshaya says: Anywhere you find two prohibitions, and one karet divide sin offering between them, And what is blends the anointing oil and applies as it is written: “Upon the flesh of man it shall not be applied, according to its composition” one karet as it is written: “Whoever compounds any like it, or whoever puts any of it upon a stranger, he shall be cut off from his people”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Hoshaya said: In any place where you find two prohibitions and one incurs karet - divide the sin-offering between them. And what is it? A fine and a penalty, as it is written: "He shall not pour oil upon it, nor put frankincense thereon" - one incurs karet, as it is written: "That makes any like it, to smell thereof, he shall be cut off from his people."

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּלָאוִין מוּחְלָקִים, כָּרֵת דַּאֲחוֹתוֹ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: But once separate prohibitions why do I karet that the Merciful One writes with regard to one’s sister,
llm_translation: And when they are not divided, the punishment of his sister, as it is written, "Why should it be done to me, my Lord?"

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק – כִּדְאִית לֵיהּ, לְרַבָּנַן מִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לוֹמַר, שֶׁאֵין עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין! לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, מַפֵּיק לֵיהּ לְחַיֵּיב עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אָבִיו וְשֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: according to Rabbi Yitzḥak, per his According to the Rabbis, they require to say that one does not administer punishment on inference. According to Rabbi Yitzḥak, he derives to deem liable with his sister who is his father’s sister and who is his mother’s sister.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yitzchak - as it was taught to him, the sages ask him: to say, that there is no punishment from the law! To Rabbi Yitzchak, he brings out to obligate for his sister who is the sister of his father and the sister of his mother.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? דְּנָפְקָא לְהוֹן מִן ״אֲחֹתוֹ״ דְרֵישָׁא. וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק? סָבַר ״אֲחוֹתוֹ״ דְרֵישָׁא אוֹרְחֵיהּ דִּקְרָא הִיא, וּמַפֵּיק לְחַלֵּק מֵ״אֲחֹתוֹ״ דְּסֵיפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא, לְחַלֵּק עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אָבִיו וְשֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, that they derive it from “his sister” in the first clause And Rabbi Yitzḥak holds “his sister” in the first clause, it is the manner of the verse And he derives from “his sister” in the latter clause to separate with his sister who is his father’s sister and who is his mother’s sister.
llm_translation: The sages? They derived from "his sister" in the beginning. And Rabbi Yitzchak? He holds that "his sister" in the beginning is the way of the verse, and he deduces to differentiate from "his sister" in its later part of the verse, to differentiate between his sister who is the sister of his father and the sister of his mother.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הַמְפַטֵּם אֶת הַשֶּׁמֶן, הַמְפַטֵּם אֶת הַקְּטֹרֶת, וְהַסָּךְ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: We learn as well: And one who blends the oil, and one who blends the incense, and one who applies the anointing oil
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, "We also learned: One who prepares the oil, one who prepares the incense, and one who pours the anointing oil."

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי דְּתַנְיָא הַמְפַטֵּם אֶת הַקְּטֹרֶת בְּמִיצְעָא? לָאו הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: מָה קְטֹרֶת לָאו בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְחַיָּיבִים עָלֶיהָ כָּרֵת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ – אַף מְפַטֵּם שֶׁמֶן וְסָךְ נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּלָאו בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ – חַיָּיבִים עָלָיו בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ?
human_translation: Why do I to teach One who blends the incense, in the middle, not this teaches us: Just as incense an independent prohibition and one is liable karet for it by itself, so too, who blends oil and who applies since an independent prohibition, one is liable karet for by itself,
llm_translation: Why do I need that it teaches: one who prepares the incense in the middle? No, this is what it implies to us: Just as the incense is not by itself and one is liable for it separately, so too, one who prepares oil and frankincense, since they are not by themselves, one is liable for them separately.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנָא פִּיטּוּמִין בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי – נִיתְנִהוּ אֵיפוֹךְ: הַמְפַטֵּם אֶת הַקְּטֹרֶת, וְהַמְפַטֵּם אֶת הַשֶּׁמֶן, וְהַסָּךְ שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה, אַמַּאי פַּלְּגֵיהּ לְשֶׁמֶן? לָאו הָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּיֵשׁ חִילּוּק חַטָּאוֹת בֵּינֵיהֶן? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And if you would say it wants to teach blending together, let teach reverse One who blends the incense, and one who blends the oil, and one who applies the anointing oil. Why divide the oil not this teaches us that there is a separation between sin offerings? Conclude from
llm_translation: And if you will say that he wants to mix the incense with the oil together - turn them over: one who prepares the incense, and one who prepares the oil, and one who pours the anointing oil, why does he separate the oil? Isn't it that it is heard for us, that there is a distinction of sins between them? Learn from it.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל הַזָּכוּר. תַּנָּא בְּמַאי קָא חָשֵׁיב?
human_translation: who engages in intercourse with male According to what does tanna tally
llm_translation: The one who comes upon the male. It was taught: With what is he considered?

hebrew_text: אִי בְּגַבְרֵי – דַּל הָאִשָּׁה הַנִּרְבַּעַת, וּבָצְרָא לַהּ חֲדָא! אִי בִּנְשֵׁי קָחָשֵׁיב – דַּל מִינְּהוֹן הַבָּא עַל הַזָּכוּר וְעַל הַבְּהֵמָה, וּבָצְרִי לְהוּ תַּרְתֵּי!
human_translation: If by men, remove a woman who brings an animal upon her and one is lacking from If by women, remove from them who engages in intercourse with male or with an animal, and two are lacking from
llm_translation: If with men - poor is the woman who is violated, and a curse to her is one! If with women of snakes - poor is the one who comes upon a male and upon an animal, and a curse to them are two!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְעוֹלָם תַּנָּא גַּבְרֵי קָחָשֵׁיב, וְתָנֵי הָכִי: הַבָּא עַל הַזָּכוּר וְהֵבִיא זָכוּר עָלָיו, וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא, דְּאָמַר: חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Actually, tanna men. and teach like this: who engages in intercourse with male, and who brings male upon him And is Rabbi Yishmael, who says liable two
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Always teach the men of Kachashib, and he taught thus: "If one comes upon the male and brings the male upon him," and Rabbi Yishmael is the one who said: "He is liable for two."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי מְגַדֵּף בְּסֵיפֵיהּ, וּמוֹקְמִינַן לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא!
human_translation: But from that teaches in its latter clause blasphemes, and we interpret in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, the first clause also Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: And this, from the Mishnah: "And one who scoffs with his lips, and we establish for him like Rabbi Akiva." The beginning of the Mishnah is in the name of Rabbi Akiva!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, וּבְרֵישָׁא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: הַבָּא עַל הַזָּכוּר וְהֵבִיא זָכוּר עָלָיו, לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל דְּמַפֵּיק לֵיהּ מִתַּרְתֵּי קְרָאֵי, מִ״וְּאֶת זָכָר לֹא תִשְׁכַּב״, וּמִ״וְּלֹא יִהְיֶה קָדֵשׁ מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ – חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם,
human_translation: And if you would say is Rabbi Akiva, and with regard to the first clause he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, doesn’t Rabbi Abbahu say: who engages in intercourse with male, and who brings male upon him according to Rabbi Yishmael, who derives from two verses, from: “And you shall not lie with a man and from: “There shall not be a sodomite of the sons of Israel” liable two
llm_translation: And if you will say: It is Rabbi Akiva, and at first he held like Rabbi Ishmael, and Rabbi Abahu said: One who comes upon the male and brings the male upon him, according to Rabbi Ishmael who deduces it from two verses, "And with a male you shall not lie down" and "And he shall not be a sanctified one among the children of Israel" - he is liable for two.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, דְּמֵחַד קְרָא נָפֵיק לֵיהּ: ״אֶת זָכָר לֹא תִשְׁכַּב״, קְרִי בֵּיהּ: לֹא תִשָּׁכֵיב!
human_translation: according to Rabbi Akiva, he is liable only one as he derives from one verse: “You shall not lie [ tishkhav ] with a man,” read in Enable your being lain with [ tishakheiv ],
llm_translation: To Rabbi Akiva, he is liable only once, as a verse comes out for him: "You shall not lie with a male," read it as: You shall not lie down!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: רֵישָׁא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וּבִמְגַדֵּף סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אִי הָכִי, נִיתְנֵי נָמֵי: הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה, וְהֵבִיא בְּהֵמָה עָלָיו!
human_translation: Rather, the first clause Rabbi Yishmael, and with regard to blasphemes he holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. If so, let also teach One who copulates with an animal, and who brings an animal upon him
llm_translation: Rather: The beginning, Rabbi Yishmael, and in blasphemy he thought like Rabbi Akiva. If so, let us say: One who comes upon an animal, and brings an animal upon him!

hebrew_text: הָא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה וְהֵבִיא בְּהֵמָה עָלָיו, אַף לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, דְּכִי כְּתִיב קְרָא – בְּגַבְרֵי כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Didn’t Abaye say: one who copulates with an animal, and who brings an animal upon him even according to Rabbi Yishmael he is liable to only one as when the verse: is written, it is written with regard to men,
llm_translation: Here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text: הָא - This אָמַר - said אַבָּיֵי - Abbaye הַבָּא - one who comes עַל - upon הַבְּהֵמָה - the animal וְהֵבִיא - and brought בְּהֵמָה - an animal עָלָיו - upon it אַף - also לְרַבִּי - to Rabbi יִשְׁמָעֵאל - Yishmael אֵינוֹ - is not חַיָּיב - liable אֶלָּא - except אַחַת - one דְּכִי - as כְּתִיב - it is written קְרָא - in the verse בְּגַבְרֵי - in the men כְּתִיב - it is written

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אָמַר: תַּנָּא תְּנִי שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשָׁלֹשׁ חַטָּאוֹת, וּתְנִי שָׁלֹשׁ כָּרֵיתוֹת, לְסַיּוֹמִינְהוּ בְּכָרֵיתוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rav: tanna teaches thirty-three sin offerings, and he teaches three karet to complete with karet .
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, from the name of Rav, said: A Tanna taught: Teach thirty-three sins, and teach three excisions, to conclude them with excisions.

hebrew_text: דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: פֶּסַח וּמִילָה בְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה – פֶּסַח וּמִילָה אַמַּאי קָתָנֵי לְהוּ?
human_translation: As teaches the latter clause: Paschal offering and circumcision, positive mitzvot. Why teach Paschal offering and circumcision?
llm_translation: The end teaches: Pesach and circumcision in the positive commandment - Pesach and circumcision, why does it teach them?

hebrew_text: וְאִיתֵּימָא לְאֵיתוֹיֵי קׇרְבָּן עֲלֵיהוֹן, מִי מַיְיתֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: הוּקְּשָׁה כָּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״תּוֹרָה אַחַת יִהְיֶה לָכֶם לָעוֹשֶׂה בִּשְׁגָגָה. וְהַנֶּפֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר תַּעֲשֶׂה בְּיָד רָמָה״ –
human_translation: And if you say to one brings an offering for them, does one bring But isn’t it taught The entire Torah is juxtaposed to idolatry, as it is written: “You shall have one law [ torah ] for him that does unwittingly. But the soul that does with a high hand,
llm_translation: And it was said in response to the question of bringing a sacrifice for them, who brings it? And it was taught: The entire Torah was made difficult for the sake of idol worship, as it is written: "One Torah shall be for you, for one who does something unintentionally, and the soul that does something with a high hand" -

hebrew_text: מָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה, אַף כֹּל שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: Just as idol worship Sit and refrain from action, so too, every sit and refrain from action,
llm_translation: What is avodah zarah, sit and do not do, so too all, sit and do not do!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: תְּנָא שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשָׁלֹשׁ חַטָּאוֹת מַאן דְּעָבְדִי בְּשׁוֹגֵג, וַהֲדַר תְּנָא שָׁלֹשׁ כָּרֵיתוֹת לְסַיּוֹמִינְהוּ לְכָרֵיתוֹת, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, isn’t it conclude from taught thirty-three sin offerings, one who acts unwittingly, and he taught three karet to complete karet ? Conclude from
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a valid deduction. A Tanna taught: Thirty-three unintentional sins. Whoever commits them inadvertently, and then the Tanna taught: Three excisions to complete them to excisions, that is a valid deduction.

hebrew_text: הַמְחַלֵּל אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. אָמְרִי: שַׁבָּת אַרְבָּעִים חָסֵר אַחַת הָוְויָין! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תַּנָּא שִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת, דְּלָא מִחַיַּיב אֶלָּא חֲדָא.
human_translation: one who desecrates Shabbat. say: Shabbat are forty-less-one, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: taught unwitting with regard to Shabbat, and intentional with regard to labors, that he is liable only one
llm_translation: The one who desecrates the Sabbath. They said: Sabbath forty less one is the liability! Rabbi Yochanan said: It was taught: Inadvertent violation of the Sabbath and intentional violation of labors, for he is liable only once.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״הֵנָּה״ שֶׁהִיא ״אַחַת״ – שִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת.
human_translation: As it is taught “them [ hena ],” which is “one [ aḥat ],” unwitting with regard to Shabbat but intentional with regard to labors,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Here" which is "one" - unintentional violation of Shabbat and intentional violation of labor.

hebrew_text: וְנִיתְנֵי זְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת, דְּמִחַיַּיב אַרְבָּעִים חָסֵר אַחַת!
human_translation: But let teach intentional with regard to Shabbat, but unwitting with regard to labors, that he is liable forty-less-one
llm_translation: And it is taught: intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional violation of labor, for which one is liable forty less one!

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְעָשָׂה מֵאַחַת מֵהֵנָּה״ – פְּעָמִים שֶׁחַיָּיב אַחַת עַל כּוּלָּן, וּפְעָמִים שֶׁחַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. דְּתַנְיָא: ״אַחַת״ שֶׁהִיא ״הֵנָּה״ – זְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת!
human_translation: as it is taught “And performs from one of them.” times when liable one for all and times when liable for each and every it is taught “one [ aḥat ],” which is “them [ hena ],” intentional with regard to Shabbat but unwitting with regard to labors,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And he shall make from one of them" - at times, one is liable for all of them, and at times, one is liable for each and every one. It was taught in a Baraita: "one" which is "from them" - intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional violation of labor.

hebrew_text: תְּנָא שִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ, דְּמֵחַטָּאת מִיהָא לָא מִיפְּטַר.
human_translation: tanna prefers unwitting with regard to Shabbat but intentional with regard to labors, that he is not exempt from at least sin offering,
llm_translation: The Tanna taught: Inadvertent violation of Shabbat and intentional violation of labor are preferable, for one is not exempt from a sin-offering.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא גַּבֵּי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דְּקָתָנֵי: שִׁגְגַת עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וּזְדוֹן עֲבוֹדוֹת.
human_translation: And likewise, you find with regard to idol worship, as he teaches unwitting with regard to idol worship, but intentional with regard to rites,
llm_translation: And so too you find regarding foreign worship, as it is taught: "Unintentional transgression of foreign worship and intentional transgressions of worship."

hebrew_text: שִׁגְגַת עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּעָמַד בְּבֵית עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְסָבַר בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת הִיא וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה – הֲרֵי לִבּוֹ לַשָּׁמַיִם!
human_translation: What are the circumstances unwittingly with regard to idol worship? If we say where he was standing in a house of idol worship and thought it was a synagogue and bowed his heart was toward Heaven
llm_translation: Mistake of foreign worship how its blood? Perhaps that stood in the house of foreign worship and thought it was a synagogue and prostrated - behold his heart to the heavens!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא דַּחֲזָא אִנְדְּרָטָא וּסְגֵיד לֵהּ? אִי דְּקַבְּלֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ בֶּאֱלוֹהַּ – בַּר סְקִילָה הוּא! וְאִי דְּלָא קַבְּלֵיהּ בֶּאֱלוֹהַּ – לָאו מִידֵּי הוּא!
human_translation: Rather, where he saw a statue [ andarta ] and bowed to it. If where he accepted upon himself as a god, he is subject to stoning, And if he did not accept upon himself as a god it is a meaningless
llm_translation: And rather, see a heretic and worship him? If he accepts upon himself the deity - he is like a stone! And if he does not accept upon himself the deity - he is not from anything!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מֵאַהֲבָה וּמִיִּרְאָה.
human_translation: Rather, out of love or out of fear
llm_translation: Rather, from love and from fear.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְאַבַּיֵּי דְּאָמַר חַיָּיב, אֶלָּא לְרָבָא דְּאָמַר פָּטוּר, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to Abaye, who says: liable But according to Rava, who says: exempt what can be said?
llm_translation: The Gemara left it according to Abbaye who said liable, rather according to Rava who said exempt, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּאוֹמֵר מוּתָּר, דְּעַד כָּאן לָא קָבָעֵי מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן אֶלָּא אִי חֲדָא מִחַיַּיב אִי תַּרְתֵּי מִחַיַּיב, אָבֵל מִיפְּטַר לִגְמָרֵי לָא בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, where one says permitted. As, Rava raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman only whether to deem liable one or whether to deem liable two But exempt him completely, not raise a dilemma before him.
llm_translation: Rather, in the case of saying "permitted," until this point, Rava does not establish his position from Rav Nachman. Rather, whether one is liable for one or two, but if he is completely exempt, he does not require his opinion.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּתִינוֹק שֶׁנִּשְׁבָּה לְבֵין הַגּוֹיִם, דְּיָדַע דַּאֲסִירָא עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְהָנֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה לָא יָדַע דַּאֲסִירָן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: You find in a child who was taken captive among the gentiles as knows that idol worship prohibited, but these idol worship not know that they are prohibited.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: One may find a child who was captured among the nations, who knows that idol worship is forbidden, yet these idolaters do not know that their idol worship is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּגָדוֹל – כְּגוֹן דְּקָא טָעֵי בְּהָדֵין קְרָא: ״לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן אִתִּי אֱלֹהֵי כֶסֶף וֵאלֹהֵי זָהָב וְגוֹ׳״ סָבַר: כִּי אֲסִירָא הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה דְּכֶסֶף וְזָהָב, אֲבָל דְּמִינֵי אַחֲרִינֵי שַׁרְיָא, דְּהַיְינוּ שִׁגְגַת עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וּזְדוֹן עֲבוֹדוֹת.
human_translation: And if you wish, say You even say with regard to an adult, where he erred with regard to this verse: “You shall not make with Me gods of silver and gods of gold, thinks when bowing prohibited to idol worship of silver or gold; but of other substances, permitted. And that is unwitting with regard to idol worship but intentional with regard to rites.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Even if you say in the case of an adult - for example, that he erred in this verse: "You shall not make with Me gods of silver, and gods of gold, etc." He might think: bowing down to foreign worship of silver and gold is prohibited, but other types of errors are permitted, meaning unintentional foreign worship and intentional foreign worship.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב בִּיבִי אָמַר: תַּנָּא שֵׁם שַׁבָּת וְשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה קָתָנֵי. מִמַּאי? מִדְּקָתָנֵי: הַבָּא עַל אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ וְעַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְהָא יֵשׁ בִּתּוֹ מֵאֲנוּסָתוֹ, דְּלָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said in the name of Rav Beivai: tanna teaches the category of Shabbat and the category of idol worship, From where From that teaches: One who engages in intercourse with a woman and her daughter, or with a married woman. But there is one’s daughter from the woman he raped, which does not teach.
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa son of Rav Ika, from the name of Rav Bibi, said: It was taught: The name of Shabbat and the name of Avodah Zarah are taught. From where? From what is taught: "If one has relations with a woman and her daughter, and with his wife, and his daughter is his wife's from a forced marriage, it is not taught about her!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: דִּכְתִיבָן קָתָנֵי, דְּלָא כְּתִיבָן לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: say teaches that are written does not teach that are not written
llm_translation: They said: for it is written in our Mishnah, that which is not written is not included.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא בַּת אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבַת בִּתָּהּ וּבַת בְּנָהּ, דִּכְתִיבָא, וְלָא קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא: שֵׁם אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ קָתָנֵי? הָכִי נָמֵי: שֵׁם שַׁבָּת וְשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: But there is one’s wife’s daughter, and the daughter of her daughter, and the daughter of her son, which are written and does not teach Rather, he teaches the category of a woman and her daughter, So too, he teaches the category of Shabbat and the category of idol worship.
llm_translation: And there is a case of his wife's daughter, and his granddaughter, and his great-granddaughter, as it is written, but it is not taught! Rather, the name of a wife and her daughter is taught? So too: the name of Shabbat and the name of idol worship is taught.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא רָמֵי דִּילֵיהּ אַדִּילֵיהּ: מִי אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי הָכִי, שֵׁם שַׁבָּת קָתָנֵי וְשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה קָתָנֵי? וְהָאִיתְּמַר: הַמַּעֲלֶה אֵבְרֵי פְּנִים בַּחוּץ – חַיָּיב, אֵבְרֵי חוּץ בַּחוּץ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, raises a contradiction of and of his: Did Rav Beivai bar Abaye say this, teaches the category of Shabbat and teaches the category of idol worship? But wasn’t it stated: One who offers up the limbs of inside outside liable limbs of outside outside liable.
llm_translation: Rav Acha son of Rav Ika raised a contradiction: Did Rav Bibi son of Abbaye say thus, that the name of Shabbat is mentioned and the name of idol worship is mentioned? But it was stated: One who carries limbs of an animal within a public domain - is liable, limbs outside in a public domain - is liable.

hebrew_text: וְקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: ״אִי הָכִי, הָא דִּתְנַן: שְׁלֹשִׁים וָשֵׁשׁ כָּרֵיתוֹת בְּתוֹרָה – תְּלָתִין וּשְׁבַע נִינְהוּ, דְּאִיכָּא הַמַּעֲלֶה וְהַמַּעֲלֶה!״ מַאי קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ? נִישְׁנֵי: שֵׁם הַעֲלָאָה קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: And Rav Beivai bar Abaye a difficulty: If so, that which we learned thirty-six in the Torah karet . They are thirty-seven, as there is one who offers up and one who offers up what difficult to him? Let him answer he teaches the category of offering up
llm_translation: The difficulty is for Rav Bibi son of Abbaye: "If so, but didn't we learn: 'Thirty-six curses in the Torah - thirty-seven of them, for there is the one that is repeated!'" What is the difficulty for him? Resolve it: The name of the repeated curse is stated!

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? שַׁבָּת וַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה תְּנָא יָתְהוֹן אַבִּינְכֵיהוֹן, גַּבַּי כָּרֵיתוֹת, דְּאִירְיָא, מְשַׁנֵּי: ״שֵׁם שַׁבָּת קָתָנֵי שֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה קָתָנֵי״, גַּבֵּי הַעֲלָאָה, מִי תְּנָא יָתְהוֹן בִּינְכֵיהוֹן דְּשַׁנִּי הָכִי?
human_translation: Are comparable? Shabbat and idol worship taught in their places [ abeinekheihon ], with regard to karet , where it is necessary answers teaches the category of Shabbat and teaches the category of idol worship, with regard to bringing up does teach them their place, that answer this
llm_translation: Who is similar? Shabbat and foreign labor. A Tanna taught: They are like their fathers, concerning the Karaites, who say, "The name of Shabbat is taught, the name of foreign labor is taught." Concerning the offering, who are the Tannaim among them who taught thus?

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מֵרַבִּי זֵירָא: שְׁתֵּי כָּרֵיתוֹת וְלָאו אֶחָד, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שׁוֹחֵט וְהֶעֱלָה קָאָמְרַתְּ? הָנֵי שְׁנֵי לָאוִין נִינְהוּ,
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised a dilemma before Rabbi Zeira: two karet and one prohibition what is said to him: Are you saying who slaughters and who offered up these are two prohibitions.
llm_translation: Requested of him Rabbi Yirmeya from Rabbi Zeira: "Two korbanot and not one, what is the law?" He said to him: "Are you speaking of slaughtering and offering?" Those are two separate matters.

hebrew_text: אִי לְמַאן דְּגָמַר מִגְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה – נֶאֱמַר כָּאן הֲבָאָה וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן הֲבָאָה,
human_translation: If according to the one who derives from a verbal analogy, it is stated here bringing: and it is stated there bringing:
llm_translation: If one who learns from a tradition is equal - it is said here "coming" and it is said there "coming."

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַלָּן לֹא עָנַשׁ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הִזְהִיר – אַף כָּאן לֹא עָנַשׁ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הִזְהִיר.
human_translation: just as there, did not punishment unless prohibited so too here, did not punishment unless prohibited
llm_translation: What is there, there was no punishment except if he warned - so too here, there is no punishment, except if he warned.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ בְּהֶיקֵּשׁ – אָמַר קְרָא: ״שָׁם תַּעֲלֶה... וְשָׁם תַּעֲשֶׂה״, מַקִּישׁ שְׁחִיטָה לְהַעֲלָאָה, מָה הַעֲלָאָה לֹא עָנַשׁ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הִזְהִיר, אַף שְׁחִיטָה לֹא עָנַשׁ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הִזְהִיר.
human_translation: according to the one who derives from a juxtaposition, the verse states: “There you shall sacrifice and there you shall do juxtaposes slaughtering, to offering up. just as there, did not punishment unless prohibited so too here, did not punishment unless prohibited
llm_translation: One who compares it to it with a difficulty - the verse says: "There you shall bring up... and there you shall do," comparing slaughtering to bringing up. Just as bringing up is not punished unless one was warned, so too slaughtering is not punished unless one was warned.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא שְׁתֵּי מִיתוֹת וְלָאו אֶחָד קָאָמְרַתְּ? מָה הִיא – אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי.
human_translation: Perhaps you are stating two death and one prohibition What is a necromancer, and a sorcerer,
llm_translation: Perhaps you are saying two deaths and not one? What is it - Ov and Yiddeoni.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ דְּהָא פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּתָנוּ גַּבֵּי סַנְהֶדְרִין: בַּעַל אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי, וְקַשְׁיָא לַן, וּמַאי שְׁנָא גַּבֵּי סְקִילוֹת תָּנֵי יִדְּעוֹנִי, וְגַבֵּי כָּרֵיתוֹת לָא תָּנֵי יִדְּעוֹנִי?
human_translation: said to as this a dispute between Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish. As taught in Sanhedrin A necromancer and a sorcerer, and a difficulty to us: And what is different with regard to stonings teaches a sorcerer, but does not teach a sorcerer with regard to karet ,
llm_translation: He said to him, for the dispute of Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish. As it was taught regarding the Sanhedrin: "A Baal Ov and a Yidoni, and they are difficult for us. And what is the difference regarding stoning? It teaches regarding a Yidoni, but it does not teach regarding Karet."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הוֹאִיל וּשְׁנֵיהֶם בְּלָאו אֶחָד נֶאֶמְרוּ. וְנֵימָא יִדְּעוֹנִי, וְלָא נֵימָא בַּעַל אוֹב! קָסָבַר: הוֹאִיל וּפָתַח הַכָּתוּב בְּבַעַל אוֹב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: since both were stated in one prohibition: And let say a sorcerer and let him not say a necromancer, maintains since the verse opened with a necromancer,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Since both of them were mentioned in one negative commandment. And it should have said "Yid'eoni" and not "Ba'al Ov!" He holds: Since the verse began with "Ba'al Ov."

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: הוֹאִיל וְאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן?
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: since it does not involve an action, And Reish Lakish, what is the reason he does not state in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan?
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Since it has no action. And Reish Lakish, what is the reason he did not say like Rabbi Yochanan?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דְּהָא חֲלוּקִין הֵן בְּמִיתוֹת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לְךָ: חֲלוּקָּה דְלָאו – הָוֵי חֲלוּקָּה, חֲלוּקָּה דְמִיתָה – לָא הָוְיָא חֲלוּקָּה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: because are divided with regard to death And Rabbi Yoḥanan say to you a division of a prohibition is a division a division of death is not a division
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Because they are distinctions in deaths. And Rabbi Yochanan said to you: A distinction that is not - is a distinction, a distinction that is of death - is not a distinction.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? קָסָבַר: מַאן תַּנָּא כָּרֵיתוֹת – רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר לָא בָּעִינַן מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is the reason he does not state in accordance with Reish Lakish, maintains: Who taught karet ? It is Rabbi Akiva, who says: An action is not required
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: What is the reason that Reish Lakish did not say? He holds: Who is the Tanna of the Keritot? It is Rabbi Akiva, for he said: We do not require an action.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? נְהִי דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לָא בָּעֵי מַעֲשֵׂה רַבָּה, מַעֲשֵׂה זוּטָא בָּעֵי.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish, although Rabbi Akiva does not require a significant action does require a minor action.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish? Nehi deRabbi Akiva la ba'e Ma'aseh Rabba, Ma'aseh Zuta ba'e.

hebrew_text: בַּעַל אוֹב, מַאי מַעֲשֶׂה אִית בֵּיהּ? הֲקָשַׁת זְרוֹעוֹתָיו הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה. מְגַדֵּף, מַאי מַעֲשֶׂה אִית בֵּיהּ? עֲקִימַת שְׂפָתָיו הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: a necromancer, what action is there in The striking of his arms is an action. blasphemes, what action is there in The twisting of his lips is an action.
llm_translation: Ba'al Ov, what is the deed that is in him? The bending of his arms is the deed. A blasphemer, what is the deed that is in him? The twisting of his lips is the deed.

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין: הֲקָשַׁת זְרוֹעוֹתָיו הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה זוּטָא אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן. מֵיתִיבִי: בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, כְּגוֹן שֶׁזִּיבַּח, וְקִיטֵּר, וְנִיסֵּךְ, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה. וְקַשְׁיָא לַן, הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה לֵית בַּהּ מַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: enters our mind the striking of arms is a minor action even according to the Rabbis, raises an objection With regard to idol worship, one is liable only for a matter that involves an action, for example where one slaughtered or burned or poured or bowed. And a difficulty to us: Bowing does not involve an action.
llm_translation: He raised an objection: If one bent his arms, it is considered a minor action even according to the Rabbis. The questioner objects: In the case of foreign worship, one is only liable for an action that involves a physical act, such as slaughtering, offering incense, pouring libations, or bowing down. And we have a difficulty: Bowing down does not involve a physical act!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר לָא בָּעִינַן מַעֲשֶׂה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, כְּפִיפַת קוֹמָתוֹ הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה. מִכְּלָל דִּסְבִירָא לֵיהּ לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אַלִּיבָּא דְרַבָּנַן כְּפִיפַת קוֹמָתוֹ לְרַבָּנַן לָא הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה. הֲקָשַׁת זְרוֹעוֹתָיו הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה?!
human_translation: And Reish Lakish said: whose is this It is Rabbi Akiva, who says: An action is not required And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: You even say the Rabbis, the bending of his height is an action. by inference that Reish Lakish maintains according to of the Rabbis, the bending of his height is not an action. the striking of his arms is an action?
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: Is this a case? It is Rabbi Akiva, for he said we do not require an action. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you were to say it is the Rabbis, the bending of his height is considered an action. From the fact that he reasoned with Reish Lakish, it is clear that according to the Rabbis, the bending of his height is not considered an action. Is the bending of his arms considered an action?!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא כִּי קָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הֲקָשַׁת זְרוֹעוֹתָיו הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה זוּטָא, אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֲבָל לְרַבָּנַן לָא הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: But rather, when Reish Lakish says the striking of his arms is a minor action, in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva; but according to of the Rabbis is not an action.
llm_translation: And rather, when Reish Lakish said, "If one ties his arms, it is considered a minor act," he was in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Akiva. But according to the Rabbis, it is not considered a minor act.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי תָּנֵי: יָצָא מְגַדֵּף שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה? נִיתְנֵי: יָצָא מְגַדֵּף וּבַעַל אוֹב! חֲדָא מִתַּרְתֵּי קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: If so, why teach excluding blasphemes, as he does not perform an action, Let it teach excluding blasphemes and a necromancer. teaches one of two
llm_translation: If so, why does it teach: One who curses, who has no action? It should teach: One who curses and practices necromancy! One of the two versions is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי בַּעַל אוֹב וְלָא לִיתְנֵי מְגַדֵּף! מְגַדֵּף אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב כָּרֵת דִּילֵיהּ בִּמְקוֹם קׇרְבָּן, אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא.
human_translation: But let teach a necromancer and let it not teach blasphemes. was necessary for blasphemes, enter your mind to say: Since its karet is written in the place an offering say concede to Rabbi Akiva teach us that not
llm_translation: The Baal Ov should be taught, but not the Megadef! The Megadef is necessary, as your mind may think: Since it is written "his soul shall be cut off" in the place of offering, I might concede to Rabbi Akiva, it is heard for us that it is not.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: בַּעַל אוֹב דְּקָתָנֵי בִּמְקַטֵּר לַשֵּׁד. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: אִם כֵּן, הַיְינוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מְקַטֵּר לַשֵּׁד עַל מְנָת לְחַבְּרוֹ.
human_translation: Ulla said: necromancer that teaches to burns to a demon Rava objects to this If so, this is an idol worshipper, Rather, Rava said: burns to a demon in order to gather it
llm_translation: Oula said: Baal Ov is referring to one who burns incense to the demon. Rava objected: If so, this is tantamount to idol worship! Rather, Rava said: One who burns incense to the demon does so in order to appease it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִם כֵּן, הָיִינוּ חוֹבֵר חָבֶר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה חוֹבֵר חָבֶר כְּגוֹן זֶה, בִּסְקִילָה. וְאֶלָּא חוֹבֵר חֶבֶר דִּבְלָאו – הֵדֵין הוּא?
human_translation: Abaye said to If so, this is a ḥover ḥever , said to him: the Torah stated: A ḥover ḥever such as this, by stoning, But a ḥover ḥever , which a prohibition what it?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: If so, we would be joining a joiner! He said to him: The Torah said joining a joiner, such as this, in stoning. But joining a joiner without a purpose - is that so?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״וְחוֹבֵר חָבֶר״ – אֶחָד חוֹבֵר גָּדוֹל וְאֶחָד חוֹבֵר קָטָן, וַאֲפִילּוּ חוֹבֵר לִנְחָשִׁים וְעַקְרַבִּים – חַיָּיב. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי מַאן דְּבָעֵי לְמִיצְמַד זִיבּוּרָא וְעַקְרַבָּא – אָסוּר, וְאִי קָאָתוּ בָּתְרֵיהּ – שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: said to As it is taught “And a ḥover ḥaver ” one gathers large and one gathers small and even gathers snakes and scorpions; liable. Abaye says: this one, who wants to gather a hornet and a scorpion, prohibited. But if they are pursuing him permitted.
llm_translation: He said to him: As it was taught: "And one who ties a knot" - whether a large knot or a small knot, and even if one ties knots for snakes and scorpions - he is liable. Abaye said: One who wants to tie a knot for a scorpion or a snake - it is forbidden, but if they come after it - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר כְּפִיפַת קוֹמָתוֹ הָוֵי מַעֲשֵׂה, עֲקִימַת
human_translation: According to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who says the bending of one’s height is an action, the twisting of
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yochanan, who said: "The circumference of his height was a deed," the raising of.

hebrew_text: שְׂפָתָיו נֶהֱוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה גַּבֵּי מְגַדֵּף? אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי מְגַדֵּף, הוֹאִיל וְיֶשְׁנוֹ בַּלֵּב, אֲבָל בְּעָלְמָא עֲקִימַת שְׂפָתָיו הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: his lips should be an action in blasphemes. Rava said: blasphemes is different, since it is in the heart. But in general, the twisting of one’s lips is an action.
llm_translation: His lips become like the deeds of a reviler? Rava said: It is different with a reviler, since he has intent in his heart, but in general, the setting of his lips is like the deeds.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי זֵירָא: יָצְאוּ עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְאַמַּאי? הָא ״עַל פִּי״ כְּתִיב בָּהֶן! אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין, הוֹאִיל וְיֶשְׁנָן בִּרְאִיָּיה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises an objection except for conspiring witnesses, as does not involve an action. But why It is written with regard to “At the mouth Rava said: conspiring witnesses is different, since their is through sight,
llm_translation: The text reads: Rabbi Zeira raises an objection: If witnesses who conspire to testify falsely come forward but there is no actual deed, why then does the Torah state "according to the mouth" regarding them? Rava said: False witnesses are different, as they are present at the scene.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹכֵל חֵלֶב. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״ – לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: one who eats fat. the Sages taught “You shall eat no fat of ox, or sheep, or goat” to render one liable for each and every one, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. And the Rabbis say he is liable only one
llm_translation: The one who eats fat. The Rabbis taught: "Any fat of ox, sheep, or goat you shall not eat" - liable for each and every one, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. And the Sages say: One is only liable for one.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: לוֹקִין עַל לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין לוֹקִין עַל לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת?
human_translation: Let us say disagree about this that Rabbi Yishmael maintains one is flogged for a general prohibition and the Rabbis maintain one is not flogged for a general prohibition.
llm_translation: Said in that case, where Rabbi Yishmael disagrees: Rabbi Yishmael holds: One is liable for a negative commandment included in a general prohibition, and the Rabbis hold: One is not liable for a negative commandment included in a general prohibition?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם סָבַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אֵין לוֹקִין עַל לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דִּמְיַיתְּרִי לֵיהּ קְרָאֵי – נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״כׇּל חֵלֶב לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״, ״שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Yishmael maintains one is not flogged for a general prohibition, but here it is different, as the verse are superfluous. Let the verse write You shall eat no fat, Why do I “Ox, or sheep, or goat”? Learn from it to separate
llm_translation: Always Rabbi Yishmael holds: Do not flog on a negative commandment that includes positives, and here is different, for additional verses are compared - it is written "You shall not eat any fat" and "Ox, sheep, and goat" why do I need them? Learn from it to differentiate.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? אִי לָא כְּתִיב: ״שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֲפִילּוּ חֵלֶב חַיָּה בַּמַּשְׁמָע, לְהָכִי כְּתַב: ״שׁוֹר כֶּשֶׂב וָעֵז״, לְמֵימְרָא: דְּחֵלֶב שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז הוּא דְּאָסוּר, אֲבָל דְּחַיָּה שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, if not written: “Ox, or sheep, or goat,” I would say even fat of an undomesticated animal is included For this writes: “Ox, or sheep, or goat,” to say that it is fat of an ox, or a sheep, or a goat that is forbidden, but of an undomesticated animal are permitted.
llm_translation: The Sages? If not, is it not written: "Ox and sheep and goat"? I would say: Even the fat of a living animal is included in the implication. Therefore it is written: "Ox sheep and goat," to indicate that it is referring to the fat of an ox, sheep, and goat that is prohibited, but the fat of a living animal is permitted.

hebrew_text: שַׁפִּיר קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל דְּקָסָבַר: אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב ״כׇּל חֵלֶב שׁוֹר לֹא תֹאכְלוּ״, ״כֶּשֶׂב וָעֵז״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: spoke well to Rather, this is the reasoning of Rabbi Yishmael, as he holds: If so, let it write: You shall eat no fat of an ox, Why do I “Sheep or goat”? Learn from it to separate
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "They are saying well to him! Rather, this is the reason, as Rabbi Yishmael holds: If so, it should have been written, 'You shall not eat any ox fat,' why 'of sheep and goat' for me? Learn from it to differentiate."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״כׇּל חֵלֶב שׁוֹר״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: נֵילַף ״שׁוֹר״ ״שׁוֹר״ מִסִּינַי,
human_translation: And the Rabbis maintain if the Merciful One had written fat of an ox, I would say: Let us derive from “ox” “ox,” Sinai:
llm_translation: The sages hold: if the Merciful One wrote "all the fat of the ox," I would have said: exclude "ox" from "ox" from Sinai.

hebrew_text: מָה גַּבֵּי סִינַי – חַיָּה וָעוֹף כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן, אַף גַּבֵּי אֲכִילָה – חַיָּה וָעוֹף כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן, לְהָכִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז״, לְמֵימְרָא דְּהָנֵי דְּאָסוּר, אֲבָל חַיָּה וָעוֹף שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Just as with regard to Sinai, undomesticated animals and birds are as so too, with regard to eating undomesticated animals and birds are as For this the Merciful One writes: “Ox, or sheep, or goat,” to say that these are forbidden, but an undomesticated animal and birds are permitted.
llm_translation: Regarding Sinai - wild animals and birds and the like, so too regarding consumption - wild animals and birds and the like, therefore the Merciful One wrote "ox and sheep and goat," to say that those that are prohibited, but wild animals and birds are permitted.

hebrew_text: שַׁפִּיר קָא אָמְרִי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, דְּקָסָבַר: נִכְתּוֹב ״כׇּל חֵלֶב כֶּשֶׂב לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״, אִי נָמֵי: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב עֵז לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״, ״שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: spoke well to Rather, this is the reasoning of Rabbi Yishmael, as he holds: Let write: You shall eat no fat of sheep; alternatively, You shall eat no fat of goat. Why do I “Ox, or sheep, or goat”? Learn from it to separate
llm_translation: Fairly they said to him! Rather, this is the reason, for he holds: it is written "You shall not eat any fat of ox or sheep or goat," or similarly: "You shall not eat any fat of goat," "ox and sheep and goat" - why do I need them? Learn from it to differentiate.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אִי כְּתַב ״כָּל חֵלֶב כֶּשֶׂב״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: חֵלֶב כֶּשֶׂב אָסוּר, וְשׁוֹר וָעֵז שְׁרֵי. וְכִי תֵּימָא, מַאי אוּלְמֵיהּ דְּכֶשֶׂב – מִשּׁוּם דְּנִתְרַבָּה בְּאַלְיָה,
human_translation: And the Rabbis maintain if had written You shall eat no fat of sheep, I would say the fat of sheep forbidden, but an ox or a goat permitted. And if you would say: what is of sheep stronger, due to that an increased with regard to tail,
llm_translation: The sages hold: If it had written "all fat of sheep," I would have said: Fat of sheep is prohibited, but of ox and goat is permitted. And if you would say, what is the reason for sheep - because it is more fatty.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְתָנָא רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא: לָמָּה מָנָה הַכָּתוּב אֵימוּרִין בְּשׁוֹר וְאֵימוּרִים בְּכֶשֶׂב, וְאֵימוּרִים, בְּעֵז, דִּכְתִיב: ״אַךְ בְּכוֹר שׁוֹר וְגוֹ׳?
human_translation: And as Rabbi Ḥanina taught: Why does the verse list sacrificial portions with regard to ox, and sacrificial portions [ ve’eimurim ] with regard to sheep, and sacrificial portions with regard to goat? As it is written: “But the firstborn of a bull,
llm_translation: And as it was taught by Rabbi Chananya: Why did the Scripture enumerate statements regarding an ox and statements regarding a lamb, and statements regarding a goat, as it is written: "But the firstborn of an ox, etc."

hebrew_text: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב שׁוֹר, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כֶּשֶׂב וָעֵז לָא יָלְפִינַן מִינֵּיהּ, דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְשׁוֹר, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה בִּנְסָכִים.
human_translation: are necessary, as, if had written ox I would say we do not derive a sheep and a goat from it, as can be refuted: What about an ox? in that has an increased of libations,
llm_translation: I need, for if one wrote "ox," I would say: "A sheep and a goat do not exempt it, for there is room to differentiate: Just as with an ox, for it has become accustomed to libations."

hebrew_text: נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בְּכֶשֶׂב וְנֵילַף שׁוֹר וָעֵז מִכֶּשֶׂב – אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְכֶשֶׂב, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה בְּאַלְיָה.
human_translation: Let the Merciful One write with regard to a sheep and we will derive an ox and a goat from a sheep, can be refuted: What about a sheep? in that an increased with regard to tail,
llm_translation: It is written: "The Merciful One prescribed the offering of a lamb, and one may substitute an ox or a goat for a lamb." There is room for dispute: What is the reason for substituting a lamb? Because it is abundant in its meekness.

hebrew_text: נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא עֵז וְנֵילַף שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב מִינֵּיהּ – אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְעֵז, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה אֵצֶל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: Let the Merciful One write a goat, and we will derive an ox and a sheep from can be refuted: What about a goat? in that has an increased with regard to idol worship,
llm_translation: It is written: "The Merciful One prescribed a goat and a calf, an ox and a sheep from its species." - There is room to differentiate: What is the case with a goat, that it has become abundant in matters of idolatry.

hebrew_text: מִן חַד לָא יָלְפִינַן, נִכְתּוֹב תַּרְתֵּי וְנֵילַף חֲדָא מִתַּרְתֵּי! הֵי דֵין? נֵילַף שׁוֹר מִכֶּשֶׂב וָעֵז – אִית לְהוֹן פִּירְכָא: מָה לְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבּוּ אֵצֶל הַפֶּסַח!
human_translation: We cannot derive from one let write two and we will derive one from two. Which this we will derive ox from a sheep and a goat, has a refutation: What about a sheep and a goat? in that they have increased for the Paschal offering,
llm_translation: From one source we do not learn, when it is written two and we derive one from the two! Is that so? We derive an ox from sheep and goat - they have a distinction: Just as with sheep and goat, for they multiplied by the Paschal offering!

hebrew_text: לָא נִכְתּוֹב כֶּשֶׂב וְנֵילַף מִשּׁוֹר וָעֵז – אִית לְהוֹן פִּירְכָא: מָה לְשׁוֹר וָעֵז, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה אֵצֶל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה!
human_translation: not write a sheep, and we will derive from an ox and a goat, has a refutation: What about an ox and a goat? in that they have increased for idol worship,
llm_translation: It is not written "a lamb" and derived from "an ox" and "a goat" - they have a refutation: What about "an ox" and "a goat," for they have multiplied in the context of idolatry!

hebrew_text: לָא נִכְתּוֹב עֵז, וְנֵילַף מִשּׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב – אִית לְהוֹן פִּירְכָא: מָה לְשׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב, שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ בּוֹ צַד רִיבּוּי! הִלְכָּךְ לָא יָלְפִי מֵהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: not write a goat, and we will derive from an ox and a sheep, has a refutation: What about an ox and a sheep? in that each has an increased aspect Therefore, they cannot be derived from each other.
llm_translation: It is not written "goat," and derived from "ox" and "sheep" - there is a distinction for them: what is there in "ox" and "sheep" that they have a potential for increase! Therefore, one does not derive from "goat."

hebrew_text: שַׁפִּיר קָא אָמְרִי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל כִּדְאָמְרִינַן מֵעִיקָּרָא, דְּאִם כֵּן נִכְתּוֹב ״כׇּל חֵלֶב״ וְלִישְׁתּוֹק. מַאי אָמְרַתְּ, הַאי דִּכְתַב ״שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז״ לְמִשְׁרֵי חֵלֶב חַיָּה?
human_translation: spoke well to Rather, the reason of Rabbi Yishmael actually as we said at the outset, that if so, let write: fat, and be silent. What did you say this that writes: “Ox, or sheep, or goat,” to permit fat of an undomesticated animal?
llm_translation: They beautifully said to him! Rather, always the reasoning of Rabbi Yishmael is as we say from the beginning, that if so it should have been written "all fat" and be silent. What do you say, that which is written "ox and sheep and goat" for the prohibition of eating live fat?

hebrew_text: הָא כִּי כְּתַב קְרָא – בְּעִנְיָינָא דְקָדָשִׁים, וְדָבָר לָמֵד מֵעִנְיָינוֹ.
human_translation: When the verse is written in the context of sacrificial And A matter derived from its context,
llm_translation: This is the case when the verse writes - regarding matters of holy things, and a matter is learned from its context.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָא יָלְפִינַן דָּבָר לָמֵד מֵעִנְיָינוֹ? לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יָלְפִינַן דָּבָר הַלָּמֵד מֵעִנְיָינוֹ, וְהָכָא בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: לְמֵידִין לָאו מִלָּאו בֵּין מִלָּאו וּבֵין מִלָּאו דְּכָרֵת,
human_translation: by inference that the Rabbis maintain we do not derive A matter derived from its context? No, everyone we do derive A matter derived from its context, and here about this that they disagree: Rabbi Yishmael maintains we derive prohibition from prohibition, whether from prohibition, or whether from a prohibition of karet .
llm_translation: From the principle of the sages, they hold: Do we not say a matter that is learned from its subject? No, for all people say a matter that is learned from its subject, and here they dispute, Rabbi Yishmael holds: For teachings, whether they are complete or not complete, there is a distinction between complete and not complete, regarding the punishment of excision.

hebrew_text: דְּ״כׇל חֵלֶב שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז״, מִלָּאו דְּ״חֻקַּת עוֹלָם לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶם בְּכֹל מוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶם כׇּל חֵלֶב וְכׇל דָּם לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״, דִּכְתִיב בְּעִנְיָינָא דְקָדָשִׁים, וּבְקָדָשִׁים לָא אִית בְּהוֹן חַיָּה, אַף ״כׇּל חֵלֶב שׁוֹר״, כִּי כְּתִיב לֵיהּ סְתָמָא לֵיכָּא לְסַפּוֹקֵי בְּחַיָּה, הִלְכָּךְ ״שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז״ לְחַלֵּק הוּא דַּאֲתָא, לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: of: no fat of ox, or sheep, or goat,” from the prohibition of: “It shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings, that you shall eat neither fat nor blood” which is written with regard to the matter of sacrificial And there are no undomesticated animals in sacrificial So too, no fat of ox, when writes it without specification, there is no to be uncertain to undomesticated animals. Therefore, “ox, or sheep, or goat” comes to separate, to render one liable for each and every one
llm_translation: The text: "Regarding all fat of ox, sheep, and goat," as it is written, "It shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings: you shall not eat any fat or any blood," as it is written in the matter of holy things, and in holy things there is no living creature, so too "all fat of ox," for it is written in a general sense to include doubt regarding living creatures. Therefore, "ox, sheep, and goat" come to divide, to obligate for each and every one.

hebrew_text: וְיָלְפִינַן לָאו דְּ״כׇל חֵלֶב״ וְלָאו דְּ״חֻקַּת עוֹלָם״ מִכָּרֵת דְּ״כִי כׇּל אוֹכֵל חֵלֶב מִן הַבְּהֵמָה אֲשֶׁר יַקְרִיבוּ מִמֶּנָּה״, מָה הָהוּא לְחַלֵּק – אַף הַדִּין לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: And we derive the prohibition of: no fat,” and the prohibition of: “It shall be a perpetual statute,” from the karet “For anyone who eats the fat of the domesticated animal, of which people present Just as that to separate so too, this to separate
llm_translation: And we shall distinguish between the prohibition of "all fat" and the prohibition of "a statute forever" as regards karet, for "for whoever eats fat from the animal from which it is offered" (Leviticus 7:25). Just as that one is liable to be divided, so too this one is liable to be divided.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, לָאו מִלָּאו יָלְפִינַן, לָאו מִכָּרֵת לָא יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis we derive prohibition from prohibition, we do not derive prohibition from karet .
llm_translation: The sages, not from the mouth we learn, not from the cutting we learn.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הַיְינוּ טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן, כְּדַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרִי לְרַב זְבִיד: ״אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, אַלְיָה דְחוּלִּין תִּיתְּסַר אֲמַר לֵיהּ״ – ״עָלֶיךָ אָמַר קְרָא: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז״, דָּבָר הַשָּׁוֶה בִּשְׁלׇשְׁתָּן בָּעִינַן, וְלֵיכָּא״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say this is the reason of the Rabbis: As Rav Mari said to Rav Zevid If that is so, tail of a non-sacred should be prohibited said to With regard to your the verse states no fat of ox, or sheep, or goat” we require an item that is equally in all three and that is not
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Is this the reason of the Rabbis, as Rav Mari said to Rav Zebid: "Rather, from now on, the fat of non-sacred animals should be removed." - "Upon you the verse said: 'All fat of ox, sheep, and goat,' a matter that is common to the three of them we require, and there is none."

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ: כִּי אֲתָא ״שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז״ – לְמִישְׁרֵי אַלְיָה דְחוּלִּין הוּא דַּאֲתָא. וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָמַר לָךְ: אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״כׇּל חֵלֶב שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב״, עֵז לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: Therefore, When “ox, or sheep, or goat” comes, it comes to permit tail of a non-sacred And Rabbi Yishmael say to you If so, let state: no fat of ox or sheep; why do I a goat? Learn from it to separate
llm_translation: Therefore: when "ox and sheep and goat" come - to the straight path of Halacha it comes. And Rabbi Yishmael said to you: If so, let us say the verse "all the fat of ox and sheep," why goat for me? Learn from it to differentiate.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל לְעִנְיַן קׇרְבָּן שֶׁאֵין מֵבִיא אֶלָּא חַטָּאת אַחַת, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּלָא דָּמֵי הָדֵין לָאו לְלָאו דַּעֲרָיוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: Rabbi Yishmael concedes with regard to an offering that brings only one sin offering. What is the reason? that this prohibition is not similar to the prohibition of those with whom relations are forbidden.
