llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: Rabbi Yishmael concedes regarding the matter of a sacrifice that only one sin offering is brought, what is the reason? Because it is not comparable to other cases of forbidden relationships.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְעָשָׂה אַחַת״ ״וְעָשָׂה הֵנָּה״ – לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת,
human_translation: the Sages taught And performs one, And performs them, to render one liable for each and every
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And he shall make one" "and he shall make it here" - to obligate for each and every one.

hebrew_text: שֶׁאִם אָכַל חֵלֶב וְחֵלֶב, שֵׁם אֶחָד בִּשְׁנֵי הֶעְלֵמוֹת – חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם, שְׁתֵּי שֵׁמוֹת בְּהֶעְלֵם אַחַת – חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: that if one ate fat and fat, one category, in two lapses of awareness, liable two two categories, in one lapse of awareness, liable two
llm_translation: If one ate fat and fat, one name in two concealments - liable two, two names in one concealment - liable two.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְרַב חִסְדָּא: בִּשְׁלָמָא שֵׁם אֶחָד בִּשְׁנֵי הֶעְלֵמוֹת חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם, מִשּׁוּם דְּהֶעְלֵמוֹת מְחַלְּקִין. אֶלָּא שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת בְּהֶעְלֵם אַחַת, אַמַּאי חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם? הָא בָּעִינַן הֶעְלֵמוֹת מְוחַלְּקִין, וְלֵיכָּא!
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said to Rav Ḥisda: Granted, one category in two lapses of awareness liable two due to that the lapses of awareness separate But two categories in one lapse of awareness, why liable two We require separate lapses of awareness and that is not
llm_translation: He said to him, Ramei bar Ḥama said to Rav Ḥisda: With regard to Shema, one name in two concealments is liable for two, because the concealments are distinct. But if there are two names in one concealment, why is one liable for two? We require that the concealments be distinct, and here they are not!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן דַּאֲכַל חֵלֶב דְּנוֹתָר, דְּמִחַיַּיב מִשּׁוּם נוֹתָר וּמִשּׁוּם חֵלֶב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן, נִיחַיַּיב נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם קוֹדֶשׁ!
human_translation: said to him: Here we are dealing with where he ate fat left over from an offering after the time allotted for its consumption [ notar ], as he is liable due to notar and due to fat. said to him: If so, let him be liable due to sacrificial as well,
llm_translation: He said to him: Here, with what are we dealing? - For example, if one ate leftover fat, for he is liable both for the leftover and for the fat. He said to him: If so, he should also be liable for the holiness!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כְּגוֹן דַּאֲכַל חֵלֶב דְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: אָכַל חֵלֶב נְבֵלָה, אָכַל חֵלֶב מוּקְדָּשִׁין – חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חֵלֶב מוּקְדָּשִׁין – לוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet said: where he ate fat of sacrificial and is Rabbi Yehuda, As it is taught ate fat of an animal carcass, ate fat of sacrificial liable two Rabbi Yehuda says: ate fat of sacrificial is flogged three
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet said: For example, one who ate the fat of consecrated items, and this is the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: One who ate the fat of a carcass, one who ate the fat of consecrated items – is liable for two offenses. Rabbi Yehuda says: For the fat of consecrated items – he receives three lashes.

hebrew_text: מְחַיְּיכוּ עֲלַהּ בְּמַעְרְבָא: וְנוֹקְמַהּ כְּגוֹן חֵלֶב דְּשׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז, וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לוֹקֶה שְׁלֹשׁ!
human_translation: They laughed at this in the West, And let us interpret where fat of an ox, and a sheep, and a goat, and it is Rabbi Yishmael, who says is flogged three
llm_translation: They argue about it in the west: and its retribution is like the fat of an ox, sheep, and goat, and Rabbi Yishmael says: He is flogged three times!

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא לָא אוֹקְמַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מוֹדֶה הָיָה רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל לְעִנְיַן קׇרְבָּן שֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא חַטָּאת אַחַת, הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא מִתּוֹקְמָא, דְּהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מוֹדֶה הָיָה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְעִנְיַן קׇרְבָּן שֶׁאֵין מֵבִיא אֶלָּא חַטָּאת אַחַת!
human_translation: Why not interpret in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael? as Rabbi Ḥanina says: Rabbi Yishmael would concede with regard to an offering that he is liable only one sin offering. Now too, should not be interpreted in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as doesn’t Rabbi Eliezer say: Rabbi Yehuda would concede with regard to an offering that brings only one sin offering?
llm_translation: The Gemara: Perhaps it was not established like Rabbi Yishmael, for Rabbi Chanina said: Rabbi Yishmael used to concede regarding a sacrifice that only requires one sin-offering, but now it is not established like Rabbi Yehuda, for Rabbi Eliezer said: Rabbi Yehuda used to concede regarding a sacrifice that only brings one sin-offering!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם בַּר תּאוּטֵנִי: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁאֲכָלָן בִּשְׁנֵי תַמְחוּיִין, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּאָמַר: תַּמְחוּיִין מְחַלְּקִים.
human_translation: Rather, Reish Lakish said in the name of bar Ta’utni: What are we dealing with here, in which he ate from two dishes, and in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua, who says dishes separate
llm_translation: Rather, Reish Lakish said in the name of Bar Tauteini: What are we dealing with here? For example, when they ate them with two different dips. And according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehoshua, who said: Dips create a separation.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: אָכַל חֵלֶב נְבֵילָה – לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם, חֵלֶב מוּקְדָּשִׁין – לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חֵלֶב מוּקְדָּשִׁין – לוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: the itself: ate fat of an animal carcass is flogged two ate fat of sacrificial is flogged two Rabbi Yehuda says: ate fat of sacrificial is flogged three
llm_translation: Body: If one ate the fat of a nevelah - receives two lashes, the fat of consecrated offerings - receives two lashes. Rabbi Yehudah says: the fat of consecrated offerings - receives three lashes.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁיזְבִי לְרָבָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיבִי קְרָאֵי: ״חֻקַּת עוֹלָם״. ״כׇּל חֵלֶב שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב וָעֵז לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״, ״וְכׇל זָר לֹא יֹאכַל קֹדֶשׁ״ – הָא תְּלָתָא לָאוִין. אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Sheizevi said to Rava: Granted, according to Rabbi Yehuda, this is verses that are written: “It shall be a perpetual statute “You shall eat no fat, of ox, or sheep, or goat” “And no non-priest shall partake of the sacred food” these three prohibitions, But according to the Rabbis, what is their reasoning?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Sheizbi to Rava: Granted for Rabbi Yehuda, that is what is written in the verses: "An eternal statute," "You shall not eat any fat of ox, sheep, or goat," "And any outsider shall not eat holy" – these three are not applicable. But for the Rabbis, what is their reasoning?

hebrew_text: קָסָבְרִי: לָאו דְּ״חֻקַּת עוֹלָם״ בְּקָדָשִׁים, וְלָאו דְּ״חֵלֶב שׁוֹר״ בְּחוּלִּין. וּצְרִיכִי,
human_translation: maintain prohibition of: “It shall be a perpetual statute,” with regard to sacrificial but the prohibition of: fat of ox,” with regard to non-sacred And are necessary,
llm_translation: He holds: Not of "a statute forever" in holy things, and not of "the fat of a bull" in mundane things. And it is necessary,

hebrew_text: דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בְּקָדָשִׁים, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: קָדָשִׁים הוּא דַּחֲמִירִי, דְּאָסוּר חֶלְבּוֹ, אֲבָל חוּלִּין – אֵימָא לָא, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב שׁוֹר״.
human_translation: As, had the Merciful One written with regard to sacrificial I would say: It is sacrificial whose stringent, that fat is forbidden. But non-sacred say not due to that the Merciful One writes: no fat of ox.”
llm_translation: If the Merciful One had written "holy things," I would say: Holy things are stringent, for their fat is forbidden, but with regard to non-sacred items - I would say no. Therefore, the Merciful One wrote: "All the fat of the ox."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב שׁוֹר״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: חֵלֶב דְחוּלִּין הוּא דְּאָסוּר מִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ, אֲבָל חֵלֶב מוּקְדָּשִׁין דְּהוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מִדְּהוּתַּר בְּשָׂרָן אִישְׁתְּרִי נָמֵי חֶלְבָּן, צְרִיכִי.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written no fat of ox,” I would say: It is fat non-sacred that is forbidden, since no which its general prohibition was permitted, But sacrificial whose general prohibition was permitted I would say from that their meat was permitted, their fat was permitted as well. are necessary,
llm_translation: "And if he wrote: 'All the fat of the ox,' I would say: It is the fat of non-consecrated animals that is prohibited because it was not permitted from the outset, but the fat of consecrated animals that was permitted from the outset, I would say: Since their meat is permitted, their fat is also permitted, it is necessary."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: כִּי כְּתִיב ״חֵלֶב שׁוֹר״, בָּעִנְיָינָא דְקָדָשִׁים כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda maintains when it is written: fat of ox,” it is written with regard to the matter of sacrificial
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: as it is written "the fat of an ox," in the matter of consecrated items it is written.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִכְּלָל דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָא יָלְפִינַן דָּבָר הַלָּמֵד מֵעִנְיָינוֹ?
human_translation: But by inference that the Rabbis maintain we do not derive A matter derived from its context?
llm_translation: Rather, from the general principle of the Sages, do they hold: Do not interject a matter that is not relevant to its subject?

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא דָּבָר הַלָּמֵד מֵעִנְיָינוֹ, וּבְהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: לְמֵידִין לָאו מִלָּאו וְלָאו מִכָּרֵת, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָאו מִלָּאו יָלְפִינַן, לָאו מִכָּרֵת לָא יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: No; everyone A matter derived from its context. And about this that they disagree: Rabbi Yehuda maintains we derive prohibition from prohibition, and a prohibition from karet , And the Rabbis we derive prohibition from prohibition, we do not derive a prohibition from karet ,
llm_translation: Not, that all the world a matter that learns from its subject, and in this they dispute, Rabbi Yehuda holds: for learning not from its subject and not from its conclusion, and the Rabbis hold: for learning not from its subject we do not differentiate, learning not from its conclusion we do not differentiate.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, ״כׇּל חֵלֶב וְכׇל דָּם לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״, לְמַאי אֲתָא? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְהַקִּישׁ, דְּתַנְיָא: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב וְכׇל דָּם לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״, מָה חֵלֶב לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם – אַף דָּם לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא אַזְהָרָה אֶחָת.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Yehuda, for what you shall eat neither fat nor blood” come? He requires it to juxtapose As it is taught “You shall eat neither fat nor blood,” just as fat is flogged two so too, blood is flogged two the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Rabbis say: Only one prohibition applies to
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, for Rabbi Yehuda, "All fat and all blood you shall not eat," for what does it come? He comes to compare, as it was taught: "All fat and all blood you shall not eat," just as fat is liable to two punishments - so too blood is liable to two punishments, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Sages say: It contains only one warning.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא חֵלֶב דְּלוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם בְּלָא הֶיקֵּישָׁא, דִּכְתַב בֵּיהּ תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי ״כׇּל חֵלֶב וְכׇל דָּם לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״, ״כׇּל חֵלֶב שׁוֹר וְכֶשֶׂב״? דָּם נָמֵי בְּלָאו הֶיקֵּישָׁא נִילְקֵי שְׁתַּיִם, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ תְּרֵי לָאוִין ״כׇּל חֵלֶב וְכׇל דָּם לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״, ״וְכׇל דָּם לֹא תֹאכְלוּ בְּכֹל מוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶם לָעוֹף וְלַבְּהֵמָה״!
human_translation: And what is different fat that is flogged two without a juxtaposition? that two verses are written with regard to it: “You shall eat neither fat nor blood,” “You shall eat no fat of ox or sheep.” blood as well, without a juxtaposition, should be flogged two as two prohibitions are written with regard to it: “You shall eat neither fat nor blood,” “And you shall eat no manner of blood, whether it is of fowl or of animal, in any of your dwellings”
llm_translation: And what is the difference regarding the fat that is burned twice without comparison? For it is written in it two verses "You shall not eat any fat or any blood," "All fat of ox and sheep"? Blood, which is compared without comparison, is burned twice, for it is written in it two prohibitions "You shall not eat any fat or any blood," "And you shall not eat any blood in all your dwellings, of birds and of beasts"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מָה חֵלֶב לוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ, אַף דָּם לוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: Rather, say just as fat is flogged three so too, blood is flogged three
llm_translation: Rather say: Just as the punishment for consuming forbidden fat is three lashes, so too the punishment for consuming blood is three lashes.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא חֵלֶב דְּלוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ? דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ הָלֵין תְּרֵי לָאוִין וְלָאו דְּזָרוּת – הָא תְּלָתָא? דָּם נָמֵי!
human_translation: And what is different fat that is flogged three that these two prohibitions are written with regard to it, and prohibition of a non-priest three. blood as well:
llm_translation: And what is the difference between the fat that is burned for three days? For it is written in it "two prohibitions" and not the prohibition of Zarut - is it not three? The blood is similar!

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִיתְמְעִיט דָּם מִטּוּמְאָה – לִיתְמְעִיט מִזָּרוּת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הֶיקֵּישָׁא.
human_translation: was necessary, enter your mind to say: Since blood is excluded from ritual impurity, let it be excluded from a non-priest. teaches us juxtaposition
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded: Since blood is diminished from impurity - diminish from sprinkling, it implies a comparison.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, הֶקֵּישָׁא לְמַאי אֲתָא?
human_translation: But according to the Rabbis, for what juxtaposition come?
llm_translation: And rather according to the Rabbis, what is the comparison coming to?

hebrew_text: מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב וְכׇל דָּם לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״, מָה חֵלֶב מְיוּחָד שֶׁחֶלְבּוֹ חָלוּק מִבְּשָׂרוֹ, וְאֵין מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה – אַף דָּם, שֶׁדָּמוֹ חָלוּק מִבְּשָׂרוֹ.
human_translation: they require it for that which is taught “You shall eat neither fat nor blood,” just as fat unique that fat of is discrete from its flesh, and they do not combine with each other, so too, blood whose blood is discrete from its flesh,
llm_translation: He asked according to the one who teaches: "All fat and all blood you shall not eat." What is the unique fat whose fat is separate from its flesh, and they do not combine with each other - so too blood, whose blood is separate from its flesh.

hebrew_text: אוֹצִיא דַּם שְׁרָצִים, הוֹאִיל דְּאֵין דָּמָן חָלוּק מִבְּשָׂרָן – מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: I will exclude blood of creeping animals, since their blood is not discrete from their flesh, combine
llm_translation: The blood of creeping things, since their blood is not separate from their flesh - they combine.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא? מֵהָתָם נָפְקָא: ״וְזֶה לָכֶם הַטָּמֵא״ – לִימֵּד עַל דַּם הַשֶּׁרֶץ וְהַשֶּׁרֶץ שֶׁמִּצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה!
human_translation: But derived from here, It is derived from there, “And these are they that are impure teaches with regard to blood of the creeping animals and the creeping animal, that they combine with each other
llm_translation: The text: And from here it is derived? It is derived from there: "And this shall be unclean to you" - it teaches about the blood of the creeping thing, and the creeping thing that they combine with each other!

hebrew_text: אִי לָאו הֶיקֵּישָׁא, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְטוּמְאָה, אֲבָל לַאֲכִילָה – אֵימָא לָא, אַשְׁמְעִינַן הֶיקֵּישָׁא לַאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: If not juxtaposition, enter your mind to say this statement with regard to ritual impurity, But with regard to consumption, say not juxtaposition teaches us with regard to consumption.
llm_translation: If not, it can be derived from your reasoning: those matters for impurity, but for eating - say no, we hear a comparison for eating.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: הִילְכָּךְ, דַּם נָחָשׁ וּבְשָׂרוֹ מִצְטָרְפִין. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? הַיְינוּ הֶיקֵּישָׁא! סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: שֶׁרֶץ, דְּאִיתְרַבִּי לְטוּמְאָה – אִיתְרַבִּי לַאֲכִילָה. נָחָשׁ, דְּלָא אִיתְרַבִּי לְטוּמְאָה – לָא אִיתְרַבִּי לַאֲכִילָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הֶיקֵּישָׁא: כׇּל מִילֵּי דְּאֵין דָּמוֹ חָלוּק מִבְּשָׂרוֹ מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: Ravina said: Therefore, blood of a snake and its flesh combine What is teaching us? This is juxtaposition. enter your mind to say a creeping animal, whose is included with regard to ritual impurity, included with regard to consumption; a snake, whose is not included with regard to ritual impurity, not included with regard to consumption. juxtaposition teaches us every item whose blood is not discrete from its flesh is included
llm_translation: Ravina said: Therefore, the blood of a snake and its flesh combine. What does this teach us? It is the same comparison! If it enters your mind, I would say: A creeping thing, which if it becomes impure - it becomes fit for consumption. A snake, which if it does not become impure - it does not become fit for consumption, this teaches us the comparison: any matter in which its blood is not distinct from its flesh, this teaches us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁלֹשׁ כָּרֵיתוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּדָּם. לְמַאי? אַחַת לְדַם חוּלִּין, וְאַחַת לְדַם קָדָשִׁים, וְאַחַת לְדַם הַתַּמְצִית.
human_translation: Rava says: three karet that are stated with regard to blood about what One for blood of non-sacred one for blood of sacrificial and one for blood of exudate,
llm_translation: Rava said: Three measures mentioned in the blood. For what? One for ordinary blood, and one for holy blood, and one for the blood of the offering.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא: דַּם הַתַּמְצִית בְּאַזְהָרָה, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּכָרֵת.
human_translation: This works out well according to Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught a prohibition with regard to blood of exudate, Rabbi Yehuda says: to karet
llm_translation: The Gemara left it for Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: The blood of the tamtzit is by way of a warning, Rabbi Yehuda says: with karet.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, הַהִיא לְמַאי אֲתָא? וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, כָּרֵת נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִן ״כׇּל דָּם״!
human_translation: But according to the Rabbis, for what that And even according to Rabbi Yehuda, he derives karet from any manner of blood”
llm_translation: To the Rabbis, for what purpose did she come? And even to Rabbi Yehuda, "cut off" comes out for him from "all blood"!

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״דָּם״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כׇּל דָּם״?
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: blood. What the verse states any manner of blood”?
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says: "Blood," what is the Talmud to say "all blood"?

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא דַּם קָדָשִׁים שֶׁהַנֶּפֶשׁ יוֹצֵא בּוֹ, דַּם חוּלִּין וְדַם הַתַּמְצִית, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כׇּל דָּם״!
human_translation: I have only blood of sacrificial the soul leaves From where blood of a non-sacred and the blood of exudate? The verse states: “Any manner of blood.”
llm_translation: I have only the blood of holy things from which the soul departs, blood of non-sacred things and blood of the essence, from where? The Talmud teaches to say: "All blood"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אֶחָד לְדַם חוּלִּין, וְאֶחָד לְדַם קָדָשִׁים, וְאֶחָד לְדַם כִּיסּוּי.
human_translation: Rather, say One for blood of non-sacred and one for blood of sacrificial and one is for blood of covering,
llm_translation: Rather say: one for the blood of non-consecrated animals, and one for the blood of consecrated animals, and one for the blood of covering.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: חֲמִשָּׁה לָאוִין הָאֲמוּרִין בְּדָם לָמָּה? אַחַת לְדַם חוּלִּין, וְאַחַת לְדַם קָדָשִׁים, וְאַחַת לְדַם כִּיסּוּי, וְאַחַת לְדַם אֵיבָרִין, וְאַחַת לְדַם הַתַּמְצִית.
human_translation: And Rava says: Why five prohibitions stated with regard to blood One for blood of non-sacred and one for blood of sacrificial and one for blood of covering, and one for blood in the limbs and one is for the blood of exudate.
llm_translation: And Rava said: Why are the five prohibitions regarding blood stated? One for the blood of non-consecrated animals, and one for the blood of consecrated animals, and one for the blood of covering, and one for the blood of limbs, and one for the blood of the essence.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִילָא: אָכַל מַעֲשֵׂר דָּגָן וְתִירוֹשׁ וְיִצְהָר – לוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ. וְהָא אֵין לוֹקִין עַל לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דִּמְיַיתְּרִי קְרָאֵי –
human_translation: Rabbi Illa says: ate tithe of grain, wine, and oil, is flogged three But one is not flogged for a general prohibition. It is different here, as the verses are superfluous.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ila said: One who consumes tithe of grain, wine, and oil - is liable for three. But isn't one not liable for a negative commandment that includes positives? The case here is different, as the verses are juxtaposed -

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מַעְשַׂר דְּגָנְךָ תִּירֹשְׁךָ וְיִצְהָרֶךָ״, בִּפְנִים – אִין, בַּחוּץ – לָא, לְמָה לִי דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״לֹא תוּכַל לֶאֱכֹל בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ מַעְשַׂר דְּגָנְךָ וְתִירֹשְׁךָ וְיִצְהָרֶךָ״? לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: Since the Merciful One writes: “And you shall eat before the Lord your God, the tithe of your grain, of your wine, and of your oil” inside yes, outside no, why do I the Merciful One to write: “You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain, or of your wine, or of your oil” to separate
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Because the Merciful One wrote: 'And you shall eat before the Lord your God, the tithe of your grain, your wine, and your oil,' inside - yes, outside - no. Why do I need that the Merciful One wrote: 'You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain, your wine, and your oil'? To differentiate."

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהָהוּא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בַּעֲשֵׂה, אֲבָל בְּלָאו אֵימָא לָא, אַמְּטוּ לְהָכִי
human_translation: If from that I would say this statement to a positive mitzva, But say that not a prohibition. due to this
llm_translation: If from that, I would say: those matters in doing, but without them, why not, say thus.

hebrew_text: כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״לֹא תוּכַל״, לְאוֹקֹמַהּ בְּלָאו.
human_translation: the Merciful One writes: “You may not eat” to establish as a prohibition.
llm_translation: The Merciful One wrote: "You shall not be able," to establish it without a negative.

hebrew_text: וַעֲדַיִין, לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת הוּא! אִם כֵּן, נֵימָא קְרָא: ״לֹא תוּכַל לְאׇכְלָם בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״, ״מַעְשַׂר דְּגָנְךָ תִּירֹשְׁךָ וְיִצְהָרֶךָ״ לְמָה לִּי? לְיַחוֹדֵי אֲכִילָה דְּכׇל חַד וְחַד.
human_translation: But still, it is a general prohibition, If so, let say: You may not eat them within your gates, Why do I “The tithe of your grain, of your wine, and of your oil”? to designate consumption of each and every
llm_translation: And still, it is not included in its entirety! If so, let us say the verse: "You may not eat within your gates," "the tithe of your grain, your wine, and your oil" - why do I need it? To specify the eating of each one separately.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: הָאוֹכֵל לֶחֶם, קָלִי, וְכַרְמֶל – לוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ. וְהָא אֵין לוֹקִין עַל לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דִּמְיַיתַּר קְרָאֵי –
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: One who eats bread, parched grain, and fresh stalks is flogged three But one is not flogged for a general prohibition. It is different here, as the verses are superfluous;
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: One who eats bread, parched grain, and kernels is liable to receive three sets of lashes. But is one not liable for the negative commandments included in them? This is different here because the verses are superfluous -

hebrew_text: לֵימָא קְרָא לֶחֶם, וְנֵילַף קָלִי וְכַרְמֶל מִינֵּיהּ. אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְלֶחֶם, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה אֵצֶל חַלָּה!
human_translation: Let say “bread,” and we will derive parched grain and fresh stalks from can be refuted: What about bread? in that it an increased with regard to ḥalla ,
llm_translation: Let us say: Scripture calls it "bread," and we derive "kalī" and "karmel" from it. There is room to refute: What is meant by "bread," that it has increased with challah!

hebrew_text: נִכְתּוֹב קָלִי וְלָא לִכְתּוֹב לֶחֶם, וְנֵילַף מִקָּלִי. לֶחֶם מִקָּלִי לָא אָתֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָלֵי אִיתֵיהּ בְּעֵינֵיהּ, לֶחֶם לָא אִיתֵיהּ בְּעֵינֵיהּ. כַּרְמֶל מִקָּלִי לָא אָתֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָלִי נִתְרַבָּה אֵצֶל מְנָחוֹת, כַּרְמֶל לֹא נִתְרַבָּה אֵצֶל מְנָחוֹת!
human_translation: Let write “parched grain,” and let it not write bread and we will derive from parched grain. bread cannot be derived from parched grain due to that parched grain is in its unadulterated form, bread is not in its unadulterated form, fresh stalks cannot be derived from parched grain due to that parched grain an increased with regard to meal offerings, fresh stalks do not an increased with regard to meal offerings.
llm_translation: It is written "kalī" and not "lekhem," and it is derived from "kalī." "Lekhem" does not come from "kalī," because with regard to "kalī," it has its own significance, but with regard to "lekhem," it does not have its own significance. "Karmel" does not come from "kalī," because the "kalī" has increased in relation to meal-offerings, but the "karmel" has not increased in relation to meal-offerings!

hebrew_text: נִכְתּוֹב כַּרְמֶל וְנֵילַף לֶחֶם וְקָלִי מִינֵּיהּ. אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְכַרְמֶל שֶׁכֵּן לֹא נִשְׁתַּנָּה מִבְּרִיָּיתוֹ! מִן חַד לָא יָלְפִי, נֵילַף חֲדָא מִן תְּרֵין?
human_translation: Let write “fresh stalks,” and we will derive bread and parched grain from can be refuted: What about fresh stalks? in that they have not changed from their original state cannot be derived from one let us derive one from two.
llm_translation: It is written: "Like Carmel and it will be taken away bread and parched grain from it." Is there to differentiate: What about Carmel that it did not change from its creation! From one side it will not be taken, shall we take one from two?

hebrew_text: לָא נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא לֶחֶם וְנֵילַף מִקָּלִי וְכַרְמֶל – אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְקָלִי וְכַרְמֶל דְּאִיתַנְהוֹן בְּעֵינֵיהוֹן! לָא נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא כַּרְמֶל וְנֵילַף מִלֶּחֶם וְקָלִי – אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְלֶחֶם וְקָלִי שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבּוּ אֵצֶל מְנָחוֹת!
human_translation: Let the verse not write bread, and let us derive from parched grain and fresh stalks. can be refuted: What about parched grain and fresh stalks? that they are in their unadulterated form. Let the verse not write fresh stalks, and let us derive from bread and parched grain. can be refuted: What about bread and parched grain? in that they an increased with regard to meal offerings.
llm_translation: It is not written "bread" and derived from "vineyard" and "carmel" - there is room to refute: what about "vineyard" and "carmel" that they are mentioned in their own right! It is not written "carmel" and derived from "bread" and "roasted grain" - there is room to refute: what about "bread" and "roasted grain" that they have increased with regard to meal-offerings!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יִצְחָק: לָא נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא קָלִי, וְנֵילַף מִלֶּחֶם וְכַרְמֶל. מַאי פָּרְכַתְּ? אִי פָּרְכַתְּ: מָה לְלֶחֶם, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה אֵצֶל חַלָּה – כַּרְמֶל יוֹכִיחַ! וְאִי מִשּׁוּם דְּכַרְמֶל לֹא נִשְׁתַּנָּה מִבְּרִיָּיתוֹ – לֶחֶם יוֹכִיחַ! הִלְכָּךְ לוֹקֶה, דִּמְיַיתַּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak say to you: Let the verse not write parched grain, and let us derive from bread and fresh stalks. What refute If you refute What about bread? in that it an increased with regard to ḥalla , fresh stalks will prove And if due to fresh stalks not changed from original state, bread will prove Therefore, is flogged as is superfluous.
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Yitzchak: It is not written a light verse, and is derived from bread and Carmel. What is the explanation? If it is an explanation: Just as with bread, for it has increased in value next to challah - Carmel will prove it! And if it is because Carmel has not changed from its creation - bread will prove it! Therefore, he is liable, for he is more stringent.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: קָלִי דִּמְיַיתַּר מִחַיַּיב חֲדָא, אַכּוּלְּהוֹן מִחַיַּיב חֲדָא! אִם כֵּן, נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״לֶחֶם כַּרְמֶל וְקָלִי״, אִי נָמֵי נִכְתּוֹב: ״קָלִי וְלֶחֶם וְכַרְמֶל״, אַמַּאי כְּתַב לְקָלִי בָּאֶמְצַע? הָכִי קָאָמַר: לֶחֶם בְּקָלִי נִחַיַּיב וְכַרְמֶל נִחַיַּיב בְּקָלִי.
human_translation: But say parched grain, whose is superfluous, is liable one for all of them, is liable one If so, let the verse write: Bread, fresh stalks, and parched grain; alternatively, let it write: Parched grain, bread, and fresh stalks. Why does it write of parched grain in between This is saying: bread is liable to parched grain, and fresh stalks is liable to parched grain.
llm_translation: And why? Soft (bread) which is more luxurious than hard (bread) is liable one, (but) if they ate them (both) they are liable one! If so, it should be written in the verse: "bread of Carmel and soft," or rather it should be written: "soft and bread and Carmel," why did (the verse) write soft in the middle? This is what it means to say: bread with soft is liable and Carmel is liable with soft.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: לְעוֹלָם אַל תְּהִי גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה קַלָּה בְּעֵינֶיךָ, שֶׁהֲרֵי פִּיגּוּל אֶחָד מִגּוּפֵי תוֹרָה, וְלֹא לִימְּדוֹ הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא מִגְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai says: A verbal analogy should never be lightly regarded in your eyes, as an offering that was sacrificed with the intent to consume it after its appointed time [ piggul ] one of the fundamental of the Torah, and the verse taught it only through a verbal analogy.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: Always do not be a decree equal light in your eyes, for behold one Pigul from bodies of Torah, and not taught Scripture except from decree equal.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, תָּנֵי זַבְדָּא בַּר לֵוִי: נֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן: ״וְאוֹכְלָיו עֲוֹנוֹ יִשָּׂא״, וְנֶאֱמַר כָּאן: ״וְהַנֶּפֶשׁ הָאֹכֶלֶת מִמֶּנּוּ עֲוֹנָהּ תִּשָּׂא״, מָה לְהַלָּן כָּרֵת – אַף כָּאן כָּרֵת.
human_translation: as Rabbi Yoḥanan says Zavda bar Levi teaches: It is stated there, “But everyone who eats it shall bear his iniquity” and it is stated here, “And the soul that eats it shall bear his iniquity” Just as there karet , so too here, karet .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yochanan said, Zavda bar Levi taught: It is stated there: "And those who eat it shall bear his iniquity," and it is stated here: "But the soul that eats of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, that pertain to the Lord, having his uncleanness upon him, that soul shall be cut off from his people." Just as there, it is karet - so too here, it is karet.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי סִימַאי: לְעוֹלָם אַל תְּהִי גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה קַלָּה בְּעֵינֶיךָ, שֶׁהֲרֵי נוֹתָר אֶחָד מִגּוּפֵי תוֹרָה, וְלֹא לִימְּדוֹ הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא מִגְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Simai says: A verbal analogy should never be lightly regarded in your eyes, as notar , one of the fundamental of the Torah, and the verse taught it only through a verbal analogy.
llm_translation: Rabbi Simlai said: Always do not be a decree that appears light in your eyes, for behold, one remains from the bodies of the Torah, and the Scripture only taught it from a decree that appears light.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא? יָלֵיף ״קֹדֶשׁ״ ״קֹדֶשׁ״ – ״וְאוֹכְלָיו עֲוֹנוֹ יִשָּׂא כִּי אֶת קֹדֶשׁ ה׳ חִלֵּל״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְשָׂרַפְתָּ אֶת הַנּוֹתָר בָּאֵשׁ כִּי קֹדֶשׁ וְגוֹ׳״
human_translation: What is derives “sacred” “sacred” “But everyone who eats it shall bear his iniquity, because he has profaned the sacred thing of the Lord” and it is written: “You shall burn the leftovers [ notar ] in fire; for sacred”
llm_translation: What is it? It should be derived: "holy" "holy" - "And those who eat it shall bear their iniquity, for he has profaned the holy things of the Lord," and it is written: "And you shall burn the remainder with fire, for it is holy, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם אַל תְּהִי גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה קַלָּה בְּעֵינֶיךָ, שֶׁהֲרֵי בִּתּוֹ מֵאֲנוּסָתוֹ הֵן הֵן גּוּפֵי תוֹרָה, וְלֹא לִימְּדָהּ הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא מִגְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: Abaye says: A verbal analogy should never be lightly regarded in your eyes, as one’s daughter from the woman he raped is the fundamental of the Torah, and the verse taught it only through a verbal analogy.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Always do not be a decree that appears light in your eyes, for indeed his daughter is his betrothed, and they are the bodies of the Torah, and the Scripture did not teach it except from a similar decree.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רָבָא, אֲמַר לִי רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: אָתְיָא ״הֵנָּה״ ״הֵנָּה״ לְאִיסּוּרָא,
human_translation: as Rava says: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said to me derived “they [ henna ]” “they [ henna ],” with regard to the prohibition
llm_translation: Rava said, Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi told me: The word "henna" "henna" comes to include prohibition.

hebrew_text: אָתְיָא ״זִמָּה״ ״זִמָּה״ לִשְׂרֵפָה.
human_translation: derived lewdness” “lewdness” to burning.
llm_translation: It was taught: "Zimah, Zimah" for burning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אַל תְּהִי גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה קַלָּה בְּעֵינֶיךָ, שֶׁהֲרֵי נִסְקָלִים הֵן הֵן גּוּפֵי תוֹרָה, וְלֹא לִימְּדָהּ הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא מִגְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה,
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: A verbal analogy should not be lightly regarded in your eyes, as those who are stoning is one the fundamental of the Torah, and the verse taught it only through a verbal analogy.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Do not consider a decree that seems light in your eyes, for they are stonings, they are the bodies of Torah, and the Scripture did not teach it except from a decree that seems light.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן: ״דְּמֵיהֶם בָּם״ וְנֶאֱמַר בְּאוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי: ״דְּמֵיהֶם בָּם״. מָה לְהַלָּן – בִּסְקִילָה, אַף כָּאן – בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: as it is taught it is stated here, “Their blood shall be upon them” and it is stated with regard to a necromancer and a sorcerer: “Their blood shall be upon them” Just as there, by stoning, so too here, by stoning.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught in a Baraita: It is stated here: "Their blood is upon them," and it is stated in the case of the medium: "Their blood is upon them." Just as there - by stoning, so too here - by stoning.

hebrew_text: הַמְּפַטֵּם אֶת הַשֶּׁמֶן כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְּפַטֵּם אֶת הַשֶּׁמֶן לִלְמוֹד בּוֹ, לְמוֹסְרוֹ לַצִּיבּוּר – פָּטוּר, לָסוּךְ – חַיָּיב. וְהַסָּךְ מִמֶּנּוּ – פָּטוּר, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין חַיָּיבִין אֶלָּא עַל סִיכַת שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה שֶׁעָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: one who blends the oil The Sages taught One who blends the oil to learn it to transfer it to the community exempt. to apply liable. And one who applies exempt, because he is liable for applying only the anointing oil that was prepared by Moses alone,
llm_translation: The one who mixes the oil, etc. The Rabbis taught: One who mixes the oil for the purpose of learning from it, or to give it to the congregation - is exempt; if he mixes it for anointing - he is liable. And one who is anointed from it - is exempt, because one is only liable for the anointing oil that Moses made alone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: לִלְמוֹד בּוֹ עַל מְנָת לְמוֹסְרוֹ לַצִּיבּוּר – פָּטוּר. מְנָלַן? אַתְיָא ״מַתְכֻּנְתּוֹ״ מִן ״בְּמַתְכּוּנְתָּהּ״ דִּקְטֹרֶת, וּכְתִיב לְגַבֵּי קְטֹרֶת: ״לֹא תַעֲשׂוּ לָכֶם״ – לָכֶם הוּא דְּאָסוּר, אֲבָל לְמוֹסְרוֹ לַצִּיבּוּר – פָּטוּר, גַּבֵּי שֶׁמֶן נָמֵי, לְמוֹסְרוֹ לַצִּיבּוּר – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: The Master said to learn it in order to transfer it to the community exempt. From where do we derived from “Its composition” “According to its composition” with regard to incense. And it is written with regard to incense it is for yourselves that is prohibited, but to transfer it to the community exempt. With regard to oil as well, to transfer it to the community exempt.
llm_translation: Master said: To learn it for the purpose of teaching it to the congregation - exempt. From where do we derive this? It is derived from "its composition" from "its composition" of the incense, and it is written regarding the incense: "You shall not make it for yourselves" - for yourselves it is prohibited, but for the purpose of teaching it to the congregation - exempt, concerning anointing oil, for the purpose of teaching it to the congregation - exempt.

hebrew_text: וְתִיהְדַּר קְטֹרֶת וְנֵילַף מִשֶּׁמֶן: מָה שֶׁמֶן כִּי מְפַטֵּם לַחֲצָיִין – פָּטוּר, אַף קְטֹרֶת נָמֵי כִּי מְפַטֵּם לַחֲצָיִין – פָּטוּר! אַלְּמָה אָמַר רָבָא: קְטֹרֶת שֶׁפִּטְּמָהּ לַחֲצָיִין – חַיָּיב, שֶׁמֶן שֶׁפִּטְּמוֹ לַחֲצָיִין – פָּטוּר?
human_translation: But let incense return and let us derive from oil: Just as when one blends in halves, exempt, so too, incense, when one blends in halves exempt. Why, Rava say: incense that one blended in halves, liable, oil that one blended in halves, exempt?
llm_translation: "And he shall offer the incense and shall turn away from the oil: What oil, for it seals the cracks - exempt, so too incense, for it seals the cracks - exempt! Why did Rava say: Incense that one sealed the cracks with it - liable, oil that one sealed the cracks with - exempt?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: גַּבֵּי שֶׁמֶן כְּתִיב ״וּבְמַתְכֻּנְתּוֹ לֹא תַעֲשׂוּ כָּמוֹהוּ״ – כָּמוֹהוּ הוּא דְּאָסוּר, אֲבָל חֶצְיוֹ שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי. גַּבֵּי קְטֹרֶת דִּכְתִיב ״וְהַקְּטֹרֶת אֲשֶׁר תַּעֲשֶׂה״ – כֹּל עֲשִׂיָּיה דִקְטֹרֶת אֶפְשָׁר דְּמַקְטֵיר פְּרָס שַׁחֲרִית וּפְרָס בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם.
human_translation: Rava say to you: With regard to oil it is written: “Neither shall you prepare any like it according to its composition” it is like it that is prohibited, but half of it, well with regard to incense, as it is written: “And the incense that you shall prepare, any preparing of incense possible to burn a portion, in the morning, and a portion in the afternoon.
llm_translation: Rava said to you: Regarding oil, it is written, "And in its preparation you shall not make it like it" - like it is prohibited, but its half is fine. Regarding the incense offering, as it is written, "And the incense that you shall make" - all the actions of the incense offering are possible to perform, as one may burn half in the morning and half between the evenings.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה מׇר דְּרוֹר חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת, קִדָּה חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת, קִנְּמָן בֶּשֶׂם חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת, וּקְנֵה בֹשֶׂם חֲמִשִּׁים וּמָאתָיִם, נִמְצְאוּ כּוּלָּם אֶלֶף וְשִׁבְעָה מֵאוֹת וַחֲמִשִּׁים.
human_translation: The Sages taught The anointing oil pure myrrh 500 cassia 500 aromatic cinnamon 500 and aromatic calamus 250 It is found all of them 1,750
llm_translation: The sages taught: The anointing oil of myrrh, five hundred; cinnamon, five hundred; calamus, five hundred; cassia, five hundred; together a thousand seven hundred and fifty.

hebrew_text: תְּנָא מִנְיָינָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנָא הָא קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ, אֵימָא: קְנֵה בֹשֶׂם כְּקִנְּמׇן בֶּשֶׂם, מָה קִנְּמׇן בֶּשֶׂם מַחֲצִיתוֹ בַּחֲמִשִּׁים וּמָאתַיִם – אַף קְנֵה בֹשֶׂם מַחֲצִיתוֹ חֲמִשִּׁים וּמָאתָיִם, דְּהָווּ לְהוּ תְּרֵין אֲלָפִים.
human_translation: Does the tanna teach us the tally? this is difficult for the tanna : say aromatic calamus like aromatic cinnamon: Just as half of aromatic cinnamon two hundred and fifty, so too, half of aromatic calamus two hundred and fifty, which is two thousand.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches us the principle? The Mishnah raises a difficulty against it, saying: "Acquire balsam like cinnamon in value, just as cinnamon is half its weight in fifty and two hundred - so too, acquire balsam half its weight in fifty and two hundred, for they were worth two thousand."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי! אִם כֵּן, נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״קִנְּמׇן בֶּשֶׂם וּקְנֵה בֹשֶׂם מֶחֱצָה וּמֶחֱצָה חֲמִשִּׁים וּמָאתַיִם״.
human_translation: But say indeed If so, let the verse write: And of aromatic cinnamon and of aromatic calamus half so much and half so much, two hundred and fifty.
llm_translation: And why not say thus! If so, it should be written in the verse: "Cinnamon and sweet cane, with cassia, a hin of each."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: כְּשֶׁהוּא שׁוֹקֵל, בְּהֶכְרֵעַ הוּא שׁוֹקֵל, אוֹ עַיִן בְּעַיִן הוּא שׁוֹקֵל? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַחֲמָנָא כְּתַב: ״בַּד בְּבַד״, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ בְּהֶכְרֵעַ? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יוֹדֵעַ הַכְרָעוֹת, אַלְמָא דְּאִית בְּהוּ הֶכְרֵעַ!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: When one weighs does he weigh with surplus, does he weigh with precision? said to him the Merciful One writes: “Of each there shall be a like weight” and you say with a surplus? But doesn’t Rabbi Yehuda say: The Holy One, Blessed be He, knows surpluses Evidently, there is a surplus in these
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: When he is weighing, is he weighing with the foot, or is he weighing eye to eye? He said to him: The Merciful One wrote: "alone by itself," and you say with the foot? But didn't Rav Yehudah say: The Holy One, blessed be He, knows the inclinations, indicating that there is an inclination in it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: דְּקִנְּמׇן בֶּשֶׂם אַמַּאי מַיְיתֵי מַחֲצִיתוֹ דַּחֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת, חֲמִשִּׁים וּמָאתַיִם בְּחַד זִימְנָא וַחֲמִשִּׁים וּמָאתַיִם בְּחַד זִימְנָא? כֵּיוָן דְּכוּלְּהוֹן חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת הָוַיִין, נַיְיתֵי חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת בְּבַת אַחַת! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, מִדְּקָמַיְיתֵי לַהּ לְקִנְּמׇן בֶּשֶׂם בִּתְרֵי זִימְנֵי, הֶכְרֵעַ אִית בֵּיהּ, וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יוֹדֵעַ בְּהֶכְרֵעוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yehuda says: With regard to aromatic cinnamon, why does one bring half of its of five hundred, two hundred and fifty at one time, and two hundred and fifty at one time? Since its entire is five hundred, let him bring five hundred all at once. Conclude from that one brings aromatic cinnamon at two times there is a surplus in this and the Holy One, Blessed be He, knows of surpluses.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yehudah said: When one acquires with the name of "why" does he bring half of five hundred, fifty and two hundred in one time and fifty and two hundred in one time? Since all of them are five hundred, he should bring five hundred at once! Learn from it, since when he acquires with the name in two times, there is a dispute in it, and the Holy One, blessed be He, knows in the disputes.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״בַּד בְּבַד״? אָמַר רָבִינָא: שֶׁלֹּא יַנִּיחַ מִשְׁקָל בְּמִשְׁקָל וְיִשְׁקוֹל.
human_translation: But what “Of each there shall be a like weight”? Ravina said: that one should not place a weight against weight and weigh
llm_translation: "What is 'bad be-vad'?" Ravina said: "That one should not place weight upon weight, and weigh."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה שֶׁעָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה בְמִדְבַּר – מְשַׁלְּקוֹ הָעִיקָּרִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וַהֲלֹא לָסוּךְ הָעִיקָּרִין אֵינוֹ סִיפֵּק! כֵּיצַד עוֹשֶׂה? הֵבִיאוּ הָעִיקָּרִין וּשְׁלָקוּם בְּמַיִם, וְהֵצִיף עֲלֵיהֶן שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה, וְקָלַט אֶת הָרֵיחַ, וְקִיפְּחוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught the anointing oil that Moses prepared in the wilderness? cook the roots in it; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei said to him: But is not sufficient to apply the roots, how act? They brought the roots and boiled them in water and one poured the anointing oil on and absorb the fragrance and removed [ vekipeḥo ]
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The anointing oil that Moses made in the wilderness - it separates the primary ingredients, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei said to him: Isn't it insufficient to mix the primary ingredients! How does one do it? They brought the primary ingredients and mixed them with water, and poured the anointing oil over them, and it absorbed the scent, and it congealed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yehuda:

hebrew_text: וְכִי נֵס אֶחָד נַעֲשָׂה בַּשֶּׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה? וַהֲלֹא נִסִּים הַרְבֵּה נַעֲשׂוּ בּוֹ מִתְּחִלָּתוֹ וְעַד סוֹפוֹ, תְּחִלָּתוֹ לֹא הָיָה אֶלָּא שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר לוֹג, וּבוֹ נִמְשַׁח הַמִּשְׁכָּן וְכֵלָיו וְאַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו כׇּל שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַמִּלּוּאִים, וּבוֹ נִמְשְׁחוּ כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים וּמְלָכִים, וְכוּלּוֹ קַיָּים לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא,
human_translation: And was one miracle performed with the anointing oil? But many miracles were performed with it, from its initial to its end. Its initial was only twelve log , and the Tabernacle and its vessels were anointed with it, and Aaron and his sons all the seven days of inauguration, and High Priests and kings were anointed with it and it all intact for the future.
llm_translation: "And was there only one miracle performed with the anointing oil? But weren't many miracles performed with it from its inception until its end? At its inception, it was only twelve log, and with it the Tabernacle, its vessels, Aaron, and his sons were anointed for all seven days of the consecration. And with it high priests and kings were anointed, and it will all be valid for the future to come."

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שֶׁמֶן מִשְׁחַת קֹדֶשׁ יִהְיֶה זֶה לִי לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶם״ – ״זֶה״ בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר לוּגִּין הָוְיָין.
human_translation: as it is stated: “This [ zeh ] shall be a sacred anointing oil to Me throughout your generations” zeh has a numerical value [ bigimatriya ] twelve, log are
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "It shall be a holy anointing oil to Me throughout your generations" - "this" in gematria is twelve logs shall be. English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה וַיִּמְשַׁח אֶת הַמִּשְׁכָּן וְגוֹ׳״, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה שֶׁעָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה בַּמִּדְבָּר הַרְבֵּה נִסִּים נַעֲשׂוּ בּוֹ מִתְּחִלָּתוֹ וְעַד סוֹפוֹ: תְּחִלָּתוֹ לֹא הָיָה אֶלָּא שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר לוּגִּין, כַּמָּה יוֹרָה בּוֹלַעַת, כַּמָּה עִיקָּרִין בּוֹלְעִין, כַּמָּה הָאוּר שׂוֹרֵף, וּבוֹ נִמְשַׁח מִשְׁכָּן וְכֵלָיו, אַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו כָּל שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַמְּלוּאִים,
human_translation: The Sages taught “And Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the Tabernacle Rabbi Yehuda says: the anointing oil that Moses prepared in the wilderness, many miracles were performed with it, from its initial to its end. Its initial was only twelve log ; how much a cauldron absorbs and how much roots absorb, how much the fire burns, and the Tabernacle, and its vessels, Aaron, and his sons were anointed with it all seven days of the inauguration.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And Moses took the anointing oil and anointed the Tabernacle, etc." Rabbi Yehuda says: The anointing oil that Moses made in the wilderness had many miracles performed with it from its beginning to its end: At its beginning, it was only twelve log, how much it would saturate, how much it would absorb, how much light it would emit. With it, the Tabernacle and all its vessels, Aaron and his sons were anointed for seven days of inauguration.

hebrew_text: וּבוֹ נִמְשְׁחוּ כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים וּמְלָכִים. וַאֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בֶּן כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל טָעוּן מְשִׁיחָה. וְאֵין מוֹשְׁחִין מֶלֶךְ בֶּן מֶלֶךְ. וְאֵם תֹּאמַר: מִפְּנֵי מָה מָשְׁחוּ אֶת שְׁלֹמֹה? מִפְּנֵי מַחְלוֹקֶת אֲדוֹנִיָּה, וְאֶת יְהוֹאָשׁ – מִפְּנֵי עֲתַלְיָה, וְאֶת יְהוֹאָחָז – מִפְּנֵי יְהוֹיָקִים אָחִיו, שֶׁהָיָה גָּדוֹל מֵאֶחָיו שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים.
human_translation: And High Priests and kings were anointed with it, and even a High Priest, the son of a High Priest, requires anointing But one does not anoint a king, the son of a king. And if you say: for what did they anoint King Solomon, due to the dispute Adonijah, And Joash, due to Athaliah, And Jehoahaz, due to Jehoiakim, his brother, who was two years older than his brother,
llm_translation: And in it were anointed high priests and kings. And even a high priest, son of a high priest, requires anointing. And we do not anoint a king, son of a king. And if you say: Why was Solomon anointed? Because of the dispute of Adonijah. And Jehoash - because of Athaliah. And Jehoahaz - because of his brother Jehoiakim, who was two years older than him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: וַאֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בֵּן כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל טָעוּן מְשִׁיחָה. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַכֹּהֵן הַמָּשִׁיחַ תַּחְתָּיו מִבָּנָיו״, נֵימָא קְרָא ״וְהַכֹּהֵן שֶׁתַּחְתָּיו מִבָּנָיו״, מַאי ״הַמָּשִׁיחַ״? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ מִבָּנָיו, הָהוּא דִּמְשַׁח הָוֵי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְאִי לָא מְשַׁח לָא הָוֵי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: The Master said And even a High Priest, the son of a High Priest, requires anointing. From where do we as it is written: “And the anointed priest that shall be in his stead from among his sons” Let the verse say The priest that shall be in his stead from among his sons. What “anointed”? This teaches us that even from among sons that who is anointed is High Priest, but if not anointed is not High Priest.
llm_translation: The Master said: Even a High Priest, son of a High Priest, requires anointing. From where do we derive this? As it is written: "And the priest who is anointed from among his sons." Let us say the verse reads: "And the priest who is beneath him from among his sons." What is the meaning of "the anointed one"? This teaches us that even from among his sons, the one who was anointed becomes a High Priest, and if he was not anointed, he does not become a High Priest.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אֵין מוֹשְׁחִין מֶלֶךְ בֶּן מֶלֶךְ. מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְמַעַן יַאֲרִיךְ יָמִים עַל מַמְלַכְתּוֹ הוּא וּבָנָיו כׇּל הַיָּמִים״ – יְרוּשָּׁה הִיא.
human_translation: The Master said But one does not anoint a king, the son of a king. From where do we Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said as it is written: In order that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he and his sons, all the days is an inheritance,
llm_translation: Master said: One does not anoint a king, son of a king. From where do we derive this? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said, as it is written: "So that his days may be prolonged upon his kingdom, he and his sons, all the days" - it is an inheritance.

hebrew_text: וּמִפְּנֵי מָה מָשְׁחוּ אֶת שְׁלֹמֹה? מִפְּנֵי מַחְלוֹקֶת אֲדוֹנִיָּה. מְנָלַן דְּכִי אָתֵי מַחְלוֹקֶת בָּעֵי מְשִׁיחָה, וְלָא כׇּל דְּבָעֵי מַלְכָּא מוֹרֵית לֵיהּ מַלְכוּתָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״בְּקֶרֶב יִשְׂרָאֵל״ – בִּזְמַן שֶׁשָּׁלוֹם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And for what did they anoint King Solomon? Due to the dispute Adonijah. From where do we that where there is a dispute requires anointing, and the king cannot grant the kingship as an inheritance to whomever he desires? Rav Pappa said the verse states: in the midst of Israel” At a time when there is peace in Israel
llm_translation: And why did they anoint Solomon? Because of the dispute of Adoniyah. From where do we know that when a dispute arises, the Messiah is desired, and not everyone who desires kingship attains it? Rav Papa said, the verse says: "In the midst of Israel" - when there is peace in Israel.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: אַף יֵהוּא בֶּן נִמְשִׁי לֹא נִמְשַׁח אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי מַחְלוֹקֶת יוֹרָם בֶּן אַחְאָב: אַמַּאי? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּמֶלֶךְ רִאשׁוֹן הוּא! חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: מַלְכֵי בֵּית דָּוִד מוֹשְׁחִין, מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵין מוֹשְׁחִין. וְאִם תֹּאמַר: מִפְּנֵי מָה מָשְׁחוּ יֵהוּא בֶּן נִמְשִׁי? מִפְּנֵי מַחְלוֹקֶת יוֹרָם בֶּן אַחְאָב.
human_translation: taught Also Jehu, son of Nimshi, was anointed only due to dispute Joram, son of Ahab, Why Let derive that he the first king is incomplete, and this it is teaching: One anoints the kings of the house of David one does not anoint the kings of Israel. And if you say: For what did anoint Jehu, son of Nimshi? due to dispute Joram, son of Ahab.
llm_translation: It was taught: Even Jehu ben Nimshi was anointed only due to the dispute of Joram ben Ahab. Why? Let him come out as a king of the first rank! Because of the lack of genealogy, and thus it is taught: Kings of the House of David are anointed, kings of Israel are not anointed. And if you say: Why was Jehu ben Nimshi anointed? Because of the dispute of Joram ben Ahab.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מַלְכֵי בֵּית דָּוִד מוֹשְׁחִין, וְאֵין מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מוֹשְׁחִין. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״קוּם מְשָׁחֵהוּ כִּי זֶה הוּא״ – זֶה טָעוּן מְשִׁיחָה, וְאֵין אַחֵר טָעוּן מְשִׁיחָה.
human_translation: The Master said One anoints the kings of the house of David one does not anoint the kings of Israel. From where do we as it is written “Arise, anoint him; for this is he” This requires anointing, but another does not require anointing.
llm_translation: Master said: Kings of the house of David are anointed, and kings of Israel are not anointed. From where do we derive this? As it is written: "Arise, anoint him, for this is he" - this one requires anointing, and no other requires anointing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מִפְּנֵי מַחְלוֹקֶת יוֹרָם. וּמִשּׁוּם מַחְלוֹקֶת יוֹרָם בֶּן אַחְאָב נִמְעַל בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה? כִּדְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בַּאֲפַרְסְמָא דַּכְיָא, הָכָא נָמֵי בַּאֲפַרְסְמָא דַּכְיָא.
human_translation: The Master said due to dispute Joram. And due to dispute Joram, son of Ahab, will we misuse with the anointing oil, as Rav Pappa said with pure balsam Here too, with pure balsam
llm_translation: Master said: Because of the dispute of Yoram. And because of the dispute of Yoram son of Achav, was he removed from the anointing oil? As Rav Papa said: In the dust of the millstone, here too in the dust of the millstone.

hebrew_text: וְאֶת יְהוֹאָחָז מִפְּנֵי יְהוֹיָקִים, שֶׁהָיָה גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים. וּמִי קַשִּׁישׁ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּבְנֵי יֹאשִׁיָּה הַבְּכוֹר יוֹחָנָן וְהַשֵּׁנִי יְהוֹיָקִים וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁי צִדְקִיָּהוּ וְהָרְבִיעִי שַׁלּוּם״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הוּא יְהוֹאָחָז, הוּא צִדְקִיָּהוּ, הוּא שַׁלּוּם!
human_translation: And Jehoahaz, due to Jehoiakim, his brother, who was two years older than him. And was older But isn’t it written: “And the sons of Josiah: The firstborn Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum” and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: is Jehoahaz, is Zedekiah is Shallum.
llm_translation: And Jehoahaz from before Jehoiakim, that he was greater from him two years. And who was the elder? And it is written: "And the sons of Josiah, the firstborn Johanan, and the second Jehoiakim, and the third Zedekiah, and the fourth Shallum," and Rabbi Yochanan said: He is Jehoahaz, he is Zedekiah, he is Shallum!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם יְהוֹיָקִים קַשִּׁישׁ, וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ בְּכוֹר – שֶׁהוּא בְּכוֹר לַמַּלְכוּת. וּמִי מוֹקְמִינַן זוּטָא קַמֵּי קַשִּׁישָׁא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת הַמַּמְלָכָה נָתַן לִיהוֹרָם כִּי הוּא הַבְּכוֹר״! הַהוּא מְמַלֵּא מְקוֹם אֲבוֹתָיו הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rather, Jehoiakim actually older And why call firstborn? that firstborn with regard to the monarchy, And do we establish the younger before the older But isn’t it written “And he gave the kingdom to Jehoram, because he was the firstborn” was who filled the place of his fathers,
llm_translation: Rather, forever Jehoiakim was elderly, and why is he called by the name "Bechor" - because he is the firstborn to the kingdom. And who established this smallness before the elder? And it is written: "And he gave the kingdom to Jehoram because he was the firstborn"! That one who fills the place of his fathers was.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: הוּא שַׁלּוּם הוּא צִדְקִיָּה. וְהָא בְּדָרֵי קָחָשֵׁיב! וּמַאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ שְׁלִישִׁי? שֶׁהוּא שְׁלִישִׁי לַבָּנִים, וּמַאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ רְבִיעִי? שֶׁהוּא רְבִיעִי לַמַּלְכוּת, מִשּׁוּם דִּמְלַךְ יְכָנְיָה קַמֵּיהּ – בִּתְחִלָּה מְלַךְ יְהוֹאָחָז, וְסוֹף מְלַךְ יְהוֹיָקִים, וְסוֹף מְלַךְ יְכָנְיָה, וְסוֹף מְלַךְ צִדְקִיָּה.
human_translation: The Master said is Shallum is Zedekiah. But the Torah counts in a row, and what calls third? that he is third of the sons, And what calls fourth? that he is fourth to the kingship, because Jeconiah reigned before him. Initially Jehoahaz reigned, and afterward Jehoiakim and afterward Jeconiah and afterward Zedekiah
llm_translation: Master said: He is Shalum, he is Zedekiah. But isn't he from the descendants of King Jehoiachin! And why is he called the third? Because he is the third in line for the throne. And why is he called the fourth? Because he is the fourth in the kingdom, since King Jehoiachin stood before him – initially King Jehoahaz reigned, and in the end King Jehoiakim, and in the end King Jehoiachin, and in the end King Zedekiah.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוּא שַׁלּוּם הוּא צִדְקִיָּה, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ שַׁלּוּם? שֶׁהָיָה שָׁלֵם בְּמַעֲשָׂיו. דָּבָר אַחֵר: שַׁלּוּם – שֶׁשָּׁלֵם מַלְכוּת בֵּית דָּוִד בְּיָמָיו, וּמָה שְׁמוֹ? מַתַּנְיָה שְׁמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּמְלֵךְ אֶת מַתַּנְיָה דֹדוֹ תַּחְתָּיו וַיַּסֵּב שְׁמוֹ צִדְקִיָּה״,
human_translation: The Sages taught is Shallum is Zedekiah, and why was he called Shallum? Because he was perfect [ shalem ] in his deeds. Alternatively, Shallum because in his days the kingdom of the house of David was completed [ shalam ], And what his name? Mattaniah his name, as it is stated: “And the king of Babylonia made Mattaniah, his father’s brother, king in his stead, and changed his name to Zedekiah”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: He is Shalom, he is Tzidkiyahu, and why was his name called Shalom? Because he was whole in his actions. Another explanation: Shalom - that he established the kingdom of the house of David in his days, and what is his name? Matanyahu is his name, as it is stated: "And he made Matanyahu his uncle king in his place, and changed his name to Tzidkiyahu."

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר: לוֹ יָהּ יַצְדִּיק עָלֶיךָ אֶת הַדִּין אִם תִּמְרוֹד בִּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְבִיאֵהוּ בָבֶלָה״ וּכְתִיב: ״וְגַם בַּמֶּלֶךְ נְבוּכַד נֶאצַּר מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל מָרָד אֲשֶׁר הִשְׁבִּיעוֹ בֵּאלֹהִים״.
human_translation: that said to him: God will justify [ yatzdik ] the judgment over you if you rebel against me, as it is stated “And brought him to Babylon” “And he also rebelled against King Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear by God”
llm_translation: He said: "May God judge between you and me if you rebel against me," as it is said: "And he brought him to Babylon." And it is written: "And also King Nebuchadnezzar was rebellious against the king of Babylon, whom he had sworn by God."

hebrew_text: וּמִי הֲוָה שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: מִשֶּׁנִּגְנַז אָרוֹן נִגְנַז צִנְצֶנֶת הַמָּן, וּצְלוֹחִית שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה, וּמַקְלוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן שְׁקֵדִים וּפְרָחִים,
human_translation: And was there anointing oil But isn’t it taught from when Ark was sequestered, was sequestered the jar of manna and the flask of the anointing oil, and Aaron’s staff almonds and blossoms
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who was the anointing oil? And it was taught: From when the Ark was hidden, the jar of manna was hidden, and the cruse of anointing oil, and Aaron's staff with almonds and blossoms.

hebrew_text: וְאַרְגַּז שֶׁשִּׁגְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים דּוֹרוֹן לֵאלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֶת כְּלֵי הַזָּהָב אֲשֶׁר הֲשֵׁבֹתֶם לוֹ אָשָׁם תָּשִׂימוּ בָאַרְגַּז מִצִּדּוֹ״. וּמִי גְּנָזוֹ? יֹאשִׁיָּה מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה גְּנָזוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל הַכֹּהֲנִים תְּנוּ אֶת אֲרוֹן הַקֹּדֶשׁ״,
human_translation: And chest that the Philistines sent as a gift to the God of Israel as it is stated: “And put the jewels of gold that you return to Him for a guilt offering, in a coffer by its side, And who sequestered Josiah, king of Judah, sequestered it, as it is stated: And the king said to the priests: Put the sacred Ark
llm_translation: And the ark that the Philistines returned, they sent to the God of Israel, as it is said: "And the golden artifacts that you shall return to Him as a guilt offering, you shall place in the ark by its side." And who hid it? Josiah, king of Judah, hid it, as it is said: "And the king said to the priests, 'Put the holy ark...'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָתְיָא ״שָׁם״ ״שָׁם״,
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: derived “there” “there.”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: It is written "there" "there".

hebrew_text: אָתְיָא ״דּוֹרוֹת״ ״דּוֹרוֹת״,
human_translation: derived “generations” “generations.”
llm_translation: It is taught: "dorot" "dorot"

hebrew_text: אַתְיָא ״מִשְׁמֶרֶת״ ״מִשְׁמֶרֶת״. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בַּאֲפַרְסְמָא דַּכְיָא.
human_translation: derived “to be kept” “to be kept.” Rav Pappa said: with pure balsam.
llm_translation: The text states: "Mishmeret" "Mishmeret." Rav Papa said: In the town of Dakiya.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מוֹשְׁחִין אֶת הַמְּלָכִים כְּמִין נֵזֶר, וְאֶת הַכֹּהֲנִים כְּמִין ״כִּי״. אָמַר רַב מְנַשְּׁיָה: כְּמִין ״כִּי״ יְוָנִי. תָּנֵי חֲדָא: בַּתְּחִלָּה מַצִּיק שֶׁמֶן עַל רֹאשׁוֹ וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹתֵן לוֹ שֶׁמֶן בֵּין רִיסֵי עֵינָיו, וְתָנֵי אַחֲרִיתִי: בַּתְּחִלָּה נוֹתֵן לוֹ שֶׁמֶן בֵּין רִיסֵי עֵינָיו וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַצִּיק לוֹ שֶׁמֶן עַל רֹאשׁוֹ!
human_translation: The Sages taught One anoints the kings similar a crown, and one anoints the Priests similar chi. Rav Menashya says: similar Greek chi, is taught one First, one pours oil on head of and afterward one places oil between his eyelashes. And it is taught another First, one places oil between his eyelashes, and afterward one pours oil on his head.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Anoint kings like a type of crown, and anoint priests like a type of "ki." Rav Menashya said: A type of "ki" is Greek. One teaching: Initially, one places oil on his head, and afterwards puts oil between the hairs of his eyes. And another teaching: Initially, one puts oil between the hairs of his eyes, and afterwards anoints oil on his head!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְשִׁיחָה עֲדִיפָא, וְאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יְצִיקָה עֲדִיפָא. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר יְצִיקָה עֲדִיפָא – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּצֹק מִשֶּׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה עַל רֹאשׁ אַהֲרֹן״, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מְשִׁיחָה עֲדִיפָא – קָסָבַר: שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה אֵצֶל כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת.
human_translation: is tanna’im , there is who says: Anointing preferable and there is who says pouring preferable What is the reasoning of the one who says pouring preferable? As it is stated: “And he poured of the anointing oil upon Aaron’s head And the one who says anointing preferable he holds in that is increased, on the service vessels,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: There is for whom says anointing is preferable, and there is for whom says pouring is preferable. What is the reason for the one who says pouring is preferable? Because it is stated: "And he poured from the anointing oil upon Aaron's head." And the one who says anointing is preferable holds that it is so because it increased by the vessels of the service.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּצֹק״ וּלְבַסּוֹף ״וַיִּמְשַׁח״! הָכִי קָאָמַר: מָה טַעַם ״וַיִּצֹק״ – מִשּׁוּם ״וַיִּמְשַׁח אוֹתוֹ לְקַדְּשׁוֹ״.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “He poured,” and ultimately: “He anointed” this is saying: What is the reason “he poured”? due to “Anointed him to sanctify him.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And he poured" and ultimately "And he anointed"! This is what he is saying: What is the reason for "And he poured" - because of "And he anointed him to sanctify him".

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כַּשֶּׁמֶן הַטּוֹב הַיּוֹרֵד עַל הָרֹאשׁ וְגוֹ׳״ – כְּמִין שְׁתֵּי טִיפִּין מַרְגָּלִיּוֹת הָיוּ תְּלוּיוֹת לְאַהֲרֹן בִּזְקָנוֹ. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא, תָּנָא: כְּשֶׁהוּא מְסַפֵּר עוֹלוֹת וְיוֹשְׁבוֹת בְּעִיקָּרֵי זְקָנוֹ. וְעַל דָּבָר זֶה הָיָה מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ דּוֹאֵג, שֶׁמָּא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם מָעַלְתִּי בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught “It is like the precious oil upon the head Two drops like pearls hung from Aaron’s beard. Rav Kahana says taught: When would speak would rise and sit on the roots of his beard, And with regard to this matter Moses, our teacher, was concerned, Perhaps, God forbid, I misused the anointing oil
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Like the good oil that descends upon the head, etc." - They were like two drops of myrrh hanging on Aaron's beard. Rav Kahana said, a Tanna taught: When he would count the sacrifices and sit in the main part of his beard. And concerning this matter, our teacher Moses was concerned, lest he might have unintentionally ascended with the anointing oil.

hebrew_text: יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: ״כְּטַל חֶרְמוֹן שֶׁיֹּרֵד עַל הַרְרֵי צִיּוֹן״, מָה טַל אֵין בּוֹ מְעִילָה – אַף שֶׁמֶן שֶׁיּוֹרֵד עַל זְקַן אַהֲרֹן אֵין בּוֹ מְעִילָה.
human_translation: A Divine Voice emerged and said: like the dew of the Hermon that comes down upon the mountains of Zion” Just as the Hermon’s dew is not subject to misuse so too, oil that descends upon Aaron’s beard is not subject to misuse
llm_translation: A voice came forth and said: "Like the dew of Hermon that descends upon the mountains of Zion," just as dew does not have a covering - so too, oil that descends upon Aaron's beard does not have a covering.

hebrew_text: וַעֲדַיִין אַהֲרֹן הָיָה דּוֹאֵג, שֶׁמָּא מֹשֶׁה לֹא מָעַל, וַאֲנִי מָעַלְתִּי! יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לוֹ: ״הִנֵּה מַה טּוֹב וּמַה נָּעִים שֶׁבֶת אַחִים גַּם יָחַד״, מָה מֹשֶׁה לֹא מָעַל, אַף אַתָּה לֹא מָעַלְתָּ.
human_translation: And still Aaron himself was concerned, Perhaps Moses did not misuse but I misused A Divine Voice emerged and said to him: “Behold how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to dwell together in unity” Just as Moses did not misuse so too, you did not misuse
llm_translation: And still Aaron was worried, perhaps Moses did not ascend, and I ascended! A bat kol came out and said to him: "Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to dwell together." Just as Moses did not ascend, so too you did not ascend.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מוֹשְׁחִין אֶת הַמְּלָכִים אֶלָּא עַל הַמַּעְיָין, כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּימָּשֵׁךְ מַלְכוּתָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל בְּנָיָהוּ וְגוֹ׳ וְהוֹרַדְתֶּם אֹתוֹ עַל גִּחוֹן וְגוֹ׳ וּמָשַׁח אוֹתוֹ שָׁם״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One may anoint kings only next to a spring. so that their kingdom should continue As it is stated And the king said to Benaiah: and bring him down to Gihon. And anoint him there
llm_translation: The sages taught: Kings are anointed only upon a spring, so that their kingdom will endure, as it is stated: "And the king said to Benaiah, etc., and you shall bring him down to Gihon, etc., and anoint him there."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַמֵּי: הַאי מַאן דְּבָעֵי לִידַּע אִי מָשְׁכָא שַׁתָּא אִי לָא, מַיְיתֵי שְׁרָגָא בְּהָלֵין עַשְׂרָה יוֹמִין דְּבֵין רֵישׁ שַׁתָּא לְיוֹמָא דְכִיפּוּרֵי, וְנִיתְלֵי בְּבֵיתָא דְּלָא נָשֵׁיב זִיקָא, אִי מְשִׁיךְ נְהוֹרֵיהּ נִידַּע דְּמַסֵּיק שַׁתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ami says: One who desires to know if he will through year or not should bring candle during those ten days between Rosh HaShana and Yom Kippur and hang it in a house which wind does not blow, If its light continues he shall know that he will live out his year.
llm_translation: Rav Ammi said: Whoever wants to know whether it will rain or not, let him bring a jug of water on the eve of Yom Kippur, place it in a room where there is no window, and if it becomes moldy, he will know that rain is imminent.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּבָעֵי נַעֲבֵיד עִיסְקֵי, וּבָעֵי דְּנִידַּע אִי מַצְלַח עִיסְקֵיהּ אִי לָא, נִירַבֵּי תַּרְנְגוֹלָא, אִי שָׁמֵין וְשָׁפַר נִידַּע דְּמַצְלַח.
human_translation: And one who desires to conduct business and wants to know if business will succeed or not should raise a rooster. If gets fat and beautiful he shall know that will succeed.
llm_translation: And one who wants to engage in business, and wants to know whether his business will succeed or not, let him raise a rooster; if it crows well, he will know that he will succeed.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאן דְּבָעֵי נִיפּוֹק בְּאוֹרְחָא, וּבָעֵי דְּנִידַּע אִי הָדַר לְבֵיתֵיהּ – נִיעוֹל נֵיקוּם בְּבֵיתָא דְּבַהֲתָא, אִם חָזֵי
human_translation: This one who wishes to leave on a journey and wants to know whether he will return to his home should enter a dark house. If he sees
llm_translation: The one who wants to go out on the road, and wants to know if he can return home - let him first enter a house of study, if he sees...

hebrew_text: בָּבוּאָה לְבָבוּאָה דְבָבוּאָה, נִידַּע דְּאָתֵי לְבֵיתֵיהּ. וְלָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא, דִּילְמָא חָלְשָׁא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, וּמִתְּרַע מַזָּלֵיהּ.
human_translation: the reflection [ bavua ] of a reflection of reflection he shall know that he will come to his home. And this is nothing, perhaps he will become despondent and his fortune will turn bad,
llm_translation: Gate by gate, in the gate of the gate, it is known that he comes to his house. And it is not a matter, perhaps his mind is weak, and his luck is bad.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ סִימָנָא מִילְּתָא הִיא, יְהֵא רְגִיל אִינִישׁ לְמֵיכַל רֵישׁ שַׁתָּא קָרָא וְרוּבְּיָא, כַּרָּתֵי, סִילְקָא וְתַמְרֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said: Now that you have said a sign is matter, a person should be accustomed to eat, at the start of the year, gourd, fenugreek, leeks, beets, and dates,
llm_translation: Abaye said: "Now that you have said that a sign is a significant matter, a person should regularly eat the top of the radish and the majority of the gourd, beetroots, and dates."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא לִבְנֵיהּ: כִּי בָּעֵיתוּ לְמֵיזֵל לְמִגְמַר קַמֵּי רַבְּכוֹן, גְּרוּסוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא מַתְנִיתִין וַהֲדַר עוּלוּ קַמֵּי רַבְּכוֹן, וְכִי יָתְבִיתוּ קַמֵּי רַבְּכוֹן, חֲזוֹ לְפוּמֵּיהּ דְּרַבְּכוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיוּ עֵינֶיךָ רוֹאוֹת אֶת מוֹרֶיךָ״, וְכִי גָּרְסִיתוּ שְׁמַעְתָּא, גְּרוּסוּ עַל מַיָּא, דְּכִי הֵיכִי דְּמָשְׁכִי מַיָּא תִּמְשׁוֹךְ שְׁמַעְתְּכוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said to his sons: When you want to go to study in the presence of your teacher, initially study the mishnayot and then ascend before your teacher. And when you sit before your teacher, see your teacher’s mouth, as it is stated: “And your eyes shall see your teacher” And when you learn a halakha , learn near water, as just as the water continues, your learning should continue.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Mesharshaya said to his sons: When you wish to go out to complete before Rabban Gamliel, first learn the Mishnah thoroughly, then come and stand before Rabban Gamliel. And when you sit before Rabban Gamliel, look at his mouth, as it is said: "And your eyes shall see your teachers." And when you have learned something, learn it with water, for just as water flows, so too should your learning flow.

hebrew_text: אַקִּילְקֵי דְּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא, וְלָא אַפַּדְנֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא. טָב גִּילְדָּנָא סַרְיָא לְמֵיכַל מִכּוּתָּחָא דְּרָמֵי כֵּיפֵי.
human_translation: on the garbage piles [ akilkei ] of Mata Meḥasya and not in the palaces [ apadnei ] of Pumbedita. better to eat rotten fish [ gildana ] than kutḥa , which tosses rocks
llm_translation: The nobles of the city of Machseya were lenient, and did not redeem from the Pumbedita winepress. It is better to drag a carcass from the alley of Michalta than to raise cups in the presence of the wicked.

hebrew_text: ״וַתִּתְפַּלֵּל חַנָּה וַתֹּאמַר עָלַץ לִבִּי בַּה׳ רָמָה קַרְנִי״, ״רָמָה קַרְנִי״ וְלֹא ״רָמָה פַּכִּי״ – דָּוִד וּשְׁלֹמֹה שֶׁנִּמְשְׁחוּ בְּקֶרֶן – נִמְשְׁכָה מַלְכוּתָם, שָׁאוּל וְיֵהוּא שֶׁנִּמְשְׁחוּ מִן הַפַּךְ – לֹא נִמְשְׁכָה מַלְכוּתָם.
human_translation: “And Hannah prayed and said: My heart exults in the Lord, my horn is exalted “My horn is exalted,” and not My jug is exalted. David and Solomon, who were anointed with a horn, their kingships lasted. Saul and Jehu, who were anointed from a jug, their kingships did not last.
llm_translation: "And Hannah prayed and said, 'My heart exults in the Lord, my horn is exalted.' 'My horn is exalted' and not 'My horn is lowered' - David and Solomon who were anointed with a horn, their kingdom endured. Saul and Jehu who were anointed with a flask, their kingdom did not endure."

hebrew_text: הַמְפַטֵּם אֶת הַקְּטֹרֶת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְפַטֵּם אֶת הַקְּטֹרֶת לְלַמֵּד בָּהּ אוֹ לְמוֹסְרָהּ לַצִּיבּוּר – פָּטוּר, לְהָרִיחַ בָּהּ – חַיָּיב. וְהַמֵּרִיחַ בָּהּ פָּטוּר, אֶלָּא שֶׁמָּעַל.
human_translation: One who blends the incense The Sages taught One who blends the incense to teach it or to transfer it to the community is exempt to smell it liable And one who smells exempt but he has misused
llm_translation: The one who prepares the incense. The Rabbis taught: One who prepares the incense to teach with it or to instruct the public - exempt. If one smells it - liable. And one who smells it is exempt, except that he benefits.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מְעִילָה? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא: קוֹל וּמַרְאֶה וָרֵיחַ – אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם מְעִילָה!
human_translation: And is there misuse But doesn’t Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says in the name of bar Kappara: sound, or sight, or smell are not subject to misuse
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is there a cloak? And Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi in the name of Bar Kappara: Sound, sight, and smell - they do not have the status of a cloak!

hebrew_text: רֵיחַ אַחַר שֶׁתַּעֲלֶה תִּמְרָתוֹ אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם מְעִילָה, אֵין לְךָ דָּבָר אַחֵר שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה מִצְוָתוֹ וּמוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: smell after the column of smoke rises is not subject to misuse you have no item after its mitzva has been performed and its misuse.
llm_translation: The smell after its ascension its date-palm it has not in it from obligation, not to you a thing other that was done its commandment and desecrate in it.

hebrew_text: אַלְּמָה לָא? וַהֲרֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן, דְּנַעֲשֵׂית מִצְוָתָהּ וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ!
human_translation: And why not But there is the removal of the ashes whose mitzva has been performed, and misusing
llm_translation: Why not? But what about the offering of the ashes, which is performed as a commandment and yet one can benefit from it!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן וּבִגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְכֹל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִים.
human_translation: since the the removal of the ashes and the priestly vestments two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: Because it is the case that the removal of the ashes and the priestly garments are two written laws that come together as one, and any two written laws that come together as one do not teach us anything.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבָּנַן, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי דּוֹסָא מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהִנִּיחָם שָׁם״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁטְּעוּנִין גְּנִיזָה.
human_translation: works out well according to the Rabbis, But according to Rabbi Dosa, what can be said? As it is taught and he shall leave them there” teaches that require interment.
llm_translation: He left it for the sages, rather for Rabbi Dosa. What is there to say? As it was taught: "And He left them there," teaches that they are in need of being buried.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁירִין הֵן לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְהִנִּיחָם שָׁם״? שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אַחֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: but they are fit for an ordinary priest, And what the verse states: “And he shall leave them there”? that may not use them on another Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: "Fit for a lay priest." And what is the reason that the Scripture says, "And leave them there"? So that he should not make use of them on another Day of Atonement.

hebrew_text: – מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן וְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְכֹל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין. תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְשָׂמוֹ אֵצֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁטְּעוּנִין גְּנִיזָה. עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְעָרְפוּ שָׁם אֶת הָעֶגְלָה בַּנָּחַל״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁטְּעוּנִין גְּנִיזָה.
human_translation: because the removal of the ashes and the heifer whose neck is broken, two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach What is the removal of the ashes? As it is taught “And he shall put them beside the altar” teaches that they require interment. What is the heifer whose neck is broken? As it is taught “And they shall break the heifer’s neck in the valley” teaches that require interment.
llm_translation: From the fact that the removal of the ashes and the decapitated calf are two written laws that come as one, and any two written laws that come as one do not teach us anything new. What is the removal of the ashes? As it was taught: "And place it beside the altar," teaches that they are loaded for disposal. What is the decapitated calf? As it was taught: "And they shall break the heifer's neck there in the valley," teaches that they are loaded for disposal.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר: שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד מְלַמְּדִין, הָכָא וַדַּאי אֵין מְלַמְּדִין, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי תְּרֵי מִיעוּטֵי. בִּתְרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן כְּתִיב: ״וְשָׂמוֹ״ – הָדֵין אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא לָא, גַּבֵּי עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה כְּתִיב: ״הָעֲרוּפָה״ – עֲרוּפָה אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא לָא.
human_translation: And according to the one who says two verses that come as one teach here they certainly do not teach due to there are two exclusions With regard to the removal of the ashes it is written: “And he shall put it.” this yes, other matter not With regard to the heifer whose neck is broken it is written: “The that had its neck broken” had its neck broken, yes, other matter not
llm_translation: And for the one who says: Two Scriptures that come as one teach, here for sure they do not teach, because it would be two exclusions. In the offering of the ashes it is written: "And he shall put" - this one, yes, another one, no. Regarding a decapitated calf it is written: "The decapitated one" - it is not decapitated, another one, no.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פִּיטּוּם הַקְּטֹרֶת: הַצֳּרִי, וְהַצִּיפּוֹרֶן, וְהַחֶלְבְּנָה, וְהַלְּבוֹנָה – מִשְׁקַל שִׁבְעִים שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים מָנָה. מוֹר, וּקְצִיעָה, שִׁיבּוֹלֶת נֵרְדְּ, וְכַרְכּוֹם – מִשְׁקָל שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר שֶׁל שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר מָנֶה. הַקּוֹשְׁטְ – שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר, קִילּוּפָה – שְׁלֹשָׁה, וְקִנָּמוֹן – תִּשְׁעָה. בּוֹרִית כַּרְשִׁינָה – תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין, יֵין קַפְרִיסִין – סְאִין תְּלָתָא קַבִּין תְּלָתָא. אִם אֵין לוֹ יֵין קַפְרִיסִין מֵבִיא חֲמַר חִיוַּרְיָין עַתִּיק. מֶלַח סְדוֹמִית – רוֹבַע. מַעֲלֵה עָשָׁן – כׇּל שֶׁהוּא. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אַף כִּיפַּת הַיַּרְדֵּן כׇּל שֶׁהוּא.
human_translation: The Sages taught the blending of the incense Balm, and onycha, and galbanum, and frankincense, each a weight of seventy maneh , Myrrh, and cassia, spikenard, and saffron, each a weight of sixteen maneh .
