Costus a weight of twelve three bark; and nine cinnamon. Kersannah lye nine kav ; Cyprus wine three se’a three kav , If one does not have Cyprus wine he brings old white wine. Sodomite salt a quarter- a minimal the smoke raiser, Rabbi Natan says: Also a minimal of Jordan amber.
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: The ingredients of the incense offering - stacte, onycha, galbanum, and frankincense - a weight of seventy shekels each. Myrrh, cinnamon, calamus, and cassia - a weight of sixteen shekels each. Costus - twelve, peel of citrus - three, and cinnamon - nine. Carshina lye - nine kav, Cyprian wine - three se'ah of three kav each. If one does not have Cyprian wine, they bring old white wine. Sodomite salt - a quarter. Raising smoke - as much as one desires. Rabbi Nathan says: Even the cap of the Jordan - as much as one desires.

hebrew_text: וְאִם נָתַן בָּהּ דְּבַשׁ – פְּסָלָהּ. חִיסַּר אַחַת מִכׇּל סַמְמָנֶיהָ – חַיָּיב מִיתָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הַצֳּרִי אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא שְׂרָף מֵעֲצֵי הַקְּטָף. בּוֹרִית כַּרְשִׁינָה, שֶׁשָּׁפִין בָּהּ אֶת הַצִּיפּוֹרֶן כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא נָאָה. יֵין קַפְרִיסִין, שֶׁשּׁוֹרִין בּוֹ אֶת הַצִּיפּוֹרֶן כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא עַזָּה. וַהֲלֹא מֵי רַגְלַיִם יָפִין לָהּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין מַכְנִיסִין מֵי רַגְלַיִם לַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: And if one placed honey in disqualified it, omitted any one of its spices liable death Rabbi Shimon says: The balm is nothing other than a resin from the balsam tree, Kersannah lye as one rubs the onycha in it so that should be pleasant. Cyprus wine as one soaks the onycha in it so that it should be strong. And urine is good for but one does not bring urine into the Temple
llm_translation: And if he placed honey in it - it invalidates it. If he omitted one of all its ingredients - he is liable to death. Rabbi Shimon says: The cedar is nothing but the burning of the wood of the olive tree. A Karshina pit, in which they soak the flax in order to make it pleasant. Cyprian wine, in which they soak the flax in order to make it strong. But aren't foot-waters more beautiful for it? Rather, foot-waters are not brought into the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: דְּאָמַר ״קֹדֶשׁ הִיא קֹדֶשׁ תִּהְיֶה לָכֶם״ – כׇּל מַעֲשֶׂיהָ לֹא יְהוּ אֶלָּא בַּקֹּדֶשׁ.
human_translation: supports of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, who says It is sacred, it shall be sacred to you all of its actions should be only in the sacred
llm_translation: Assisting him to Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina: for he said, "It is holy; it shall be holy to you" - all its work shall be only in holiness.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ נְכָסָיו וְהָיוּ בָּהּ דְּבָרִים הָרְאוּיִין לְקׇרְבְּנוֹת הַצִּיבּוּר – יִנָּתְנוּ לָאוּמָּנִין בִּשְׂכָרָן.
human_translation: raises an objection one who consecrates his possessions And among them there were items suitable for communal offerings, They are given to artisans as their wages,
llm_translation: Challenger: One who sanctifies his property and designates items suitable for communal sacrifices - they should be given to craftsmen for their wages.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי דְּבָרִים הָרְאוּיִין, מַאי נִינְהוּ? אִי בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה – תְּנָא לֵיהּ! אִי יֵינוֹת שְׁמָנִים וּסְלָתוֹת – תְּנָא לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו קְטֹרֶת?
human_translation: These items suitable what are they? If domesticated animals and undomesticated animals, taught them if wines, oils, and flours, taught them Rather, not incense
llm_translation: These matters that are fitting, what are they? If it is regarding domesticated animals and wild animals - teach it! If it is regarding wines, oils, and flours - teach it! Rather, is it not referring to incense?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: בְּאוֹתָהּ הַנִּיתֶּנֶת לְאוּמָּנִים בִּשְׂכָרָן. דְּתַנְיָא: מוֹתַר הַקְּטֹרֶת, מָה הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין בָּהּ? הָיוּ מַפְרִישִׁין מִמֶּנָּה שְׂכַר הָאוּמָּנִין, וּמְחַלְּלִין אוֹתָהּ עַל מְעוֹת הָאוּמָּנִין וְנוֹתְנִין אוֹתָן לָאוּמָּנִין בִּשְׂכָרָן, וְחוֹזְרִים וְלוֹקְחִין אוֹתָהּ מִתְּרוּמָה חֲדָשָׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: to that which is given to the artisans as their wages, As it is taught The leftover incense What would they do with it would remove of it the wages of the artisans And they desacralize to the money the artisans. They give to the artisans as their wages. And they return and purchase from the new collection
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: In that which is given to skilled craftsmen as their wages. As it was taught: The incense was permitted, what would they do with it? They would separate from it the wages of the craftsmen, and desecrate it with the coins of the craftsmen and give them to the craftsmen as their wages, and then they would take it back from a new contribution.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: הָא בְּכוּלְּהוּ מוּתָּרוֹת תָּנֵי חוֹזְרִין וְלוֹקְחִין אוֹתָהּ מִתְּרוּמָה חֲדָשָׁה, וְהָכָא לָא תָּנֵי!
human_translation: Rav Yosef objects to this With regard to all leftovers teaches: They return and purchase from the new collection And here, does not teach
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Yosef: This, in all cases, they are permitted, it teaches they return and take it from a new terumah, and here it does not teach!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּאֶחָד מִסַּמְמָנֵי הַקְּטֹרֶת.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef says: to one of the ingredients of the incense,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: In one of the ingredients of the incense.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קְטֹרֶת הָיְתָה נַעֲשֵׂית שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת שִׁשִּׁים וּשְׁמוֹנָה מָנֶה, שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת שִׁשִּׁים וַחֲמִשָּׁה כְּנֶגֶד יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה, שְׁלֹשָׁה מָנִין יְתֵירִין, שֶׁמֵּהֶן מַכְנִיס כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו בְּיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, וְהַשְּׁאָר נִיתֶּנֶת לָאוּמָּנִין בִּשְׂכָרָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught incense was prepared 368 maneh , 365 correspond to the days of the solar year. additional three maneh from which the High Priest would bring in his handful on Yom Kippur and the rest, was given to the artisans as their wages.
llm_translation: The sages taught: The incense was made of three hundred sixty-eight maneh, three hundred sixty-five corresponding to the days of the sun, three extra maneh, one of which the High Priest would bring in his hands full on the Day of Atonement, and the rest were given to the craftsmen as their wages.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: מוֹתַר הַקְּטֹרֶת מָה הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין בָּהּ? מַפְרִישִׁין מִמֶּנָּה שְׂכַר הָאוּמָּנִין, וּמְחַלְּלִין אוֹתָהּ עַל מְעוֹת הָאוּמָּנִין וְנוֹתְנִין אוֹתָן לָאוּמָּנִין בִּשְׂכָרָן, וְחוֹזְרִין וְלוֹקְחִין אוֹתָהּ מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה.
human_translation: as it is taught the leftover incense, what would they do with it? remove of it the wages of the artisans And they desacralize to the money the artisans. They give to the artisans as their wages. And they would return and purchase from the collection of the chamber.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Regarding the incense, what would they do with it? They would separate from it the wages of the craftsmen, and they would desecrate it with the coins of the craftsmen, and give them to the craftsmen as their wages, and then they would take it from the contribution of the Temple chamber.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מוֹתַר הַקְּטֹרֶת, אַחַת לְשִׁשִּׁים אוֹ לְשִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה, הָיוּ מְפַטְּמִין אוֹתָהּ לַחֲצָאִין. לְפִיכָךְ יָחִיד שֶׁפִּיטֵּם לַחֲצָאִין – חַיָּיב, דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם הַסְּגָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught The leftover of the incense, once every sixty or every seventy years they would blend by halves, Therefore, individual who blended by halves liable the statement of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said in the name of the deputy
llm_translation: The sages taught: Incense is permitted once every sixty or seventy years, they would apportion it into halves. Therefore, an individual who apportions it into halves - is liable. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel, who said in the name of the deputy.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל שְׁלִישׁ וּרְבִיעַ לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּכׇל יוֹם מְתַקֵּן בְּמַתְכּוּנְתָּהּ, וְהָיָה מַכְנִיס.
human_translation: But I did not hear one-third or one-quarter And the Rabbis say: Every day would prepare according to its composition, and he would bring in
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But third and fourth I have not heard. And the sages say: Every day he would fix it in its proper order, and he would bring it in.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה שֶׁפִּטְּמוֹ לַחֲצָאִין – חַיָּיב, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַקְּטֹרֶת אֲשֶׁר תַּעֲשֶׂה״ – כֹּל שֶׁתַּעֲשֶׂה, וְהָא אֶפְשָׁר דְּעָבְדַהּ פְּרָס בְּשַׁחֲרִית וּפְרָס בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם.
human_translation: supports of Rava, as Rava says: the anointing oil that one blended in parts, liable, as it is written: “And the incense that you shall prepare, any that you prepare it is possible to burn a portion, in the morning, and a portion in the afternoon.
llm_translation: He assists him to Rava, for Rava said: Anointing oil that they smeared on the half-log - liable, as it is written: "And the incense that you shall make" - anything that you make, and it is possible that a Persian made it in the morning and a Persian made it between the evenings.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיוּ מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתָהּ לְמַכְתֶּשֶׁת פַּעֲמַיִם בְּשָׁנָה, בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה פְּזוּרָה – שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְעַפֵּשׁ, בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים צְבוּרָה – כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תָּפוּג רֵיחָהּ. וּכְשֶׁהוּא שׁוֹחֵק, אוֹמֵר: הָדֵק הֵיטֵב, הֵיטֵב הָדֵק, דִּבְרֵי אַבָּא יוֹסֵי בֶּן יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught They would return to the mortar twice a year; in the summer scattered so it should not grow moldy, in the rainy season piled, in order that its scent should not dissipate. And when one would grind say: Crush well, well crush; the statement of Abba Yosei ben Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: They would return it to the mortar twice a year, in the days of the sun it is scattered - so that it does not spoil, in the days of rain it is compacted - so that its scent does not dissipate. And when one is grinding, he should say: Grind well, well grind, the words of Abba Yosei ben Yochanan.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁלֹשׁ מָנִין יְתֵירִין שֶׁמֵּהֶן כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מַכְנִיס מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, נוֹתֵן אוֹתָהּ לְמַכְתֶּשֶׁת בְּעֶרֶב יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וְשׁוֹחֲקָן יָפֶה יָפֶה, כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא דַּקָּה מִן הַדַּקָּה, כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״דַּקָּה״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁחַקְתָּ מִמֶּנּוּ הָדֵק״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״דַּקָּה״? כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא דַּקָּה מִן הַדַּקָּה.
human_translation: And extra three maneh from which the High Priest would bring in his handful on Yom Kippur, one would place it in the mortar on Yom Kippur eve and grind it thoroughly so that should be extra fine. As it is taught “Finely ground What the verse states Isn’t it already stated “And you shall grind some of it finely” Why the verse state “finely ground”? in order that it should be extra fine.
llm_translation: And three extra measures, from them is the High Priest inserts full handfuls on the Day of Atonement, he places it on the fire-pan on the eve of the Day of Atonement, and he grinds them finely, finely, so that it will be fine from the fine, as it was taught: "fine," what is the Talmud to say? Has it not already been said: "and you shall grind it very fine," what is the Talmud to say: "fine"? So that it will be fine from the fine.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: כְּשֶׁהוּא שׁוֹחֵק, אוֹמֵר ״הֵיטֵב הָדֵק, הָדֵק הֵיטֵב״: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַדִּיבּוּר רַע לַיַּיִן – כֵּן הַדִּיבּוּר יָפֶה לַבְּשָׂמִים.
human_translation: The Master said When one would grind say: Crush well, well crush. supports of Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Just as speech is detrimental to wine, so too, speech is beneficial to the spices
llm_translation: The Master said: When one is joking, he says, "Fine is delicate, delicate is fine." This supports Rabbi Yochanan, for Rabbi Yochanan said: Just as speech is harmful to wine, so too speech is beneficial to spices.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַחַד עָשָׂר סַמְמָנִין נֶאֶמְרוּ לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה בְּסִינַי. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאי קְרָאָה? ״קַח לְךָ סַמִּים״ – תְּרֵי, ״נָטָף וּשְׁחֵלֶת וְחֶלְבְּנָה״ – הָא חַמְשָׁה, וְ״סַמִּים״ אַחֲרִינֵי – חַמְשָׁה, הָא עַשְׂרָה, ״וּלְבוֹנָה זַכָּה״ – חַד, הָא חַד סְרֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: eleven ingredients were stated to Moses at Sinai, Rav Huna said: What is the verse “Take for you spices” two “stacte, and onycha, and galbanum” this five; and other “spices” five, this ten. And “pure frankincense” one, this eleven.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Eleven spices were stated to Moses at Sinai. Rav Huna said: What is the verse? "Take for yourself spices" - two, "stacte and onycha and galbanum" - these are five, and "other spices" - another five, these are ten, "and pure frankincense" - one, this is eleven.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא ״סַמִּים״ – כָּלַל, ״נָטָף וּשְׁחֵלֶת וְחֶלְבְּנָה״ – פָּרַט, ״סַמִּים״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל. כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט. מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ – דָּבָר שֶׁקִּיטֵּר וְעוֹלֶה וְרֵיחוֹ נוֹדֵף, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁקִּיטֵּר וְעוֹלֶה וְרֵיחוֹ נוֹדֵף.
human_translation: But say “spices” a generalization; “stacte, and onycha, and galbanum,” a detail; “spices” it then generalized a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail: Just as the detail is explicit an item whose smoke rises and its scent diffuses, so too, any item whose smoke rises and its scent diffuses.
llm_translation: "And why 'spices'? - general, 'balsam and shellot and helbena' - specific, 'spices' - repeated and general. General, specific, and general, you can only judge in accordance with the nature of the specific. What is the specific that is explicit? - something that is crushed, rises, and its fragrance spreads, so too, anything that is crushed, rises, and its fragrance spreads."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵימָא, אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב קְרָא חַד פְּרָטָא! לָאיֵי, מִיצְרָךְ צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב ״נָטָף״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מִין אִילָן – אִין, אֲבָל גִּידּוּלֵי קַרְקַע – לָא, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי כְּתַב: ״וּשְׁחֵלֶת״. וְאִי כְּתַב ״וּשְׁחֵלֶת״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: גִּידּוּלֵי קַרְקַע – אִין, אֲבָל מִין אִילָן – אֵימָא לָא, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי כְּתַב: ״נָטָף״.
human_translation: And if you would say: If so, let the verse write one detail indeed [ la’ei ], are necessary. As, if had written “stacte,” I would say a type of tree, yes, but grown from the ground, no, due to that wrote “and onycha.” And if had written “and onycha,” I would say grown from the ground, yes, but a type of tree, say no, due to that wrote “stacte.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if you say, if so, let a specific verse be written! It is necessary to say, I need it for a difficulty, for if it had written "planted," I would have said: from a tree - yes, but from the produce of the ground - no, therefore it wrote: "and uncultivated." And if it had written "and uncultivated," I would have said: from the produce of the ground - no, but from a tree - why not? Therefore it wrote: "planted."

hebrew_text: וְחֶלְבְּנָה לְגוּפֵיהּ אֲתָא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרֵיחָהּ רַע! אִם כֵּן, מִ״קַּח לְךָ״ נָפְקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And galbanum, comes for itself, because its smell is foul. If so, derive “Take for you.”
llm_translation: "And chelbenah by itself comes, because its smell is bad! If so, 'take for yourself' is derived from it."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: ״סַמִּים״ בָּתְרָאֵי תְּרֵין נִינְהוּ, כְּ״סַמִּים״ קַדְמָאֵי! אִם כֵּן, נִכְתּוֹב ״סַמִּים״ ״סַמִּים״ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, וְסוֹף נִכְתּוֹב ״נָטָף וּשְׁחֵלֶת וְחֶלְבְּנָה״.
human_translation: But say the last “spices” two like the first “spices”? If so, let write “spices” “spices” together, and afterward let it write “stacte, and onycha, and galbanum.”
llm_translation: And why? "Samim" are two, like "samim" before them! If so, it should be written "samim" "samim" together, and at the end it should be written "nataf, ushechelet, vechelbana."

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנֵי: ״סַמִּים״ – כָּלַל, ״נָטָף שְׁחֵלֶת וְחֶלְבְּנָה״ – פָּרַט, ״סַמִּים״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל. כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט. מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ – דָּבָר שֶׁקִּיטֵּר וְעוֹלֶה וְרֵיחוֹ נוֹדֵף, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁקִּיטֵּר וְעוֹלֶה וְרֵיחוֹ נוֹדֵף.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael teaches “spices” a generalization; “stacte, and onycha, and galbanum,” a detail; “spices” it then generalized a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail: Just as the detail is explicit an item whose smoke rises and its scent diffuses, so too, any item whose smoke rises and its scent diffuses.
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yishmael teaches: "Spices" - a general category, "dropped myrrh and galbanum" - a specification, "spices" - it repeated and included. General, specification, and general - you can only judge based on the nature of the specification. Just as the specification is explicit - something that is crushed, rises, and its fragrance spreads, so too, anything that is crushed, rises, and its fragrance spreads.

hebrew_text: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּלָל בִּכְלָל רִאשׁוֹן, וּפְרָט בִּפְרָט רִאשׁוֹן? אָמְרַתְּ לָאו. הָא אֵין לְךָ עָלֶיךָ לָדוּן בְּלָשׁוֹן אַחֲרוֹן, אֶלָּא בְּלָשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Or it is only generalization in first generalization, and detail in first detail. You say not consequently, you cannot learn in accordance with the last version, rather in accordance with the first version.
llm_translation: Or is it only a general within a general first, and a specific within a specific first? You said no. But you must judge not in the language of the latter, but in the language of the former.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּלָל בִּכְלָל רִאשׁוֹן, וּפְרָט בִּפְרָט רִאשׁוֹן? אָמְרַתְּ לָאו, הָא אֵין עָלֶיךָ לָדוּן. מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? הָכִי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: ״סַמִּים״ בָּתְרָאֵי תְּרֵי, כִּי סַמִּים קַדְמָאֵי תְּרֵין! הֲדַר וְשַׁנִּי כִּדְשַׁנִּין, דְּאִם כֵּן נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״סַמִּים סַמִּים נָטָף וּשְׁחֵלֶת וְחֶלְבְּנָה״.
human_translation: The Master said: Or it is only generalization in first generalization, and detail in first detail. You say not consequently, you cannot learn What the difficulty this is what difficult to the last “spices” two as the first “spices” two then answered as we answered that if so, let write: Spices, spices, stacte, and onycha, and galbanum,
llm_translation: Master said: Or is it only general within general first, and specific within specific first? You said no, you do not have to judge. What is the question? This is the question: "Spices" in the latter two, like spices before two! Return and change as they change, for if so, it should be written: "Spices, spices drip, and myrrh, and cassia, and cinnamon."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי. ״פְּרָט בִּפְרָט רִאשׁוֹן״? הָכִי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: מִינֵי אִילָנוֹת יָלְפִי מִן נָטָף, וְגִידּוּלֵי קַרְקַע יָלְפִי מִשְּׁחֵלֶת, וְלֵילְפִי נָמֵי מִלְּבוֹנָה זַכָּה, דְּאַיְיתֵי בְּחַד צַד, דְּנֵיתֵי דָּבָר שֶׁרֵיחוֹ נוֹדֵף וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין קוֹטֵר וְעוֹלֶה!
human_translation: And what detail in first detail? this is what difficult to types of trees are derived from stacte and grown from the ground are derived from onycha, Let them also learn from pure frankincense, which includes one aspect, that include an item whose scent diffuses, even though its smoke rise.
llm_translation: And what is "particular in the first particular"? This is difficult for him: species of trees sprout from a drop, and the growths of the ground sprout from a root, and the night sprouts from the day, for it comes from one side, for it is said, "a thing whose scent is wafted, though it has no knot and does not rise!"

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר: אִם כֵּן, נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא לִלְבוֹנָה זַכָּה בְּמִיצְעֵי, וְתֵילַף מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: then said if so, let the verse write “pure frankincense” in the middle, and derive from it.
llm_translation: The scholar said: If so, it should be written: "A verse for Lilvona, she will be pure in the middle, and it will be taken from her."

hebrew_text: אִי כַּתְבַיהּ לְבוֹנָה זַכָּה בְּמִיצְעֵי, הָוַיִין תְּרֵי עָשָׂר! אִם כֵּן, נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא לְבוֹנָה זַכָּה בְּמִיצְעֵי, וְחֶלְבְּנָה לְבַסּוֹף. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִגּוּפַהּ, מָה לְשׁוֹן ״קְטֹרֶת״? דָּבָר שֶׁקּוֹטֵר וְעוֹלֶה.
human_translation: If write “pure frankincense” in the middle, there twelve If so, let the verse write “pure frankincense” in the middle and “galbanum” at the end, Reish Lakish says from itself: What term incense [ ketoret ]? an item that smoke [ koter ] and rises.
llm_translation: If one wrote "levonah" in the middle, there are twelve letters. If so, it should be written: "levonah" in the middle, and "chelbena" at the end. Reish Lakish said: From its body, what is the language of "ketoret"? A matter that burns and ascends.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: כׇּל תַּעֲנִית שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ מִפּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵינָהּ תַּעֲנִית, שֶׁהֲרֵי חֶלְבְּנָה רֵיחָהּ רַע וּמְנָאָהּ הַכָּתוּב עִם סַמְמָנֵי קְטֹרֶת. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: מֵהָכָא: ״וַאֲגֻדָּתוֹ עַל אֶרֶץ יְסָדָהּ״
human_translation: Rav Ḥana bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says: Any fast that does not include of the sinners of the Jewish people is not a fast, as the smell of galbanum is foul and the verse lists it with the ingredients of the incense. Abaye says from here: and has established His bundle on the earth”
llm_translation: Rav Ḥanina bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida: Any fast that does not include the transgressors of Israel is not a fast, for its fat is foul-smelling and its measure is written among the incense spices. Abbaye said: From here: "And his offering shall be upon the earth, its foundation."

hebrew_text: וְהַסָּךְ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַסָּךְ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה לִבְהֵמָה וְכֵלִים – פָּטוּר, לְגוֹיִם וּלְמֵתִים – פָּטוּר. בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּהֵמָה וְכֵלִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״עַל בְּשַׂר אָדָם לֹא יִיסָךְ״, וּבְהֵמָה וְכֵלִים לָאו אָדָם הוּא. מֵתִים נָמֵי פָּטוּר, דְּכֵיוָן דְּמִית לֵיהּ – מֵת מִיקְּרֵי, וְלָאו אָדָם. אֶלָּא גּוֹיִם, אַמַּאי פָּטוּר? הָא אָדָם נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: And one who applies the anointing oil The Sages taught One who applies the anointing oil to animals or vessels exempt, to gentiles or to corpses exempt. Granted, animals and vessels, as it is written: “Upon the flesh of a person it shall not be applied” and animals and vessels are not a person. also exempt a corpse, as once someone has died, is called a corpse and not a person. But gentiles why exempt? Aren’t they person [ adam ]?
llm_translation: The anointing oil. The Rabbis taught: The anointing oil for animals and vessels - exempt; for non-Jews and the dead - exempt. It is understandable regarding animals and vessels, as it is written: "Upon human flesh, it shall not be poured," and animals and vessels are not human. The dead are also exempt, for since he is already dead, he is called dead, not a human. But regarding non-Jews, why are they exempt? They are also considered human!

hebrew_text: לָאיֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַתֵּן צֹאנִי צֹאן מַרְעִיתִי אָדָם אַתֶּם״ – אַתֶּם קְרוּיִין ״אָדָם״ וְאֵין הַגּוֹיִם קְרוּיִין ״אָדָם״.
human_translation: Indeed As it is written: “And you My sheep, the sheep of My pasture, are people [ adam ]” you, are called adam , but gentiles are not called adam .
llm_translation: To Aiyei, as it is written: "But you, My flock, the flock of My pasture, you are men" - you are called "men," but the nations are not called "men."

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְנֶפֶשׁ אָדָם שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר אָלֶף״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָהוּא לְאַפּוֹקֵי בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “And the people [ nefesh adam ] were sixteen thousand” said to That to exclude, animals
llm_translation: The text reads: "And it is written: 'And the soul of man is sixteen thousand'! He said to him: That refers to the offspring of cattle."

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַאֲנִי לֹא אָחוּס עַל נִינְוֵה וְגוֹ׳״! הַהוּא לְאַפּוֹקֵי בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “And should I not have pity on Nineveh, That to exclude animals
llm_translation: And it is written: "But as for me, I will not spare Nineveh, etc." That one is to be sent to check on livestock.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא – כִּדְקָתָנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּסָךְ – יֶשְׁנוֹ בְּבַל יִיסָךְ, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּסָךְ – אֵינוֹ בְּבַל יִיסָךְ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say as a tanna teaches before Rabbi Elazar: Anyone included in apply is included It shall not be applied, And anyone not included in to apply is not included It shall not be applied.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say - as it was taught in a Baraita before Rabbi Elazar: Whoever has it in a sack - has it in Babylon; and whoever does not have it in a sack - does not have it in Babylon.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הַסָּךְ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה לִבְהֵמָה וְכֵלִים, לְגוֹיִם וּמֵתִים – פָּטוּר, לִמְלָכִים וּלְכֹהֲנִים – רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר. וְכַמָּה יָסוּךְ וִיהֵא חַיָּיב? רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּזַיִת. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: פָּטוּר! כִּי פָּטַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה – גַּבֵּי מְלָכִים וְכֹהֲנִים, גַּבֵּי הֶדְיוֹט מְחַיֵּיב.
human_translation: It is taught another One who applies the anointing oil to animals or vessels, to gentiles or corpses, exempt. to kings or to priests Rabbi Meir deems liable and Rabbi Yehuda deems exempt. And how much apply and be liable? Rabbi Meir says: Any amount. Rabbi Yehuda says: An olive-bulk. But doesn’t Rabbi Yehuda say exempt? When Rabbi Yehuda deems exempt with regard to kings and priests, of an ordinary deems liable.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The one who anoints with the anointing oil, whether it be on an animal or vessels, for Gentiles and for the deceased – is exempt; for kings and for priests – Rabbi Meir obligates, and Rabbi Yehuda exempts. And how much must one anoint to be liable? Rabbi Meir says: any amount, Rabbi Yehuda says: like an olive. And didn't Rabbi Yehuda say: exempt! When Rabbi Yehuda exempted – regarding kings and priests, he obligates regarding a commoner.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי – רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: ״עַל בְּשַׂר אָדָם לֹא יִיסָךְ״ כְּתִיב, וּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲשֶׁר יִתֵּן מִמֶּנּוּ עַל זָר״, מָה סִיכָה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא – אַף נְתִינָה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא.
human_translation: Concerning what Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda disagree? Rav Yosef says they disagree concerning this Rabbi Meir holds it is written: “Upon the flesh of a person it shall not be applied” and it is written: “Or whoever places any of it upon a stranger, Just as applying any amount, so too, placing any amount.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda, what do they argue about? Rav Yosef said: In this they argue - Rabbi Meir holds: "Do not anoint upon human flesh" is written, and it is also written: "And whatever is left over of it upon a stranger." Just as anointing is any amount - so too, giving is any amount.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: יָלְפִינַן נְתִינָה דְּעַל זָר מִנְּתִינָה דְּעָלְמָא, מָה נְתִינָה דְּעָלְמָא כְּזַיִת, אַף נְתִינָה דְּעַל זָר – כְּזַיִת. אֲבָל סִיכָה לְמִימְשַׁח מְלָכִים וְכֹהֲנִים – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כׇּל שֶׁהוּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds: We derive placing [ netina ] that upon a stranger, from giving [ netina ] in general. Just as giving in general an olive-bulk, so too, placing upon a stranger an olive-bulk. But applying to anoint kings and priests, everyone agrees any amount.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: We differentiate between the anointing oil for a non-priestly individual from the anointing oil for the general populace. Just as the anointing oil for the general populace is like olive oil, so too the anointing oil for a non-priestly individual is like olive oil. However, anointment for anointing kings and priests - this is the consensus opinion, whatever it may be.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה גַּבֵּי מְלָכִים וְכֹהֲנִים? רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: ״וַאֲשֶׁר יִתֵּן מִמֶּנּוּ עַל זָר״ כְּתִיב, וּמֶלֶךְ וְכֹהֵן הַשְׁתָּא זָרִים נִינְהוּ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: בָּעֵינַן עַד דְּאִיכָּא זָר מִתְּחִלָּתוֹ וְעַד סוֹפוֹ, וּמֶלֶךְ וְכֹהֵן מֵעִיקָּרָא לָאו זָרִים הָווּ.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef says: With regard to what Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda disagree of kings and priests Rabbi Meir holds it is written: “Or whoever puts any of it upon a stranger,” and now king and priest are strangers And Rabbi Yehuda holds: we require that be a stranger from his beginning to his end, and king and priest were initially not strangers.
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef said: With what do Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda argue regarding kings and priests? Rabbi Meir holds: "And that he may give of it to the stranger" is written, and a king and a priest are considered strangers. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: We require that there be a stranger from the beginning to the end, and a king and a priest are not considered strangers from the outset.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אִיקָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַמֵּי: וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: Rav Ika, son of Rav Ami, said: And follow their reasoning, as it is taught
llm_translation: Rav Ika, son of Rav Ammi, said: And they went according to their reasoning, as it is taught:

hebrew_text: בַּת כֹּהֵן שֶׁנִּישֵּׂאת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאָכְלָה בִּתְרוּמָה – מְשַׁלֶּמֶת אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְאֵינָהּ מְשַׁלֶּמֶת אֶת הַחוֹמֶשׁ, וּמִיתָתָהּ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: the daughter of a priest who married an Israelite and partook of teruma , she pays the principal, But she does not pay the one-fifth And her death by burning,
llm_translation: Daughter of a Kohen who marries an Israelite, and eats from Terumah - she pays the principal but does not pay the additional fifth, and her death is by burning.

hebrew_text: נִיסֵּת לְאֶחָד מִן הַפְּסוּלִין – מְשַׁלֶּמֶת קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ, וּמִיתָתָהּ בְּחֶנֶק, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: she married one of those who are unfit she pays principal and one-fifth and her death by strangulation, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: If one of the disqualified priests married - she pays the principal and a fifth, and her death is by strangulation, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ מְשַׁלֶּמֶת [אֶת] הַקֶּרֶן וְאֵינָהּ מְשַׁלֶּמֶת [אֶת] הַחוֹמֶשׁ, וּמִיתָתָהּ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: both this and that she pays the principal but she does not pay the one-fifth and her death by burning,
llm_translation: The Sages say: one this and one this pays the principal and does not pay the interest, and her death is by burning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּנְתִינַת שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה וּבְשִׁינּוּיֵי דְּשַׁנִּינַן, אֲבָל נְתִינָה דְּעָלְמָא – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כְּזַיִת.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said dispute to the placing of the anointing oil, and by answers that we answered But placing in general, everyone agrees an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Dispute in the placing of the anointing oil and in the anointing of the priests, we learn, but general anointing - the words of all are like an olive.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּסָךְ – יֶשְׁנוֹ בְּבַל יִיסָךְ, וְכׇל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּסָךְ – אֵינוֹ בְּבַל יִיסָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר קָאָמְרַתְּ, ״לֹא יִיסָךְ״ כְּתִיב, וּקְרִי בֵּיהּ ״לֹא יַסִּיךְ״.
human_translation: the itself: A tanna teaches before Rabbi Elazar: Anyone included in apply is included It shall not be applied, And anyone not included in to apply is not included It shall not be applied. said to You are saying well, it is written: it shall not be applied [ lo yisakh ]” and read into Lo yasikh ,
llm_translation: Body. It was taught, a teacher taught before Rabbi Elazar: Anyone whose name is mentioned in the Book of Chronicles - his name is mentioned in the Book of Babylon, and anyone whose name is not mentioned in the Book of Chronicles - his name is not mentioned in the Book of Babylon. He said to him: You have spoken well, "not mentioned" is written, and read it as "will not be mentioned."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב חֲנַנְיָה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא: מִנַּיִן לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁנָּטַל מִשֶּׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה שֶׁעַל רֹאשׁוֹ וְנָתַן עַל בְּנֵי מֵעָיו, מִנַּיִן שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל בְּשַׂר אָדָם לֹא יִיסָךְ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: כֹּהֵן שֶׁסָּךְ בְּשֶׁמֶן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, בֶּן בִּתּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִתְעַגֵּל בּוֹ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ?
human_translation: Rav Ḥananya taught before Rava: From where with regard to a High Priest who took from the anointing oil that is on his head and placed it on his stomach; from where that he is liable? as it is stated: “Upon the flesh of a person it shall not be applied” Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: What is different between that which is taught a priest who applied teruma oil the Israelite son of his daughter may rub against [ mitaggel ] without concern
llm_translation: It was taught before Rav Chananya in the presence of Rava: From where do we derive that a High Priest who takes the anointing oil from his head and places it on his sons is liable? Because it is stated: "Upon man's flesh shall it not be poured" (Exodus 30:32). Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: What is the difference between this case and that which is taught: If a priest anointed with the oil of terumah, the daughter of an Israelite may marry him and she need not be concerned?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם, ״וּמֵתוּ בוֹ כִּי יְחַלְּלֻהוּ״ כְּתִיב – כֵּיוָן דְּחַלְּלֵיהּ הָא אִיתַּחַיל, אֲבָל גַּבֵּי שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה כְּתִיב: ״כִּי נֵזֶר [שֶׁמֶן מִשְׁחַת] אֱלֹהָיו עָלָיו״ – ״שֶׁמֶן מִשְׁחָה״ קַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיתֵיהּ עָלָיו לָא אִיתַּחַיל.
human_translation: said to him: There, it is written: “They will die through it if they profane it” since has profaned profaned. But with regard to the anointing oil it is written: “For the consecration His God is upon him” The Merciful One calls it anointing oil that even though it is upon not profaned,
llm_translation: He said to him: There, "and they shall die in it when they pollute it" is written - since they have polluted it, there is room for desecration, but regarding the anointing oil it is written: "for the consecration oil of his God is upon him" - the Merciful One calls it "consecration oil," for even though it is upon him, there is no room for desecration.

hebrew_text: עַל אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כּוּ׳. קָתָנֵי: חוּץ מִמְּטַמֵּא מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו. מִמַּאי מַפֵּיק לֵיהּ? הָכִי קָתָנֵי: חוּץ מִמִּטַּמֵּא מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו, שֶׁאֵין מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי.
human_translation: For these one is liable for its intentional teaches: except for one who defiles the Temple, or its consecrated items From what does exclude This is teaching: Except for one who defiles the Temple or its consecrated items as does not bring a provisional guilt offering.
llm_translation: On what cases is one liable for intentional sin? It was taught: Except for one who defiles the Temple and its sanctity. From where is this derived? Thus it was taught: Except for one who defiles the Temple and its sanctity, for he does not bring a guilt offering dependent on his act.

hebrew_text: וְנִיתְנֵי נָמֵי: חוּץ מִמִּי שֶׁעָבַר עָלָיו יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, שֶׁאֵין מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי! אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כִּי קָתָנֵי, הֵיכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ לַחֲטָאֵהּ וְרַחֲמָנָא פַּטְרֵיהּ. עָבַר עָלָיו יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים לֵיתֵיהּ לַחֲטָאֵהּ, דְּקָא כַפַּר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And let also teach: Except for one who Yom Kippur passed, as does not bring a provisional guilt offering. Reish Lakish said: When teaches where there is a sin and the Merciful One exempts him Yom Kippur passed, there is no sin, as atoned for him,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Except for one who has passed the Day of Atonement, for he does not bring a guilt offering! Reish Lakish said: When the Mishnah teaches, in a case where one has brought his sin offering and the Merciful One has exempted him. If he has passed the Day of Atonement, he brings a sin offering, for he has achieved atonement.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בִּמְבַעֵט, דְּקָאָמַר: אֵין יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר, דְּאִי הָדַר בֵּיהּ בָּתַר יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, בָּעֵי לְאֵיתוֹיֵי אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ סָבַר: מְבַעֵט נָמֵי מְכַפַּר עֲלֵיהּ יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: to one who rejects who says: Yom Kippur does not atone that if he retracted after Yom Kippur required to bring a provisional guilt offering. And Reish Lakish he maintains even one who rejects Yom Kippur atones for his
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: In the case of one who is in doubt, for he says: Yom Kippur does not atone, for if he repents after Yom Kippur, he needs to bring a guilt-offering. And Reish Lakish holds: In the case of one who is in doubt, Yom Kippur also atones for him.

hebrew_text: וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא: הָאוֹמֵר: ״לֹא יִתְכַּפֵּר לִי חַטָּאתִי״, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֵינָהּ מְכַפֶּרֶת, רָבָא אָמַר: מְכַפֶּרֶת. הֵיכָא דְּאָמַר: ״לֹא תִּיקְרַב״ – דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא מְכַפְּרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״יַקְרִיב אוֹתוֹ״ – לִרְצוֹנוֹ. כִּי פְּלִיגִי, דְּאָמַר: ״תִּיקְרַב וְלֹא תְּכַפֵּר״, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֵין מְכַפֶּרֶת, דְּהָא אָמַר לֹא תְּכַפֵּר. רָבָא אָמַר: מְכַפֶּרֶת, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר תִּיקְרַב – כַּפָּרָה מִמֵּילָא (אָתֵי).
human_translation: And with regard to the dispute one who says: My sin offering, should not atone for me, Abaye said: does not atone Rava said: It atones where he said: not to be sacrificed, everyone agrees that it does not atone as it is written: “He shall bring it in accordance with his will” Where they disagree when he says: should be sacrificed but it should not atone Abaye said: does not atone as he said it should not atone Rava said: It does atone once he says should be sacrificed, atonement comes by itself.
llm_translation: In the dispute: One who says, "My sin offering shall not atone for me," Abaye said: It does not atone, Rava said: It does atone. Where he said, "Do not come near" - everyone agrees that it does not atone, as it is written: "He shall offer it" - willingly. When they dispute, as he said, "Come near but do not atone," Abaye said: It does not atone, for he said, "Do not atone." Rava said: It does atone, since he said "Come near" - atonement comes automatically.

hebrew_text: וַהֲדַר בֵּיהּ רָבָא, כִּדְתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל יְהֵא יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר עַל שָׁבִין וְעַל שֶׁאֵין שָׁבִין? וְדִין הוּא, וּמָה חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם מְכַפְּרִין וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר, מָה חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם אֵין מְכַפְּרִין אֶלָּא עַל הַשָּׁבִין אַף יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אֵין מְכַפֵּר אֶלָּא עַל הַשָּׁבִין!
human_translation: And Rava retracted as it is taught might Yom Kippur atones for those who repent and for those who do not repent. And there is a logical inference Just as a sin offering and a guilt offering atone, and Yom Kippur atones, just as a sin offering and a guilt offering atone only for those who repent, so too, Yom Kippur atones only for those who repent.
llm_translation: And Rava returned to it, as it was taught: Can it be that Yom Kippur atones for intentional sins and unintentional sins? It is a proper judgment, for just as sin-offerings and guilt-offerings atone, and Yom Kippur atones, just as sin-offerings and guilt-offerings only atone for transgressions, so too Yom Kippur only atones for transgressions!

hebrew_text: לֹא, אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם, שֶׁאֵין מְכַפְּרִין עַל הַמֵּזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג, תֹּאמַר בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, שֶׁמְּכַפֵּר עַל הַמֵּזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג. וְהוֹאִיל וּמְכַפֵּר עַל הַמֵּזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג, מְכַפֵּר עַל שָׁבִין וְעַל שֶׁאֵין שָׁבִין! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַךְ״, חָלַק.
human_translation: No, if you said with regard to a sin offering and a guilt offering, which do not atone for intentional as unwitting shall you say with regard to Yom Kippur, which does atone for intentional as unwitting And since it atones for intentional as unwitting may atone for those who repent and for those who do not repent. the verse states: “Yet divided
llm_translation: Not, if you say in sin offering and guilt offering, that do not atone for intentional sin like unintentional sin, say on Yom Kippur, that atones for intentional sin like unintentional sin. And since it atones for intentional sin like unintentional sin, it atones for those who understand and those who do not understand! The Talmud teaches: "However," it distinguishes.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״שָׁבִין״ וְ״שֶׁאֵין שָׁבִין״? אִלֵּימָא ״שָׁבִין״ – שׁוֹגֵג, ״לֹא שָׁבִין״ – מֵזִיד, הָא קָתָנֵי: לֹא אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם כּוּ׳!
human_translation: What Those who repent and those who do not repent? Shall we say those who repent unwitting, those who do not repent intentional? teaches: No, if you said a sin offering and a guilt offering,
llm_translation: What is "Shavin" and "She'ein Shavin"? If you say "Shavin" - unintentional, "She'ein Shavin" - intentional, but it teaches: Only if you said in regards to sin-offering and guilt-offering!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי הָא דְּעוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָכַל חֵלֶב וְהִפְרִישׁ קׇרְבָּן, וְנִשְׁתַּמֵּד וְחָזַר בּוֹ, הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחָה – יִדָּחֶה.
human_translation: Rather, like that which Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan ate fat and separated an offering and became an apostate and subsequently retracted since was rejected it shall rejected.
llm_translation: Rather, for this that D'Ula said Rabbi Yochanan: One who ate forbidden fat and separated an offering, and then regretted it and returned to it, since it is disqualified, it shall be disqualified.

hebrew_text: נְהִי דְּאִידְּחִי קׇרְבָּן, גַּבְרָא בַּר כַּפָּרָה הוּא! אֶלָּא ״שָׁבִין״ – דְּאָמַר: ״יְכַפֵּר עָלַי חַטָּאתִי״, ״שֶׁאֵין שָׁבִין״ – דְּאָמַר: ״לֹא תְּכַפֵּר עָלַי חַטָּאתִי״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ:
human_translation: offering is rejected man is fit for atonement, Rather, those who repent who says: My sin offering should atone for me, and those who do not repent who says: My sin offering should not atone for me. Conclude from
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "neẖi de'idẖi qorban, gabra bar kaparah hu! ella 'shavin' – de'amar: 'yekhaper alai ẖatta'ti', 'she'ein shavin' – de'amar: 'lo tekhaper alai ẖatta'ti', shema minah." English translation: "When the offering is rejected, it is a man of atonement! Rather, 'shavin' – as it says: 'it shall atone for me for my sin', 'she'ein shavin' – as it says: 'it shall not atone for me for my sin', learn from it."

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר אֶלָּא עַל שֶׁנִּתְעַנָּה בּוֹ וְלֹא עָשָׂה בּוֹ מְלָאכָה וּקְרָאוֹ מִקְרָא קוֹדֶשׁ, לֹא נִתְעַנָּה בּוֹ וְעָשָׂה בּוֹ מְלָאכָה וְלֹא קְרָאוֹ מִקְרָא קוֹדֶשׁ יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא יוֹם כִּיפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים הוּא״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ סְתָם סִיפְרָא הוּא, קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי!
human_translation: And raise a contradiction: might Yom Kippur shall atone only for who fasted on it and did not perform labor on it and declared it a holy convocation. did not fast on it, or performed labor on it, or did not declare it a holy convocation, might Yom Kippur shall not atone the verse states: it is Yom Kippur” in any case. and both unattributed Sifra . are difficult, each other.
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: Can it be that Yom Kippur atones only for one who afflicted himself on it and did not do work on it, and its verse is a holy calling? If one did not afflict himself on it and did work on it, and its verse is not a holy calling, can it be that Yom Kippur atones? The Talmud teaches: "It is the day of Yom Kippur," from every angle. And both are general statements, they contradict each other!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא – רַבִּי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא – רַבִּי אַלִּיבָּא דִּידֵיהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, בֵּין עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה וּבֵין לֹא עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה – יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר,
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult. This is Rabbi in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, that is Rabbi in accordance with his own As it is taught Rabbi says: all transgressions that are in the Torah, whether one repented or whether one did not repent, Yom Kippur atones.
llm_translation: Abaye said, it is not difficult: this - Rabbi Aliba, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, and this - Rabbi Aliba, his own son, as it was taught: Rabbi says: All transgressions in the Torah, whether one repents or does not repent - Yom Kippur atones.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִפּוֹרֵק עוֹל, וּמְגַלֶּה פָּנִים בַּתּוֹרָה, וּמֵפֵר בְּרִית בָּשָׂר, שֶׁאִם עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה – יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: except for who divests yoke and one who reveals facets of the Torah and one who nullifies the covenant of flesh, With regard to if one repented, Yom Kippur atones, and if not, Yom Kippur does not atone.
llm_translation: Outside of Yom Kippur atones, and one reveals faces in the Torah, and one breaks the covenant of flesh, for if one repents - Yom Kippur atones, and if not - Yom Kippur does not atone.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הָא וְהָא רַבִּי אַלִּיבָּא דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ, וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי בַּעֲבֵירוֹת דְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים גּוּפֵיהּ – דְּלָא מְכַפַּר. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, כָּרֵת דְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לְרַבִּי, כֵּיוָן דִּבְכֹל שַׁעְתָּא וְשַׁעְתָּא מְכַפַּר, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: Rava said: this and that Rabbi in accordance with his own but Rabbi concedes with regard to transgressions of Yom Kippur itself, that does not atone as if you do not say so, according to Rabbi karet for Yom Kippur, since each and every hour atones how can you find
llm_translation: Rava said: This and this, Rabbi Aliba himself, and Rabbi concedes regarding the transgressions of Yom Kippur itself - that it does not atone. For if you do not say this, the cutting off of Yom Kippur is for Rabbi, since at every moment it atones, how does he forget it?

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּילְמָא דַּעֲבַד עֲבִידְתָּא כּוּלֵּי לֵילְיָא וּבַהֲדֵי עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר מִית, דְּלָא הֲוָה יְמָמָא דִּלְכַפַּר לֵיהּ! תִּינַח כָּרֵת דְּלֵילְיָא, כָּרֵת דִּימָמָא הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: And what is the difficulty? Perhaps where he performed labor the entire night and died at dawn, as there was no daytime to atone for him. works out well karet for night; karet for daytime, how can you find these
llm_translation: And what is the difficulty? Perhaps he performed work all night, and at the break of dawn he died, for it was not yet daytime to atone for him! Let the cutting of the night be left, how do you find the cutting of the day?

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּילְמָא בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָאָכַל נַהֲמָא חֲנַקְתֵּיהּ אוּמְצָא, דְּלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ שְׁהוּת בִּימָמָא דִּלְכַפַּר לֵיהּ. אִי נָמֵי, דַּעֲבַד עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ סָמוּךְ לִשְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה. אִי נָמֵי, בַּהֲדֵי דְּעָבֵיד עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ פַּסְקֵיהּ מָרָא לְשָׁקֵיהּ וּמִית, דְּלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ שְׁהוּת בִּימָמָא דִּלְכַפַּר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And what is the difficulty? Perhaps while eating bread he choked on meat as there was not enough time in the day to atone for him. Alternatively, where he performed labor close to sunset; alternatively, as he was performing labor, the hoe cut his thigh and he died, as there was no time to atone for him,
llm_translation: And what is the difficulty? Perhaps while he was eating a date, it got stuck in his throat, and he did not have the opportunity to immerse himself in a mikveh to purify himself. Alternatively, he was engaged in his work close to sunset. Alternatively, while he was engaged in his work, the time for reciting the Shema arrived, and he died, and he did not have the opportunity to immerse himself in a mikveh to purify himself.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים אַף הַמְגַדֵּף כּוּ׳. מַאי אַף הַמְגַדֵּף שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה?
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: even the one who blasphemes, What Even blasphemes, as he does not perform an action?
llm_translation: The Sages say: Even the one who reviles, etc. What is meant by "even the one who reviles" that he has no deed?

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן שְׁמַעוּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּתָנֵי בַּעַל אוֹב וְלָא תָּנֵי יִדְּעוֹנִי, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי שְׁנָא דְּלָא מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן, מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ מַעֲשֶׂה? מְגַדֵּף נָמֵי לֵית בֵּיהּ מַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: The Rabbis heard that Rabbi Akiva teaches a necromancer, and he does not teach a sorcerer they said to him: What is different that he does not bring an offering? due to that does not involve an action. blasphemes as well, does not involve an action.
llm_translation: The sages heard from Rabbi Akiva who taught: "The Baal Ov is mentioned but not the Yiddeoni." They said to him: "What is the difference that one does not bring a sacrifice, because it does not involve an action? One who blasphemes does not involve an action!"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְגַדֵּף מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן, הוֹאִיל וְנֶאֱמַר בּוֹ כָּרֵת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וְנָשָׂא חֶטְאוֹ״. וּכְלָלָא הוּא, כֹּל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ כָּרֵת מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן? וְהָא פֶּסַח וּמִילָה דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ כָּרֵת וְלָא מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן!
human_translation: The Sages taught blasphemes brings an offering, since karet is stated with regard to it. the statement of Rabbi Akiva. And states: shall bear his sin” And is it principle wherever it is written karet with regard to brings an offering? But there Paschal offering, and circumcision, as karet is written them, and one does not bring an offering
llm_translation: The sages taught: One who curses brings an offering, since it is stated regarding it "cut off," the words of Rabbi Akiva. And he says: "And he shall bear his sin." And this is a general principle: wherever it is written regarding it "cut off," an offering is brought? But the Passover sacrifice and circumcision, regarding which it is written "cut off," yet an offering is not brought!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: מְגַדֵּף מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן הוֹאִיל וּבָא בּוֹ כָּרֵת בִּמְקוֹם קׇרְבָּן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. קָסָבַר: מִיגּוֹ דְּבָעֵי מִכְתַּב כָּרֵת בְּעָלְמָא, וּכְתִיב כָּרֵת בִּמְקוֹם קׇרְבָּן, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: this is saying: blasphemes brings an offering, since its karet comes, in a place an offering, the statement of Rabbi Akiva, he maintains: Since should have written karet in general, and karet is written in a place an offering, conclude from it brings an offering
llm_translation: So it was stated: One who reviles brings an offering, since he willingly brings it upon himself, he incurs karet in the place of an offering, the words of Rabbi Akiva. He holds: From the fact that it requires a written document, karet is simply a general principle, and it is written karet in the place of an offering, learn from it that he brings an offering.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר: ״חֶטְאוֹ יִשָּׂא״. אֲתָא[ן] לְרַבָּנַן, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְרַבָּנַן: אָמְרִיתוּ מְגַדֵּף לֵית בֵּיהּ מַעֲשֶׂה, מַהוּ מְגַדֵּף – מְבָרֵךְ אֶת הַשֵּׁם. אֶלָּא כָּרֵת דִּכְתִיב, לְמַאי אֲתָא?
human_translation: And states: shall bear his sin” arrive at the Rabbis, and this Rabbi Akiva is saying to the Rabbis: You say blasphemes does not involve an action, what is blasphemes? blesses, the Name, But karet that is written: for what does it come,
llm_translation: And he says: "His sin he shall bear." The Rabbis came and thus Rabbi Akiva said to the Rabbis: You said, "One who blasphemes has no part in the World to Come." What is considered blasphemy? - One who blesses the Name. Rather, the punishment is excision, as it is written, for what case does it come?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: לִיתֵּן כָּרֵת לִמְקַלֵּל, דִּכְתִיב בִּמְקַלֵּל: (״חֶטְאוֹ יִשָּׂא הָאִישׁ הַהוּא״) [״וְנָשָׂא חֶטְאוֹ״], וּכְתִיב בְּפֶסַח שֵׁנִי: ״חֶטְאוֹ יִשָּׂא״, מָה לְהַלָּן – כָּרֵת, אַף כָּאן – כָּרֵת.
human_translation: say to him: to give karet to one who curses As it is written with regard to one who curses shall bear his sin,” and it is written with regard to second Pesaḥ shall bear his sin” Just as there, karet , so too here, karet .
llm_translation: They said to him: Let a cutting off be given to the one who curses, as it is written regarding the one who curses: ("The man shall bear his sin") "And he shall bear his sin", and it is written in the second Passover: "He shall bear his sin," just as there - cutting off, so too here - cutting off.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אֶת ה׳ [הוּא] מְגַדֵּף״, אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּאָדָם הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״גֵּירַפְתָּה הַקְּעָרָה וְחִיסַּרְתָּהּ״. קָסָבַר: מְגַדֵּף – מְבָרֵךְ אֶת הַשֵּׁם הוּא.
human_translation: the Sages taught blasphemes [ megaddef ] the Lord” Isi ben Yehuda says: like a person who says to another: You cleaned [ geirafta ] the bowl and rendered it lacking, maintains blasphemer is blesses, the Name,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "He who blasphemes the Lord," Issi ben Yehuda says: Like a person who says to his friend, "You have overturned the bowl and diminished it." He holds: "Blasphemes" - he blesses the Name itself.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּאָדָם הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״גֵּירַפְתָּה הַקְּעָרָה וְלֹא חִיסַּרְתָּהּ״. קָסָבַר: מְגַדֵּף – הַיְינוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says like a person who says to another: You cleaned the bowl but did not render it lacking, maintains blasphemer is an idol worshipper,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: Like a person who says to his friend, "You have lifted the bowl but not stirred it." He holds: "He is a blasphemer," meaning he is engaging in idol worship.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״אֶת ה׳״, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: בְּעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לִיתֵּן כָּרֵת לִמְבָרֵךְ הַשֵּׁם.
human_translation: is taught another the Lord” Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: The verse is speaking of an idol worshipper. And the Rabbis say: The verse comes only to give karet to one who blesses, the Name,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "אֶת ה׳" - Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: The Scripture speaks regarding one who performs foreign worship, and the Sages say: The Scripture only came to give excision to one who blesses the Name.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יֵשׁ מְבִיאוֹת קׇרְבָּן וְנֶאֱכָל, וְיֵשׁ מְבִיאוֹת קׇרְבָּן וְאֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל, וְיֵשׁ שֶׁאֵינָם מְבִיאוֹת.
human_translation: There are bring offering and is eaten And there are bring offering but it is not eaten. And some do not bring
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: There are those who bring a sacrifice and it is eaten, and there are those who bring a sacrifice and it is not eaten, and there are those who do not bring at all.

hebrew_text: מְבִיאוֹת קׇרְבָּן וְנֶאֱכָל: הַמַּפֶּלֶת כְּמִין בְּהֵמָה חַיָּה וָעוֹף, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בּוֹ מִצּוּרַת אָדָם.
human_translation: bring offering and it is eaten One who miscarries similar to a domesticated animal, an undomesticated animal, or a bird; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: unless has the form of a person.
llm_translation: Bringing an offering and it shall be eaten. The miscarried fetus is like a type of living animal and bird, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: Until it has the form of a human.

hebrew_text: הַמַּפֶּלֶת סַנְדָּל אוֹ שִׁילְיָא אוֹ שַׁפִּיר מְרוּקָּם, וְהַיּוֹצֵא מְחוּתָּךְ, וְכֵן שִׁפְחָה שֶׁהִפִּילָה, מְבִיאָה קׇרְבָּן וְנֶאֱכָל.
human_translation: who miscarries a sandal or placenta; or an amniotic sac tissue developed; or that emerged cut, and likewise maidservant, who miscarried; she brings offering and it is eaten
llm_translation: The sandal or shoe or slipper that is embroidered, and the one who removes your shoe, and similarly a maidservant who has miscarried, brings a sacrifice and it is eaten.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ מְבִיאוֹת וְאֵינָן נֶאֱכָלוֹת: הַמַּפֶּלֶת וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ מָה הִפִּילָה, וּשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים שֶׁהִפִּילוּ, אַחַת מִמִּין פְּטוּר וְאַחַת מִמִּין חוֹבָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָלְכוּ זֶה לַמִּזְרָח וְזֶה לַמַּעֲרָב. אֲבָל אִם הָיוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן עוֹמְדוֹת – שְׁתֵּיהֶן מְבִיאוֹת קׇרְבָּן, וְנֶאֱכָל.
human_translation: And these bring but are not eaten: One who miscarries and does not know what she miscarried; and two women who miscarried, one of a type exempt and one of a type liable Rabbi Yosei said: When when went this to the east and that to the west. But if both of them were standing both of them bring offering, and it is eaten.
llm_translation: These are the things that are brought and not eaten: the miscarriage when one does not know what she miscarried, and two women who miscarried, one from the category of exempt and one from the category of obligated. Rabbi Yosei said: When is this? When one went to the east and one to the west. But if both of them were standing - both of them bring a sacrifice, and it is eaten.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין מְבִיאוֹת: הַמַּפֶּלֶת שַׁפִּיר מָלֵא מַיִם, מָלֵא דָּם, מָלֵא גְּנִינִים, הַמַּפֶּלֶת כְּמִין דָּגִים וַחֲגָבִים וּשְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים, הַמַּפֶּלֶת יוֹם אַרְבָּעִים, וְיוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מְחַיֵּיב בְּיוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן.
human_translation: These do not bring who miscarries an amniotic sac full of water, full of blood, full of colors; who miscarries similar to fish, or grasshoppers, or repugnant creatures, or creeping animals; who miscarries fortieth day and caesarean section. Rabbi Shimon deems liable in caesarean section.
llm_translation: These are the ones that do not bring: the miscarriage that is filled with water, filled with blood, filled with embryos, the miscarriage resembling fish, locusts, vermin, and creeping things, the miscarriage of forty days, and the one that brings forth a dophen. Rabbi Shimon obligates for the one that brings forth a dophen.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שִׁפְחָה מְנָלַן? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, גִּיּוֹרֶת וְשִׁפְחָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִשָּׁה״.
human_translation: From where do we maidservant, As the Sages taught the children of Israel, I have only children of Israel from where a convert and maidservant The verse states “a woman,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Where do we derive that a maidservant is included? For the Rabbis taught: 'Bnei Yisrael,' I have only Bnei Yisrael, how do we know that a convert and a maidservant are included? The Torah teaches: 'A woman.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְכֵן שִׁפְחָה״? סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כִּי אָמְרִינַן כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה חַיֶּיבֶת בָּהּ – עֶבֶד חַיָּיב בָּהּ, הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּדָבָר שֶׁשָּׁוֶה בֵּין אִישׁ וּבֵין אִשָּׁה. אֲבָל יוֹלֶדֶת, דִּבְנָשִׁים אִיתַהּ, בַּאֲנָשִׁים לֵיתַהּ, אֵימָא לָא תִּחַיַּיב שִׁפְחָה, אַהָכִי תְּנָא: שִׁפְחָה.
human_translation: What And likewise maidservant? enter your mind to say when we say: any mitzva in which a woman is obligated slave is obligated in that this statement with regard to a matter that is the same for a man and for a woman. But a woman after childbirth, which is to women does not to men, say maidservant is not obligated for this taught maidservant.
llm_translation: What is meant by "and similarly a maidservant"? Your initial thought I say: When we say any commandment that a woman is obligated in - a male slave is also obligated in it, these are matters that are equal between a man and a woman. But regarding a woman who gives birth, where women have it and men do not have it, you might say that a maidservant should not be obligated. Therefore, it was taught: a maidservant.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן כּוּ׳. מַאי עָבְדִין? מַייתְיָן תַּרְוַיְיהוּ חַד קׇרְבָּן וַדַּאי, וְחַטַּאת עוֹף סָפֵק, וּמַתְנֵי.
human_translation: These bring offering What do they do? The two of them bring one definite offering, and a sin offering of a bird uncertainty, and they stipulate
llm_translation: These are the ones who bring a sacrifice of a bird. What do they do? They bring both of them, one definite sacrifice and a sin offering of a bird which is uncertain, and they teach.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי תְּנָאָה? וְהָתְנַן: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מְבִיאוֹת שְׁנֵיהֶן חַטָּאת אַחַת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר אֵין שְׁנֵיהֶן מְבִיאוֹת חַטָּאת אַחַת. אַלְמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לֵית לֵיהּ תְּנָאָה!
human_translation: And is Rabbi Yosei of a stipulation But didn’t we learn Rabbi Shimon says: They both bring one sin offering Rabbi Yosei says: They do not both bring one sin offering Evidently, Rabbi Yosei is not of a stipulation
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And does Rabbi Yosei have a teaching? And we learned: Rabbi Shimon says: Their bringing is one sin-offering. Rabbi Yosei says: Both of them do not bring one sin-offering. It is evident that Rabbi Yosei does not have a teaching!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בִּמְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה. וְכֵן כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בִּמְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Yosei concedes with regard to one who has not yet an atonement And likewise, when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Yosei concedes with regard to one who has not yet an atonement
llm_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Yosei concedes in the case of a lack of atonement. And similarly, when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Yosei concedes in the case of a lack of atonement.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? הָתָם בָּעֵי גַּבְרָא יְדִיעָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״אוֹ הוֹדַע אֵלָיו חַטָּאתוֹ״ הִילְכָּךְ, לָא מַתְיָין וּמַתְנְיָ[ין]. אֲבָל הָכָא, כִּי מַתְיָין נָשִׁים קׇרְבָּן – לְאִישְׁתְּרוֹיֵי בַּאֲכִילַת קָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: What is the reason There, the man requires awareness as it is written: “If his sin, be known to him” Therefore, they do not bring and stipulate But here, when women bring to become permitted in the consumption of sacrificial
llm_translation: What is the reason? There, it requires a man's knowledge, as it is written: "Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, be known to him" (Leviticus 4:23). Therefore, they do not mix and teach. But here, when women mix the offering - it is for the benefit of facilitating the consumption of holy foods by their husbands.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתָנֵי סֵיפָא דְּהַהִיא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל חַטָּאת שֶׁהִיא בָּאָה עַל חֵטְא – אֵין שְׁתַּיִם מְבִיאוֹת אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: As it is taught in the latter clause of that Rabbi Yosei says: any sin offering that comes for a sin, two do not bring it
llm_translation: As it was taught in the latter part of that teaching: Rabbi Yosei says: Any sin-offering that comes for a sin - two sins do not bring it.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין מְבִיאוֹת כּוּ׳ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מְחַיֵּיב בְּיוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאִם נְקֵבָה תֵּלֵד״, לְרַבּוֹת לֵידָה אַחֶרֶת, מַאי הִיא – יוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן.
human_translation: these do not bring Rabbi Shimon deems liable in caesarean section. What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? Reish Lakish said the verse states: “But if she bears a girl” to include another birth, what it? caesarean section.
llm_translation: These are the cases that do not bring a sin-offering. Rabbi Shimon obligates in the case of a miscarriage. What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion? Reish Lakish said: The verse states, "And if a woman gives birth," to include another form of birth, which is a miscarriage.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי מַנִּי בַּר פַּטִּישׁ: ״אִשָּׁה כִּי תַזְרִיעַ וְיָלְדָה״ – עַד שֶׁתֵּלֵד מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁמַּזְרַעַת.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what is reasoning? Rabbi Mani bar Pattish said “If a woman conceives [ tazria ] and gives birth to a male” unless she gives birth through the place where she receives seed,
llm_translation: The sages, what is the reason? Rabbi Mani bar Patishe said: "When a woman conceives and gives birth" - until she gives birth from the place she conceived.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפֶּלֶת לְאוֹר שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹטְרִין מִן הַקׇּרְבָּן, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מְחַיְּיבִין.
human_translation: who miscarries on the night of, the eighty-first Beit Shammai deem exempt from offering and Beit Hillel deem liable
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If a miscarriage occurs after eighty-one days, Beit Shammai exempt from bringing a sacrifice, while Beit Hillel obligate."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: מַאי שְׁנָא אוֹר שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד מִיּוֹם שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד? אִם שָׁיוָה לוֹ לְטוּמְאָה, לֹא יִשְׁוֶה לוֹ לְקׇרְבָּן?
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: What is different night of the eighty-first and day of the eighty-first? If they are equal with regard to ritual impurity, will not be equal with regard to offering
llm_translation: The House of Hillel said to the House of Shammai: What is the difference between eighty and one day eighty and one? If it was fitting for impurity, should it not be fitting for sacrifice?

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: לֹא, אִם אֲמַרְתֶּם בְּמַפֶּלֶת יוֹם שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד, שֶׁכֵּן יָצְאָה לְשָׁעָה שֶׁהִיא רְאוּיָה לְהָבִיא בָּהּ קׇרְבָּן, תֹּאמַר בְּמַפֶּלֶת לְאוֹר שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד, שֶׁלֹּא יָצְאָה לְשָׁעָה שֶׁהִיא רְאוּיָה לְהָבִיא בָּהּ קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: Beit Shammai said to No, If you said with regard to who miscarries eighty-first day as she emerged into a period that is fit her to bring offering. say with regard to who miscarries on the night of eighty-first where she did not emerge into a period that is fit her to bring offering,
llm_translation: They said to them, Beit Shammai: No, if you say in the intercalated month of eighty-one, that she went out for an hour that is fitting to bring an offering in it, you should say in the intercalated month of eighty-one to light, that she did not go out for an hour that is fitting to bring an offering in it.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶן בֵּית הִלֵּל: וַהֲלֹא הַמַּפֶּלֶת יוֹם שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת תּוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁלֹּא יָצְאָה לְשָׁעָה שֶׁהִיא רְאוּיָה לְהָבִיא בָּהּ קׇרְבָּן, וְחַיֶּיבֶת קׇרְבָּן!
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to But let who miscarries on eighty-first day that occurs on Shabbat prove as she did not emerge into a period that is fit her to bring offering and she is obligated to bring offering.
llm_translation: They said to the House of Hillel: But wasn't the miscarriage on the eighty-first day that happened to fall on Shabbat a proof, that it did not come out at a time when it was fitting to bring a sacrifice in it, and she is obligated to bring a sacrifice!

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶן בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: לֹא, אִם אֲמַרְתֶּם יוֹם שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לְקׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, רָאוּי לְקׇרְבַּן צִיבּוּר, תֹּאמַר בְּמַפֶּלֶת לְאוֹר שְׁמוֹנִים יוֹם וְאֶחָד, שֶׁאֵין הַלַּיְלָה רָאוּי לֹא לְקׇרְבַּן יָחִיד וְלֹא לְקׇרְבַּן צִיבּוּר?
human_translation: Beit Shammai said to No, If you said who miscarries on eighty-first day that occurs on Shabbat, that although is unfit for an individual offering, fit for a communal offering say with regard to who miscarries on the night of eighty-first as the night is completely unfit, neither an individual offering nor a communal offering
llm_translation: They said to the House of Shammai: No, if you say the eighty-first day that happens to fall on Shabbat, even though it is not fitting for an individual offering, it is fitting for a communal offering. Should you say at the end of eighty-one days, that the night is not fitting for either an individual offering or a communal offering?

hebrew_text: וְהַדָּמִים אֵינָן מוֹכִיחִים, שֶׁהַמַּפֶּלֶת בְּתוֹךְ מְלֹאת – דָּמֶיהָ טְמֵאִים, וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַקׇּרְבָּן.
human_translation: And the blood, does not prove as who miscarries completion her blood is impure she is exempt from the offering.
llm_translation: The blood does not prove, for if it falls within the fullness - its blood is impure, and exempt from the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא: אָמְרוּ לָהֶן בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לְבַת״ לְרַבּוֹת אוֹר שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: is taught Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: states: for a daughter” to include the night eighty-first
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: The House of Hillel said to the House of Shammai: He says: "Levat" to include the light of eighty-one.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא הֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ קַמֵּיהּ דְּבַר קַפָּרָא, שַׁבְקֵיהּ וַאֲתָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא. יוֹמָא חַד פְּגַע בֵּיהּ, בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ: זָב שֶׁרָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ רְאִיּוֹת בְּלֵיל שְׁמִינִי, מָה בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים בְּדָבָר זֶה?
human_translation: Rabbi Hoshaya would regularly before bar Kappara. He left him and came before Rabbi Ḥiyya. One day encountered raised dilemma before him: a man who experiences a gonorrhea-like discharge [ zav ], he saw three sightings, on the night eighth what do Beit Hillel say about this matter?
llm_translation: Rabbi Hoshaya was often found before Rabbi Kapara, he left and came before Rabbi Hiyya. One day he met him, he asked him: A man who saw three emissions on the eighth night, what do the House of Hillel say about this matter?

hebrew_text: טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית הִלֵּל בְּמַפֶּלֶת בַּלַּיְלָה מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״לְבַת״, אֲבָל זָב שֶׁרָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ רְאִיּוֹת בְּלֵיל שְׁמִינִי – פָּטְרִי, דְּלָא מְיַיתְּרִי קְרָאֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: reason of Beit Hillel that who miscarries on the night due to as it is written: for a daughter”? But a zav who saw three sightings on the night eighth they exempt, as no superfluous verses Or perhaps is no difference
llm_translation: Their reasons of Beit Hillel in the case of a miscarriage at night because it is written: "for a daughter," but a man who saw three emissions on the eighth night - he is exempt, for the verses are not multiplied, or perhaps it is not different?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּר קַפָּרָא: מָה בָּבְלִי אוֹמֵר בְּדָבָר זֶה? אִישְׁתִּיק רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא, לָא אֲמַר כְּלוּם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּר קַפָּרָא: צְרִיכִין לְדִבְרֵי עִיָּיא? נַחְזוֹר עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לְבַת״ – לְרַבּוֹת אוֹר שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: Bar Kappara said to What does Babylonian, say about this matter? Rabbi Hoshaya was silent and did not say anything. Bar Kappara said to him: we require the statement of Iyya, Let us review the earlier states: for a daughter” to include the night of eighty-first
llm_translation: He said to him, Bar Kappara: What does Babli say about this matter? Rabbi Hoshaya remained silent, he did not say anything. Bar Kappara said to him: Do we need the words of Iyya? Let us go back to the earlier statements: Behold, it says, "to a daughter" - to include eighty-one lights.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: זָב שֶׁרָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ רְאִיּוֹת בְּלֵיל שְׁמִינִי, תָּנֵי חֲדָא: מֵבִיא, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא. מַאי לַָאו תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּהָא דְּתַנְיָא מֵבִיא, קָסָבַר: לַיְלָה אֵין מְחוּסַּר זְמַן, וְהָדְתָנֵי אֵין מֵבִיא, קָסָבַר: לַיְלָה מְחוּסַּר זְמַן?
human_translation: Let us say is subject tanna’im . a zav who saw three sightings on the night eighth is taught one brings and is taught another does not bring What, is it not is tanna’im ? As, this who taught brings holds night not whose time has not yet and that who taught does not bring holds night whose time has not yet
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima k'tanna'ei: zav she'ra'ah shalosh reiyot b'leil shemini, tanai chada: mevi, v'tanaya idach: einu mevi. Mai la'av tanana'ei hi, deha d'tanaya mevi, kasavarei: laila ein mechusar zman, v'hadetanei ein mevi, kasavarei: laila mechusar zman?" English translation: "It was stated in the name of the younger scholars: If a zav sees three emissions on the eighth night, one taught: he brings a sacrifice, and another taught: he does not bring a sacrifice. What is the reason that they are not in agreement? Because the one who taught that he brings holds: at night there is no fixed time, and the one who taught that he does not bring holds: at night there is a fixed time?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר אַחָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי סָבְרִי לַיְלָה מְחוּסַּר זְמַן. וְהָא דְּתַנְיָא מֵבִיא – בְּזָב בַּעַל שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת, וְהָדְתַנְיָא אֵין מֵבִיא – בְּזָב בַּעַל שָׁלֹשׁ רְאִיּוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Aḥa said Rabbi Elazar said: These tanna’im hold night whose time has not yet And this which taught brings with regard to a zav who experienced two sightings. And that which taught does not bring with regard to a zav who experienced three sightings.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Acha said, Rabbi Elazar said: Those Tannaim hold that at night it is lacking time. And that which is taught: he brings - in the case of a seminal emission, the husband of two witnesses, and that which is taught: he does not bring - in the case of a seminal emission, the husband of three witnesses.

hebrew_text: זָב בַּעַל שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דַּוְקָא רָאָה בְּלֵיל שְׁמִינִי, אֲבָל בִּימָמָא דִּשְׁבִיעִי, לָא. קָסָבַר: כׇּל רְאִיָּיה שֶׁסּוֹתֶרֶת – אֵין מְבִיאָה לִידֵי קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: a zav who experienced two sightings, what of stating This teaches us: specifically saw on the night eighth but on seventh day not holds: Any sighting that negates does not bring to offering.
llm_translation: A man with two emissions, what is meant to say? This teaches us: specifically if he saw on the eighth night, but not on the seventh day. He holds: any emission that contradicts - does not bring to the obligation of a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַמַּאי אוֹקֵימְתַּאּ לְהָא דְּתַנְיָא אֵין מֵבִיא – בְּזָב בַּעַל שָׁלֹשׁ רְאִיּוֹת, לִיתְנְיַיהּ גַּבֵּי, חֲמִשָּׁה מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד עַל עֲבֵירוֹת הַרְבֵּה! – לָא פְּסִיקָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רָאָה אַחַת בַּלַּיְלָה וּשְׁתַּיִם בַּיּוֹם – מֵבִיא, שְׁתַּיִם בַּלַּיְלָה וְאַחַת בַּיּוֹם – אֵין מֵבִיא.
human_translation: Rava said: Why did you interpret that which is taught does not bring with regard to a zav who experienced three sightings? let teach in five bring one offering for multiple transgressions, not a definitive As Rabbi Yoḥanan says: saw one at night and two on the day, brings two at night and one in the day, does not bring
llm_translation: Rava said: Why is it established for that which it teaches "one does not bring" - regarding a zav who emitted semen with three sightings, it should have taught about him, "they bring one sacrifice for many transgressions"! - It is not a conclusive proof, for Rabbi Yochanan said: If he saw one at night and two during the day - he brings a sacrifice, if he saw two at night and one during the day - he does not bring a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תֵּדַע דְּאַחַת בַּלַּיְלָה וּשְׁתַּיִם בַּיּוֹם מֵבִיא, דְּהָא רְאִיָּיה רִאשׁוֹנָה שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע בְּעָלְמָא, וְאִילּוּ חָזֵי תַּרְתֵּין אַחְרָנְיָיתָא מִצְטָרְפִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Know that one at night and two in the day brings because first sighting merely semen, And yet sees two other they combine to him
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Know that one at night and two during the day bring, for the first sighting is mere seminal emission, while if one sees two subsequent ones, they combine.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: מִידֵּי אִירְיָא? רְאִיָּיה רִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁל זָב – חַזְיַיהּ בִּזְמַן חִיּוּבָא. אַחַת בַּלַּיְלָה, כֵּיוָן דְּלָאו בִּזְמַן חִיּוּבָא חַזְיַיהּ, אִי לָאו דְּאַשְׁמְעִינַן רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּמִצְטַרְפָא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לָא תִּצְטְרֵף.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: Are the cases comparable? first sighting of a zav , he saw it at a time of liability one at night since he saw it not the time of liability were it not that Rabbi Yoḥanan teaches us that it combines I would say does not combine
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: From the first sighting of a Zav - observe him at the time of obligation. If one sees him at night, once it is not the time of obligation, if he sees him, if not that we hear Rabbi Yochanan that it is combined, I would say it will not combine.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לַיְלָה מְחוּסַּר זְמַן?
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yoḥanan say night whose time has not yet
llm_translation: And who said Rabbi Yochanan: "At night is there a lack of time?"

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: נִטְמָא בַּיּוֹם – מֵבִיא, בַּלַּיְלָה – אֵין מֵבִיא. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בַּלַּיְלָה – מֵבִיא!
human_translation: But doesn’t Ḥizkiyya say became ritually impure on the day brings on the night does not bring And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even on the night brings
llm_translation: And he said Hezekiah: If one became impure during the day - he brings a sacrifice, during the night - he does not bring a sacrifice. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even during the night - he brings a sacrifice!

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״שְׁתַּיִם בַּלַּיְלָה וְאַחַת בַּיּוֹם – אֵין מֵבִיא״, לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר מְחוּסַּר זְמַן.
human_translation: When Rabbi Yoḥanan says two at night and one on the day does not bring according to the statement of the one who says night whose time has not yet
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ki ka'amar Rabbi Yochanan: 'Shetayim balaylah ve'achat bayom - ein mevi," ledivrei ha'omer mechusar zman. English translation: "For Rabbi Yochanan said: 'Two at night and one during the day - one does not bring,'" according to the opinion of one who says it is lacking in time.

hebrew_text: לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר? פְּשִׁיטָא! רָאָה אַחַת בַּלַּיְלָה וּשְׁתַּיִם בַּיּוֹם אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דְּלָאו בִּזְמַן חִיּוּבָא קָחָזֵי לֵיהּ – לָא תִּצְטְרֵף, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: according to the statement of the one who says obvious It was necessary for him saw one at night and two in the day. Lest you say: Since he saw when it was not the time of liability it should not combine teaches us
llm_translation: According to the one who says? It is obvious! If he saw one at night and two during the day, it is necessary for him. What might you say: Since he did not see them at the time of obligation, they do not combine, this is what he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלֶיהָ סְפֵק חָמֵשׁ לֵידוֹת וּסְפֵק חָמֵשׁ זִיבוֹת – מְבִיאָה קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד וְאוֹכֶלֶת בִּזְבָחִים וְאֵין הַשְּׁאָר עָלֶיהָ חוֹבָה. חָמֵשׁ זִיבוֹת וַדָּאוֹת וְחָמֵשׁ לֵידוֹת וַדָּאוֹת – מְבִיאָה קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד וְאוֹכֶלֶת בִּזְבָחִים וְהַשְּׁאָר עָלֶיהָ חוֹבָה.
human_translation: a woman who has in her uncertainty five births, and uncertainty five discharges she brings one offering, and she may partake of offerings. And the remaining are not an obligation for her. five definite discharges of a zava or five definite births, she brings one offering, and she may partake of offerings. And the remaining are an obligation for her.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A woman who has uncertainty regarding five menstrual periods and uncertainty regarding five instances of abnormal uterine bleeding - she brings one offering and eats sacrificial portions, and the rest is not obligatory upon her.
