If there are five instances of abnormal uterine bleeding that are certain, and five menstrual periods that are certain - she brings one offering and eats sacrificial portions, and the rest is obligatory upon her.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁעָמְדוּ קִינִּין בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם בְּדִינַר זָהָב, אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: הַמָּעוֹן הַזֶּה, לֹא אָלִין הַלַּיְלָה עַד שֶׁיִּהְיֶה בְּדִינָרִין (בַּסּוֹף) [כֶּסֶף!] נִכְנַס לְבֵית דִּין וְלִמֵּד: ״הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלֶיהָ חָמֵשׁ לֵידוֹת וַדָּאוֹת חָמֵשׁ זִיבוֹת וַדָּאוֹת – מְבִיאָה קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד וְאוֹכֶלֶת בִּזְבָחִים וְאֵין הַשְּׁאָר עָלֶיהָ חוֹבָה״ וְעָמְדוּ קִינִּין בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא בְּרִבְעָתַיִם.
human_translation: an incident where nests, stood in Jerusalem at one gold dinar, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: this abode I will not lie tonight until will be in dinars. Ultimately, he entered the court and taught: A woman who has in her five definite discharges of a zava or five definite births brings one offering, and she may partake of offerings. And the remaining are not an obligation for her. And nests stood that day at one-quarter
llm_translation: The incident of the pigeons that stood in Jerusalem for a golden dinar, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: "This residence, they do not lodge overnight until it is in two dinars at the end of silver! He entered the court and taught: 'A woman who has upon her five births and certain emissions of blood – she brings one offering and eats of the sacrifices, and the rest is not obligatory upon her.' And the pigeons stood that day at a quarter of a dinar."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חָמֵשׁ לֵידוֹת וַדַּאי חָמֵשׁ זִיבוֹת סָפֵק אוֹ חָמֵשׁ לֵידוֹת וַדַּאי וְחָמֵשׁ לֵידוֹת סָפֵק – מְבִיאָה שְׁתֵּי קִינִּין, אַחַת עַל הַוַּדַּאי וְאַחַת עַל הַסָּפֵק, שֶׁל וַדַּאי נֶאֱכֶלֶת וְהַשְּׁאָר עָלֶיהָ חוֹבָה, שֶׁל סָפֵק אֵין נֶאֱכֶלֶת וְאֵין הַשְּׁאָר עָלֶיהָ חוֹבָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught five definite births and five uncertain discharges of a zava , or five definite births and five uncertain births, she brings two nests, one for the definite and one for the uncertain for definite eaten and the remaining are an obligation for her. for uncertain not eaten, and the remaining are not an obligation for her.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If there are five certain births and definitely five emissions, or five certain births and definitely five possible emissions - she brings two pairs of birds, one for the certain and one for the possible, the certain one is eaten and the rest is obligatory, the possible one is not eaten and there is no obligation upon it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אוֹמֵר: עַל וַדַּאי תֹּאמַר: ״עַל הָאַחֲרוֹנָה״ וְתִפָּטֵר. שֶׁל סָפֵק, אִם יֵשׁ וַדַּאי בֵּינֵיהֶן, תֹּאמַר: ״עַל הַוַּדַּאי״ וְתִפָּטֵר, וְאִם לָאו, תֹּאמַר: ״עַל אֶחָד מֵהֶן״ וְתִפָּטֵר. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: בֵּין עַל הַוַּדַּאי בֵּין עַל הַסָּפֵק, תֹּאמַר: ״עַל אַחַת מֵהֶן״ וְתִפָּטֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: for definite she should say: for the last and she is exempt for uncertain if there is a definite among she should say: for the definite and she is exempt But if no she should say: for one of them, and she is exempt. Rabbi Akiva says: Whether for the definite whether for the uncertain she should say: for one of them, and she is exempt.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says: Certainly you should say, "on the last one" and be exempt. In a case of doubt, if there is certainty between them, you should say, "on the certain one" and be exempt. And if not, you should say, "on one of them" and be exempt. Rabbi Akiva says: Whether on the certain one or on the doubtful one, you should say, "on one of them" and be exempt.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרַב פָּפָּא, אֵימָא לָךְ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי, דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי מְדַמֵּי לְהוֹן לְחַטָּאת, דְּמַאן דְּחַיָּיב חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת עַד דְּמַיְיתֵי כּוּלְּהוֹן וְסוֹף מִכַּפַּר לֵיהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rav Pappa: I will say to you in the name of Rava: these tanna’im , with regard to what disagree? that Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, compares to a sin offering As, one who is liable five sin offerings until he brings all of them, and end atones for him. Here too, is no different,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak to Rav Papa, say to you from the name of Rava: Those Tannaim, with what do they argue? According to Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, they resemble them to a sin offering, for whoever is liable for five sin offerings until he brings all of them and ultimately achieves atonement, here it is not different.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְדַמֵּי לְהוֹן לִטְבִילוֹת, דְּמַאן דִּמְחַיַּיב חָמֵשׁ טְבִילוֹת, כֵּיוָן דְּטָבֵיל חֲדָא זִימְנָא אִיטְּהַר, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva compares to immersions As one who is obligated five immersions, once he immersed one time he is purified. Here too, is no different,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva compares them to immersion, as one who is obligated in five immersions, once he immerses one time he becomes pure, here it is not different.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי לְחַטָּאת מְדַמֵּי לְהוֹן, אַמַּאי שֶׁל סָפֵק תֹּאמַר: ״עַל אַחַת מֵהֶן״, וְתִפָּטֵר? אִילּוּ מַאן דִּמְחַיַּיב
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to If enters your mind Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri compares to a sin offering, why for uncertain should she say: for one of them, and she is exempt? If one who is obligated
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa: If it enters your mind, Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, regarding a sin offering, they are comparable to them, why do you say "on one of them" in the case of doubt, and he is exempt? If someone is liable

hebrew_text: חָמֵשׁ אֲשָׁמוֹת תְּלוּיִין, כִּי מַיְיתֵי חַד מִי מִיפְּטַר? וְהָתַנְיָא, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁחֲלוּקִין בְּחַטָּאוֹת – חֲלוּקִין בַּאֲשָׁמוֹת!
human_translation: five provisional guilt offerings, when he brings one is he exempt But isn’t it taught this is the principle: any where are divided with regard to sin offerings, divided with regard to guilt offerings,
llm_translation: Five guilt offerings depend, for if one comes, who is exempt? And it was taught, this is the principle: Anything that is divided in sins - is divided in guilt offerings!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לִטְבִילוֹת מְדַמֵּי לְהוֹן, וּבְחוֹשְׁשִׁין לִפְשִׁיעָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי סָבַר: חָיְישִׁינַן לִפְשִׁיעָה, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לִפְשִׁיעָה.
human_translation: Rather, everyone we compare to immersions, And they disagree with regard to we are concerned for negligence. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri maintains we are concerned for negligence. And Rabbi Akiva maintains we are not concerned for negligence,
llm_translation: Rather, the entirety of the world is comparable to immersion pools, and concerning the concern for negligence, Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri holds: we are concerned for negligence, and Rabbi Akiva holds: we are not concerned for negligence.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים וָשֵׁשׁ
llm_translation: We will return to you in thirty-six.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַרְבָּעָה מְחוּסְּרֵי כַּפָּרָה, וְאַרְבָּעָה מְבִיאִין עַל הַזָּדוֹן כַּשּׁוֹגֵג.
human_translation: four Lacking atonement [ khappara ], And four bring for an intentional as an unwitting
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Four are exempt from bringing a sin offering, and four bring for intentional transgression as for unintentional.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן מְחוּסְּרֵי כַּפָּרָה: הַזָּב, וְהַזָּבָה, וְהַיּוֹלֶדֶת, וְהַמְצוֹרָע.
human_translation: And these are who lack atonement: The man who experiences a gonorrhea-like discharge [ zav ], the woman who experiences a discharge of uterine blood after her menstrual period [ zava ], the woman after childbirth, and the leper.
llm_translation: And these are the ones lacking atonement: the male zav, and the female zavah, and the woman who gave birth, and the metzora.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: גֵּר מְחוּסָּר כַּפָּרָה עַד שֶׁיִּזָּרֵק עָלָיו הַדָּם. נָזִיר – לְיֵינוֹ וְתִגְלַחְתּוֹ וְטוּמְאָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: A convert lacks atonement, until sprinkles the blood on his A nazirite with regard to his wine, and cutting his hair, and his ritual impurity
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: A convert requires atonement until blood is sprinkled upon him. A Nazirite - regarding his wine, shaving, and impurity.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁנָא זָב וְזָבָה דְּמָנֵי לְהוֹן בִּתְרֵין – מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲלוּקָהּ טוּמְאָתוֹ, דְּזָב לָא מְטַמֵּא בְּאוֹנֶס וְזָבָה לָא מְטַמְּאָה בִּרְאִיּוֹת בְיָמִים,
human_translation: What is different a zav and a zava , that count them as two due to that the impurity of is distinct as a zav does not become impure by accident, and a zava , does not become impure by sightings like by days.
llm_translation: "Gemara: A male Zav and a female Zavah, their blood is similar in two aspects - because his impurity is divided, for a Zav does not render impure through forced emission, and a Zavah does not render impure through regular emissions during the days."

hebrew_text: דתניא: ״מבשרו״ – ולא מחמת אונסו. (ומי טמא) [ומיטמא] בראיות כבימים, דתניא: תלה הכתוב את הזכר בראיות ואת הנקבה בימים. וזבה מטמאה באונס, ולא מטמאה בראיות כבימים.
human_translation: As it is taught “from his flesh” and not due to his accident. And becomes impure by sightings like by days, as it is taught The verse links the male, to sightings and the female to days And a zava becomes impure by accident, and does not become impure by sightings like by days.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: "From his flesh" - and not due to his coercion. (And who is impure) and becomes impure through sight, like days, as it was taught: The Scripture connected the male with sight and the female with days. And a Zavah imparts impurity through coercion, but does not impart impurity through sight like days.

hebrew_text: מְצוֹרָע וּמְצוֹרַעַת נָמֵי חֲלוּקָה טוּמְאָתָן, דִּמְצוֹרָע טָעוּן פְּרִיעָה וּפְרִימָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּגָדָיו יִהְיוּ פְרֻמִים וְרֹאשׁוֹ יִהְיֶה פָרוּעַ״. וְאָסוּר בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה.
human_translation: the impurities of a male leper and a female leper are also distinct, as a male leper requires letting hair grow wild and rending garments, as it is written: “His garments shall be rent and the hair of his head shall go wild” and he is prohibited from sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: The afflicted one and the afflicted woman, their impurity is the same, for the afflicted one requires shaving and tearing, as it is written: "His clothes shall be rent, and his head bare." And they are prohibited in marital relations.

hebrew_text: וּמְצוֹרַעַת אֵינָהּ טְעוּנָה פְּרִיעָה וּפְרִימָה, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אִישׁ, אִשָּׁה מִנַּיִן? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהַצָּרוּעַ״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: And a female leper does not require letting hair grow wild and rending garments, as it is taught I have only a man from where a woman When states: “And the leper there are two here,
llm_translation: "And a metzora'at does not require te'unah, peri'ah, and perimah, as it was taught: 'I only have a man, from where do we know about a woman? When it says, 'and the tzara'at' - here are two."

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ״? נִתְּקוֹ הַכָּתוּב מֵעִנְיָן שֶׁל מַעְלָה לְעִנְיָן שֶׁל מַטָּה, לוֹמַר: אִישׁ פּוֹרֵעַ וּפוֹרֵם, וְאֵין הָאִשָּׁה פּוֹרַעַת וּפוֹרֶמֶת. וּמוּתֶּרֶת בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָשַׁב מִחוּץ לְאׇהֳלוֹ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״ – וְלֹא מִחוּץ לְאׇהֳלָהּ.
human_translation: If so, why the verse state: man”? The verse removed it from the matter earlier, to the matter later: to say a man lets his hair grow wild and rends his garments, but the woman does not let her hair grow wild and rend her garments. And is permitted to sexual intercourse, as it is stated: “And he shall dwell outside his tent for seven days” and not: Outside her tent.
llm_translation: If so, what does the Scripture mean to say "man"? The Scripture has disconnected from the matter of above to the matter of below, to say: a man separates and divorces, and the woman does not separate and divorce. And she is permitted for marital relations, as it is stated: "And she shall sit outside his tent for seven days" - and not outside her tent.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ נַמְנִינְהוּ בִּתְרֵין! זָב וְזָבָה – עִיקַּר טוּמְאָתָן חֲלוּקָה, מְצוֹרָע וּמְצוֹרַעַת – אֵין עִיקַּר טוּמְאָתָן חֲלוּקָה, הַאי וְהַאי כִּגְרִיס הוּא.
human_translation: Therefore, let us count as two a zav and zava , essence of their impurity is distinct, a male leper and female leper, essence of their impurity is not distinct, this and that is of a split bean.
llm_translation: Therefore, we count them as two! Zav and Zavah - the primary aspect of their impurity is divided, Metzora and Metzorah - the primary aspect of their impurity is not divided, this one and that one are like a dried fig.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: גֵּר מְחוּסָּר כּוּ׳. וְתַנָּא קַמָּא, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא תָּנֵי גֵּר? כִּי קָתָנֵי – מִדַּעַם דְּמִישְׁ[תְּ]רֵי לְמֵיכַל בְּקָדָשִׁים, גֵּר – כִּי קָא מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן לְאַכְשׁוֹרֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ לְמֵיעַל בְּקָהָל.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: A convert lacks And what is the reason the first tanna does not teach a convert, When teaches matter where permits to partake of sacrificial when a convert brings offering, to qualify him to enter the congregation
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: A convert who lacks knowledge of the laws of Judaism. And it was taught in the first clause, what is the reason he did not teach about a convert? Because it was taught - since they are more stringent with themselves to eat holy things, a convert - because he brings a sacrifice to atone for his soul to join the congregation.

hebrew_text: וְנָזִיר מַאי טַעְמָא לָא תָּנֵי? סוֹף סוֹף נָזִיר נָמֵי כִּי מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן – לְאִישְׁתְּרוֹיֵי לְמִישְׁתֵּי יַיִן דְּחוּלִּין הוּא.
human_translation: And what is the reason does not teach a nazirite Ultimately, as well, when a nazirite brings offering, it is to permit him to drink non-sacred wine,
llm_translation: "And regarding a Nazir, what is the reason it does not teach? Ultimately, a Nazir is considered as one who brings a sacrifice - to permit the drinking of wine, for it is mundane."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּקָתָנֵי נָזִיר לְמִישְׁרֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ, נִיתְנֵי נָמֵי נָזִיר טָמֵא! כִּי קָא מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן – לְמֵיחַל עֲלֵיהּ נְזִירוּת בְּטָהֳרָה הוּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer who teaches a nazirite to permit himself let also teach, a ritually impure nazirite. when brings offering, it is to effect upon himself naziriteship in purity.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, as it was taught: A Nazirite who shaves for his own benefit, he is given the status of a defiled Nazirite! For he brings a sacrifice - to annul his Naziriteship in purity it is.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גֵּר מְעוּכָּב לֶאֱכוֹל בְּקָדָשִׁים עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא קִינּוֹ, הֵבִיא פְּרִידָה אַחַת שַׁחֲרִית – אוֹכֵל בְּקָדָשִׁים לָעֶרֶב. כׇּל הַקִּינִּין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה – אֶחָד חַטָּאת וְאֶחָד עוֹלָה, כָּאן – שְׁתֵּיהֶן עוֹלוֹת.
human_translation: the Sages taught A convert is precluded from partaking of sacrificial until he brings his bird nest, brought one young bird [ perida ] morning, may partake of sacrificial in the evening, all in the Torah bird nests one a sin offering and one a burnt offering; here, both of them burnt offerings.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A convert is delayed from eating of the holy offerings until he brings his offering. If he brought one bird offering in the morning, he may eat of the holy offerings in the evening. All the offerings in the Torah - one is a sin offering and one is a burnt offering, here - both are burnt offerings.

hebrew_text: הֵבִיא חוֹבָתוֹ מִן הַבְּהֵמָה – יָצָא, עוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים – יָצָא, מִנְחָה וּשְׁלָמִים – לֹא יָצָא. לֹא אָמְרוּ קֵן אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: brought from an animal his obligatory fulfilled a burnt offering and a peace offering, fulfilled a meal offering and a peace offering, has not fulfilled a bird nest was stated only to be lenient
llm_translation: He brought his obligation from the animal - he fulfilled, burnt offering and peace offerings - he fulfilled, meal offering and peace offerings - he did not fulfill. They did not say nest but to be lenient.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מִנְחָה וּשְׁלָמִים דְּלֹא יָצָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר תַּעֲשׂוּ כֵּן יַעֲשֶׂה״, מָה אַתֶּם עוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים – אַף גֵּר עוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים?
human_translation: What is different a meal offering and peace offering, that has not fulfilled as it is written: as you do, so he shall do” Just as you a burnt offering and a peace offering so too, a convert a burnt offering and a peace offering.
llm_translation: What is the difference between a Mincha offering and Peace offerings that one has not fulfilled his obligation? As it is written: "As you do, so shall you do." Just as you, O Israel, with regard to burnt offerings and peace offerings - so too, a convert with burnt offerings and peace offerings?

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, חוֹבָתוֹ אַחַת מִן הַבְּהֵמָה לָא תִּיסְגֵּי עֲלֵיהּ בְּגַוֵּויהּ, דְּהָכְתִיב: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר תַּעֲשׂוּ כֵּן יַעֲשֶׂה״! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, יֵשׁ לוֹמַר: לְעוֹף אִיתְרַבִּי, לְעוֹלַת בְּהֵמָה לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: If so, one from an animal his obligation, that should not be enough for him, as isn’t it written: “As you do, so he shall do,” Rav Pappa says: can say If a bird was included not all the more so animal burnt offering?
llm_translation: If so, its obligation one from the animal not will exceed upon it in its body, as it is written: "As you do, so shall it be done." Rav Papa said: Can we say this for birds, all the more so for animal sacrifices?

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ מִנְחָה נָמֵי! מַיעֵט קְרָא: ״כֵּן״.
human_translation: If so, even a meal offering The verse restricts so
llm_translation: If so, even a meal-offering is included! The verse limits: "So."

hebrew_text: וָעוֹף הֵיכָא אִיתְרַבִּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר תַּעֲשׂוּ כֵּן יַעֲשֶׂה״ – מָה אַתֶּם עוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים, אַף הוּא עוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כָּכֶם כַּגֵּר״. מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָעוֹף? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִשֵּׁה רֵיחַ נִיחֹחַ לַה׳״ – אֵיזֶה דָּבָר שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ לַה׳? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר [זוֹ] עוֹלַת הָעוֹף.
human_translation: And where was a bird included as the Sages taught “As you do, so he shall do” Just as you a burnt offering and a peace offering, so too, a burnt offering and a peace offering, as it is stated: “As you are, so the stranger From where to include the bird The verse states: “An offering made by fire, of a pleasing aroma unto the Lord” Which item is entirely for the Lord? You must say: a bird burnt offering,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And where is the bird mentioned? For the Rabbis taught: "As you do, so shall he do" - Just as you bring burnt offerings and peace offerings, so does he bring burnt offerings and peace offerings, as it is stated: "Like you, like the stranger." How do we know to include birds in this category? The Talmud teaches: "An offering of a pleasing aroma to the Lord" - What is something entirely for the Lord? One would say this refers to a burnt offering of a bird.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מְרַבֶּה אֲפִילּוּ מִנְחָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כֵּן״.
human_translation: might that I include even a meal offering, the verse states: “So
llm_translation: I am able to increase even a Mincha offering? The Talmud teaches: "Yes."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״וְעָשָׂה אִשֵּׁה רֵיחַ נִיחוֹחַ לַה׳״, שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי כֹּל שֶׁעוֹלֶה לָאִשִּׁים, אֲפִילּוּ מִנְחָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר תַּעֲשׂוּ כֵּן יַעֲשֶׂה״ – מָה אַתֶּם מִינֵי דָמִים, אַף הֵם מִינֵי דָמִים.
human_translation: is taught another and will offer an offering made by fire, of a pleasing aroma unto the Lord, I derive any that is brought on the fire even a meal offering. the verse states: “As you do, so he shall do,” just as you types blood so too they, types blood
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And make a pleasing aroma for the Lord." I hear this to include all offerings brought by women, even a meal offering? The Torah teaches: "As you do, so shall it be done" - just as you are types of blood, so too are they types of blood.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה אַתֶּם עוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים, אַף הֵם עוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כָּכֶם כַּגֵּר יִהְיֶה״ – לָכֶם הִקַּשְׁתִּיו, וְלֹא לְדָבָר אַחֵר, לְקׇרְבְּנוֹתֵיכֶם.
human_translation: If Just as you a burnt offering and a peace offering, so too, they with a burnt offering and a peace offering? the verse states: “As you are, so shall the stranger be I compared him to you but not to another matter, your offerings.
llm_translation: "If you are offering burnt offerings and peace offerings, so are they offering burnt offerings and peace offerings! The Torah teaches: 'Like you, so shall the convert be' – I have compared them to you, and not to anything else, regarding your sacrifices."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״כָּכֶם״ – כַּאֲבוֹתֵיכֶם, מָה אֲבוֹתֵיכֶם לֹא נִכְנְסוּ לַבְּרִית אֶלָּא בְּמִילָה וּטְבִילָה וְהַרְצָאַת דָּם – אַף הֵם לֹא יִכָּנְסוּ לַבְּרִית אֶלָּא בְּמִילָה וּטְבִילָה וְהַרְצָאַת דָּמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi says: “As you are, as your ancestors Just as your ancestors entered the covenant only through circumcision and immersion and the sprinkling of blood so too they may enter the covenant only through circumcision and immersion and the sprinkling of blood,
llm_translation: Rabbi says: "Like your fathers," - just as your fathers entered into the covenant only through circumcision, immersion, and sprinkling of blood, so too they will not enter into the covenant except through circumcision, immersion, and sprinkling of blood.

hebrew_text: לְהָבִיא פְּרִידָה אַחַת – אִי אֶפְשָׁר, שֶׁלֹּא מָצִינוּ בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ. לֹא אָמְרוּ קֵן אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל עָלָיו.
human_translation: is impossible to bring one young bird as we have not found in the entire Torah. a bird nest was stated only to be lenient for him.
llm_translation: To bring one calf - impossible, for we did not find in the entire Torah. They did not say "nest" except to lighten it.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וְהִקְרִיבוֹ״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בְּתוֹרִים: ״וְהִקְרִיב״, שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי הָאוֹמֵר: ״הֲרֵי עָלַי עוֹלַת הָעוֹף״ לֹא יִפְחוֹת מִשְּׁנֵי פְרִידִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהִקְרִיבוֹ״ – אֲפִילּוּ פְּרִידָה אַחַת! – חוֹבָה מִיהָא לָא אַשְׁכְּחַן.
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught “And shall sacrifice it” Why the verse state Since is stated about doves: “And he shall sacrifice I derive the one who says: It upon me a bird a burnt offering, shall not bring less than two young birds. the verse states: “And shall sacrifice it” even one young bird. In any event, we have not found an obligatory
llm_translation: And not? And it was taught: "And he shall offer it," what does the Talmud say? As it is stated in the Torah: "And he shall offer," do I not hear the one who says: "Behold, I am obligated to bring a bird offering," should it not be less than two young calves? The Talmud says: "And he shall offer it" – even if it is just one young calf! – the obligation is not forgotten from there.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא יוֹלֶדֶת, דְּמַתְיָא בֶּן יוֹנָה אוֹ תוֹר לְחַטָּאת! – מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא כֶּבֶשׂ בַּהֲדַהּ.
human_translation: But isn’t there a woman after childbirth, who brings pigeon or dove as a sin offering because there is a lamb with it
llm_translation: And there is a case of a woman giving birth, where she is in doubt whether it is a son of a dove or a son of a bull for a sin-offering! - Because there is a sheep in the bundle.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מָה אֲבוֹתֵיכֶם לֹא נִכְנְסוּ לַבְּרִית אֶלָּא כּוּ׳. בִּשְׁלָמָא מִילָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי מוּלִים הָיוּ כׇּל הָעָם הַיּוֹצְאִים״, אִי נָמֵי מֵהָכָא: ״וְאֶעֱבוֹר עָלַיִךְ וָאֶרְאֵךְ מִתְבּוֹסֶסֶת בְּדָמָיִךְ וָאוֹמַר לָךְ בְּדָמַיִךְ חֲיִי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: The Master said: Just as your ancestors entered the covenant only Granted, circumcision as it is written: “For all the nation that left was circumcised” Alternatively, from here, “And when I passed by you, and saw you wallowing in your blood, I said unto you: In your blood, live;
llm_translation: The Master said: "Your forefathers entered into the covenant only at the age of thirteen." Regarding circumcision, as it is written: "For all the people who came out were circumcised." Alternatively, from here: "And I passed by you and saw you wallowing in your blood, and I said to you in your blood, 'Live!'"

hebrew_text: הַרְצָאַת דָּמִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁלַח אֶת נַעֲרֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״. אֶלָּא טְבִילָה מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה חֲצִי הַדָּם וְיִזְרוֹק עַל הָעָם״ – וְאֵין הַזָּאָה בְּלֹא טְבִילָה.
human_translation: the sprinkling of blood, as it is written: “And he sent the young men of the children of Israel, But from where do we immersion As it is written: “And Moses took half the blood and sprinkled it on the people” and there is no sprinkling without immersion.
llm_translation: The sprinkling of blood, as it is written: "And he sent the young men of the children of Israel." But where is immersion derived from? As it is written: "And Moses took half of the blood and sprinkled it on the people" - and sprinkling is not without immersion.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הָאִידָּנָא דְּלֵיכָּא קׇרְבָּן לָא נְקַבֵּל גֵּרִים! אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: ״וְכִי יָגוּר אִתְּכֶם גֵּר אֲשֶׁר בְּתוֹכְכֶם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: If that is so, now, when there are no offerings, we not should accept converts. Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says “And if a stranger sojourn with you, whosoever may be among you,
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, the present time, that there is no acceptance of sacrifices for converts! Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: "And if a stranger dwells with you, a stranger who is among you, etc."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גֵּר בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה – צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּפְרִישׁ רוֹבַע לְקִינּוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כְּבָר נִמְנָה (עָלָיו) [עָלֶיהָ] רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי וּבִטְּלָהּ, מִפְּנֵי הַתַּקָּלָה. אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר גֵּרְשׁוֹם אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: the Sages taught A convert in the present time is required to set aside a quarter for his bird nest, Rabbi Shimon says: Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai already voted and nullified due to mishap. Rav Idi bar Gershom says Rav Adda bar Ahava says: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: The sages taught: A convert nowadays - he must separate a quarter for his nest. Rabbi Shimon said: Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai already counted it upon him and annulled it, due to the difficulty. Rav Idi bar Gershon said Rav Adda bar Ahava: The halakha is like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְמַתְנֵי לַהּ עַל הָדָא, דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹת מְלָאכָה בְּשַׁבָּת לְעַצְמוֹ כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד.
human_translation: And there are who teach this with regard to this as the Sages taught A gentile who resides in Eretz Yisrael and observes the seven Noahide mitzvot [ ger toshav ] permitted to perform labor on Shabbat for himself in the same manner a Jew on the intermediate days of a Festival,
llm_translation: And there is one who teaches about this, as the Rabbis taught: A resident alien is permitted to perform labor on Shabbat for himself like an Israelite on a weekday of a festival.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּיוֹם טוֹב. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב עוֹשֶׂה בַּשַּׁבָּת לְעַצְמוֹ כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בַּחוֹל. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב וְאֶחָד עֶבֶד וְאָמָה הַתּוֹשָׁבִים עוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בַּשַּׁבָּת לְעַצְמָן כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בַּחוֹל.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: in the same manner a Jew on a Festival, Rabbi Yosei says: A ger toshav may perform on Shabbat for himself in the same manner a Jew on a weekday. Rabbi Shimon says: Both a ger toshav and a resident male or female slave may perform labor on Shabbat for themselves in the same manner a Jew on a weekday.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Like Israel on a festival day. Rabbi Yosei says: A resident alien performs on Shabbat for himself like Israel on a weekday. Rabbi Shimon says: Both a resident alien and a slave and a maidservant, the residents, perform work on Shabbat for themselves like Israel on a weekday.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ מְבִיאִין עַל הַזָּדוֹן כַּשּׁוֹגֵג: הַבָּא עַל שִׁפְחָה, וְנָזִיר שֶׁנִּטְמָא, וּשְׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת, וּשְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן.
human_translation: These bring for an intentional as an unwitting One who engages in intercourse with maidservant, and a nazirite who became ritually impure, and the oath of testimony, and the oath on a deposit,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the cases where one brings a guilt offering for intentional transgression as for unintentional transgression: One who has relations with a maidservant, a Nazirite who becomes impure, the oath of testimony, and the oath of deposit.

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד עַל עֲבֵירוֹת הַרְבֵּה, וַחֲמִשָּׁה מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד. אֵלּוּ מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד עַל עֲבֵירוֹת הַרְבֵּה: הַבָּא עַל שִׁפְחָה בִּיאוֹת הַרְבֵּה, וְנָזִיר שֶׁנִּטְמָא טוּמְאוֹת הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: five bring one offering for several transgressions, and five bring a sliding-scale offering, These bring one offering for several transgressions: one who engages in several intercourse with maidservant, and a nazirite who became ritually impure several of ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Five bring a sacrifice one for many transgressions, and five bring a burnt offering and a descending. These bring a sacrifice one for many transgressions: one who comes upon a maidservant with many comings, and a Nazirite who becomes impure with many impurities.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַבָּא עַל הַשִּׁפְחָה, מְנָלַן?
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with maidservant From where do we
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma ha-ba al ha-shifcha, m'nalan?" Translation: "A question: 'If one has relations with a maidservant, what is the law?'"

hebrew_text: דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְכִפֶּר עָלָיו הַכֹּהֵן בְּאֵיל הָאָשָׁם עַל חַטָּאתוֹ אֲשֶׁר חָטָא״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמֵּבִיא קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד עַל עֲבֵירוֹת הַרְבֵּה. ״בְּאֵיל הָאָשָׁם... וְנִסְלַח לוֹ מֵחַטָּאתוֹ אֲשֶׁר חָטָא״ – לַעֲשׂוֹת שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד.
human_translation: As the Sages taught “And the priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the guilt offering for his sin that he has sinned” teaches that brings one offering for several transgressions. “With the ram of the guilt offering and he shall be forgiven for his sin that he has sinned.” to render an unwitting as an intentional
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And the priest shall make atonement for him with the guilt offering ram for the sin that he committed," teaches that one brings one offering for many sins. "With the guilt offering ram... and he shall be forgiven from his sin that he committed" - to equate unintentional sin with intentional sin.

hebrew_text: נָזִיר שֶׁנִּטְמָא, מְנָלַן?
human_translation: nazirite who became ritually impure From where do we
llm_translation: "Nazir who became impure, whence is it derived?"

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי יָמוּת מֵת עָלָיו בְּפֶתַע פִּתְאוֹם״, ״פֶּתַע״ – זֶה שׁוֹגֵג, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִם בְּפֶתַע בְּלֹא אֵיבָה הֲדָפוֹ״, ״פִּתְאוֹם״ – זֶה אוֹנֶס, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ פִּתְאֹם אֶל מֹשֶׁה״.
human_translation: as it is written “And if any man die unexpectedly [ befeta ], suddenly [ pitom ] beside him” “Unexpectedly,” this an unwitting and similarly, it states: “But if he thrust him unexpectedly without enmity” “Suddenly,” this circumstances beyond control, and similarly, it states: “And the Lord spoke suddenly to Moses,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is written: "And if a sudden death falls upon him suddenly," "suddenly" - this is inadvertent, and so it says: "If he was suddenly thrust aside without enmity," "suddenly" - this is forced, and so it says: "And the Lord spoke suddenly to Moses."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״פִּתְאוֹם״ – זֶה מֵזִיד, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״עָרוּם רָאָה רָעָה וְנִסְתָּר וּפְתָאִים עָבְרוּ וְנֶעֱנָשׁוּ״.
human_translation: is taught another “Suddenly”; this an intentional and similarly states: “A prudent man sees the evil, and hides himself; but the thoughtless pass on, and are punished”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Pit'om" - this refers to intentional sin, as it also says: "The shrewd sees evil and hides, but the simple pass on and suffer."

hebrew_text: נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״פִּתְאוֹם״, דְּמַשְׁמַע שׁוֹגֵג, וּמַשְׁמַע מֵזִיד, וּמַשְׁמַע אוֹנֶס. מֵזִיד וְאוֹנֶס – כְּדַאֲמַרַן, וּמַשְׁמַע נָמֵי שׁוֹגֵג, דִּכְתִיב: ״פֶּתִי יַאֲמִין לְכׇל דָּבָר״, וְלָא נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״פֶּתַע״!
human_translation: Let the verse write “Suddenly [ pitom ],” as indicates unwitting and indicates intentional and indicates circumstances beyond his control. intentional and circumstances beyond his control, as said and it also indicates unwitting as it is written: “The thoughtless one [ peti ] believes every word” And let the verse not write: Unexpected [ peta ].
llm_translation: It is written in the verse "pit'om," indicating unintentional, and it implies both accidental and intentional, and it implies coerced. Intentional and coerced - as we said, and it implies truly unintentional, as it is written: "The simple believes every word," and the verse does not say "peta."

hebrew_text: אִי כְּתַב קְרָא ״פִּתְאוֹם״, דְּמַשְׁמַע שׁוֹגֵג וּמַשְׁמַע מֵזִיד וּמַשְׁמַע אוֹנֶס, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כִּי מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן – בְּשׁוֹגֵג, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵי אַתּוֹרָה כּוּלַּהּ, אֲבָל אוֹנֶס וּמֵזִיד אֵימָא לָא,
human_translation: If the verse had written “suddenly,” which indicates unwitting and indicates intentional and indicates circumstances beyond his control, I would say: When brings an offering, unwittingly, as is the case for the entire Torah, but circumstances beyond his control or an intentional say not
llm_translation: If the verse writes "pit'om," it implies both unintentional and intentional, and implies also under duress. I would say: when one brings a sacrifice - if it is unintentional, it is immediately, since the entire Torah is his, but under duress and intentional, I would say no.

hebrew_text: כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״פֶּתַע״, דְּשׁוֹגֵג הוּא, לְגַלּוֹיֵי עֲלֵיהּ דְּפִתְאוֹם דְּאוֹנֶס וּמֵזִיד הוּא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי חַיֵּיב רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: the Merciful One wrote: Unexpected, which is unwitting to reveal about “suddenly” that it is circumstances beyond his control or intentional that even this the Merciful One rendered him liable
llm_translation: The Merciful One wrote "suddenly," for it is unintentional, to reveal regarding it the suddenness of compulsion and intention, for even so, the Merciful One obligates.

hebrew_text: שְׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת, מְנָלַן? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּכוּלָּן נֶאֱמַר ״וְנֶעְלַם״, כָּאן לֹא נֶאֱמַר ״וְנֶעְלַם״ – לְחַיֵּיב עַל הַשּׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד.
human_translation: the oath of testimony From where do we as the Sages taught With regard to all it is stated: “And it be hid here, it is not stated: And it be hid to render liable for an unwitting as an intentional
llm_translation: The oath of testimony, from where? For the Rabbis taught: In all of them it is stated "and it was hidden," here it is not stated "and it was hidden" - to obligate for unintentional as intentional.

hebrew_text: שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן, מְנָלַן? יָלֵיף ״תֶּחְטָא״ ״תֶּחְטָא״ מִשְּׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת.
human_translation: the oath on a deposit From where do we derives “shall sin,” “shall sin,” with regard to the oath of testimony
llm_translation: The oath of deposit, from where do we derive it? It is derived from "he shall surely sin" (Leviticus 5:15), "he shall surely sin" is derived from the oath of testimony.

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד עַל עֲבֵירוֹת הַרְבֵּה. קָתָנֵי: הַבָּא עַל הַשִּׁפְחָה בִּיאוֹת הַרְבֵּה. מְנָלַן?
human_translation: five bring one offering for several transgressions, teaches: One who engages in several intercourse with maidservant. From where do we
llm_translation: Five bring one offering for many sins. It was taught: One who comes upon a maidservant brings many offerings. Whence do we derive this?

hebrew_text: דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְכִפֶּר עָלָיו הַכֹּהֵן בְּאֵיל הָאָשָׁם עַל חַטָּאתוֹ אֲשֶׁר חָטָא״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמֵּבִיא קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד עַל עֲבֵירוֹת הַרְבֵּה. ״בְּאֵיל הָאָשָׁם וְנִסְלַח לוֹ מֵחַטָּאתוֹ אֲשֶׁר חָטָא״ – לַעֲשׂוֹת מֵזִיד כְּשׁוֹגֵג.
human_translation: as the Sages taught “And the priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the guilt offering for his sin that he has sinned” teaches that brings one offering for several transgressions. “With the ram of the guilt offering and he shall be forgiven for his sin that he has sinned.” to render an intentional as an unwitting
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And the priest shall make atonement for him with the guilt offering ram for his sin which he has committed," teaches that one brings one offering for many sins. "With the guilt offering ram, and he shall be forgiven for his sin which he has committed" - to make intentional like unintentional.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קְרָא, כִּי כְּתִיב – בְּמֵזִיד כְּתִיב! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: לַעֲשׂוֹת שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד.
human_translation: But when this verse is written, written with regard to an intentional Rather, say renders an unwitting as an intentional
llm_translation: And this is the verse, as it is written - written intentionally! Rather say: to make unintentional as intentional.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא טִירְנָאָה מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַבָּא עַל חָמֵשׁ שְׁפָחוֹת חֲרוּפוֹת בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד, מַהוּ? חַיָּיב עַל כָּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַיָּיב עַל כָּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina of Tirna’a raised a dilemma before Rabbi Yoḥanan: one engages in intercourse with five espoused maidservants [ shefaḥot ḥarufot ] in one lapse of awareness, what is liable for each and every one, or is he liable only one said to him: liable for each and every one.
llm_translation: Requested text: Rabbi Chanina asked a question from Rabbi Yochanan: If one has relations with five non-Jewish maidservants in one lapse, what is the ruling? Is he liable for each one individually, or is he only liable for one? He said to him: He is liable for each one individually.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵחֲמִשָּׁ[ה] הֶעְלֵמוֹת בְּשִׁפְחָה אַחַת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: (אֵין) שִׁפְחָה אַחַת [אֵין] גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין, חָמֵשׁ שְׁפָחוֹת גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין.
human_translation: What is different to five lapses of awareness with regard to one maidservant, said to him: one maidservant, are not separate bodies, five maidservants, separate bodies,
llm_translation: What is the difference between five concealed virgins in one maidservant? He said to him: There is no one maidservant where bodies are divided, five maidservants where bodies are divided.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּגַבֵּי שִׁפְחָה גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אָמְרַתְּ גַּבֵּי עֲרָיוֹת ״וְאִשָּׁה״ – לְחַלֵּק עַל כׇּל אִשָּׁה וְאִשָּׁה? גַּבֵּי שִׁפְחָה נָמֵי כְּתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁכַּב אֶת אִשָּׁה שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע
human_translation: And from where do we that separate bodies of maidservant? said to him: Did you not state with regard to those with whom relations are forbidden “And a woman to separate for each and every woman With regard to maidservant it is also written: “And if a man lies carnally with a woman,
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that regarding a maidservant, the bodies are considered separate? He said to him: Did you not say regarding forbidden relationships "and a woman" - to divide concerning every woman? Regarding a maidservant it is also written: "If a man lies with a woman with seminal emission."

hebrew_text: וְהִיא שִׁפְחָה״ – לְחַלֵּק עַל כׇּל שִׁפְחָה וְשִׁפְחָה.
human_translation: and she is a maidservant to separate for each and every maidservant.
llm_translation: "And she is a maidservant" - to differentiate between every maidservant and maidservant.

hebrew_text: נָזִיר שֶׁנִּטְמָא טוּמְאוֹת הַרְבֵּה. מַאן תַּנָּא?
human_translation: A nazirite who became ritually impure several ritual impurity Who taught
llm_translation: "Nazir who became impure with many impurities. Who is the Tanna?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: נְזִירוּת דְּטׇהֳרָה מִשְּׁבִיעִי הוּא דְּחָיְילָא עֲלֵיהּ. וּמַשְׁכַּחַת לַהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּטְמָא בַּשְּׁבִיעִי, וְחָזַר וְנִטְמָא בַּשְּׁבִיעִי, וְכֵיוָן דְּלֹא יָצָא שָׁעָה הָרְאוּיָה לְהַקְרִיב בָּהּ קׇרְבָּן – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: It is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who says: naziriteship of purity, takes effect from seventh And you find where became impure on the seventh and again became impure on the seventh And since for the appropriate time to sacrifice an offering, had not emerged, he is liable to bring only one offering.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: The naziriteship of purity is from the seventh day that it is incumbent upon him. And she forgets, for example, if he became impure on the seventh day, and then he became impure again on the seventh day, and since the proper time to bring a sacrifice has not passed – he is only obligated to bring one sacrifice.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי רַבִּי, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר רַבִּי: נְזִירוּת דְּטׇהֳרָה עַד שְׁמִינִי לָא חָיְילָא עֲלֵיהּ, אִי דְּנִטְמָא בַּשְּׁבִיעִי וְחָזַר וְנִטְמָא בַּשְּׁבִיעִי – כּוּלַּהּ טוּמְאָה אֲרִיכְתָּא הִיא,
human_translation: as if Rabbi since Rabbi says: naziriteship of purity does not take effect until eighth If where became impure on the seventh and became impure again on the seventh that is all long impurity,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If Rabbi, since Rabbi said: The naziriteship of purity, until the eighth day, does not have any effect upon it, whether he became impure on the seventh day and then became impure again on the seventh day - it is entirely impure, it is a prolonged impurity."

hebrew_text: אִי דְּנִטְמָא בַּשְּׁמִינִי וְחָזַר וְנִטְמָא בַּשְּׁמִינִי, כֵּיוָן דְּיָצָאת שָׁעָה שֶׁרְאוּיָיה לְהַקְרִיב קׇרְבָּן – מְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינָּה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: if where became impure on the eighth and again became impure on the eighth since the appropriate time to sacrifice an offering had emerged, he is obligated for each and every Rather, conclude from it Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: If he became impure on the eighth day and then became impure on the eighth day again, since he had a suitable time to bring a sacrifice - he is liable for each and every one! Rather, learn from it the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְקִדַּשׁ אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא״ – בְּיוֹם הֲבָאַת קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי.
human_translation: And what of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? As it is taught and he shall sanctify his head on that day” on the day of the bringing of his offerings, the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: And what is the reason for Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? For it was taught: "And he shall consecrate his head on that day" - on the day he brings his sacrifices, the words of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּיוֹם תִּגְלַחְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: on the day of his shaving,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: "On the day of his shaving."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַנֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ עַל יְדֵי אֲנָשִׁים הַרְבֵּה וּמְצוֹרָע שֶׁנִּתְנַגַּע נְגָעִים הַרְבֵּה,
human_translation: one who issues a warning to his wife with regard to several men And a leper who was afflicted several leprosy,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who is jealous of his wife with many men, and a metzora who has been afflicted with many afflictions.

hebrew_text: הֵבִיא צִיפֳּרִין וְנִתְנַגֵּעַ – לֹא עָלוּ לוֹ עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא חַטָּאתוֹ, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא אֲשָׁמוֹ.
human_translation: brought birds and was afflicted do not satisfy his obligation until he brings his sin offering. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until he brings his guilt offering.
llm_translation: He brought a bird and it became afflicted - they did not ascend for him until he brings his sin-offering. Rabbi Yehuda says: until he brings his guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַקְּנָאוֹת״ – תּוֹרָה אַחַת לְקִנּוּיִין הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: From where do we as it is written: “This is the law of jealousies, one law, for several jealousies,
llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive this? As it is written: "This is the Torah of jealousy" - one Torah for many acquisitions.

hebrew_text: מְצוֹרָע שֶׁנִּתְנַגֵּעַ נְגָעִים הַרְבֵּה כּוּ׳. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַמְּצוֹרָע״ – תּוֹרָה אַחַת לִמְצוֹרָעִים הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: a leper who was afflicted several leprosy From where do we as it is written: “This the law of the leper one law, for several lepers,
llm_translation: Afflicted person who has been afflicted with many afflictions. Whence do we derive this? As it is written: "This is the Torah of the leper" - one Torah for many lepers.

hebrew_text: הֵבִיא צִיפֳּרִין וְנִתְנַגֵּעַ – לֹא עָלוּ לוֹ עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא חַטָּאתוֹ, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא אֲשָׁמוֹ.
human_translation: brought birds and was afflicted do not satisfy his obligation until he brings his sin offering. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until he brings his guilt offering.
llm_translation: He brought a bird and it became afflicted - they did not ascend for him until he brings his sin-offering. Rabbi Yehuda says: until he brings his guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמְרַתְּ: אֵין מֵבִיא אֶלָּא קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד! חַסּוֹרֵי מִחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: הֵבִיא צִיפֳּרִין וְנִתְנַגֵּעַ – אֵין מֵבִיא אֶלָּא קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד. וּלְאַקְבּוֹעֵי בַּעֲנִיּוּת וּבַעֲשִׁירוּת – לָא מִיקְּבַע, עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא חַטָּאת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא אֲשָׁמוֹ.
human_translation: But didn’t you say he brings only one offerings is incomplete, and this it is teaching: brought birds, and was afflicted brings only one offerings. But establishing of poverty or of affluence is not established until he brings sin offering. Rabbi Yehuda says: until he brings his guilt offering.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And you say: One may only bring one offering! This is lacking from the lacking. And thus it was taught: If one brought two birds and one of them became blemished - one may only bring one offering. And for those who establish the ruling in poverty and in wealth - it is not established, until one brings a sin offering. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until he brings his guilt offering."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: מְצוֹרָע שֶׁהֵבִיא אֲשָׁמוֹ וְהֶעֱשִׁיר – הַכֹּל הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר חַטָּאת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַכֹּל הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר אָשָׁם. תַּנְיָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן, יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הַכֹּל הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר צִיפֳּרִין.
human_translation: We learned there a leper who brought his guilt offering and then became wealthy all follow sin offering; the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: It all follows guilt offering. is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: It all follows birds.
llm_translation: We learned there: A leper who brought his guilt-offering and became rich - everything follows the sin-offering, the words of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: everything follows the guilt-offering. It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: everything follows the birds.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שְׁלָשְׁתָּן מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ – ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא תַשִּׂיג יָדוֹ בְּטׇהֳרָתוֹ״, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: דָּבָר הַמְכַפְּרוֹ, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: דָּבָר הַמַּכְשִׁירוֹ, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: דָּבָר הַגּוֹרֵם לוֹ טׇהֳרָה, וּמַאי נִינְהוּ? צִיפֳּרִין.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: three of them interpreted the same verse whose means do not suffice for that which pertains to his purification” Rabbi Shimon holds matter that atones for his Rabbi Yehuda holds matter that renders him fit Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says matter that causes him purity. And what are these? birds.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Three Scriptures interpreted one verse - "that his hand shall not reach his purification." Rabbi Shimon holds: something that atones for him. Rabbi Yehudah holds: something that renders him fit. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: something that causes him purification. And what are they? Birds.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁיָּלְדָה וְלָדוֹת הַרְבֵּה, וְהִפִּילָה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים נְקֵבָה, חָזְרָה וְהִפִּילָה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים נְקֵבָה,
human_translation: A woman who gave birth to several offspring. And she miscarried a female within eighty and then again and miscarried female within eighty
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: A woman who gave birth and bore many children, and she miscarried within eighty days, a female, and then miscarried within eighty days, a female.

hebrew_text: וְהַמַּפֶּלֶת תְּאוֹמִים,
human_translation: And who miscarries multiple
llm_translation: And the mappelet, twins,

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מְבִיאָה עַל הָרִאשׁוֹן וְאֵינָהּ מְבִיאָה עַל הַשֵּׁנִי. מְבִיאָה עַל הַשְּׁלִישִׁי וְאֵינָהּ מְבִיאָה עַל הָרְבִיעִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: she brings for the first does not bring for the second She brings for the third and does not bring for the fourth
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One brings it on the first day and does not bring it on the second. One brings it on the third and does not bring it on the fourth.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָלַן? דְּתָנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַיּוֹלֶדֶת לַזָּכָר וְלַנְּקֵבָה״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמְּבִיאָה קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד עַל וְלָדוֹת הַרְבֵּה. יָכוֹל אַף עַל הַלֵּידָה וְעַל הַזִּיבָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זֹאת״.
human_translation: From where do we As the tanna taught before Rav Sheshet “This is the law for the woman who bears a child, whether a male or a female” This teaches that she brings one offering for several offspring. might even for a birth and for discharge [ ziva ]. the verse states: “This,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive this? For a Tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: "This is the Torah of the one who gives birth to a male or female" - this teaches that she brings one offering for multiple births. Can we also include birth and menstruation? The verse teaches: "This."

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי: יָכוֹל עַל הַלֵּידָה וְעַל הַזִּיבָה אֵינָהּ מְבִיאָה אֶלָּא קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, אָכְלָה דָּם וְיָלְדָה, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאֵין מְבִיאָה אֶלָּא קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד?
human_translation: teaches: might for a birth and for ziva , she should bring only one offering. If that is so, consumed blood and gave birth, also that she should bring only one offering?
llm_translation: It was taught: Can she bring only one offering for childbirth and for zivah? Rather, from now on, if she ate the blood and gave birth, is it not also true that she brings only one offering?

hebrew_text: אֵימָא הָכִי: יָכוֹל עַל הַלֵּידָה שֶׁלִּפְנֵי מְלֹאת וְעַל הַלֵּידָה שֶׁלְּאַחַר מְלֹאת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זֹאת״.
human_translation: say this might for a birth that before the completion and for a birth that after the completion the verse states: “This,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima hachi: yakhol al ha'leidah shel lifnei melot ve'al ha'leidah shel le'achar melot? Talmud lomar: 'zot'." English translation: "Say thus: Can one bring a sacrifice for the birth before the completion of the days of purification and for the birth after the completion of the days of purification? The Talmud teaches: 'This.'"

hebrew_text: הִפִּילָה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים כּוּ׳. כְּשֶׁתִּמְּצֵי לוֹמַר לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה – וָלָד רִאשׁוֹן גּוֹרֵם וּמִוָּלָד רִאשׁוֹן מוֹנָה. לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים – וָלָד שֵׁנִי גּוֹרֵם וּמִוָּלָד שֵׁנִי מוֹנָה.
human_translation: miscarried within eighty- you will find say according to Rabbi Yehuda, first fetus causes and she counts from first fetus; according to Rabbis, second fetus causes and she counts from of second fetus.
llm_translation: She gave birth within eighty days. When you want to say according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda - the firstborn causes and the firstborn is counted. According to the words of the Sages - the secondborn causes and the secondborn is counted.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁתִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר? פְּשִׁיטָא, הָכִי אִיתָא! מַפֶּלֶת תְּאוֹמִים אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא בְּמַפֶּלֶת תְּאוֹמִים מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְרַבָּנַן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: you will say obvious, it is was necessary for miscarries multiple enter your mind to say in miscarries multiple Rabbi Yehuda concedes to the Rabbis teaches us
llm_translation: When do you find an opportunity to say this? Obviously, it is so! This is what is stated: The miscarriage of twins requires it, for it is evident in your mind that Rabbi Yehuda concedes to the Rabbis regarding the miscarriage of twins, as it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ:
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before
llm_translation: He asked them:

hebrew_text: בְּטוּמְאָה מָה לִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה? מִי אָמְרִינַן: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וָלָד שֵׁנִי כְּמַאן דְּלֵיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן קׇרְבָּן, כֵּיוָן דְּלֹא יָצְאָה שָׁעָה שֶׁרְאוּיָה לְהַקְרִיב בָּהּ קׇרְבָּן, הוֹאִיל וְכֵן – וָלָד שֵׁנִי כְּמַאן דְּלֵיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה וְטׇהֳרָה, אֵימָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ כְּמַאן דְּאִיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי, וּמַפְסְקָא טוּמְאָה דְּשֵׁנִי, וּמְמַלֵּא יוֹמֵי טׇהֳרָה דְּרִאשׁוֹן וַהֲדַר (מוֹנֶה) [מָנֵי לֵיהּ] יוֹמֵי,
human_translation: Concerning ritual impurity, what does Rabbi Yehuda say? Do we say Rabbi Yehuda says second offspring is as though it does not only with regard to the matter of an offering? since the time which possible to sacrifice an offering had not emerged, since that is so, second offspring is as though it does not But concerning the matter of ritual impurity and purity, say he holds as something that does and impurity by second interrupt and she completes the days of purity for first and then counts the days of purity by the second
llm_translation: In impurity, what is it to me, said Rabbi Yehuda? Who said: Until here did Rabbi Yehuda say, and a second offspring, whose blood is not like it, except for the matter of offering. Since the hour suitable for offering the offering has not passed, it is considered as if the second offspring's blood is like it. But regarding the matter of impurity and purity, perhaps he considers it as if its blood is like it, and the final ruling is impurity of the second, and it fills the days of purity of the first and then counts the days.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה חוּמְרָא הוּא דְּאִית לֵיהּ, אֲבָל הָכָא – קוּלָּא הוּא, וְקוּלָּא לֵית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps, according to Rabbi Yehuda, there is a stringency But here, this is a leniency, and does not hold a leniency.
llm_translation: Perhaps according to Rabbi Yehuda it is a stringent matter that he has, but here - it is a lenient matter, and a lenient matter he does not have.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא מִסּוּרָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: יוֹלֶדֶת, שׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עָלֶיהָ בְּיוֹם אַרְבָּעִים לַזָּכָר וּבְיוֹם שְׁמוֹנִים לַנְּקֵבָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna from Sura said: Come hear a woman after childbirth, one slaughters and sprinkles on her account on fortieth day to a male or on eightieth day to a female.
llm_translation: Rav Huna from Sura said: Come and hear: A woman who gives birth, they slaughter and sprinkle upon her on the fortieth day for a male and on the eightieth day for a female.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן? טְמֵאָה הִיא! וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: וָלָד שֵׁנִי כְּמַאן דְּלֵיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Is that so? she is impure And Rav Ḥisda said whose is this It is Rabbi Yehuda, who says second offspring is deemed as though it does not
llm_translation: Until here? It is impure! And Rav Ḥisdah said: Is this a count? It is Rabbi Yehudah, as he said: "And the second child shall be like the one who does not have blood."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּטוּמְאָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וָלָד שֵׁנִי כְּמַאן דְּאִיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי, הֵיכִי שָׁחֲטִינַן עֲלַהּ בְּיוֹם אַרְבָּעִים? לְאוּרְתָּא נָמֵי לָא מָצְיָא אָכְלָה! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינָּה: לְטׇהֳרָה וּלְטוּמְאָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וָלָד שֵׁנִי כְּמַאן דְּלֵיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי!
human_translation: And if you say concerning impurity, Rabbi Yehuda holds second offspring is as though it is how may one slaughter on her account on the fortieth day? in the evening she also may not eat Rather, not conclude from concerning ritual purity and impurity, Rabbi Yehuda holds second offspring is as it does not
llm_translation: And if you say regarding impurity, it is reasonable according to Rabbi Yehuda that a second-born is like one who has blood, how do we slaughter it on the fortieth day? It cannot be eaten the following day! Rather, is it not logical to say: regarding purity and impurity, it is reasonable according to Rabbi Yehuda that a second-born is not like one who has blood!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: לְטוּמְאָה וּלְטׇהֳרָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּוָלָד שֵׁנִי כְּמַאן דְּאִיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי, וְכִי תַנְיָא הַהִיא – בְּפֶסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Actually, I say to you: concerning impurity and purity, Rabbi Yehuda holds that second offspring is considered as something that does and when that is taught, of a Paschal offering that is brought in impurity.
llm_translation: Forever say to you: for impurity and purity it is reasonable for Rabbi Yehuda that he holds like the one who holds that blood, and if it is taught that - in the Passover that comes in impurity.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָכְלָה? וְהָתְנַן: פֶּסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה, לֹא יֹאכְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ זָבִים וְזָבוֹת, נִדּוֹת וְיוֹלְדוֹת!
human_translation: And does she partake But didn’t we learn a Paschal offering brought in impurity, men who experience a gonorrhea-like discharge [ zavim ], women who experience a discharge of uterine blood after their menstrual periods [ zavot ], menstruating women, and women after childbirth may not partake of it?
llm_translation: "And who ate? And we learned in a Mishnah: The Passover sacrifice that was brought in a state of impurity, those who are afflicted with a discharge, both men and women, menstruating women, and women who have given birth, may not eat from it!"

hebrew_text: הָהִיא, לָא אָכְלָן כִּי לָא טְבִילָן. כִּי תַּנְיָא הַהִיא דְּשׁוֹחֲטִין וְזוֹרְקִין עָלֶיהָ, דְּהָא טָבְלָה. אִי הָכִי, מִשְּׁמִינִי דִּילַיהּ הוּא דְּחַזְיָא!
human_translation: that they do not partake because they did not immerse when that is taught, that one slaughters and sprinkles on her account, that she immersed If that is so, it is from eighth his that is fit
llm_translation: That one, did not eat because they were not immersed. For it was taught: that one who slaughters and sprinkles on it, for it is immersed. If so, it is from the fat of its tail that it sees!

hebrew_text: מִשְּׁמִינִי לָא חַזְיָא, קָסָבַר: טְבוּל יוֹם דְּזָב – כְּזָב דָּמֵי.
human_translation: is not fit from eighth day, maintains a zav who immersed that day is considered of a zav
llm_translation: From the eighth day he does not see, he holds: a tevul yom is like a zab - regarding the blood it is considered like a zab.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בְּיוֹם אַרְבָּעִים נָמֵי לָא חַזְיָא! לָאיֵי, בְּיוֹם אַרְבָּעִים חַזְיָא, קָסָבַר: מְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים דְּזָב – לָאו כְּזָב דָּמֵי.
human_translation: If that is so, on fortieth day she is also not fit not so; on fortieth day she is fit holds a zav lacking atonement, is not considered of a zav .
llm_translation: Thus, on the fortieth day, he did not see! He comes and on the fortieth day, he sees, for he holds: the lack of atonement of Zav - it is not like the blood of a liar.

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר מְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים דְּזָב כְּזָב דָּמֵי, הָא מַתְנִייתָא הֵיכִי מְתָרֵץ לַהּ? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: רָבָא מְתָרֵץ לַהּ בְּיוֹם אַרְבָּעִים לִיצִירַת זָכָר וּבְיוֹם שְׁמוֹנִים לִיצִירַת נְקֵבָה, וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לְזָכָר אַרְבָּעִים וְאֶחָד, לִנְקֵבָה שְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: But according to Rava, who says a zav who lacking atonement is considered of a zav , how does he resolve this baraita ? Rav Ashi said Rava resolves it fortieth day after the conception of a male, or eightieth day after the conception of a female. And it is Rabbi Yishmael, who says forty-one for a male eighty-one for a female
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for Rava, who said that the lack of atonements of a menstruating woman is like the blood of a false oath, how does the Mishnah resolve it? Rav Ashei said: Rava resolves it as follows - on the fortieth day for the formation of a male and on the eightieth day for the formation of a female. And Rabbi Yishmael is the one who said: for a male, forty-one days, for a female, eighty-one days.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף, תִּיפּוֹק לִי דִּטְמֵאָה הִיא מִשּׁוּם נִדָּה! – בְּלֵידָה יַבִּישְׁתָּא. אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אִי אֶפְשָׁר לִפְתִיחַת הַקֶּבֶר בְּלֹא דָּם, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאֶפְשָׁר לִפְתִיחַת הַקֶּבֶר בְּלֹא דָּם.
human_translation: ultimately, conclude that she is impure because a menstruating woman. with regard to a dry birth, If that is so, what of stating it? lest you say impossible for the womb to open without blood teaches us that it is possible for the womb to open without blood
llm_translation: At the end, it will emerge for me that it is due to menstruation! - In childbirth, a drying up. If so, what is there to say? What might you say: If it is impossible to open the grave without blood, it is heard for us that it is possible to open the grave without blood.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמַעְיָה, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״שִׁשִּׁים״, יָכוֹל בֵּין רְצוּפִין בֵּין מְפוּזָּרִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יוֹם״, מָה יוֹם רָצוּף – אַף שִׁשִּׁים כּוּלָּן רְצוּפִין. מַנִּי? אִלֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, מִי אִית [לְהוּ] לְרַבָּנַן מְפוּזָּרִין?
human_translation: Rabbi Shemaya said: Come hear sixty might whether they are continuous or dispersed. the verse states: days just as a day is a continuous so too all sixty are continuous. whose If we say the Rabbis, are the Rabbis of dispersed
llm_translation: Rabbi Shemaiah said, come and hear: "Sixty," could it be whether they are arranged or scattered? The Talmud teaches: "day," just as a continuous day – so too all sixty are arranged. Who is the Tanna? If you wish, say it is the Rabbis, do the Rabbis have any that are scattered?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וּמִדְּקָא יָהֵיב לַהּ שִׁשִּׁים רְצוּפִים בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, שְׁמַע מִינָּה חוּמְרָא אִית לֵיהּ, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה קוּלָּא לֵית לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, is it not Rabbi Yehuda? And from he prescribes for her sixty continuous days together, conclude from it Rabbi Yehuda maintains a stringency a leniency he does not maintain
llm_translation: Rather, it is not according to Rabbi Yehuda, and since he gave her sixty chains in the presence of Hadadei, it is evident that there is a stringency with him, for Rabbi Yehuda does not have leniency!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם רַבָּנַן הִיא. וְהָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן – לְיוֹלֶדֶת זָכָר מִתּוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים שֶׁל נְקֵבָה.
human_translation: No, actually, is the Rabbis. And what are we dealing with here? with a woman who gives birth to a male within eighty- of a female,
llm_translation: Not, always, sages, it is. And here, with what, we are dealing - for a female who gives birth to a male from within the eighty days of a female.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף, שָׁלְמִין יוֹמֵי דְּקַדְמָאָה, וְעַד כָּאן דְּבָתְרָאָה לָא שָׁלְמִין, דְּהָא רַבָּנַן לְוָלָד שֵׁנִי מָנוּ! אֶלָּא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ לְרַבָּנַן – בְּיוֹלֶדֶת תְּאוֹמִים, נְקֵבָה קַדְמָיְיתָא וְזָכָר בָּתְרָאָה, וּכְגוֹן דִּילֵידְתֵּיהּ לְזָכָר בָּתְרָאָה בְּעֶשְׂרִים לְיוֹמֵי טׇהֳרָה, דְּבָעֲיָא מִינְקָט לֵיהּ שִׁבְעָה יוֹמֵי טוּמְאָה דְּלֵידָה (תאומים נקבה),
human_translation: ultimately, the days of the first are completed while the days of the latter are not completed, as the Rabbis count the days following the second birth, Rather, you find according to the Rabbis where a woman gives birth to twins, first a female and then a male, and for example, she gives birth to the latter male, on twentieth of days purity as she is required to observe for him seven days of impurity for birth.
llm_translation: At the end, the days of the first child are complete, and until here, the days of the latter child are not complete, for the Rabbis consider them as two separate entities! Rather, she forgets about them – in the case of giving birth to twins, the female child is considered the firstborn and the male child the latter, such as when she gives birth to a male child twenty days after her purification, for he requires seven days of impurity due to the birth of twins (female twins).

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: יָכוֹל הֵיכָא דְּיָלְדָה תְּאוֹמִים, נְקֵבָה מֵעִיקָּרָא וְזָכָר לְבַסּוֹף, תַּפְסֵיק טוּמְאָה דְּלֵידָה בְּמִיצְעֵי, וְנִימְנֵי לַהּ שִׁשָּׁה וְשִׁשִּׁים מְפוּזָּרִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יוֹם״, מָה יוֹם כּוּלּוֹ רָצוּף – אַף שִׁשִּׁים כּוּלָּם רְצוּפִין.
human_translation: And this is saying: might where she gave birth to twins, a female initially and a male afterward, impurity of birth interrupts in the middle, and she counts sixty-six dispersed days. the verse states: days just as a day is an entirely continuous so too all sixty are continuous.
llm_translation: And thus he said: Can it be that in a case where a woman gives birth to twins, if the firstborn is female and the secondborn is male, the impurity of childbirth will be interrupted between them, and she will count for herself sixty-six scattered days? The teaching states: "day," just as an entire day is continuous - so too all sixty are continuous.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״שְׁלֹשִׁים״ – יָכוֹל בֵּין רְצוּפִין בֵּין מְפוּזָּרִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יוֹם״, מָה יוֹם כּוּלּוֹ רָצוּף – אַף שְׁלֹשִׁים רְצוּפִין. מַנִּי הָא? אִלֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, וּמִי אִית לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear thirty might whether they are continuous or dispersed. the verse states: days just as a day is an entirely continuous so too thirty are continuous. whose If we say the Rabbis, are the Rabbis of
llm_translation: Abaye said, come and hear: "Thirty" - can it be whether they are arranged or scattered? The Talmud teaches: "day," just as an entire day is continuous - so too thirty are continuous. Who is the Tanna? If you wish, say it is the Rabbis, and do the Rabbis have anyone to support their opinion?

hebrew_text: מְפוּזָּרִין? הָא אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: לְוָלָד שֵׁנִי מָנְיָא! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: חוּמְרָא אִית לֵיהּ, קוּלָּא לֵית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: dispersed the Rabbis say she counts of second fetus. Rather, is it not Rabbi Yehuda? And conclude from it is of a stringency a leniency he is not of
llm_translation: Dispersed? The Rabbis said: For a second-born, count! Rather, it is not according to Rabbi Yehuda, and learn from it: There is a stringency, there is no leniency.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְשֵׁשֶׁת יָמִים״ – יָכוֹל בֵּין רְצוּפִין וּבֵין מְפוּזָּרִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שִׁשִּׁים״, מָה שִׁשִּׁים כּוּלָּן רְצוּפִין – אַף שִׁשָּׁה כּוּלָּן רְצוּפִין. מַנִּי? אִלֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, מִי אִית לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן מְפוּזָּרִין? הָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: לְוָלָד שֵׁנִי מָנְיָא!
human_translation: And further, Rav Ashi said: Come hear and six days” might whether they are continuous or dispersed, the verse states: “Sixty” just as the sixty days are all continuous, so too, the six days are all continuous. Whose If we say the Rabbis, are the Rabbis dispersed Didn’t the Rabbis say she counts for second offspring?
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rav Ashe said, come and hear: "And six days" - could it be between arranged and scattered? The Talmud teaches: "Sixty," just as all sixty are arranged - so too, all six are arranged. Is it a question? Rather say, the Rabbis, do the Rabbis have any teaching that is scattered? The Rabbis said: for a second-born, count!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: חוּמְרָא אִית לֵיהּ, קוּלָּא לֵית לֵיהּ? שְׁמַע מִינָּה.
human_translation: Rather, is it not Rabbi Yehuda? And conclude from it Rabbi Yehuda is of a stringency a leniency he is not of conclude from it
llm_translation: Rather, it is not according to Rabbi Yehuda, and learn from it: Does it have a stringency but not a leniency? Learn from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד: עַל שְׁמִיעַת קוֹל, וְעַל בִּטּוּי שְׂפָתָיִם, וְעַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו, וְהַיּוֹלֶדֶת, וְהַמְצוֹרָע.
human_translation: These brings a sliding-scale offering: For hearing the voice and for utterance of the lips, and for defiling of Temple, or its sacrificial and a woman after childbirth; and a leper
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the ones who bring a burnt offering and descend: on the basis of hearing a voice, and on the basis of the movement of the lips, and on account of impurity of the sanctuary and its holy things, and the woman who has given birth, and the leper.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יֵשׁ מֵבִיא בְּדַלּוּת וַעֲשִׁירוּת, וְיֵשׁ מֵבִיא בְּדַלּוּת וְיֵשׁ מֵבִיא בְּדַלֵּי דַלּוּת:
human_translation: The Sages taught There is one brings of poverty or wealth; and there is one brings of poverty, of extreme poverty.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Some bring with humility and wealth, and some bring with humility, and some bring with the humility of humility.

hebrew_text: יוֹלֶדֶת – מְבִיאָה בְּדַלּוּת וַעֲשִׁירוּת. מְצוֹרָע – מֵבִיא בְּדַלּוּת. שְׁמִיעַת הַקּוֹל וּבִטּוּי שְׂפָתָיִם וְטוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו – מְבִיאִין בְּדַלּוּת וְדַלֵּי דַלּוּת.
human_translation: A woman after childbirth brings in poverty, or wealth, A leper brings in poverty the hearing of the voice, or the utterance of the lips, defiling of Temple or its sacrificial brings or in poverty, or in extreme poverty,
llm_translation: Yoledet - brings in with poverty and wealth. Metzora - brings in with poverty. Hearing the voice and the turning of the lips, and impurity of the sanctuary and its holiness - they bring in with poverty and the poorest of the poor.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: יֵשׁ מֵבִיא אֶחָד תַּחַת אֶחָד, יֵשׁ מֵבִיא שְׁנַיִם תַּחַת שְׁנַיִם, יֵשׁ מֵבִיא שְׁנַיִם תַּחַת אֶחָד, יֵשׁ מֵבִיא אֶחָד תַּחַת שְׁנַיִם, מִכָּאן אַתָּה לָמֵד לַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה בִּפְרוּטָה.
human_translation: is taught another there is brings one instead of one; there is brings two instead of two there is brings two instead of one there is brings one instead of two From here you may derive of one-tenth of an ephah as one peruta .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: There is one who brings one in place of one, there is one who brings two in place of two, there is one who brings two in place of one, there is one who brings one in place of two. From here you learn about the tenth of the ephah in detail.

hebrew_text: יוֹלֶדֶת מְבִיאָה אַחַת תַּחַת אַחַת – פְּרִידָה אַחַת וָעוֹף תַּחַת כֶּבֶשׂ, מְצוֹרָע – שְׁתֵּי פְרִידִין תַּחַת שְׁנֵי כְבָשִׂים, שְׁמִיעַת הַקּוֹל וּבִטּוּי שְׂפָתָיִם וְטוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו – מְבִיאִין שְׁתֵּי פְרִידִין תַּחַת כִּבְשָׂה אַחַת, וּמְבִיאִין בְּדַלֵּי דַלּוּת עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה תַּחַת שְׁתֵּי פְרִידִין.
human_translation: A woman after childbirth brings one instead of one One young bird, and bird instead of lamb. A leper two young birds instead of two lambs. the hearing of the voice and the utterance of the lips and the defiling of Temple or its sacrificial brings two young birds instead of one female lamb, and in of extreme poverty brings one one-tenth of an ephah instead of two young birds.
llm_translation: A woman who gives birth brings one lamb as a burnt offering and one bird as a sin offering. A leper brings two birds for his purification, one for a burnt offering and one for a sin offering. Regarding the hearing of the voice, the turning of the lips, the impurity of the sanctuary and its holy items, they bring two birds for a burnt offering instead of one lamb. And they bring a tenth of an ephah of fine flour for the sin offering instead of the two birds.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי: מִכָּאן אַתָּה לָמֵד לַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה שֶׁהִיא בִּפְרוּטָה. מְנָלַן? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָאוֹמֵר ״הֲרֵי עָלַי בְּסֶלַע לַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ – מֵבִיא כֶּבֶשׂ, שֶׁאֵין דָּבָר קָרֵב בְּסֶלַע אֶלָּא כֶּבֶשׂ.
human_translation: teaches: From here you may derive of one-tenth of an ephah as one peruta . From where do we as the Sages taught one who says: It upon me to one sela to the altar, brings a lamb, as there is nothing that is sacrificed upon the altar one sela other than a lamb.
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught: From here you learn about the tenth of an ephah, which is in detail. Where do we derive this from? For the Rabbis taught: One who says, 'I hereby take upon myself to bring an offering on the altar,' must bring a sheep, for nothing is brought on the altar except a sheep."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? מִדְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״אֵיל אָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים״, מִכְּלָל דְּכֶבֶשׂ בֶּן שָׁנָה בְּסֶלַע, מִדִּכְתִיב ״כֶּבֶשׂ בֶּן שְׁנָתוֹ״. וּתְנַן: עָמְדוּ קִינִּין בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם בְּרִבְעָתַיִם.
human_translation: From where from that the Merciful One states ram a guilt offering silver shekels” by inference that a lamb, in its year is one sela . as it is written: “A lamb of the first year” And we learned nests, stood that day at one-quarter
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From what? Since the Merciful One said, "a ram as a guilt offering in silver shekels," does this not include a one-year-old lamb on a rock, as it is written, "a lamb in its first year"? And we learned: The purchase contracts were established with him on the day of the fourteenth. English translation: From what? Since the Merciful One said, "a ram as a guilt offering in silver shekels," does this not include a one-year-old lamb on a rock, as it is written, "a lamb in its first year"? And we learned: The purchase contracts were established with him on the day of the fourteenth.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּחָס רַחֲמָנָא עֲלֵיהּ דְּדַלּוּת לְמִיהְוֵי חַד מִשֵּׁית עֲשַׂר בַּעֲשִׁירוּת, חָס רַחֲמָנָא עֲלֵיהּ דְּדַלֵּי דַּלּוּת לְמִיהְוֵי חַד מִשֵּׁית עֲשַׂר בְּדַלּוּת.
human_translation: And from that the Merciful One has mercy upon in poverty, that is one-sixteenth in wealth, the Merciful One takes pity upon in extreme poverty, which is one-sixteenth in poverty.
llm_translation: And from the compassion of the Merciful One upon it, that wealth should be one-sixth in richness, the Merciful One has compassion upon it, that the rich should be one-sixth in poverty.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, דַּלּוּת כְּמָה הָוְיָא – רִיבְעָא, וּכְמָה פְּרִיטֵי בְּרִיבְעָא – אַרְבָּעִים וּתְמָנְיָא פְּרִיטֵי, חַד מִשֵּׁית עֲשַׂר כְּמָה הָוֵי דְּדַלּוּת – תְּלָתָא פְּרִיטֵי.
human_translation: If so, how much is poverty one-quarter And how many perutot in one-quarter Forty-eight perutot . how many are one-sixteenth of poverty? Three perutot .
llm_translation: If so, how much is a hava'ya - a quarter, and how many peritei in a hava'ya - forty-eight peritei, one-sixth of sixteen, how much is daluta - three peritei.

hebrew_text: דְּקָתָנֵי: מִכָּאן אַתָּה לָמֵד לַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה בִּפְרוּטָה, אַמַּאי פְּרוּטָה? הָאָמְרַתְּ: עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה דַּלֵּי דַּלּוּת הוּא, וְאָמְרַתְּ חַד מִשֵּׁית סְרֵי דְּדַלּוּת הוּא, דְּחָשְׁבִינַן דִּתְלָתָא פְּרִיטֵי הָוַיִין!
human_translation: But that teaches: From here you may derive of one-tenth of an ephah as one peruta , why one peruta , Didn’t you say one-tenth of an ephah is extreme poverty, and you said one-sixteenth of poverty, which we calculated to be three perutot ?
llm_translation: The text states: From here you learn about the tenth of the ephah in detail. Why in detail? Because you said: The tenth of the ephah is a poor man's measure, and you also said: One-sixth is a measure of poverty, for we consider three meals to be the amount!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא מִיּוֹלֶדֶת יָלֵיף, דְּמַתְיָא פְּרִידָה אַחַת תַּחַת כֶּבֶשׂ, דְּהָוֵי חַד מִתְּלָתִין וּתְרֵין דְּכֶבֶשׂ. וְעַד כָּאן, דַּלֵּי דַּלּוּת כְּמָה הָוֵי – חַד מִשֵּׁית עֲשַׂר בְּדַלּוּת, דְּמֵהֵיכָא יָלֵיף – מִכֶּבֶשׂ וְאַיִל. עַד כָּאן, פְּרוּטָה וּפַלְגָא הָוֵי!
human_translation: The tanna derives from a woman after childbirth, who brings one bird instead of a lamb, as is one thirty-second of a lamb. But until now, how much extreme poverty One-sixteenth in poverty. from where derived? from the lamb and ram, until now, is one and one-half perutot ,
llm_translation: We learned: from a female sheep one may derive, for it is equivalent to one sheep. For it is one of thirty and two sheep. And until here, the lowest of the low, how many are there? - one of sixteen in the lowest, for what is derived from a sheep and a ram. Until here, it is a detail and a half!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כּוּלַּהּ מִילְּתָא מִיּוֹלֶדֶת יָלֵיף, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: מִדְּחָס רַחֲמָנָא עֲלֵיהּ דְּדַלּוּת לְמִיהְוֵי חַד מִתְּלָתִין וּתְרֵין בַּעֲשִׁירוּת, וּמַאי הִיא – יוֹלֶדֶת, הָכִי חָס רַחֲמָנָא עֲלֵיהּ דְּדַלֵּי דַּלּוּת לְמִיהְוֵי חַד מִן תְּלָתִין וּתְרֵין בְּדַלּוּת.
human_translation: Rava said The entire matter is derived from a woman after childbirth, and this is saying: from the Merciful One has mercy upon in poverty, in which is one thirty-second in wealth. And what is this a woman after childbirth. So too, the Merciful One has mercy upon in extreme poverty, in that is one thirty-second poverty.
llm_translation: Rava said: The entire matter is inferred from the newborn, and thus he said: Because the Merciful One has compassion on her, that the poor should not be less than the rich, and what is it? - newborn, thus the Merciful One has compassion on her, that the poor should not be less than thirty-two and thirty-two in poverty.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, נְכֵי רִיבְעָא דִּפְרוּטָה הָוֵי! הָכִי נָמֵי, אֶלָּא דְּלָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְאֵיתוֹיֵי פָּחוֹת מִפְּרוּטָה לַמָּקוֹם.
human_translation: If so, be one peruta minus one-quarter, Indeed but not proper conduct to bring less than one peruta before God.
llm_translation: So it is, a wound of a quarter kab is considered! So too, but not that it is not the way of the land to find less than a quarter kab to the place.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָה בֵּין שִׁפְחָה לְבֵין כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת? שֶׁלֹּא שָׁוְותָה לָהֶן לֹא בָּעוֹנֶשׁ וְלֹא בַּקׇּרְבָּן. שֶׁכׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת בְּחַטָּאת, וְשִׁפְחָה בְּאָשָׁם. כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת בִּנְקֵבָה, וְשִׁפְחָה בְּזָכָר.
human_translation: What are between maidservant and all those with whom relations are forbidden? that is not equal to their neither with regard to punishment nor with regard to an offering, as any of those with whom relations are forbidden to a sin offering, and maidservant to a guilt offering. any of those with whom relations are forbidden a female and maidservant a male
