llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: What is the difference between a maidservant and all other forbidden relationships? That they are not equal to them neither in punishment nor in offering. For all other forbidden relationships, the offering is a sin offering, but for a maidservant, it is a guilt offering. All other forbidden relationships are in the female, but a maidservant is in the male.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת אֶחָד הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד הָאִשָּׁה שָׁוִין בַּמַּכּוֹת וּבַקׇּרְבָּן, וּבַשִּׁפְחָה לֹא הִשְׁוָה לֹא הָאִישׁ לָאִשָּׁה בַּמַּכּוֹת, וְלֹא הִשְׁוָה אִשָּׁה לָאִישׁ בַּקׇּרְבָּן.
human_translation: any of those with whom relations are forbidden, both the man and the woman are equal with regard to lashes and with regard to an offering And in a maidservant, did not equate the man with the woman with regard to lashes, and did not equate the woman with the man with regard to an offering,
llm_translation: All the nakednesses one the man and one the woman equal in the blows and in the offering, and in the maidservant not equal neither the man to the woman in the blows, and not equal the woman to the man in the offering.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת עָשָׂה בָּהֶן אֶת הַמְעָרֶה כְּגוֹמֵר, וְחַיָּיב עַל כׇּל בִּיאָה וּבִיאָה.
human_translation: With regard to any of those with whom relations are forbidden, rendered one who engages in the initial stage like completes and one is liable for each and every intercourse
llm_translation: All the forbidden sexual relationships he engaged in, he is liable for each and every act of intercourse.

hebrew_text: (זוֹ חוֹמֶר) הֶחְמִיר בְּשִׁפְחָה,
human_translation: This is a stringency imposed with regard to the maidservant
llm_translation: This is the translation: "This is the stringency, he was stringent with a maidservant,"

hebrew_text: שֶׁעָשָׂה בָּהּ אֶת הַמֵּזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג.
human_translation: That established her the intentionally is like the unwittingly,
llm_translation: That he did in it the intentional as the unintentional.

hebrew_text: אֵיזוֹ שִׁפְחָה? כֹּל שֶׁחֶצְיָהּ שִׁפְחָה וְחֶצְיָהּ בַּת חוֹרִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהׇפְדֵּה לֹא נִפְדָּתָה״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: זוֹ הִיא שִׁפְחָה וַדָּאִית. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת מְפוֹרָשׁוֹת, וְשִׁיּוּר אֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא חֶצְיָהּ שִׁפְחָה וְחֶצְיָהּ בַּת חוֹרִין.
human_translation: Who is maidservant any who is half-maidservant half-free woman, as it is stated: “And she was redeemed and not redeemed” the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yishmael says: maidservant certain, Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: All those with whom relations are forbidden enumerated and we have no exception other than one who is half-maidservant half-free woman.
llm_translation: Which is a maidservant? Any that half of her is a maidservant and half of her is a free woman, as it is stated: "And she was not redeemed," the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yishmael says: This is a definite maidservant. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: All his nakedness is explicit, and we have no remnant except half of her is a maidservant and half of her is a free woman.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָלַן דְּהִיא לָקְיָ[א] וְהוּא לָא לָקֵי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בִּקּוֹרֶת תִּהְיֶה״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִיא לוֹקָה. יָכוֹל שְׁנֵיהֶן לוֹקִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תִּהְיֶה״ – הִיא לוֹקֶה וְהוּא אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: From where do we that she is flogged and he is not flogged? As the Sages taught man…there shall be an inspection [ bikkoret tihye ]” teaches that she is flogged. might both are flogged, the verse states: “There shall be [ tihye ],” she is flogged and he is not flogged.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive that she is liable and he is not liable? For the Rabbis taught: "She shall be liable" - this teaches that she is liable. Could it be that both of them are liable? The verse teaches: "She shall be liable" - she is liable and he is not liable.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן דְּהָדֵין ״בִּקּוֹרֶת״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּמַלְקוּת הוּא? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: ״תְּהֵא בֵּקָרָאֵי״, כִּדְתַנְיָא: גְּדוֹל הַדַּיָּינִין מַקְרִא, שֵׁנִי מוֹנֶה, שְׁלִישִׁי אוֹמֵר: הַכֵּהוּ. רַב אָשֵׁי אוֹמַר: ״בְּבִיקּוּר תִּהְיֶה״, כְּדִתְנַן: אֵין אוֹמְדִין אוֹתוֹ אֶלָּא מַכּוֹת הָרְאוּיוֹת לְהִשְׁתַּלֵּשׁ.
human_translation: And from where that this inspection [ bikkoret ] is a term for flogging? Rabbi Yitzḥak said: she shall be to the reciting of [ bikra’ei ] as it is taught the eldest of the judges recites second- counts third says Strike him. Rav Ashi says she shall be to an assessment [ bikkur ], as we learned One assesses only by lashes fit to be three.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that "bikoret" (inspection) is considered a form of malqut (punishment)? Rabbi Yitzhak said: "Let it be in the verses," as it was taught: The first judge examines, the second counts, the third says: Strike him. Rav Ashi says: "It shall be with inspection," as we learned: One may only administer fitting blows.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה לוֹקָה – הָאִישׁ מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן, אֵין הָאִשָּׁה לוֹקָה – אֵין הָאִישׁ מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן. מְנָלַן? אָמַר רָבָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאִישׁ כִּי יִשְׁכַּב אֶת אִשָּׁה שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע וְהִיא שִׁפְחָה נֶחֱרֶפֶת לְאִישׁ וְהׇפְדֵּה לֹא נִפְדָּתָה אוֹ חוּפְשָׁה לֹא נִתַּן לָהּ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught At the time that, the woman is flogged, the man brings an offering. the woman is not flogged, the man does not bring an offering. From where do we Rava said as it is written: “And if a man lies carnally with a woman, and she is a maidservant designated for a man, and not at all redeemed, nor was freedom given her;
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: When the woman is accused - the man brings a sacrifice, when the woman is not accused - the man does not bring a sacrifice. From where do we derive this? Rava said, as it is written: "If a man lies with a woman who is a slave designated for another man, but who has not been ransomed or given her freedom..."

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי עַד הָכָא בְּאִישׁ קָא מִשְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא, נִכְתּוֹב: ״וְהֵבִיא אֶת אֲשָׁמוֹ לַה׳״, וּלְבַסּוֹף לִכְתּוֹב ״בִּקּוֹרֶת תִּהְיֶה״. אַמַּאי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בְּרֵישָׁא: ״בִּקּוֹרֶת תִּהְיֶה״ וּלְבַסּוֹף כְּתַב: ״וְהֵבִיא אֶת אֲשָׁמוֹ לַה׳״? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם בִּקּוֹרֶת תִּהְיֶה הִיא – ״וְהֵבִיא אֶת אֲשָׁמוֹ לַה׳״, וְאִם לֹא תִּהְיֶה בִּקּוֹרֶת – לֹא יָבִיא הוּא אֶת אֲשָׁמוֹ.
human_translation: Since until here, the verse is dealing with a man, let it write: “He shall bring his guilt offering unto the Lord,” and at the end let it write: “There shall be an inspection.” Why did the Merciful One first write: “There shall be an inspection,” and at the end write: “He shall bring his guilt offering unto the Lord”? this is saying: If there will be an inspection, “he shall bring his guilt offering unto the Lord.” But if there will not be an inspection, he shall not bring his guilt offering.
llm_translation: From here until now, in a man, the verse is interpreted, as it is written: "And he shall bring his guilt offering to the Lord," and ultimately it is written, "It shall be of acacia wood." Why did the Merciful One write at the beginning, "It shall be of acacia wood," and ultimately write, "And he shall bring his guilt offering to the Lord"? This is what he is saying: If it shall be of acacia wood, then "And he shall bring his guilt offering to the Lord," but if it shall not be of acacia wood, he shall not bring his guilt offering.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא, הוּא מַעֲטֵיהּ קְרָא, אֲבָל הִיא תִּילְקֵי וְתַיְתֵי קׇרְבָּן! – ״וְהֵבִיא אֶת אֲשָׁמוֹ לַה׳״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: say the verse excludes him but she flogged and bring an offering. “He shall bring his guilt offering unto the Lord,” is written
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima, hu ma'atei kera, aval hi tilkei ve'taitei korban!" - "Vehevi et ashamo laHashem" ketiv. English translation: "Say, he diminishes scripture, but she will bring and offer a sacrifice!" - "And he shall bring his guilt offering to the Lord" is written.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל שִׁפְחָה בְּעוּלָה בִּלְבָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִיא שִׁפְחָה נֶחֱרֶפֶת לְאִישׁ״. וּמַאי מַשְׁמַע, דְּהַאי ״נֶחֱרֶפֶת״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּשַׁנּוֹיֵי הוּא? דִּכְתִיב ״וַתִּשְׁטַח עָלָיו הָרִיפוֹת״. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: ״אִם תִּכְתּוֹשׁ הָאֱוִיל בַּמַּכְתֵּשׁ בְּתוֹךְ הָרִיפוֹת בַּעֱלִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Actually, he is liable only a non-virgin maidservant, as it is stated: “And she is a maidservant designated [ neḥerefet ] for a man.” And from where may be inferred that this “designated [ neḥerefet ],” is a term of change, As it is written: “And strewed groats [ harifot ] thereon” And if you wish, say “Though you should bray a fool in a mortar with a pestle among groats [ harifot ]”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Always one is obligated only for a maidservant who is married, as it is stated: "And she is a maidservant disgraced to a man." And what does it imply, that this "disgraced" is a language of change? For it is written: "And she poured it upon him." And if you wish, say: "If you beat the fool in a mortar among the grain with a pestle, his foolishness will not depart from him."

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּתְּנוּ יָדָם לְהוֹצִיא נְשֵׁיהֶם וַאֲשֵׁמִים אֵיל צֹאן עַל אַשְׁמָתָם״, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכּוּלָּן שְׁפָחוֹת חֲרוּפוֹת בָּעֲלוּ.
human_translation: And they gave their hand that they would divorce their wives; and being guilty, a ram of the flock for their guilt” Rav Ḥisda said: teaches that they had all engaged in intercourse with espoused maidservants,
llm_translation: "They put forth their hand to bring out their wives and guilty ones, a ram of the flock for their guilt," Rav Hisda said: This teaches that their maidservants were brazen-faced towards their husbands.

hebrew_text: אֵיזוֹהִי שִׁפְחָה כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהׇפְדֵּה״, יָכוֹל כּוּלָּהּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא נִפְדָּתָה״. יָכוֹל לֹא נִפְדָּתָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהׇפְדֵּה״,
human_translation: Which is maidservant? the Sages taught “And she was redeemed” might entirely the verse states: and not redeemed,” might was not redeemed the verse states: “And she was redeemed,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Which is a maidservant, etc." The Rabbis taught: "And he shall redeem," can it be the entire maidservant? The Talmud teaches: "She was not redeemed." Can it be she was not redeemed? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall redeem."

hebrew_text: הָא כֵיצַד? פְּדוּיָה וְאֵינָהּ פְּדוּיָה – חֶצְיָהּ שִׁפְחָה וְחֶצְיָיהּ בַּת חוֹרִין וּמְאוֹרֶסֶת לְעֶבֶד עִבְרִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, וּמְאוֹרֶסֶת לְעֶבֶד עִבְרִי. אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהׇפְדֵּה לֹא נִפְדָּתָה״? דִּבְּרָה תוֹרָה כִלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: How so? redeemed and not redeemed, half of her is a maidservant and half of her is a free woman, and she is betrothed to a Hebrew slave. the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yishmael says the verse is speaking of a Canaanite maidservant and is engaged to a Hebrew slave. If so, why the verse state: “And she was redeemed and not redeemed”? the Torah spoke in the language of people,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ha keitzad? Peduyah ve'einah peduyah - chetziyah shifchah uchetziyah bat chorin umeorset le'evad ivri, divrei Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yishmael omer: Beshifchah kenanit haktuv medaber, umeorset le'evad ivri. Im ken mah talmud lomar: 've'hifdeh lo nifdeta'? Dibra Torah kilshon benei adam." English translation: "How so? If she is redeemed and not redeemed - half of her is a maidservant and half of her is a free woman, according to the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yishmael says: The Scripture speaks of a Canaanite maidservant and a betrothed woman to a Hebrew slave. If so, what does the Torah mean when it says: 'And if she is not redeemed'? The Torah spoke in the language of people."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת מְפוֹרָשׁוֹת לָנוּ, מְשׁוּיָּיר לָנוּ חֶצְיָהּ שִׁפְחָה וְחֶצְיָהּ בַּת חוֹרִין וּמְאוֹרֶסֶת לְעֶבֶד עִבְרִי. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: ״לֹא יוּמְתוּ כִּי לֹא חוּפָּשָׁה״ – בְּשִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, וּמְאוֹרֶסֶת לְעֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: All those with whom relations are forbidden are enumerated for us excluded for us is a half-maidservant half-free woman who is betrothed to a Hebrew slave. And Aḥerim say “They shall not be put to death because she was not free,” the verse is speaking about a Canaanite maidservant who is betrothed to a Canaanite slave.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: All forbidden relationships are explicitly stated for us, as it is written, "half of her is a maidservant and half is a free woman, and she is betrothed to a Hebrew slave." Others say: "They shall not be put to death, for she was not free" - the verse is speaking of a Canaanite maidservant, and a betrothed woman to a Canaanite slave.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, בִּשְׁלָמָא ״וְהׇפְדֵּה לֹא נִפְדָּתָה״ – כִּדְקָתָנֵי: דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה כִלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם, אֶלָּא דְּקָתָנֵי: מְאוֹרֶסֶת לְעֶבֶד עִבְרִי, מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי לֹא חוּפָּשָׁה״, מִכְּלָל דְּהוּא חוּפַּשׁ.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Yishmael, granted “and she was redeemed and not redeemed” as it is taught The Torah spoke in the language of people. But from where do we that is taught, she is betrothed to a Hebrew slave? as it is written: because she was not free” By inference, that he, is free.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yishmael, in truth, "and she was not redeemed" - as it is taught: The Torah spoke in the language of people, but it is taught: If she was betrothed to a Hebrew slave, from where? As it is written: "For she was not freed," which implies that she was not freed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה הַיְינוּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא! לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל קָאָמַר: לְדִידִי, בְּעָלְמָא כְּווֹתָיךְ סְבִירָא לֵיהּ דְּדִבְּרָה תוֹרָה כִלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם, וְהָכָא שָׁאנֵי. מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב לֵיהּ קְרָא: ״כִּי לֹא חוּפָּשָׁה״, ״וְהׇפְדֵּה לֹא נִפְדָּתָה״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינָּה לְהָכִי אֲתָא, לְחֶצְיָהּ שִׁפְחָה וְחֶצְיָהּ בַּת חוֹרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya is Rabbi Akiva. is saying to Rabbi Yishmael: According to me, in general I hold in accordance with your that the Torah spoke in the language of people. But here it is different, since it is written in the verse: “Because she was not free.” why do I “and she is redeemed and not redeemed”? Conclude from it that it comes for this to half-maidservant half-free woman.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, that is Rabbi Akiva! According to Rabbi Yishmael he said: In my opinion, in the world, it is reasonable for him that the Torah was spoken in the language of people, and here it is different. As it is written for him in the verse: "For she is not free," "and she was not redeemed," why do I need it? Learn from this that it comes to this: half of her is a maidservant and half of her is a free woman.

hebrew_text: לַאֲחֵרִים, בִּשְׁלָמָא ״וְהׇפְדֵּה לֹא נִפְדָּתָה״, קָסָבַר: דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה כִלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם, אֶלָּא הָא דְּעֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי מְנָלַן? אֲמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי לֹא חוּפָּשָׁה״, אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְדִידַהּ – תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְדִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: According to Aḥerim , granted “and she was redeemed and not redeemed” as they maintain the Torah spoke in the language of people. But from where do we that a Canaanite slave? verse states: “Because she was not free,” if it is not needed matter of her apply it matter of his
llm_translation: To others, it is understandable "and if she is not redeemed," he holds: the Torah spoke in the language of people, but where is it derived that a Canaanite slave is different? The verse says: "for she has not been freed," if it is not relevant to her – give it relevance to her.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת, אֶחָד גָּדוֹל וְאֶחָד קָטָן – קָטָן פָּטוּר, אֶחָד עֵר וְאֶחָד יָשֵׁן – יָשֵׁן פָּטוּר, אֶחָד שׁוֹגֵג וְאֶחָד מֵזִיד – שׁוֹגֵג בְּחַטָּאת וּמֵזִיד בְּהִכָּרֵת.
human_translation: all those with whom relations are forbidden, one is an adult and one is a minor, minor is exempt; one is awake and one is sleeping, sleeping exempt; one unwittingly and one intentionally, unwittingly to a sin offering and intentionally with karet .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All forbidden relationships, whether one is major and one is minor - the minor is exempt; whether one is awake and one is asleep - the one who is asleep is exempt; whether one is unintentional and one is intentional - the unintentional is liable for a sin offering, and the intentional is liable for excision.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָכָא, חַיָּיב קָטָן? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת, אֶחָד גָּדוֹל וְאֶחָד קָטָן – קָטָן פָּטוּר וְגָדוֹל חַיָּיב, וְהָכָא – גָּדוֹל נָמֵי פָּטוּר, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּהָא מִקַּשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: And here, a minor is liable? Rav Yehuda said: This is teaching: all those with whom relations are forbidden, one is an adult and one is a minor, the minor is exempt and the adult is liable. But here, the adult is also exempt. What is the reason? as they are juxtaposed to each other
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: And here, is a minor liable? Rav Yehudah said, thus it was taught: With all forbidden relationships, whether one is an adult or a minor - a minor is exempt and an adult is liable. And here - the adult is explicitly exempt, what is the reason? Because they are conflicting with each other."

hebrew_text: כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת, אֶחָד נֵיעוֹר וְאֶחָד יָשֵׁן – פָּטוּר. וְכָאן, יָשֵׁן נָמֵי חַיָּיב? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת, אֶחָד נֵיעוֹר וְאֶחָד יָשֵׁן – יָשֵׁן פָּטוּר וְנֵיעוֹר חַיָּיב, וְכָאן – אֲפִילּוּ נֵיעוֹר פָּטוּר, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּמִקַּשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: all those with whom relations are forbidden, one is awake and one is sleeping, exempt. And here sleeping is liable? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: This is teaching: all those with whom relations are forbidden, one is awake and one is sleeping, sleeping is exempt and awake is liable. But here, even the one awake is exempt. What is the reason? as they are juxtaposed to each other
llm_translation: All forbidden relationships, whether one is young or old - exempt. And here, if one is old, is he liable? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, thus it was taught: All forbidden relationships, whether one is young or old - if one is old, he is exempt, and if he is young, he is liable. And here - even if he is young, he is exempt. What is the reason? Because they are compared to each other.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: עָשׂוּ גּוֹמֵר כִּמְעָרֶה, מִתְכַּוֵּין כְּשֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין, כְּדַרְכָּהּ כְּשֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, נֵיעוֹר כְּיָשֵׁן.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: rendered one who completes like one who engages in the initial stage one who intentionally like one who unintentionally; a typical like an atypical manner, one who is awake like one who is sleeping.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: They did the finishing like a cave, they intend when they do not intend, in its usual manner and not in its usual manner, they shake like one who is asleep.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי קָאָמְרַתְּ? אִי בְּשִׁפְחָה חֲרוּפָה קָתָנֵי, אַמַּאי עָשׂוּ גּוֹמֵר כִּמְעָרֶה? גּוֹמֵר בְּשִׁפְחָה חֲרוּפָה מִיחַיַּיב, מְעָרֶה לָא מִיחַיַּיב! וְתוּ: מִתְכַּוֵּין כְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מִתְכַּוֵּין, אִי מִכַּוְּונָה – מִיחַיְּיבָא, אִי לָא – לָא מִיחַיְּיבָא!
human_translation: said to him: What are you saying? If are teaching an espoused maidservant, why they rendered one who completes like one who engages in the initial stage one who completes with an espoused maidservant is liable, one who engages in the initial stage is not liable. And furthermore, one who intentionally like one who unintentionally: If she intended it, is liable if not is not liable.
llm_translation: He said to him: What are you saying? If it is with a disgraced maidservant that it is dealing, why did they complete it like a cave? If it is dealing with a disgraced maidservant, he is liable; but if it is like a cave, he is not liable! And furthermore: If one intends when he does not intend, whether he intended or not, he is not liable!

hebrew_text: וּכְדַרְכָּהּ כְּשֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ נָמֵי, כְּדַרְכָּהּ בְּשִׁפְחָה חֲרוּפָה מִיחַיַּיב, וְשֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ לָא מִיחַיַּיב, מַאי טַעְמָא? ״שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע״ כְּתִיב! וּמַאי נֵיעוֹר כְּיָשֵׁן?
human_translation: And also in a typical like in an atypical manner: in a typical with an espoused maidservant is liable, and in an atypical manner is not liable. What is the reason? It is written: “Lies carnally [ shikhvat zera ],” And what one who is awake like one who is sleeping?
llm_translation: "And in her normal way, when not in her normal way, truly, in her normal way with a disgraced maidservant he is liable, but when not in her normal way, he is not liable. What is the reason? 'Lying with seed' is written! And what is the comparison to one who is asleep?"

hebrew_text: וְאִי בִּשְׁאָר עֲרָיוֹת קָא תָנֵי, עָשׂוּ גּוֹמֵר כִּמְעָרֶה?
human_translation: And if teach with all those others with whom relations are forbidden, they rendered one who completes like one who engages in the initial stage
llm_translation: And if in other forbidden relationships he teaches, they completed like a cave?

hebrew_text: אִיפְּכָא אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִיתְנֵי!
human_translation: It should teach the opposite,
llm_translation: Opposite, he asked to him to learn!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיסְמְיַיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: עָשׂוּ גּוֹמֵר שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ בְּשִׁפְחָה חֲרוּפָה, דְּלָא מִיחַיְּיבִי, כִּמְעָרֶה כְּדַרְכָּהּ, דְּ״שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: said to Should I remove said to him: No; this is teaching: rendered one who completes an atypical with an espoused maidservant, for which is not liable, like one who engages in the initial stage in the typical manner, that it is written: “Lies carnally.”
llm_translation: He said to him: Is it permissible for her? He said to him: No, thus it was taught: They completed the act not in its usual manner with a disgraced maidservant, for they are not liable, like a cave in its usual manner, as "lying with seed" is written.

hebrew_text: מִתְכַּוֵּין שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ בְּשִׁפְחָה, דִּפְטוּרִין כְּאֵינוֹ מִתְכַּוֵּין, דְּ״שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע״ כְּתִיב. נֵיעוֹר שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ בְּשִׁפְחָה, דִּפְטוּרִין כְּיָשֵׁן, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּ״שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: one who intentionally atypical with a maidservant, which they are exempt, like one who does unintentionally, as it is written: “Lies carnally.” one who in an atypical manner with maidservant is awake, which they are exempt, like one who sleeping. What is the reason? that it is written: “Lies carnally.”
llm_translation: Intending not as its normal manner in a maidservant, they are exempt as one who did not intend, for "the lying of seed" is written. Stirring not as its normal manner in a maidservant, they are exempt as one who is asleep. What is the reason? For "the lying of seed" is written.

hebrew_text: נִמְצָא מִתְכַּוֵּין וְהַמְעָרֶה בְּשִׁפְחָה, כְּשֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין בְּכׇל עֲרָיוֹת. יָשֵׁן כְּדַרְכָּהּ – כְּיָשֵׁן דַּעֲרָיוֹת, נִמְצָא נֵיעוֹר שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ בְּשִׁפְחָה – כְּיָשֵׁן דְּכׇל עֲרָיוֹת.
human_translation: has been determined one who intentionally or engages initial stage of intercourse with maidservant is like one who unintentionally with all those with whom relations are forbidden, one who in a typical manner sleeping is like one who sleeping, with those with whom relations are forbidden, determined one who atypical with maidservant awake is like one who with all those with whom relations are forbidden, while sleeping,
llm_translation: Found intent and cave in maidservant, when not intent in all forbidden relationships. Sleeps in her usual manner - like one who sleeps in forbidden relationships, found a youth not in her usual manner in maidservant - like one who sleeps in all forbidden relationships.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אַרְבָּעָה מְחוּסְּרֵי כַּפָּרָה
llm_translation: We will return to you with four missing atonements.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אָכַלְתָּ חֵלֶב – מֵבִיא חַטָּאת. עֵד אוֹמֵר: אָכַל, וְעֵד אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָכַל, אִשָּׁה אוֹמֶרֶת: אָכַל, וְאִשָּׁה אוֹמֶרֶת: לֹא אָכַל – מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. עֵד אוֹמֵר: אָכַל, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָכַלְתִּי – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: said to you ate fat, bring a sin offering a witness says: He ate and a witness says: He did not eat a woman says: He ate and a woman says: He did not eat bring a provisional guilt offering, a witness says: He ate and says: I did not eat exempt.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: They said to him: "You ate forbidden fat" - he brings a sin offering. One witness says: "He ate," and one witness says: "He did not eat." A woman says: "He ate," and another woman says: "He did not eat" - he brings a guilt offering. One witness says: "He ate," and he says: "I did not eat" - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים: אָכַל, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָכַלְתִּי – רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב. אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִם הֱבִיאוּהוּ שְׁנַיִם לִידֵי מִיתָה חֲמוּרָה, לֹא יְבִיאוּהוּ לִידֵי קׇרְבָּן הַקַּל? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מָה אִם יִרְצֶה לוֹמַר ״מֵזִיד הָיִיתִי״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: two say: He ate and says: I did not eat Rabbi Meir deems liable Rabbi Meir said: If two brought him to severe death, they not bring him to an offering, which is lenient? said to him: what if he wishes to say: I did intentionally, exempt
llm_translation: Two say: he ate, and he says: I did not eat - Rabbi Meir obligates. Rabbi Meir said: If two brought him to a severe death, should they not bring him to a lighter sacrifice? They said to him: What if he wants to say "I acted intentionally" - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָכַל חֵלֶב וְחֵלֶב בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. אָכַל חֵלֶב וָדָם וּפִיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. זֶה חוֹמֶר בְּמִינִין הַרְבֵּה מִמִּין אֶחָד.
human_translation: ate fat and fat during one lapse of awareness, he is liable only one ate fat, and blood, and piggul , and notar in one lapse of awareness, liable for each and every one This is a stringency to several types one type
llm_translation: He ate fat and fat unknowingly (one) - he is liable only for one. He ate fat and blood and pigul and left unconsciously (one) - he is liable for each and every one. This is a stringency in many species over one species.

hebrew_text: וְחוֹמֶר בְּמִין אֶחָד מִמִּינִין הַרְבֵּה, שֶׁאִם אָכַל כַּחֲצִי זַיִת וְחָזַר וְאָכַל כַּחֲצִי זַיִת אַחֵר בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד, מִמִּין אֶחָד – חַיָּיב, מִשְּׁנֵי מִינִין – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: And a stringency to one type several types that if one ate half an olive-bulk and then ate another half an olive-bulk during one lapse of awareness, from one type liable from two types, exempt,
llm_translation: And a stringency in one of the species is significant, for if one ate half an olive's bulk and then returned and ate another half an olive's bulk in one forgetfulness, of one species - he is liable, of two species - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָתָנֵי: אָמְרוּ לוֹ ״אָכַלְתָּ חֵלֶב״ – מֵבִיא חַטָּאת. אָמְרוּ כְּמָה הָוְיָין? תְּרֵין. וְהוּא מָה אָמַר לְהוֹן? אִלֵּימָא דְּשָׁתֵיק וְלָא קָמַכְחֵישׁ לְהוּ, אֶלָּא שְׁתִיקָה דִּתְרֵין הוּא דְּמֵבִיא חַטָּאת, עַל שְׁתִיקָה דְּחַד – לָא.
human_translation: teaches: said to him: You ate fat, bring a sin offering. said, how many are two And what does he say to them If we say that he is silent and does not contradict them, only silence of two that he brings a sin offering, for silence of one not
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: They said to him, "You ate forbidden fat" - he brings a sin offering. They said, how many instances are there? Two. And what did he say to them? If you say that he remained silent and did not confirm to them, rather, his silence regarding two instances is what brings a sin offering, but regarding silence about one - no.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא מְצִיעֲתָא, עֵד אוֹמֵר: אָכַל, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָכַלְתִּי. טַעְמָא דְּמַכְחִישׁ לֵיהּ, אֲבָל שָׁתֵיק – מִיחַיַּיב, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן תְּרֵי!
human_translation: say the middle clause: a witness says he ate and says: I did not eat The reason that he contradicts him. But silent, he is liable, and all the more so two
llm_translation: The text reads: "Eima metzichta, ed omer: akhal, vehu omer: lo akhalti. Ta'ama de'makhchish lei, aval shatayk - mikhayyav, ve'khol sheken trei!" Translation: "A witness presents, a witness says: he ate, and he says: I did not eat. The reason for contradicting him, but if he remains silent - he is liable, and all the more so two!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דְּקָמַכְחֵישׁ לְהוּ, מַנִּי – רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: הַכְחָשָׁה דְּבֵי תְרֵי לָאו הַכְחָשָׁה הִיא, אֲבָל לְרַבָּנַן, פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rather, where he contradicts Whose is Rabbi Meir, who says contradiction of two is not a contradiction, But according to the Rabbis, exempt.
llm_translation: Rather: that he contradicts them, who is it? - It is Rabbi Meir, as he said: The denial of the house of Terai is not a denial, but for the Rabbis, one is exempt.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָמַשְׁמַע לַן? מִסֵּיפָא שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ! הָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן: דָּבָר זֶה מַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבָּנַן, וְהוּא דְּקָמַכְחֵישׁ לְהוּ.
human_translation: And what teach us From the latter clause you learn this teaches us: This matter a dispute Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis, and that where he contradicts their
llm_translation: And what is it that we infer from this? From the latter part we infer it! This is what we infer: This matter is a dispute between Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis, and he is the one who strengthens their position.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: ״אָמְרוּ לוֹ״ נָמֵי חַד קָרֵי לֵיהּ, דִּתְנַן: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וּבָאוּ וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ מֵת בַּעֲלִיךְ וְנִישֵּׂאת וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּא בַּעְלָהּ – תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, דְּקַיְימָא לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּחַד.
human_translation: Some say said to him, also refer one As we learned a woman whose husband went overseas, and came and said to her: Your husband died, and she married and afterward her husband came she must leave this and that as we maintain that even where one
llm_translation: There are those who say: "They said to him" also one verse calls him, as we learned: If a woman whose husband went to a country across the sea and they came and said to her, "Your husband has died, and you are permitted to marry," and afterwards her husband came - she may leave from this one and from that one, for we hold that even with one witness it is established.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: נִישֵּׂאת שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת – מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ. מַאי שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת – שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת בֵּית דִּין וְעֵד אֶחָד,
human_translation: From where from that the latter clause teaches: she married without consent she is permitted to return to him. What without consent? without the consent of the court, one witness.
llm_translation: From where? From the fact that it teaches in the latter clause: If she was carried out without permission – she is permitted to return. What is meant by "without permission"? Without permission of the court and one witness.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא, בִּרְשׁוּת בֵּית דִּין וּבְעֵד אֶחָד. אַלְמָא גַּבֵּי עֵד אֶחָד קָתָנֵי ״אָמְרוּ״, וְהָכָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי ״אָמְרוּ לוֹ״, מַשְׁמַע אֲפִילּוּ עֵד אֶחָד.
human_translation: By inference, that the first clause with the consent of the court and of one witness. Evidently, teaches Said, to one witness, and here, too, where it teaches said to him, indicates even one witness
llm_translation: From the general principle of the first clause, with the permission of the court and with one witness. This implies that regarding one witness it states "they said," and here it also states "they said to him," indicating that even with one witness.

hebrew_text: וְהוּא, מַאי קָאָמַר? אִלֵּימָא דְּקָא מַכְחֵישׁ לֵיהּ, מִי מַיְיתֵי? וְהָא קָתָנֵי מְצִיעֲתָא: עֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: אָכַל, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר לֹא אָכַלְתִּי – פָּטוּר!
human_translation: And what does he say If we say that he contradicts does he bring But doesn’t the middle clause teach: a witness says: He ate and says: I did not eat exempt?
llm_translation: He, what is he saying? If you say he contradicts him, who brings it? But it teaches a principle: One witness says, "He ate," and he says, "I did not eat" - he is exempt!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּשָׁתֵיק, מִמְּצִיעֲתָא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: עֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: כּוּ׳. טַעְמָא דְּקָא מַכְחֵישׁ לֵיהּ, אֲבָל שָׁתֵק מִישְׁתָּק – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: Rather, where he is silent, learn from the middle clause, a witness says: the reason that he contradicts but he was silent, liable
llm_translation: Rather, he remained silent, from the fact that he heard from her: one witness says, "so and so." The reason that he contradicts him, but if he remains silent, he is liable!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּלָא מַכְחֵישׁ לֵיהּ, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אָכַלְתָּ חֵלֶב – מֵבִיא חַטָּאת. בַּמֶּה דְבָרִים אֲמוּרִים: דְּשָׁתֵיק, אֲבָל מַכְחֵישׁ לֵיהּ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Actually, where he does not contradict And this is teaching: they, said to him: You ate fat, bring a sin offering. In what is this statement said? where he was silent but if he contradicts exempt.
llm_translation: Forever not contradict him, and thus it was taught: They said to him: "You ate fat - bring a sin offering." In what case are these words said: that he remains silent, but if he contradicts him - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מְנָלַן דְּלָא מַכְחֵישׁ לֵיהּ חַיָּיב? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אוֹ הוֹדַע אֵלָיו חַטָּאתוֹ״ – וְלֹא שֶׁיּוֹדִיעוּהוּ אֲחֵרִים. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ אֵין מַכְחִישָׁן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹ הוֹדַע אֵלָיו״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: And from where do we that by Torah law that he does not contradict he is liable as the Sages taught “Or if his sin is known to him” but not where others informed him might even he does not contradict the verse states: “Or if is known to him,” in any case
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from the Torah, from where do we derive that if one does not confess, he is liable? For the Rabbis taught: "Or if the sin which he has sinned be made known to him" - and not that others inform him. Could it be that even if they do not inform him, he is not liable? The Talmud teaches: "Or if the sin which he has sinned be made known to him" - from any place.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִלֵּימָא בִּתְרֵין, תְּרֵין וְאֵין מַכְחִישָׁן קְרָא בָּעֵי?
human_translation: What are we dealing with, If we say to two two and he does not contradict them need a verse
llm_translation: In what are we dealing? If you say with two, two, and the verse does not contradict them, does the verse require?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו בְּחַד, וְקָתָנֵי כִּי אֵין מַכְחִישָׁן מְהֵימַן, שְׁמַע מִינָּה.
human_translation: Rather, isn’t of one and it teaches when he does not contradict is deemed credible? Learn from
llm_translation: Rather, not with one, and it is taught: because they do not contradict a trustworthy person, infer from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: קַל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said: a fortiori :
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: "Kal vachomer."

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו: מאי טעמייהו דרבנן, משום דאדם נאמן על עצמו יותר ממאה איש, או דלמא משום דאמרינן: מיגו דאי בעי אמר ״מזיד הייתי״ – פטור, כי אמר נמי ״לא אכלתי״ – מהימן ופטור?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is the reasoning of the Rabbis, because that a person is deemed credible about himself more than one hundred people? Or perhaps because we say since [ miggo ], that if he wishes, say: I did intentionally, exempt also when he says: I did not eat, he is deemed credible and is exempt.
llm_translation: The question was asked: What is the reason of the Rabbis, is it because a person is believed upon himself more than a hundred others, or perhaps because we say: From the aspect that if he wanted, he could say, "I acted intentionally" – he is exempt, for if he also says, "I did not eat" – he is believed and exempt?

hebrew_text: ומאי נפקא מינה? למיפשט מינה לטומאה, דאי אמרת טעמייהו דרבנן משום דאדם נאמן על עצמו יותר ממאה איש – לא שנא טומאה חדשה ולא שנא טומאה ישנה.
human_translation: And what is the difference to resolve from it of ritual impurity, If you say the Rabbis’ reasoning is that a person is deemed credible about himself more than one hundred people, is no different new impurity, and is no different old impurity,
llm_translation: And what is derived from this? To exclude it for impurity, for if you say their reasoning is due to the Rabbis' decree that a person is more reliable regarding himself than a hundred others - it does not matter if it is a new impurity or an old impurity.

hebrew_text: ואי אמרת טעמיהון דרבנן משום דאמר ״מיגו״ היא – פטרי ליה רבנן מטומאה ישנה, אבל מטומאה חדשה מחייב. מאי טעמא? טומאה ישנה, מיגו דאי בעי אמר ״טבלתי״ – פטור, כי אמר נמי ״לא נטמאתי״ – פטור, דאיכא למימר: מאי ״לא נטמאתי״ דקאמר – לא עמדתי בטומאתי אלא טבלתי.
human_translation: But if you say the reasoning of the Rabbis is that say miggo , the Rabbis deem him exempt from old impurity, but of new impurity would be obligated What is the reason? old impurity, since if he wishes, he could say: I immersed exempt also when he says: I did not become impure, exempt, as it can be said: What when he says: I did not become impure? I did not remain in my impurity, rather I immersed
llm_translation: And if you say their reason is because they say "migu" - the Rabbis exempt him from old impurity, but from new impurity he is liable. What is the reason? For old impurity, because if he wants to say "I have immersed" - he is exempt, for he also can say "I have not become impure" - he is exempt, for it can be said: What is "I have not become impure" that he says - I did not stand in my impurity but I immersed.

hebrew_text: אבל טומאה חדשה – מחייב, מאי טעמא? דכי אמר נמי ״טבלתי״ – מחייב, דאמרו ליה עדים: השתא נטמאת.
human_translation: But new impurity, would be obligated What is the reason? because even when he says: I immersed would be obligated as the witnesses would say to him: You became impure now,
llm_translation: But new impurity - liable, what is the reason? For when he also said "I have immersed" - liable, for the witnesses said to him: "Now you have become impure."

hebrew_text: מאי? תא שמע: אמר לו עד אחד: נטמאת, והוא אומר: לא נטמאתי – פטור. יכול אפילו שנים? אמר רבי מאיר: קל וחומר, אם הביאוהו שנים למיתה חמורה – לא יביאוהו לידי קרבן הקל? וחכמים אומרים: אדם נאמן על עצמו יותר ממאה איש. שמע מינה טעמייהו דרבנן משום דאמרי: אדם נאמן על עצמו יותר ממאה איש.
human_translation: What, Come hear one witness said to You became impure, and he says: I did not become impure, exempt might even two Rabbi Meir said: a fortiori : If two brought him to severe death, they not bring him to an offering, which is lenient? And the Rabbis say: A person is deemed credible about himself more than one hundred people. Learn from the reasoning of the Rabbis is that they say a person is deemed credible about himself more than one hundred people.
llm_translation: What? Come and hear: He said to him, "You are impure," and he says, "I am not impure" - he is exempt. Could this even apply to two? Rabbi Meir said: A fortiori, if they brought him two for a more severe punishment - should they not bring him for a lighter punishment? And the sages say: A person is more trustworthy regarding himself than a hundred others. Learn from this that the reasons of the Rabbis are because they say: A person is more trustworthy regarding himself than a hundred others.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: לְעוֹלָם טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן ״מִיגּוֹ״, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאִם רָצָה לוֹמַר: לֹא עָמַדְתִּי בְּטוּמְאָתִי – פָּטוּר, הִילְכָּךְ אָדָם נֶאֱמָן עַל עַצְמוֹ יוֹתֵר מִמֵּאָה אִישׁ. אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ חֵלֶב!
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: Actually, the Rabbis’ reasoning that we say miggo , and this is teaching: Since if he wished to say: I did not remain in my impurity exempt, therefore a person is deemed credible about himself more than one hundred people. If so, this is fat,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: Always the reason of the Sages is because we say "from here." And thus it was taught: Since if he wanted to say, "I did not stand in my impurity," he is exempt. Therefore, a person is more trusted on himself than a hundred others. If not, this is considered fat!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: ״אָכַלְתִּי חֵלֶב״, קָמְתָרֵיץ דִּיבּוּרֵיהּ: לָא אָכַלְתִּי שׁוֹגֵג אֶלָּא מֵזִיד, אֲבָל: נִטְמֵאתָ, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא נִטְמֵאתִי, אֵימָא לָא קָמְתָרֵיץ דִּבּוּרֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הָכָא נָמֵי: לֹא עָמַדְתִּי בְּטוּמְאָתִי אֲבָל טָבַלְתִּי.
human_translation: lest you say I eat fat, he may explain his statement I did not eat unwittingly but intentionally, But You have become impure, and he says: I have not become impure, say cannot explain his statement teaches us here too, I did not remain in my impurity, but I immersed,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reasoning of one who says, "I have eaten fat," he seeks to justify his words: "I did not eat unintentionally but intentionally, yet you became impure, and he says, 'I did not become impure,' why not seek to justify his words? It can be inferred: Here too: 'I did not remain in my impurity but I immersed.'

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְהִתְוַדָּה״ – מוֹדֶה בַּדְּבָרִים – חַיָּיב, אֵין מוֹדֶה בַּדְּבָרִים – פָּטוּר. אָמַר לוֹ עֵד אֶחָד: נִטְמֵאתָ, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא נִטְמֵאתִי – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Come hear that he shall confess confesses liable not confess exempt one witness said to him: You have become impure, and he says: I have not become impure, exempt
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And he shall confess' - one who admits to the matter - is liable, one who does not admit to the matter - is exempt. One witness said to him: 'You became impure,' and he says: 'I did not become impure' - he is exempt."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ שְׁנַיִם מַכְחִישִׁין? אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִם הֱבִיאוּהוּ שְׁנַיִם לִידֵי מִיתָה חֲמוּרָה, לֹא יְבִיאוּהוּ לִידֵי קׇרְבָּן הַקַּל? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמָן אָדָם עַל עַצְמוֹ יוֹתֵר מִמֵּאָה אִישׁ.
human_translation: might even two contradict Rabbi Meir said: If two brought him to severe death, they not bring him to an offering, which is lenient? Rabbi Yehuda says: A person is deemed credible about himself more than one hundred people.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is it possible that even two contradict? Rabbi Meir said: If they brought him to a severe death penalty, should they not bring him to a lighter sacrifice? Rabbi Yehuda says: A person is more trusted on himself than a hundred others.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּחֲלָבִין וּבְבִיאַת מִקְדָּשׁ, אֲבָל בְּטוּמְאָה – לָא מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, concede to Rabbi Yehuda with regard to fats, or with regard to entering the Temple But with regard to ritual impurity, they do not concede to him;
llm_translation: The sages concede to Rabbi Yehuda regarding matters of milk and the bringing of the Temple, but in the case of impurity - they do not concede to him.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵּימָא
human_translation: What are we dealing with? If we say
llm_translation: In what are we dealing? Perhaps...

hebrew_text: בְּטוּמְאָה יְשָׁנָה, מַאי שְׁנָא חֲלָבִין וּבִיאַת מִקְדָּשׁ דְּמוֹדוּ לֵיהּ, דְּאִם רָצָה יֹאמַר: ״מֵזִיד הָיִיתִי״? טוּמְאָה יְשָׁנָה נָמֵי מְתָרֵץ דִּיבּוּרֵיהּ, דְּאִם רָצָה יֹאמַר: ״לֹא עָמַדְתִּי בְּטוּמְאָתִי אֶלָּא טָבַלְתִּי״!
human_translation: to old impurity, what is different fat and entering the Temple where concede to since if he wished, he could say: I intentionally. old impurity, also explain his statement, since if he wished, he could say I did not remain in my ritual impurity, but I immersed
llm_translation: In a case of old impurity, what is the difference between sacrificial portions and entering the Temple that they agree to it, for if he wishes he can say, "I acted intentionally"? In a case of old impurity, the speaker also resolves his words, for if he wishes he can say, "I did not remain in my impurity, but I immersed!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: לְעוֹלָם בְּטוּמְאָה יְשָׁנָה, וּכְגוֹן דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ עֵדִים: אָכַלְתָּ קָדָשִׁים בְּטוּמְאַת הַגּוּף, וְהוּא אָמַר לְהוֹן: ״לֹא נִטְמֵאתִי״, דְּהָכָא לָא מְתָרֵיץ דִּיבּוּרֵיהּ. דְּלֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר לֹא עָמַדְתִּי בְּטוּמְאָה אֲבָל טָבַלְתִּי,
human_translation: Ravina said: Actually, to old impurity, where the witnesses say to him: You ate sacrificial in physical impurity, and he says to them: I did not become impure. that here he cannot explain his statement, as one cannot say I did not remain in of impurity but I immersed.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Always in old impurity, and for example, that they said to him witnesses: "You ate holy things in bodily impurity," and he said to them: "I did not become impure," for here his words do not resolve, for it is impossible to say, "I did not stand in impurity," but rather, "I immersed."

hebrew_text: מַאי אָמַר לְהוֹן? ״טָבַלְתִּי וְאָכַלְתִּי״, כִּי אָמַר לְהוֹן הָכִי, אִיתַּכְחַשׁ לֵיהּ דִּבּוּרֵיהּ קַמָּא מִיהָא בְּטוּמְאַת מַגָּעוֹ!
human_translation: What say to them I immersed and I ate, when he says this to them, his initial statement has been contradicted in any event with regard to his impurity contact.
llm_translation: What did he say to them? "I immersed and ate," for he said to them thus, he contradicted his own words from the outset regarding the impurity of his touch!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לֹא אֲמָרָהּ [רַבִּי יְהוּדָה] אֶלָּא בֵּינוֹ לְבֵין עַצְמוֹ וּלְעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda Rav Yosef says: said only when by himself and with regard to himself,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: The halacha is like Rabbi Yehuda. Rav Yosef said: Rabbi Yehuda only said it between himself and himself.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי מֵאִיר לַחֲכָמִים, שֶׁאִם אָמְרוּ לוֹ שְׁנַיִם: בָּעַלְתָּ שִׁפְחָה חֲרוּפָה, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא בָּעַלְתִּי – מְהֵימַן, דְּאִי בָּעֵי אָמַר לְהוֹן: לֹא גָּמַרְתִּי בִּיאָתִי.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: Rabbi Meir concedes to the Rabbis that if two said to him: You engaged in sexual intercourse with an espoused maidservant, and he says: I did not engage in sexual intercourse, he is deemed credible, since if he wishes, say to them: I did not complete my intercourse,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Rabbi Meir concedes to the sages, that if two people say to him: "You have had relations with a betrothed maidservant," and he says: "I did not," he is believed, for if he wanted, he could have said to them: "I did not complete the act."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי מֵאִיר לַחֲכָמִים בְּנָזִיר טָמֵא, שֶׁאָמְרוּ לוֹ שְׁנַיִם: נִטְמֵאתָ, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא נִטְמֵאתִי – פָּטוּר, דְּאִי בָּעֵי אָמַר: נִשְׁאַלְתִּי עַל נִזְירִי.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: Rabbi Meir concedes to the Rabbis in an impure nazirite, to whom two said: You became impure and he says: I did not become impure, exempt, since if he wishes, he can say: I requested my nazirite vow,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Rabbi Meir concedes to the sages regarding a defiled Nazirite, for they said to him twice: "You have become defiled," and he says: "I have not become defiled" - he is exempt, for if he wanted to, he could say: "I was asked about my Naziriteship."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי מֵאִיר לַחֲכָמִים, שֶׁאִם אָמְרוּ לוֹ שְׁנַיִם: יוֹדֵעַ אַתָּה בְּעֵדוּת פְּלוֹנִי, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: לֹא יָדַעְתִּי – פָּטוּר, דְּאִי בָּעֵי אָמַר: לֹא נִתְכַּוַּונְתִּי לְעֵדוּת.
human_translation: Abaye says: Rabbi Meir concedes to the Rabbis that if two said to You know testimony about so-and-so, and he says: I do not know, exempt that if he wishes, say: I had not intended to testimony,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Meir concedes to the sages, that if two witnesses said to him, "Do you know that you are a witness for so-and-so?" and he says, "I did not know," he is exempt, for if he wanted to say, "I did not intend to be a witness."

hebrew_text: אָכַל חֵלֶב וָחֵלֶב בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד]. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: אַמַּאי אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא חַטָּאת אַחַת וְהָא שְׁנֵי זֵיתֵי חֵלֶב אָכַל!
human_translation: ate fat and fat during one lapse of awareness, Rabbi Zeira objects to this: Why is he liable only one sin offering? But didn’t he eat two olive-bulks of fat?
llm_translation: He ate fat and fat unknowingly. Rabbi Zeira objects: Why is he only liable for one sin offering when he ate two olive sizes of fat!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הֶעְלֵמוֹת מְחוּלָּקוֹת, וְהָכָא הֶעְלֵם אֶחָד הוּא דְּאִיכָּא.
human_translation: Abaye said to separate lapses of awareness, But here there is one lapse of awareness.
llm_translation: Abaye said to him: Concealed maidens are divided, and here there is one concealed.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַקְשֵׁי לֵיהּ הָכִי: טַעְמָא דְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד, הָא בִּשְׁתֵּי הֶעְלֵמוֹת חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם. אַמַּאי? שֵׁם חֵלֶב אֶחָד הוּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הֶעְלֵמוֹת מְחוּלָּקִין.
human_translation: There are who raised difficulty in this The reason that that one lapse of awareness; but in two lapses of awareness, two why? It one category fat Abaye said to separate lapses
llm_translation: There is one who challenges him thus: The taste of one concealment, but in two concealments, one is liable for two. Why? It is one name of fat! Abaye said to him: Concealments are distinct.

hebrew_text: אָכַל חֵלֶב וָדָם פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר – חַיָּיב כּוּ׳.
human_translation: one ate fat, and blood, and piggul , and notar liable
llm_translation: He ate fat and blood, pigul and leftover - liable.

hebrew_text: מִמִּין אֶחָד חַיָּיב, פְּשִׁיטָא! אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם בַּר תּוּטֵינִי: כְּגוֹן שֶׁאֲכָלוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי תַמְחוּיִין, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: דְּאָמַר תַּמְחוּיִין מְחוּלָּקִין.
human_translation: of one type liable obvious, Reish Lakish said in the name of bar Tutini: where he ate two dishes, and in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua, who says dishes differentiates
llm_translation: From one species liable, obvious! Reish Lakish said in the name of Bar Tutini: For example, if one ate it with two tastes, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehoshua: for he said tastes are distinct.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ – לָא שְׁנָא לְקוּלָּא, וְלָא שְׁנָא לְחוּמְרָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּחַיָּיב, אַלְמָא: לְחוּמְרָא אָמַר, לְקוּלָּא לָא אָמַר.
human_translation: lest you say when Rabbi Yehoshua says is no different a leniency and is no different a stringency. teaches us that liable Evidently, says a stringency, did not say a leniency.
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? When Rabbi Yehoshua said - it is not different for leniency, and not different for stringency. He is teaching us that one is liable. Therefore: for stringency he said, for leniency he did not say.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמַר עַל סֵיפָא: מִשְּׁנֵי מִינִין – פָּטוּר. פְּשִׁיטָא! אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם בַּר תּוּטֵינִי: כְּגוֹן שֶׁאֲכָלוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי תַמְחוּיִין, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: דְּאָמַר תַּמְחוּיִין מְחוּלָּקִין.
human_translation: There are who say to the latter clause from two types exempt. obvious, Reish Lakish said in the name of bar Tutini: where he ate it in two dishes, and in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua, who says dishes differentiates
llm_translation: There is one who said regarding the latter part: From two species - exempt. It is obvious! Reish Lakish said in the name of Bar Tutini: For example, if one ate from two different storage pits, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehoshua: who said that storage pits are considered separate.

hebrew_text: דְּמַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ – לְחוּמְרָא אָמַר, לְקוּלָּא לָא אָמַר. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: מִשְּׁנֵי מִינִין פָּטוּר.
human_translation: lest you say when Rabbi Yehoshua says says a stringency, he does not say a leniency. teaches us from two types exempt.
llm_translation: The text reads: "What is the reason? For if Rabbi Yehoshua said - he said for stringency, he did not say for leniency. It is implied to us: One is exempt from two species."

hebrew_text: מַאי מִשְּׁנֵי מִינִין? מִמִּין אֶחָד הוּא, וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ שְׁנֵי מִינִים – מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲכָלוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי תַמְחוּיִין, וְקָתָנֵי: פָּטוּר, אַלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא לְקוּלָּא וְלָא שְׁנָא לְחוּמְרָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: What from two types It from one and why call it two types? because he ate it in two dishes, and teaches exempt. Evidently, is no different a leniency and is no different a stringency; Rabbi Yehoshua says
llm_translation: What is "from two species"? It is from one species, so why is it called "two species"? Because they ate it with two different tastes. And it teaches: exempt. This implies that it is not different for leniency or for stringency that Rabbi Yehoshua is saying.

hebrew_text: מִדְּסֵיפָא מִין אֶחָד וּשְׁנֵי תַמְחוּיִין, רֵישָׁא מִין אֶחָד וְתַמְחוּי אֶחָד. פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: From the latter clause, one type but two dishes, the former clause one type and one dish. obvious?
llm_translation: From the end, one kind and two distinctions, the beginning, one kind and one distinction. It is obvious!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה לוֹ יְדִיעָה בֵּינְתַיִים, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמַר: אֵין יְדִיעָה לַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: Ravina said: where he had awareness in the interim, And in accordance with of Rabban Gamliel, who says: There is no awareness for a half-measure.
llm_translation: Ravina said: For example, if he had knowledge in the meantime, and according to the opinion of Rabban Gamliel, who said: "Knowledge is not considered for half the measure."

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַכּוֹתֵב שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת בִּשְׁתֵּי הֶעְלֵמוֹת, אַחַת שַׁחֲרִית וְאַחַת עַרְבִית – רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִחַיַּיב, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין.
human_translation: As we learned one who writes two letters in two lapses of awareness, one the morning and one in the afternoon, Rabban Gamliel deems liable and the Rabbis deem exempt.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who writes two letters in two concealments, one in the morning and one in the evening - Rabban Gamliel obligates, and the Sages exempt.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: אֵין יְדִיעָה לַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יֵשׁ יְדִיעָה לַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel holds there is no awareness for a half-measure. And the Rabbis hold: There is awareness for a half-measure.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel holds: There is no knowledge for half a measure, and the Rabbis hold: There is knowledge for half a measure.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כַּמָּה יִשְׁהֶא בָּאוֹכָלִין? כְּאִילּוּ אוֹכֵל קְלָיוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁהֶא מִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף כְּדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: How much can one expend of food as though he were eating toasted grain, the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Unless he expends from beginning to end to eat a half-loaf [ peras ] liable.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How much must one eat to be liable? As if one were eating parched grain, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: From the beginning until the end of the time it takes to eat half a loaf – one is liable.

hebrew_text: אָכַל אוֹכָלִין טְמֵאִין וְשָׁתָה מַשְׁקִין טְמֵאִין, שָׁתָה רְבִיעִית יַיִן וְנִכְנַס לַמִּקְדָּשׁ וְשָׁהָה כְּדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס – חַיָּיב, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אִם פָּסֵק בָּהּ אוֹ אִם נָתַן בּוֹ מַיִם כׇּל שֶׁהוּא – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: ate ritually impure foods or drank ritually impure liquids drank a quarter log of wine and entered the Temple, and he remained to eat a half-loaf liable. Rabbi Elazar says: If he interrupted or if he placed any amount of water into exempt.
llm_translation: He who ate impure foods and drank impure beverages, if he drank a quarter log of wine and entered the Temple and remained there the time it takes to eat half a loaf – he is liable. Rabbi Eliezer says: If he paused in it or if he added any amount of water to it – he is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי מֵאִיר, לְחוּמְרָא קָאָמַר אוֹ לְקוּלָּא קָאָמַר? לְחוּמְרָא קָאָמַר, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: כְּאִילּוּ אוֹכֵל קְלָיוֹת, דַּאֲפִילּוּ כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס, כֵּיוָן דִּמְשִׁיכָה אֲכִילְתֵיהּ – מִחַיַּיב. וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: דְּעַד שֶׁיִּשְׁהֶא בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס הוּא דְּחַיָּיב יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Rabbi Meir state as a stringency or he state as a leniency? Does he state it as a stringency, and this is teaching: as though he were eating toasted grain even the entire day and even though from beginning to end more than to eat a half-loaf since extended eating, he is liable; and the Rabbis said to him that unless he expends to eat a half-loaf he is liable, more than to eat a half-loaf exempt?
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a question: Rabbi Meir, is he stating a stringency or leniency? He is stating a stringency, and thus it is taught: As if one were eating fine bread, for even the entire day. And even though from the beginning until the end more than the amount of a pras of eating, once his eating is prolonged - he is liable. And the Sages said to him: As long as he is within the amount of a pras of eating, he is liable more than the amount of a pras of eating - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא לְקוּלָּא קָאָמַר, דְּהָכִי קָתָנֵי: כְּאִילּוּ אוֹכֵל קְלָיוֹת, וְהוּא דְּלָא אַיפְסֵיק בֵּינֵי וּבֵינֵי, אֲבָל דְּאַיפְסֵיק בֵּינֵי וּבֵינֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס – פָּטוּר. וְאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיוָן דְּמִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס הוּא – חַיָּיב?
human_translation: Or perhaps says as a leniency, as this is teaching: as though he were eating toasted grain, which is he did not interrupt in between But he interrupted in between although from beginning to end to eat a half-loaf exempt; and the Rabbis said to him: Since from beginning to end is to eat a half-loaf liable,
llm_translation: Or perhaps he is coming to be lenient, for thus it was taught: as if one were eating vegetables, and he did not interrupt between them and between them, but if he interrupted between them and between them, even though from the beginning to the end it is enough for the eating of half a loaf - he is exempt. And the sages said to him: since from the beginning to the end it is enough for the eating of half a loaf - is he liable?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עֵד שֶׁיִּשְׁהֶא בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס מִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף.
human_translation: Come hear And the Rabbis say: Unless he expends from beginning to end to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: va'chachamim omrim: eid sheyish'eh bichdei achilat pras mit'chila ve'ad sof." English translation: "Come and hear: And the sages say: A witness who was present from the beginning until the end of the meal."

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְחוּמְרָא, הַיְינוּ דְקָתָנֵי: ״עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁהֶא״, עַד דִּשְׁהִיָּ[ה] דִּילֵיהּ כְּדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס.
human_translation: Granted, if you say Rabbi Meir as a stringency, this that the teaches Unless he expends, Unless his expenditure to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: If you say that Rabbi Meir said it stringently, that is what it teaches: "Until it becomes dark," until the time it takes to eat half a loaf.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְקוּלָּא, ״וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אִם שָׁהָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינָּה: רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְחוּמְרָא? שְׁמַע מִינָּה.
human_translation: But if you say Rabbi Meir as a leniency, should And the Rabbis say: If he expended Rather, isn’t it conclude from it Rabbi Meir as a stringency? Conclude from it
llm_translation: Rather, if you say Rabbi Meir's opinion is lenient, "and the sages say: if he delayed," what does he need it for? Rather, is it not to say the following: Rabbi Meir is stringent? Understand from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבְנַאי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בַּחֲלָבִים וּבִנְבֵילָה עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁהֶא מִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס. אוֹכָלִים טְמֵאִים, שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים וּמַשְׁקִין – אֲפִילּוּ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס.
human_translation: Ravnai says Shmuel says: With regard to fats and with regard to animal carcass, unless he expends from beginning to end to eat a half-loaf impure foods repugnant creatures or creeping or liquids, even the entire day, to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: In milk and in a carcass, until one rinses from the beginning until the end in the time it takes to eat a loaf. Unclean animals, detestable creatures, and creeping things, and liquids - even the entire day entirely in the time it takes to eat a loaf.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, וְהוּא שֶׁאָכַל כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס.
human_translation: What is saying? Rav Pappa said this is saying: Even the entire day but that where he ate olive-bulk within to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: What is he saying? Rav Papa said, thus he is saying: Even the entire day entirely, and he who ate like an olive in the time it takes to eat a loaf.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כׇּל הָאוֹכָלִין מִצְטָרְפִין לִפְסוֹל הַגְּוִיָּיה בְּכַחֲצִי פְרָס – מַאי לַָאו דְּאַכְלֵיהּ לַחֲצִי פְרָס בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס? לָא, דַּאֲכַל כְּזַיִת כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס.
human_translation: raises an objection All foods combine to disqualify body if a quarter-loaf What, is not where he ate the quarter-loaf within to eat a half-loaf No, where he ate each olive-bulk within to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Meitivi: kol ha'ochalin mitztarfim lifsol hageviyah bechachatzi pras - mai la'av de'achlei lechatzi pras bichdei achilat pras? La, da'achal kezayit kezayit bichdei achilat pras. English translation: It was raised in objection: all foods combine to disqualify the size of an olive in half a loaf - what is the case of one who eats half a loaf in order to eat a full loaf? No, for he ate olive-sized portions in order to eat a full loaf.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כׇּל הָאוֹכָלִין מִצְטָרְפִין לִפְסוֹל אֶת הַגְּוִיָּיה בְּכַחֲצִי פְרָס בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס, כֵּיצַד? אָכַל וְחָזַר וְאָכַל, אִם יֵשׁ מִתְּחִלַּת אֲכִילָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וְעַד סוֹף אֲכִילָה אַחֲרוֹנָה כְּדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס – מִצְטָרְפִין, יוֹתֵר מִכָּאן – אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: raises an objection All foods combine to disqualify body a quarter-loaf within to eat a half-loaf How so? he ate and then ate again, if from the beginning of the first eating until the end of the last eating there is to eat a half-loaf they combine more than that, they do not combine
llm_translation: Challenger: All foods combine to disqualify the stomach in half a loaf's worth in order to eat a loaf. How so? He ate and returned and ate. If there is from the beginning of the first eating until the end of the last eating a loaf's worth - they combine; more than this - they do not combine.

hebrew_text: לֹא הִתִּירוּ לֶאֱכוֹל פָּחוֹת מִכְּשִׁיעוּר לֵירֵד וְלִטְבּוֹל, יָרַד וְטָבַל וְעָלָה וְהִשְׁלִימוֹ – מִצְטָרֵף. הִתִּירוּ לָהּ לָעוּבָּרָה לֶאֱכוֹל פָּחוֹת מִכְּשִׁיעוּר, מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה.
human_translation: did not permit who ate less than the measure to descend and to immerse he descended, immersed, ascended, and completed combines permitted a pregnant woman to eat less than the measure due to the danger
llm_translation: They did not permit him to eat less than the prescribed amount to descend and immerse, he descended and immersed and ascended and completed - he is joined. They permitted her to eat less than the prescribed amount for a pregnant woman, due to danger.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַמַּשְׁקִין מִצְטָרְפִין לִפְסוֹל אֶת הַגְּוִיָּיה בִּרְבִיעִית בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס. כֵּיצַד? שָׁתָה וְחָזַר וְשָׁתָה, אִם יֵשׁ מִתְּחִלַּת שְׁתִיָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה וְעַד סוֹף שְׁתִיָּה אַחֲרוֹנָה כְּדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס – מִצְטָרְפִין, יוֹתֵר מִכָּאן – אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: All liquids combine to disqualify body a quarter- within to eat a half-loaf How so? he drank and then drank again, if from the beginning of the first drinking until the end of the last drinking there is to eat a half-loaf they combine more than that they do not combine.
llm_translation: All liquids combine to disqualify the giyyah in the fourth part of a log in order to eat a peras. How so? If one drank, and then returned and drank again, if from the beginning of the first drinking until the end of the last drinking is enough for eating a peras - they combine; if more than this - they do not combine.

hebrew_text: הִתִּירוּ לָהּ לְמַגַּע טְמֵא מֵת לְהָנִיק בְּנָהּ, וּבְנָהּ טָהוֹר.
human_translation: contact impure a corpse, permitted her to nurse her child, and her child pure.
llm_translation: They permitted her to have contact with a ritually impure corpse to nurse her son, and her son is pure.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: אִם יֵשׁ מִתְּחִלַּת אֲכִילָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וְעַד סוֹף אֲכִילָה בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס – מִצְטָרֵף. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבְנַאי, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: In any event, taught if from the beginning of the first eating until the end of the last eating there is to eat a half-loaf they combine The refutation of Ravnai a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: It was taught in one place: If there is from the beginning of the first eating until the end of the eating, in the time it takes to eat half a loaf – he is joined. The dispute of Rabbanai, the dispute.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: לֹא הִתִּירוּ לוֹ לֶאֱכוֹל פָּחוֹת מִכְּשִׁיעוּר לֵירֵד וְלִטְבּוֹל. מַאי קָאָמַר?
human_translation: The Master said did not permit who ate less than the measure to descend and to immerse What is he saying;
llm_translation: Master said: They did not permit him to eat less than the size of an olive to descend and immerse. What is he saying?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אָכַל פָּחוֹת מִכְּשִׁיעוּר – לֹא הִתִּירוּ לוֹ לֵירֵד וְלִטְבּוֹל, שֶׁאִם יָרַד וְטָבַל וְעָלָה וְהִשְׁלִימוֹ – מִצְטָרֵף. וְאָתֵי לְמֵימַר: אַהֲנִי לִי טְבִילָה קַמַּיְיתָא, וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין טְבִילָה אֶלָּא בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said this is saying: he ate less than the measure did not permit him to descend and immerse. As, if he would descend and immerse and ascend and complete would combine and he come to say: first immersion was effective for me, But he does not know that immersion is only at the end,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, thus he said: If he ate less than the size of a kezayit - they did not permit him to descend and immerse, because if he descends and immerses and ascends and completes it - he joins. And it comes to say: I have a primary immersion before me, and he does not know that immersion is only in the last one.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי: הִתִּירוּ לָהּ לָעוּבָּרָה לֶאֱכוֹל פָּחוֹת מִכְּשִׁיעוּר מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה. מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה אֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא נָמֵי תֵּיכוֹל! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: הִתִּירוּ לָהּ לָעוּבָּרָה פָּחוֹת מִכְּשִׁיעוּר, אֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא, מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה.
human_translation: taught permitted a pregnant woman to eat less than the measure due to the danger due to the danger, let her even eat a lot, Rav Pappa said this is teaching: They permitted a pregnant woman less than the measure even a lot due to the danger
llm_translation: It was taught: They permitted her to the pregnant woman to eat less than the prescribed measure due to danger. Due to danger, even a lot you may eat! Rav Papa said, so it was taught: They permitted her to the pregnant woman less than the prescribed measure, even a lot, due to danger.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי: הִתִּירוּ לְמַגַּע טְמֵא מֵת לְהָנִיק אֶת בְּנָהּ, וּבְנָהּ טָהוֹר – אַמַּאי טָהוֹר? כֵּיוָן דִּיינַק חָלָב אִיטַּמִּי לֵיהּ מֵחָלָב!
human_translation: taught contact impure a corpse, permitted to nurse her child, and her child pure Why pure? Once he nurses the milk he becomes impure from the milk.
llm_translation: The text states: They permitted a person who is impure due to contact with a dead body to nurse her son, and her son is pure - why is he pure? Since he sucks milk from her, he becomes pure from milk!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: לָא אִיתַּכְשַׁר – נִתַּכְשַׁר בְּטִיפָּה מְלוּכְלֶכֶת עַל פִּי הַדַּד! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: בִּתְקִיפָה אַחַת, לֹא הִנִּיחַ טִיפָּה מְלוּכְלֶכֶת עַל פִּי הַדַּד.
human_translation: And if you would say was not rendered susceptible it rendered susceptible due to the drop smeared on the nipple. Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: with one strong not leave a drop smeared on the nipple.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if you say: it is not valid - it is valid with a drop of diluted wine according to Hadad! Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: with one drop, he did not leave a drop of diluted wine according to Hadad.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁתֵּי תְשׁוּבוֹת בַּדָּבָר: חֲדָא, דְּקָחָזֵינָא לְפוּמֵּיהּ דְּיָנוֹקָא דִּמְלֵא חָלָב! וְעוֹד, מְקוֹם חָלָב מַעְיָין הוּא.
human_translation: Rava said: two refutations of statement: One that we see the mouth of the infant is filled with milk, And furthermore, the location the milk is a spring,
llm_translation: Rava said: Two responses in the matter: One, that we see in the mouth of the nursing infant that is full of milk! And furthermore, the place of milk is a spring.

hebrew_text: דְּקָתָנֵי: חֲלֵב אִשָּׁה מְטַמֵּא בֵּין לְרָצוֹן וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא לְרָצוֹן, (בְּהֵמָה אֵינָהּ מְטַמֵּא אֶלָּא לְרָצוֹן.)
human_translation: As teaches: A woman’s milk renders impurity, whether emerges to satisfaction or not to satisfaction. an animal renders to impurity only to satisfaction
llm_translation: The text states: "The fat of a woman defiles whether it is intentional or unintentional, (but with an animal, it only defiles if it is intentional)."

hebrew_text: מַאי לַָאו ״שֶׁלֹּא לְרָצוֹן״ – דְּלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ, וְקָתָנֵי: ״מְטַמֵּא״?
human_translation: What, is it not not to satisfaction that not amenable and teaches renders impurity?
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "not willingly"? - Because it is not pleasing to him, and it is taught: "He defiles."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דִּבְנָהּ טָהוֹר – דְּסָפֵק יָנַק כַּשִּׁיעוּר וְסָפֵק לֹא יָנַק, וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר יָנַק, סָפֵק יְנָקוֹ בַּאֲכִילַת פְּרָס, סְפֵק יְנָקוֹ בְּיוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said this is the reason that her child pure: that uncertain nursed the measure or not nurse And if you say nursed uncertain nursed within eat a half-loaf nursed in more than to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: This is the reason why the egg of a clean bird is pure - because if it is possible that it nursed the proper amount and if it is possible that it did not nurse, and if you can say that it nursed, it is possible that it nursed through the eating of a half-olive size piece, and it is possible that it nursed through more than the amount of a half-olive size piece.

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא, מְקוֹם חָלָב מַעְיָין הוּא, וְלֹא צָרִיךְ הֶכְשֵׁר?
human_translation: And according to Rava, the location milk is a spring, and and it does not need rendered susceptible
llm_translation: And for Rava, the place of milk is a spring, and it does not require kashering?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁנָּטַף חָלָב מִדַּדֶּיהָ וְנָפַל לַאֲוִיר תַּנּוּר – תַּנּוּר טָמֵא. וְקַשְׁיָא לַן: בְּמַאי אִיתַּכְשַׁר? וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּטִיפָּה מְלוּכְלֶכֶת עַל פִּי הַדַּד.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn woman who had milk dripping from her nipples, and it fell into the airspace of an oven, the oven impure. And a difficulty for us: In what rendered susceptible And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: by the drop smeared on the nipple.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And we learned in a Mishnah: If a woman dripped milk from her breasts and it fell into the opening of an oven - the oven is impure. And we have a difficulty: With what does it become permissible? And Rabbi Yochanan said: With a drop that is mixed on the mouth of the breast.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, רָבָא לָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְהָתַנְיָא: נִמְצֵאתָ אַתָּה אוֹמֵר, תִּשְׁעָה מַשְׁקִין בְּזוֹב: הַזֵּיעָה, וְלֵיחָה סְרוּחָה, וְרֶיעִי – טְהוֹרִין מִכְּלוּם. דִּמְעַת עֵינוֹ, וְדַם מַגֵּפָתוֹ,
human_translation: And if you would say Rava does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, but isn’t it taught You are found saying nine liquids with regard to a zav : The sweat, ill-smelling pus, and excrement pure than all of them, The tears eye, and the blood wound,
llm_translation: And if you will say, Rava does not hold like Rabbi Yochanan, and it was taught: You have found, you say, nine liquids in zov: sweat, and saliva, and mucus - they are pure from all of them. Tears, and blood of his wound,

hebrew_text: וַחֲלֵב אִשָּׁה – מְטַמְּאִין טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין בִּרְבִיעִית. רוּקּוֹ, זוֹבוֹ, וּמֵימֵי רַגְלָיו – מְטַמְּאִין טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה, בְּכֹל שֶׁהוּא.
human_translation: and the milk of a woman transmit impurity of liquids where a quarter- saliva, gonorrhea-like discharge and urine transmit severe impurity in any amount.
llm_translation: "And the fat of a woman - imparts impurity of liquids in the fourth degree. His spit, his semen, and the water of his feet - impart a severe impurity, in all that it is."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מְקוֹם חָלָב מְעַיֵּין [הוּא], חָלָב נָמֵי נְטַמֵּא טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה בְּכֹל שֶׁהוּא, כְּזוֹבוֹ וְרוּקּוֹ! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מְקוֹם חֲלֵב אִשָּׁה לָאו מַעְיָין הוּא.
human_translation: And if you say the location milk a spring, milk also should transmit severe impurity in any amount, like the gonorrhea-like discharge and his saliva. Rather, conclude from it the location milk of a woman is not a spring,
llm_translation: And if you say, "The place of milk is the intestines, milk of a woman becomes impure with a severe impurity in everything it touches, like its flow and its spit!" Rather, learn from it: the place of a woman's milk is not the intestines.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, קַשְׁיָא הָא מַתְנִיתָא וְאָמַר רָבָא: ״מְטַמֵּא בֵּין לְרָצוֹן וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא לְרָצוֹן״!
human_translation: If so, this mishna Rava said is difficult, renders impurity whether to satisfaction or not to satisfaction.
llm_translation: So it is difficult, the question of the Mishnah, and Rava said: "It defiles whether it is intentional or unintentional!"

hebrew_text: מִי סָבְרַתְּ ״שֶׁלֹּא לְרָצוֹן״ דְּאָמַר – דְּלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ? לָא, מַאי ״שֶׁלֹּא לְרָצוֹן״ דְּאָמַר, דְּדַעְתֵּיהּ דְּתִינוֹק קָרִיבָא לְגַבֵּי חָלָב, אֲבָל אָמַר לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ – טָהוֹר.
human_translation: Do you maintain Not to satisfaction, that states, that is not amenable to him? No; what Not to satisfaction, that states? as a child’s mind is close to milk, But he says, not amenable to him, pure.
llm_translation: Who holds "not willingly" that he said - that it is not pleasing to him? No, what is "not willingly" that he said, that the mind of the infant is drawn close to milk, but he said it is not pleasing to him - pure.

hebrew_text: אָכַל אוֹכָלִין טְמֵאִין וְכוּ׳. לְמָה לִי שְׁהִיָּיה, דְּקָתָנֵי: וְשָׁהָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: אָכַל אוֹכָלִין טְמֵאִין, וְשָׁתָה מַשְׁקִין טְמֵאִין, וְשָׁתָה רְבִיעִית יַיִן, וְשָׁהָה בַּאֲכִילָתָן וּבִשְׁתִיָּיתָן כְּדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס, וְנִכְנַס לַמִּקְדָּשׁ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: ate ritually impure foods Why do I remain that it teaches: And remained Rav Yehuda said this is teaching: ate ritually impure foods or drank impure liquids, or drank a quarter- of wine, and remained in eating them or drinking them to eat a half-loaf and entered the Temple, liable.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Achal ochalin temein v'chul. L'mah li shehiyah, dekatanei: v'shaha? Amar Rav Yehudah, hachi katanei: Achal ochalin temein, v'shatah mashkin temein, v'shatah revi'it yayin, v'shaha ba'achilatan uvishitiyatan k'dei achilat pras, v'nichnas lamikdash - chayav." English translation: "He who ate impure foods, etc. Why do I need 'and he stayed'? Rav Yehudah said: This is what is taught: He who ate impure foods, and drank impure beverages, and drank a revi'it of wine, and stayed in their eating and drinking the time it takes to eat half a loaf, and entered the Temple - he is liable."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר אַל תֵּשְׁתְּ״ – יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ כֹּל שֶׁהוּא, אֲפִילּוּ מִגִּתּוֹ?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: The Sages taught “Drink no wine nor intoxicating drink, might even any amount, even from its press,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: "It was taught by the Sages: 'Wine and strong drink you shall not drink.'" - Can this mean even any amount, even from its very essence?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְשֵׁכָר״ – אֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא כְּדֵי לְשַׁכֵּר, וְכַמָּה כְּדֵי לְשַׁכֵּר? רְבִיעִית יַיִן בֶּן אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם.
human_translation: the verse states: “Nor intoxicating drink,” only to intoxicate prohibited. And how much to intoxicate? a quarter- wine forty days old,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And strong drink" - it is prohibited only in the amount to become intoxicated, and how much is the amount to become intoxicated? A quarter of a log of wine aged forty days.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יַיִן״? לוֹמַר לְךָ שֶׁמּוּזְהָרִין עָלָיו כֹּל שֶׁהוּא, וּמוּזְהָרִין עָלָיו מִגִּתּוֹ.
human_translation: If so, why the verse state “wine,” to tell you that prohibited any amount of it, and prohibited from its press
llm_translation: If so, what does the Talmud say "wine" for? To tell you that one should be cautious with it in every way, and be cautious with it from its press.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״יַיִן״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא יַיִן, שְׁאָר מְשַׁכְּרִין מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְשֵׁכָר״. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יַיִן״? עַל הַיַּיִן – בְּמִיתָה, וְעַל שְׁאָר מַשְׁקִין – בְּאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: “wine” I have only wine from where other intoxicating beverages The verse states: “Nor intoxicating drink.” If so, why the verse state “wine”? for wine death but for other drinks, prohibition.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "Wine" - I have only wine, from where do I derive that other intoxicants are included? The Torah teaches: "And strong drink." If so, why does the Torah say: "Wine"? Regarding wine - with regard to death penalty, and regarding other beverages - with a warning.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: ״יַיִן אַל תֵּשְׁתְּ וְשֵׁכָר״ – אַל תִּשְׁתֵּהוּ כְּדֶרֶךְ שִׁכְרוּתוֹ, הָא אִם הִפְסִיק בּוֹ, אוֹ נָתַן לְתוֹכוֹ מַיִם כֹּל שֶׁהוּא – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Wine you shall not drink, and intoxicating drink, you shall not drink it in the manner of its being intoxicating. if one interrupted or placed any amount of water into it exempt.
