llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: "Wine do not drink, and strong drink" - do not drink it in the manner of its intoxication. But if one diluted it, or added water to it, any amount - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי פְלִיגִי? תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: גָּמְרִינַן ״שֵׁכָר״ ״שֵׁכָר״ מִנָּזִיר.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? The first tanna holds: We learn “intoxicating drink” from “intoxicating drink” a nazirite
llm_translation: With what do they argue? The first Tanna holds: We learn "wine" "wine" from a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא יָלֵיף ״שֵׁכָר״ ״שֵׁכָר״ מִנָּזִיר. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר סָבַר: מַאי ״שֵׁכָר״? מִידֵּי דְּהוּא מְשַׁכֵּר.
human_translation: But Rabbi Yehuda does not derive “intoxicating drink” from “intoxicating drink” a nazirite. And Rabbi Elazar holds: What intoxicating drink”? in the manner that it intoxicates.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda does not derive "shechar" from "shechar" of a Nazir. And Rabbi Elazar holds: What is "shechar"? From the fact that he intoxicates.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: אָכַל דְּבֵילָה קְעִילִית, וְשָׁתָה דְּבַשׁ אוֹ חָלָב, וְנִכְנַס לַמִּקְדָּשׁ וְשִׁימֵּשׁ – לוֹקֶה, כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר אֲחוֹתַאי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. וְקָרֵי רַב עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״טוּבְיָנָא דְּחַכִּימֵי״.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught ate dried fig from Ke’ila, or drank honey or milk, and entered the Temple and performed flogged. In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, Rav Yehuda bar Aḥotai says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, and Rav referred to Rabbi Elazar as the most gratified of the Sages,
llm_translation: As to where did he go, this one that it was taught: One who ate a k'ayilit fig cake, and drank honey or milk, and entered the Temple and served - he is liable, according to whom? According to Rabbi Yehuda. Rav Yehuda bar Achotai said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Elazar. And Rav would call him: "The wise scholars' tubyana."

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא דְּהוּצָל הֲוָה נִידְרָא עֲלַהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל הָאִידָּנָא וְתָא לִמְחַר, דְּרַב לָא מוֹקֵי אָמוֹרָא עֲלֵיהּ מִיּוֹמָא טָבָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם שִׁכְרוּת.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Huzal had a vow from his wife. He came before Rav Ashi said to him: Go now and come tomorrow, as Rav not place a disseminator before him from Festival until the other, due to drunkenness.
llm_translation: Rav Acha who was a eunuch had a vow upon him from his household, he came before Rav Ashe, he said to him: "Go now and come tomorrow, for Rav does not establish a matter concerning him from one day to the next for the sake of reward."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, וְהָאָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וּמָר הוּא דְּקָא רָמֵי בֵּיהּ מַיָּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בִּרְבִיעִית, הָא בְּיוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי רְבִיעִית.
human_translation: said to him: But doesn’t Rav say: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Elazar and the Master is who puts water into said to him: That not difficult; that where a quarter this more than a quarter
llm_translation: He said to him, and Rav said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Eliezer, and the master is raising an objection against him from water! He said to him, this is not difficult: this is in the fourth level of impurity, this is more than the fourth level of impurity.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וּלְהַבְדִּיל בֵּין הַקֹּדֶשׁ וּבֵין הַחוֹל״ – אֵלּוּ דָּמִין וַעֲרָכִין, חֲרָמִין וְהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught “And that you may differentiate between the sacred and the common.” These values and valuations, dedications and consecrations,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And to distinguish between the holy and the common" - these are blood and valuations, cherem and consecrated items.

hebrew_text: ״בֵּין הַטָּמֵא וּבֵין הַטָּהוֹר״ – אֵלּוּ טְמָאוֹת וּטְהָרוֹת. ״וּלְהוֹרוֹת״ – זוֹ הוֹרָאָה. ״אֵת כׇּל הַחוּקִּים״ – אֵלּוּ מִדְרָשׁוֹת. ״אֲשֶׁר דְּבַר ה׳״ – זוֹ הֲלָכָה. ״בְּיַד מֹשֶׁה״ – זֶה תַּלְמוּד.
human_translation: “Between the impure and the pure”; these ritually impure and ritually pure “And that you may instruct”; this issuing a ruling “All the statutes”; this expositions “Which the Lord has spoken”; this halakha “By the hand of Moses”; this Talmud,
llm_translation: "Between the impure and the pure" - these are impurities and purities. "And to instruct" - this is teaching. "All the statutes" - these are interpretations. "Which the Lord has spoken" - this is halakha. "By the hand of Moses" - this is the Talmud.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אַף הַמִּשְׁנָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּלְהוֹרוֹת״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל אַף תַּלְמוּד? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּלְהוֹרוֹת״.
human_translation: might even Mishna the verse states: “And that you may instruct,” Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: might even Talmud the verse states: “And that you may instruct,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Yachol af hamishneh? Talmud lomar: 'ul'horoht'. Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda omer: Yachol af Talmud? Talmud lomar: 'ul'horoht'." English translation: "Can the Mishnah also teach? The Torah states: 'and for teaching.' Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Can the Talmud also teach? The Torah states: 'and for teaching.'"

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: יָצָא שֶׁרֶץ טָמֵא, וּצְפַרְדֵּעַ טָהוֹר, שֶׁשְּׁתוּיֵי יַיִן מוֹרִין בָּהֶן הוֹרָאָה. נֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וְלָא רַבָּנַן? – אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּזִיל קְרִי בֵּי רַב הוּא.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught a creeping animal is ritually impure and a frog is pure excluded as those who have drunk wine may issue ruling Let us say is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, and not the Rabbis. You even say the Rabbis, and this is different, as is go learn in a children’s school,
llm_translation: As to where did he go? This that it was taught: A creeping thing is impure, and a frog is pure, that two cups of wine impart teaching. Let us say, Rabbi Yosei the son of Rabbi Yehuda said it, and not the Rabbis? - Even if you say the Rabbis, it is different here, for he went to the study hall of Rav.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְהָא רַב לָא מוֹקֵים אָמוֹרָא מִיּוֹמָא טָבָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם שִׁכְרוּת! שָׁאנֵי רַב, דְּאוֹרִי מוֹרֵי. וְנֹיקֵם (דְּלָא) [וְלָא] לוֹרֵי! – כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּיָתֵיב רַב לָא סַגִּי לֵיהּ בְּלָא הוֹרָאָה.
human_translation: Rav says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, But Rav not place a disseminator before him from Festival until the other, due to drunkenness. Rav is different, as he would issue rulings And let him place but not issue rulings. Wherever Rav sits not possible without ruling.
llm_translation: Rav said: The halacha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda. But didn't Rav retract his statement on a different day in order to avoid receiving payment? Rav is different, as he is a master who teaches. And he retracted (and did not) teach! - Whenever Rav is sitting, he is not satisfied without teaching.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יֵשׁ אוֹכֵל אֲכִילָה אַחַת וְחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ אַרְבָּעָה חַטָּאוֹת וְאָשָׁם אֶחָד: טָמֵא שֶׁאָכַל חֵלֶב, וְהָיָה נוֹתָר מִן הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין, בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: There is a single eating and liable four sin offerings and one guilt offering for it. ritually impure who ate fat, and it was left over from a consecrated [ notar ], on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There is one who eats one portion and is liable for four sin-offerings and one guilt-offering. A ritually impure person who ate forbidden fat, and there remained from the consecrated items on the Day of Atonement.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיָה שַׁבָּת וְהוֹצִיאוֹ – חַיָּיב. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵינוֹ מִן הַשֵּׁם.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: If it was Shabbat and he carried it out liable said to him: is not from the type
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: If it was Shabbat and he carried it out - liable. They said to him: It is not from the name.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ נֵימָא אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר? נְהִי דְּאִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר לֵית לֵיהּ, אִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל וְאִיסּוּר מוֹסִיף אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Let us say Rabbi Meir holds a prohibition takes effect prohibition Although he does not hold a prohibition takes effect prohibition inclusive prohibition and an expanded prohibition, he holds
llm_translation: Gemara: Does Rabbi Meir hold that one prohibition can take effect upon another prohibition? Even though one prohibition can take effect upon another prohibition, it does not have the power to take effect upon it. A general prohibition and an additional prohibition have the power to take effect upon it.

hebrew_text: טָהוֹר, מֵעִיקָּרָא לָא אֲסִיר אֶלָּא בְּחֵלֶב, הֲוָה לֵיהּ טָמֵא, מִיגּוֹ דַּאֲסִיר בַּחֲתִיכוֹת טְהוֹרוֹת – אִיתּוֹסַף בֵּיהּ נָמֵי אִיסּוּרָא עִילָּוֵי חֵלֶב.
human_translation: initially pure was prohibited only of fat. became impure, since he prohibited from pure pieces prohibition is also added fat.
llm_translation: Pure, from the outset not forbidden except with fat, it was considered impure, because it was forbidden in pure pieces - with it was added another prohibition on top of the fat.

hebrew_text: וְחֵלֶב מֵעִיקָּרָא לָא אֲסִיר אֶלָּא בַּאֲכִילָה, אַקְדְּשֵׁיהּ, מִיגּוֹ דְּאִיתּוֹסַף בֵּיהּ אִיסּוּרָא דַּהֲנָאָה – אִיתּוֹסַף בֵּיהּ לְגַבֵּי חֵלֶב.
human_translation: And fat was initially forbidden only in consumption. consecrated since the prohibition deriving benefit was added to it, it was added with regard to fat.
llm_translation: And fat from the primary source is not forbidden except through eating, sanctify it, from the fact that the prohibition of benefit is added to it - the prohibition of benefit is added to it regarding fat.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי לְהֶדְיוֹט הוּא דַּאֲסִיר אֲבָל לְגָבוֹהַּ שְׁרֵי, הֲוָה לֵיהּ נוֹתָר, מִיגּוֹ דְּאִיתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּרָא לְגַבֵּי גָּבוֹהַּ – אִיתּוֹסַף בֵּיהּ לְגַבֵּי הֶדְיוֹט. חָל עֲלֵיהּ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, מִיגּוֹ דְּאִיתּוֹסַף בֵּיהּ אִיסּוּר לְגַבֵּי חוּלִּין – אִיתּוֹסַף בֵּיהּ לְגַבֵּי גָבוֹהַּ.
human_translation: And still, prohibited to an ordinary but it is permitted to the Most High, it becomes leftover, since a prohibition was added with regard to the Most High, added with regard to an ordinary Yom Kippur, takes effect with regard to it, since a prohibition was added with regard to non-sacred is added with regard to to the Most High.
llm_translation: And as for a commoner, he who is forbidden, but for a distinguished person it is permitted, he would remain, because when the prohibition was added regarding the distinguished person, it was added in relation to the commoner. If it fell on him on Yom Kippur, because when the prohibition was added regarding Yom Kippur, it was added in relation to weekday activities – it was added in relation to the distinguished person.

hebrew_text: וְנִתְנֵי: חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת, וְנוֹקְמַהּ כְּגוֹן דַּאֲכַל כְּזַיִת פִּיגּוּל! בַּחֲדָא בְּהֵמָה קָמַיְירֵי, בִּשְׁתֵּי בְּהֵמוֹת לָא קָמַיְירֵי, וְנוֹתָר וּפִיגּוּל בַּחֲדָא בְּהֵמָה לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ.
human_translation: And let teach: five sin offerings, and interpret it where he ate an olive-bulk an offering that was sacrificed with the intent to consume it after its appointed time [ piggul ]. referring of one animal, not referring of two animals, and you do not find leftover and piggul to one animal.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Five sin-offerings, and retribution is like eating a revolting thing! In the case of one animal, they are liable, in the case of two animals, they are not liable, and the leftover and the revolting thing in one animal you do not forget for it.

hebrew_text: אַלְּמָה לָא? מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁהֶעֱלָה אֵבֶר פִּיגּוּל לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, דְּפָקַע פִּיגּוּלֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ נוֹתָר,
human_translation: Why not You find it where one brought upon the altar a limb piggul , as its piggul been abrogated, and it becomes notar
llm_translation: Why not? You find her like a case where he brought a limb of a disqualified offering onto the altar, where he removed its disqualification and it became valid.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְאָמַר עוּלָּא: קוֹמֶץ פִּיגּוּל שֶׁהֶעֱלָה לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ – פָּקַע פִּיגּוּלוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ נוֹתָר. בְּאֵבֶר אֶחָד קָא מַיְירֵי, בִּשְׁנֵי אֵבָרִים לָא קָמַיְירֵי, וְנוֹתָר וּפִיגּוּל בְּחַד אֵבֶר לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ.
human_translation: And as Ulla says: a handful of piggul that one brought upon the altar, its piggul been abrogated and it becomes leftover. referring to one limb, not referring to two limbs, and you do not find notar and piggul with regard to one limb.
llm_translation: And as Ula said: A handful of Pigul that was brought up to the top of the altar - its Pigul is removed from it and it remains. In one limb it is explained, in two limbs it is not explained, and it remains, and Pigul in one limb you do not forget about it.

hebrew_text: אַלְּמָה לָא? מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁהֶעֱלָה אֵבֶר פִּיגּוּל לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, דְּפַלְגֵיהּ אַנְּחֵיהּ עַל גַּבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, וּפַלְגֵיהּ מֵאַבָּרַאי דְּמִזְבֵּחַ, דְּהָהוּא דְּמִזְבֵּחַ פָּקַע פִּיגּוּל וַהֲוָה לֵיהּ נוֹתָר, וְכִדְאָמַר עוּלָּא: קוֹמֶץ פִּיגּוּל שֶׁהֶעֱלָה עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ – פָּקַע פִּיגּוּלוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ וְהָוֵי לֵיהּ נוֹתָר!
human_translation: Why no You find it where one brought a limb a piggul upon the altar, he placed half of it upon the altar and half of it outside of the altar. that altar, piggul been abrogated and it becomes notar . And as Ulla says: a handful of piggul that one brought upon the altar, its piggul been abrogated and it becomes notar .
llm_translation: Why not? You find it like a case where he brought a limb of a disqualified offering onto the altar, he divided it, placing half of it on the altar, and the other half from the limbs of the altar, for that which was on the altar, the disqualified part split off and remained, as Ulla said: If a limb of a disqualified offering was brought onto the altar - its disqualified part splits off from it and remains!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, אִי רוּבָּא דְּמִזְבֵּחַ – שִׁדְיֵיהּ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ, רוּבָּא דְּבָרַאי – שִׁדְיֵיהּ לְבָרַאי.
human_translation: said to No, the majority on the altar, throw it on the altar, the majority outside throw it outside,
llm_translation: He said to him: No, if the majority of the altar - leave it for the altar, if the majority of his words - leave it for his words.

hebrew_text: תִּפְשׁוֹט דְּבָעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הָלְכוּ בְּאֵבָרִים אַחַר הָרוֹב אוֹ לֹא! אֶלָּא, בִּכְזַיִת אֶחָד קָמַיְירֵי, בִּשְׁנֵי זֵיתִים לָא קָא מַיְירֵי.
human_translation: resolve that Rami bar Ḥama raised: follow the majority with regard to limbs or not? Rather, referring to one olive-bulk not referring to two olive-bulks.
llm_translation: He grasped the words of Ramei bar Hama: Do they follow the majority in limbs or not! Rather, they are arguing over one olive's worth, not over two olives.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָקָתָנֵי ״יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים״, וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים כּוֹתֶבֶת [הוּא] דְּמִחַיַּיב, וְכוֹתֶבֶת אִית בַּיהּ שְׁנֵי זֵיתִים!
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught Yom Kippur, and on Yom Kippur volume of a large date that obligates and volume of a large date contains two olives?
llm_translation: And not? And it was taught, "Yom HaKippurim," and on Yom HaKippurim she writes that he is obligated, and she writes that there are two olives in it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָכַל כּוּלְיָא בְּחֶלְבָּהּ. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דְּמַלְּיֵיהּ בְּתַמְרֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: where he eats a kidney with the fat it. Rav Pappa said: where he completed with dates.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: For example, if one ate the entire animal with its fat. Rav Papa said: For example, if one filled it with dates.

hebrew_text: רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַחָא מַתְנֵי ״חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת״, וּמְתָרֵיץ לַהּ: כְּגוֹן דַּאֲכַל כְּזַיִת פִּיגּוּל, וְלָא מְשַׁנֵּי כְּהָנֵי שִׁינּוּיֵי דְּקָא מְשַׁנֵּינַן.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Aḥa teaches five sin offerings and he interprets it where one ate an olive-bulk of piggul and he does not answer with these answers that we answered
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Acha teaches "five sin offerings," and he resolves it: for example, one who ate an olive size of disqualified meat, and did not change the status of the priests who are changing.

hebrew_text: וְנִתְנֵי: ״שֵׁשׁ חַטָּאוֹת״, וְנוֹקְמַהּ כְּגוֹן דַּאֲכַל כְּזַיִת דָּם! בַּחֲדָא אֲכִילָה קָא מַיְירֵי, בִּשְׁתֵּי אֲכִילוֹת לֹא קָא מַיְירֵי, וְשִׁיעֲרוּ חֲכָמִים דְּאֵין בֵּית הַבְּלִיעָה מַחֲזִיק יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁנֵי זֵיתִים.
human_translation: And let teach six sin offerings, and interpret it where he consumed an olive-bulk of blood referring to one eating, not referring to two eating, and the Sages calculated that throat does not hold more than two olive-bulks
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: 'Six sins,' and the punishment is like one who ate an olive's worth of blood! In one eating it is explained, in two eatings it is not explained, and the sages estimated that the stomach cannot hold more than two olives."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. וְנִתְנֵי: ״אִם הוֹצִיאוֹ – חַיָּיב״, מַאי טַעְמָא קָתָנֵי ״אִם הָיְתָה שַׁבָּת״? אָמַר רַפְרָם: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: עֵירוּב וְהוֹצָאָה לְשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין עֵירוּב וְהוֹצָאָה לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: And let teach: If he carried it out liable, What is the reason teaches: If it was Shabbat Rafram said: That is to say joining and carrying with regard to Shabbat, joining and carrying do not with regard to Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says, etc. And it was taught: "If he carried out - he is liable." What is the reason that it teaches "if it was Shabbat"? Rafhram said: This means: Eruv and carrying out for Shabbat, and there is no Eruv and carrying out for Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא יֵשׁ עֵירוּב וְהוֹצָאָה לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אִם הָיְתָה שַׁבָּת וְהוֹצִיאוֹ – חַיָּיב אַף מִשּׁוּם שַׁבָּת וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים!
human_translation: From where Perhaps joining and carrying do to Yom Kippur, and this is teaching: If it was Shabbat and he carried it out liable due to Shabbat and also Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps there is an eruv and carrying out on Yom Kippur, and thus it teaches: If it was Shabbat and he carried out - he is liable even for both Shabbat and Yom Kippur!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר דְּרַפְרָם עַל הָדָא אִיתְּמַר, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְשִׁלַּח בְּיַד אִישׁ עִתִּי״, ״אִישׁ״ – לְהַכְשִׁיר אֶת הַזָּר. ״עִתִּי״ – אֲפִילּוּ בְּטוּמְאָה וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת, ״עִתִּי״ – בִּמְזוּמָּן.
human_translation: Rather, if of Rafram was stated, was stated with regard to this as it is taught “And he shall send it away with an appointed man “man” to render a non-priest fit “appointed” even in ritual impurity, and even on Shabbat. “appointed” to designated
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated that Refram said on this matter, it was stated as follows: "And he shall send by the hand of a timely man," "man" - to make the non-priest eligible. "Timely" - even in a state of impurity and even on Shabbat, "timely" - at the appointed time.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי: ״עִתִּי״ – אֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת, אָמַר רַפְרָם: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת עֵירוּב וְהוֹצָאָה לְשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין עֵירוּב וְהוֹצָאָה לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: taught “appointed” even on Shabbat, Rafram says: That is to say joining and carrying with regard to Shabbat, joining and carrying do not with regard to Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: The text states: "It is taught: 'At its time' - even on Shabbat," Raphram said: This means Eruv and carrying out on Shabbat, and there is no Eruv and carrying out on Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? שָׁאנֵי שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, דְּהֶכְשֵׁירוֹ בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים בְּכָךְ! אֶלָּא דְּרַפְרָם בְּרוּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: From where the scapegoat is different, as its validity on Yom Kippur is in this Rather, of Rafram is an error [ beruta ],
llm_translation: From what? Different is the goat that is raised, for it is made fit on Yom Kippur in this way! Rather, it is a wild goat.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יֵשׁ בָּא בִּיאָה אַחַת וְחַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ שֵׁשׁ חַטָּאוֹת, כֵּיצַד? הַבָּא עַל בִּתּוֹ חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם בִּתּוֹ, וַאֲחוֹתוֹ, אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, וְאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו, וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְנִדָּה.
human_translation: There is one engage in a single intercourse and liable six sin offerings for it. How so? one who engages in intercourse with his daughter liable due to his daughter, his sister, the wife of his brother, the wife of his father’s brother, a married woman, and a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There is a case of intercourse that incurs six sin-offerings. How so? If one has intercourse with his daughter, he is liable for her as his daughter, his sister, his brother's wife, his father's brother's wife, a married woman, and a menstruating woman.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָא לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר! נְהִי דְּאִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר לֵית לֵיהּ, אִיסּוּר מוֹסִיף וְאִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But Rabbi Meir does not hold a prohibition takes effect prohibition Although he does not hold a prohibition takes effect prohibition an expanded prohibition and a more inclusive prohibition, he does hold
llm_translation: Gemara: And this question does not apply to Rabbi Meir - one prohibition does not take effect on another prohibition! Even though one prohibition does not take effect on another prohibition, if there is an additional prohibition and a general prohibition, it does take effect.

hebrew_text: כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּא עַל אִמּוֹ וְהוֹלִיד בַּת, דְּאִיסּוּר בִּתּוֹ וַאֲחוֹתוֹ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי אָתֵי. נִשֵּׂאת לְאָחִיו, מִיגּוֹ דְּאִיתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּר לְגַבֵּי אַחִין – אִיתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּרָא לְגַבֵּי דִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: where one engaged in intercourse with his mother and fathered a daughter, so the prohibitions his daughter and his sister come simultaneously. married his brother, since a prohibition was added with regard to brothers, prohibition is added with regard to him
llm_translation: For example, if one came upon his mother and fathered a daughter, the prohibition of his daughter and his sister come together. If she marries his brother, since the prohibition of his brother is added to the prohibitions - the prohibition of his brother is added to her own.

hebrew_text: נִשֵּׂאת לַאֲחִי אָבִיו, מִיגּוֹ דְּאִיתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּרָא לְגַבֵּי שְׁאָר אֲחֵי אָבִיו – אִיתּוֹסַף לְגַבֵּי דִּידֵיהּ. הָוְיָא לַהּ אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, מִיגּוֹ דְּאִיתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּר לְגַבֵּי עָלְמָא – אִיתּוֹסַף נָמֵי לְגַבֵּי דִּידֵיהּ. הָוְיָא לַהּ נִדָּה, מִיגּוֹ דְּאִיתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּר לְגַבֵּי בַּעֲלַהּ – אִיתּוֹסַף נָמֵי לְגַבֵּי דִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: she married his father’s brother, since a prohibition is added with regard to his father’s other brothers, is added with regard to him. she becomes, a married woman, since a prohibition is added with regard to the world a prohibition is added with regard to him as well. she becomes a menstruating woman, since a prohibition is added with regard to her husband, a prohibition is added with regard to him as well.
llm_translation: Elevated to the brother of his father, from the aspect of the prohibition regarding the other brothers of his father - it is also considered with regard to his own. She is considered the wife of a man, from the aspect of the prohibition regarding others - it is also considered with regard to his own. She is considered a menstruating woman, from the aspect of the prohibition regarding her husband - it is also considered with regard to his own.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבָּא עַל בַּת בִּתּוֹ – חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם בַּת בִּתּוֹ, וְכַלָּתוֹ, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, וְאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו, וַאֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְנִדָּה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אִם עָבַר זָקֵן וּנְשָׂאָהּ – חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָב.
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with his daughter’s daughter liable due to his daughter’s daughter, and his daughter-in-law, and the wife of his brother, and the wife of his father’s brother, and his wife’s sister, and a married woman, and a menstruating woman. Rabbi Yosei says: If elder, transgressed and married her, liable for her due to the wife of his father.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who has relations with his granddaughter is liable on her account due to his granddaughter, his daughter-in-law, his brother's wife, his father's brother's wife, his wife's sister, a married woman, and a menstruating woman. Rabbi Yosei says: If an elderly man has relations with her, he is liable on her account due to his father's wife.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הַבָּא עַל בַּת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְעַל בַּת בִּתָּהּ.
human_translation: And likewise, one who engages in intercourse with the daughter of his wife And with daughter’s daughter
llm_translation: And so one who comes upon the daughter of his wife, and upon the daughter of her daughter.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָתָנֵי: חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָב. מִי שַׁרְיָא לֵיהּ? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּפְלָה לוֹ לְיִבּוּם.
human_translation: It is taught liable for her due to the wife of his father. Is she permitted to Rabbi Yoḥanan said: where she happened to him for levirate marriage,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: One is obligated regarding her due to the status of the wife of the father. Who is permitted to her? Rabbi Yochanan said: Such as when she fell to him for levirate marriage."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי ״עָבַר״? אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב: שֶׁעָבַר מִשּׁוּם כַּלַּת בְּנוֹ, שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: If so, what transgressed Rabbi Ya’akov said: that he transgressed due to his son’s daughter-in-law, a secondary relative,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, what is "avar"? Rabbi Yaakov said: He transgressed because of his son's wife, a second time. English translation: If so, what is "avar"? Rabbi Yaakov said: He transgressed because of his son's wife, a second time.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: כַּלָּתוֹ עֶרְוָה, כַּלַּת בְּנוֹ שְׁנִיָּה. וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּבַת בְּנוֹ, וּבְבַת בֶּן בְּנוֹ. עַד סוֹף כׇּל הַדּוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: as it is taught One’s daughter-in-law is a forbidden relative his son’s daughter-in-law is a secondary relative, and similarly, you find with regard to the daughter of his son, and with regard to the daughter of his son’s son, until the end of all generations;
llm_translation: As it was taught: His daughter-in-law is forbidden, his son's daughter-in-law is also forbidden. And likewise, you find with his son's daughter, and with his son's son's daughter. Throughout all generations.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר? וְהָא תְנַן: עָבַר עֲבֵירָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ שְׁתֵּי מִיתוֹת – נִידּוֹן בַּחֲמוּרָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: נִידּוֹן בְּזִיקָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁבָּאָה עָלָיו.
human_translation: And is Rabbi Yosei of a prohibition takes effect prohibition But didn’t we learn violated a transgression that two death penalties, he is sentenced to the harsher Rabbi Yosei says: He is sentenced according to first prohibition that applied to him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And does Rabbi Yosei hold that one prohibition takes effect upon another prohibition? But didn't we learn: If one transgresses a sin that incurs two death penalties - he is judged by the more severe one. Rabbi Yosei says: He is judged by the first liability that came upon him."

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: כֵּיצַד אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי נִידּוֹן בְּזִיקָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה? חֲמוֹתוֹ וְנַעֲשֵׂת אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ – נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם חֲמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: And it is taught In what case did Rabbi Yosei say he is sentenced according to first prohibition that applied to him? his mother-in-law and became a married woman, he is sentenced due to his mother-in-law,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: How did Rabbi Yosei say the first case of zikah is judged? His mother-in-law and she becomes a man's wife - she is judged because of his mother-in-law.

hebrew_text: אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ וְנַעֲשֵׂת חֲמוֹתוֹ – נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ!
human_translation: a married woman, became his mother-in-law, he is sentenced due to a married woman,
llm_translation: The wife of a man and she becomes his mother-in-law - she is judged as the wife of a man!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאִיסּוּר מוֹסִיף. וְכֵן כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאִיסּוּר מוֹסִיף.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: Rabbi Yosei concedes in an expanded prohibition And similarly, when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Yosei concedes with regard to an expanded prohibition.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avahu: Rabbi Yosei concedes in prohibition adds. And similarly when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Yosei concedes in prohibition adds.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיסּוּר מוֹסִיף אִיכָּא הָכָא? דְּאִיכָּא בְּרָא לְסָבָא, מִיגּוֹ דְּאִיתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּרָא לְגַבֵּי בְּרֵיהּ – אִיתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּרָא לְגַבֵּי דִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: What expanded prohibition is there here? when there is son of the grandfather, since a prohibition is added with regard to his son, prohibition is added with regard to him
llm_translation: What is the additional prohibition adding here? Because there is a son for a grandfather, since the prohibition is added to his son - the prohibition is added to himself.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבָּא עַל חֲמוֹתוֹ חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם חֲמוֹתוֹ, וְכַלָּתוֹ, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, וְאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו, וַאֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְנִדָּה. וְכֵן הַבָּא עַל אֵם חָמִיו, וְעַל אֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with his mother-in-law liable for due to his mother-in-law, and his daughter-in-law, and the wife of his brother, and the wife of his father’s brother, and his wife’s sister, and a married woman, and a menstruating woman. And likewise, one who engages in intercourse with the mother of his father-in-law or with the mother of his mother-in-law.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who engages in relations with his mother-in-law is liable on account of his mother-in-law, and likewise for his daughter-in-law, his brother's wife, his father's brother's wife, his wife's sister, a married woman, and a menstruating woman. Similarly, one who engages in relations with his father's wife or his mother-in-law is liable.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אוֹמֵר: הַבָּא עַל חֲמוֹתוֹ חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם חֲמוֹתוֹ, וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ, וְאֵם חָמִיו. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: שְׁלׇשְׁתָּן שֵׁם אֶחָד הֵן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: one who engages in intercourse with his mother-in-law liable due to his mother-in-law, and the mother of his mother-in-law, and the mother of his father-in-law. said to him: Those three are one category
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says: One who comes upon his mother-in-law is obligated towards her on account of his mother-in-law, and his mother-in-law, and his father-in-law. They said to him: The three of them have one name.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי וְסוֹמְכוֹס אָמְרוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. סוֹמְכוֹס מַאי הִיא? דִּתְנַן:
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Hoshaya says: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri and Sumakhos said the same thing. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, that which we stated Sumakhos, what is as we learned
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Hoshaya said: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri and Symmachus said one thing. Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri - what did we say? What is Symmachus? As we learned:

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטָהּ וְאֶת בַּת בִּתָּהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ שָׁחַט אֶת בִּתָּהּ – סוֹפֵג אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים. סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: סוֹפֵג שְׁמוֹנִים.
human_translation: one slaughtered and its daughter’s daughter and afterward slaughtered daughter, he incurs the forty Sumakhos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: He incurs eighty
llm_translation: He slaughtered it and its daughter, and afterwards he slaughtered its daughter - he incurs forty lashes. Simekos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: he incurs eighty lashes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דִּלְמָא לָא הִיא, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי הָכָא אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם שֵׁמוֹת מוּחְלָקִין, דְּמִיקַּרְיָא חֲמוֹתוֹ, וּמִיקַּרְיָא אֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ, וּמִיקַּרְיָא אֵם חָמִיו.
human_translation: Rava said: Perhaps it is not so, Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says only here, only due to differentiated names as she is called his mother-in-law, and she is called his mother-in-law’s mother, and she is called his father-in-law’s mother,
llm_translation: Rava said: Perhaps it is not so. Until here, Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri did not say here, but because the names are divided, it is called his father-in-law's mother, and it is called his mother-in-law, and it is called his father-in-law's mother.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל גַּבֵּי אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ, דְּכוּלְּהוּ ״אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ״ מִיקַּרְיָין, דְּאֵין שֵׁמוֹת מוּחְלָקִין – לָא.
human_translation: But with regard to a mother and its offspring where all of are called: A mother and its offspring, as there are no differentiated names not
llm_translation: Regarding him and his son, in all cases "him and his son" are considered, for names are not divided - no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס אֶלָּא גַּבֵּי אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ, דְּגוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Perhaps Sumakhos says only with regard to a mother and its offspring as differentiated bodies.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Perhaps until here it did not say "Somchos," rather regarding him and his son, as they are separate entities.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּאֵין גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין, אֵימָא כְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״שַׁאֲרָה הֵנָּה זִמָּה הִיא״, הַכָּתוּב עֲשָׂאָן לְכוּלָּן זִמָּה אַחַת.
human_translation: But here, where not differentiated bodies, say holds in accordance with Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: “They are near kinswomen; it is lewdness” the verse rendered them all one lewdness,
llm_translation: But here, where the bodies are not divided, say like Rabbi Abahu said Rabbi Yochanan holds, for Rabbi Abahu said Rabbi Yochanan: "The remnant here is a conspiracy," the Scripture made them all one conspiracy.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: שָׁאַלְתִּי אֶת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְאֶת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בָּאִיטְלֵיס שֶׁל עֵימָאוּם, שֶׁהָלְכוּ לִיקַּח בְּהֵמָה לְמִשְׁתֵּה בְנוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ וְעַל אֲחוֹת אָבִיו וְעַל אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, מַהוּ? חַיָּיב אַחַת עַל כּוּלָּן, אוֹ חַיָּיב עַל כָּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת?
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: I asked Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Yehoshua in the meat market [ itlis ] in Emmaus, where they went to purchase an animal for the feast of the son of Rabban Gamliel: one who engages in intercourse with his sister, and the sister of his father, and the sister of his mother, what is liable one for all or liable for each and every one
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Akiva said: I asked Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Yehoshua in the attic of the house of the impure, who went to purchase an animal for the feast of the son of Rabban Gamliel. If one had relations with his sister, his paternal sister, and his maternal sister, what is the law? Is he liable for one for all of them, or is he liable for each one separately?

hebrew_text: לוֹ: לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ, אֲבָל שָׁמַעְנוּ: הַבָּא עַל חָמֵשׁ נָשָׁיו נִדּוֹת בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד], שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת, (וְרוֹאֶה אֲנִי) [וְרוֹאִין אָנוּ] שֶׁהַדְּבָרִים קַל וָחֹמֶר.
human_translation: They said to We did not hear but we heard One who engages in intercourse with his five wives menstruating, during one lapse of awareness, that he is liable for each and every one And it appears to me that these matters an a fortiori
llm_translation: He: we did not hear, but we heard: one who comes upon his five wives, they are all prohibited due to his concealment, for he is liable for each and every one, and we see that the matter is a fortiori.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא כִּדְקָתָנֵי, מַאי תִּיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ? הֲרֵי שֵׁמוֹת מוּחְלָקִין, הֲרֵי גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say as teaches what raise this dilemma Aren’t they differentiated names aren’t they differentiated bodies?
llm_translation: Gemara: How so the value? If you say as it was taught, what does he require of it? Behold, the names are divided, behold, the bodies are divided!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָתָנֵי: הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹת אָבִיו שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, חַיָּיב אַחַת עַל כּוּלָּן, אוֹ חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן: הֲרֵי שֵׁמוֹת מוּחְלָקִין, אוֹ דִלְמָא הֲרֵי אֵין גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין?
human_translation: Rather, this is teaching: one who engages in intercourse with the sister of his father who is the sister of his mother, liable one for all of those or is he liable for each and every one? What is Do we say they are differentiated names Or perhaps It is not differentiated bodies;
llm_translation: Rather, thus it was taught: One who engages in relations with the sister of his father who is the sister of his mother, is liable for each one individually, or is he liable for each and every one separately? What is the ruling? Do we say: "Their names are distinct," or perhaps "Their bodies are not distinct"?

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ, אֲבָל שָׁמַעְנוּ: הַבָּא עַל חָמֵשׁ נָשָׁיו נִדּוֹת בְּבַת אַחַת, שֶׁהוּא שֵׁם אֶחָד, שֶׁחַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת מִשּׁוּם נִדָּה,
human_translation: they said to him: We did not hear but we heard one who engages in intercourse with his five wives menstruating, at the same time, which is one category that liable for each and every one due to a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: They said to him: "We did not hear, but we did hear: One who has relations with his five wives in one room, which is considered one name, is liable for each and every one of them due to impurity."

hebrew_text: וְרָאִינוּ שֶׁהַדְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה הַבָּא עַל חָמֵשׁ נָשָׁיו נִדּוֹת בְּבַת אַחַת, שֶׁהִיא שֵׁם אַחַת – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, אֲחוֹתוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אָבִיו שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, שֶׁהֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה שֵׁמוֹת – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּהֵא חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת?
human_translation: And it appears to us that these matters an a fortiori If one who engages in intercourse with his five wives menstruating, at the same time, which is one name liable for each and every one his sister who is the sister of his father the sister of his mother, which are three names, is it not logical that he should be liable for each and every one
llm_translation: And we have seen that the matters are a fortiori: And what comes upon his five wives, he vows in one daughter, that is one name - he is obligated for each and every one, his sister who is the sister of his father who is the sister of his mother, for they are three names - is it not the law that he should be obligated for each and every one?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְחָמֵשׁ נִדּוֹת – שֶׁכֵּן גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין!
human_translation: can be refuted, What about five menstruating women in that differentiated bodies,
llm_translation: There is room to refute: What is the comparison to the five categories of impurity - that their bodies are divided!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר קְרָא: ״עֶרְוַת אֲחוֹתוֹ גִלָּה״, לְחַיֵּיב עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אָבִיו שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, the verse states: he has uncovered his sister’s nakedness” to render him liable for his sister who is the sister of his father who is the sister of his mother.
llm_translation: Rather, the verse says: "He has uncovered the nakedness of his sister," to obligate for his sister who is the sister of his father, who is the sister of his mother.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּרַשִּׁיעָא בַּר רַשִּׁיעָא, שֶׁבָּא עַל אִמּוֹ וְהוֹלִיד שְׁתֵּי בָּנוֹת, וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל אַחַת מֵהֶן וְהוֹלִיד בֵּן, וּבָא בְּנוֹ עַל אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹתוֹ, שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אָבִיו, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ רַשִּׁיעָא בַּר רַשִּׁיעָא.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava says: You find it in a wicked man, the son of a wicked man. engaged in intercourse with his mother and fathered two daughters, and then engaged in intercourse with one of those and fathered a son, and his son engaged in intercourse with his mother’s sister who is his sister, is his father’s sister. is a wicked man, the son of a wicked man,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: She was found in Rashia bar Rashia, who came upon his mother and begot two daughters, then returned and came upon one of them and begot a son. And his son came upon his mother's sister, who is his aunt, who is his father's sister, making him Rashia bar Rashia.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּא עָלֶיהָ, וְחָזַר וּבָא עָלֶיהָ, וְחָזַר וּבָא עָלֶיהָ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אֶחָת.
human_translation: The Sages taught engages in intercourse with and then engages in intercourse with her, and then engages in intercourse with her, liable for each and every one the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. But the Rabbis say: He is liable only one
llm_translation: The sages taught: If one comes upon it, then goes back and comes upon it again, and goes back and comes upon it – he is liable for each and every one, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the sages say: He is only liable for one.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּבָא עַל חָמֵשׁ נָשָׁיו נִדּוֹת בְּבַת אַחַת, שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, הוֹאִיל וְהוּא גָּרַם לָהֶן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Eliezer with regard to one who engages in intercourse with his five wives menstruating, at the same time, that he is liable for each and every one since he caused them
llm_translation: The sages concede to Rabbi Eliezer in Bava Kama concerning five of his wives who were menstruating at the same time, for he is liable for each and every one, since he caused it for them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: מִי אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל וְהוּא גָּרַם לָהֶן״? וְהָתַנְיָא: הוּא בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] וְהִיא בַּחֲמִשָּׁה הֶעְלֵמוֹת – הוּא אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת וְהִיא חַיֶּיבֶת עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: Do we say since he caused them But isn’t it taught he during one lapse of awareness, but she during five lapses he is liable only one but she is liable for each and every one
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Nachman: Who said, "Since he caused it for them"? And it was taught: He in one concealment and she in five concealments - he is liable only for one and she is liable for each and every one.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְגוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין.
human_translation: Rather, say because differentiated bodies.
llm_translation: Rather say: Since the bodies are distinct.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ, קָצַר וְקָצַר – מָה לִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before reaped and reaped what Rabbi Eliezer say?
llm_translation: He asked them: "If he cut and cut - what is it for me?" said Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָתָם מִשּׁוּם דְּהוּא דַּעֲבַד תַּרְתֵּין, וְאַמְּטוּל (ל)הָכִי אָמַר: חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, וְהָכָא נָמֵי דַּעֲבַד תַּרְתֵּין,
human_translation: the reason for Rabbi Eliezer there, that performed two and therefore says liable for each and every one here too, where he performed two
llm_translation: Reason of Rabbi Eliezer there because he did two, and Amatul so said: obligated on each and each, and here also did two,

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִּלְמָא טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָתָם מִשּׁוּם דְּאִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְעָרְבָן לְבִיאוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ, אַמְּטוּל (לְ)הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, אֲבָל קָצַר כִּגְרוֹגֶרֶת וְחָזַר וְקָצַר כִּגְרוֹגֶרֶת בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד], כֵּיוָן דְּאֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְעָרֵב שְׁתֵּי גְּרוֹגְרוֹת בְּבַת אַחַת אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אֶחָת, מַאי?
human_translation: Or, perhaps the reason of Rabbi Eliezer there, that it is impossible for to combine the intercourse with one another, therefore Rabbi Eliezer says liable for each and every one But reaped a fig-bulk and then reaped fig-bulk, in a single lapse of awareness, since it is possible for him to combine the two fig-bulks at the same time, he liable only one What
llm_translation: Or perhaps the reason for Rabbi Eliezer's opinion there is because if it were possible for him to mix this with that, he would say as Rabbi Eliezer said: One is liable for each and every one, but if he cut like a dried fig and then cut like a dried fig in secret, since it is possible for him to mix two dried figs in one dough, he is only liable for one. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָתָם – מִשּׁוּם דַּעֲבַד תַּרְתֵּי, הָכָא נָמֵי הָא עֲבַד תַּרְתֵּי. וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָתָם – דְּאִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְעָרְבָן, אֲבָל אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְעָרְבָן – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אֶחָת.
human_translation: Rabba said: The reason of Rabbi Eliezer there, that performed two here too, he has performed two And Rav Yosef said: The reason of Rabbi Eliezer there, that it is impossible for him to combine but possible for him to combine them, he is liable only one
llm_translation: Rabba said: The reason for Rabbi Eliezer there - because he did two, here also he did two. And Rav Yosef said: The reason for Rabbi Eliezer there - because if he could mix, but if he could mix - he is only liable for one.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַבָּה: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב עַל וַלְדֵי מְלָאכוֹת בִּמְקוֹם אֲבוֹת מְלָאכוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to Rabba Rabbi Eliezer deems liable for subcategories labor in a situation primary categories of labor
llm_translation: Abaye raised an objection to Rava: Rabbi Eliezer obligates for the offspring of labors in the place of the primary labors.

hebrew_text: הָא אָב וְאָב, בְּבַת אַחַת – פָּטוּר. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מִשּׁוּם דְּקָעָבֵד תַּרְתֵּי, אַמַּאי פָּטוּר?
human_translation: But a primary category and primary category at the same time, exempt But if you say the reason of Rabbi Eliezer because performed two why exempt
llm_translation: The father and the father, with one daughter - exempt. And if you say the reason of Rabbi Eliezer is because it is disgraceful for both, why then exempt?

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּנַן: אֲנָא וְרַב נְחוּמִי בַּר זְכַרְיָה תַּרְגֵּימְנָא: הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן –
human_translation: Mar, son of the Sages, said: Rav Naḥumi bar Zekharya and I interpreted What are we dealing with here,
llm_translation: Master, son of the sages, said: I and Rav Neḥumi bar Zeḥarya translated: Here, with what are we dealing -

hebrew_text: בְּדָלִית הַמּוּדְלֵית עַל גַּבֵּי תְּאֵינָה וּקְצָצָן בְּבַת אַחַת, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מְחַיֵּיב רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הוֹאִיל וְשֵׁמוֹת מוּחְלָקִין וְגוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין.
human_translation: of a climbing grapevine that is trellised over a fig tree, and he cut them at the same time, Due to that Rabbi Eliezer deems liable since differentiated names and differentiated physical entities,
llm_translation: In the case of the Dalit Hamudleit on top of the Teina and cutting them in one stroke, therefore Rabbi Eliezer obligates, since the names are divided and the bodies are divided.

hebrew_text: דִּכְווֹתַהּ קָצַר וְקָצַר, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דְּמִיפְּטַר? כְּגוֹן שֶׁקָּצַר שְׁתֵּי גְּרוֹגְרוֹת בְּבַת אַחַת, אֲבָל קָצַר כִּגְרוֹגֶרֶת וְחָזַר וְקָצַר כִּגְרוֹגֶרֶת – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: In the corresponding reaped and reaped how can you find which he is exempt where he reaped two fig-bulks simultaneously, But reaped a fig-bulk and then reaped fig-bulk, liable
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If one cuts and cuts, how does one find that it is exempt? For example, if one cut two figs in one pit, but if one cuts like a fig and then returns and cuts like a fig - he is liable."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְעוֹד שָׁאַל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אֵבֶר הַמְדֻולְדָּל בַּבְּהֵמָה, מַהוּ? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ, אֲבָל שָׁמַעְנוּ אֵבֶר הַמְדֻולְדָּל בָּאָדָם שֶׁהוּא טָהוֹר, וְכָךְ הָיוּ
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Akiva asked What is a dangling limb of an animal? They said to We have not heard but we have heard a dangling limb of a person that it is ritually pure. And this would
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And Rabbi Akiva further inquired: What is the status of a limb that is hanging loose in an animal? They said to him: We have not heard about that, but we have heard about a limb that is hanging loose in a human, which is considered ritually pure, and so it was.

hebrew_text: מוּכֵּי שְׁחִין עוֹשִׂין בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, הוֹלֵךְ לוֹ עֶרֶב פֶּסַח אֵצֶל הָרוֹפֵא, וְחוֹתְכוֹ עַד שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ בּוֹ כְּשַׂעֲרָה, וְתוֹחֲבוֹ בְּסִירָא, וְנִמְשָׁךְ מִמֶּנּוּ,
human_translation: afflicted with boils, act in Jerusalem: would go on Passover eve to the doctor, would cut until he would leave by a hairbreadth impale on a thorn and would pull away from
llm_translation: Those afflicted with boils in Jerusalem, go to the doctor on the eve of Passover, and he cuts it until he leaves in it like a hair, and he applies to it a plaster, and it is drawn out from him.

hebrew_text: וְהַלָּה, עוֹשֶׂה פִּסְחוֹ וְהָרוֹפֵא עוֹשֶׂה פִּסְחוֹ, וְרוֹאֶה אֲנִי שֶׁהַדְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: And that would perform his Paschal offering, and the doctor would perform his Paschal offering, And I consider that these matters an a fortiori
llm_translation: And the Halakhah, one who performs his Pesach and the healer performs his Pesach, and I see that the matters are a fortiori.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: הַמּוֹחֵק אֶת הַכְּרֵישָׁה, וְהַסּוֹחֵט בִּשְׂעָרוֹ וּבִכְסוּתוֹ – מַשְׁקִין שֶׁבְּתוֹכוֹ אֵינָם בְּ״כִי יוּתַּן״, וְהַיּוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנּוּ הֲרֵי הֵן בְּ״כִי יוּתַּן״.
human_translation: We learned elsewhere one who wipes a leek or squeezes out in his hair or in his clothing, the liquid that within it is not under “If be put But that is released from it, is under “If be put,”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches there: One who erases the hair and squeezes it with his hair and garment - the liquids inside are not considered "Kli Yutan," but those that come out of it are considered "Kli Yutan."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וּכְרֵישָׁה עַצְמָהּ הוּכְשְׁרָה, מַאי טַעְמָא? בִּשְׁעַת פְּרִישָׁה מִמֶּנּוּ הוּכְשְׁרָה.
human_translation: Shmuel says: And the leek itself is rendered susceptible What is the reason at the moment of separation is rendered susceptible
llm_translation: Samuel said: And the head itself is valid, what is the reason? At the time of separation from it, it is valid.

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: עֶרֶב פֶּסַח הוֹלֵךְ לוֹ אֵצֶל כּוּ׳. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁעַת פְּרִישָׁתָן הוּכְשַׁר, הָא אִיכָּא נָמֵי הָהוּא אֵבֶר הַמְדוּלְדָּל, בִּשְׁעַת פְּרִישָׁתוֹ מֵאָדָם – נְטַמְּיֵיהּ לְאָדָם!
human_translation: But we learned would go on Passover eve to And if you say at the moment of separation is rendered susceptible there is also that dangling limb; at the moment of its separation from the person it should render that person ritually impure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And we learned in a Mishnah: On the eve of Passover, one goes to him (i.e., the sage). And if you say that at the time of their separation it was valid, behold, there is that hanging lobe, at the time of its separation from a person - it is concealed from a person!

hebrew_text: כִּדְקָאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּנִיתָּזִין בְּכׇל כֹּחָן, הָכָא נָמֵי, בְּנִיתָּזִין בְּכׇל כֹּחָן.
human_translation: as Rav Yosef says to are removed with great force. Here too, to are removed with great force.
llm_translation: As Rav Yosef said: "With all their might they built, here too, with all their might they built."

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָא אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב יוֹסֵף? אַהָא: זָב וּטְמֵא מֵת שֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכִים וְיָרְדוּ עֲלֵיהֶם גְּשָׁמִים, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁסּוֹחֲטִין זֶה אֶת זֶה, מַשְׁקִין הַיּוֹרְדִין מִצַּד הָעֶלְיוֹן לְצַד הַתַּחְתּוֹן – טְהוֹרִים, שֶׁאֵין מְחַשְּׁבִין אֶלָּא שֶׁיָּצְאוּ מִכּוּלָּן.
human_translation: And where, was of Rav Yosef stated? with regard to this a man who experiences a gonorrhea-like discharge [ zav ] and one ritually impure a corpse were walking and rain fell on them, although they squeeze one another liquids that flow down from the upper section to the lower section pure. as are not considered unless they have emerged from entirely.
llm_translation: And where is it stated that Rav Yosef said this? Here: A zav and a person who is impure due to contact with a dead body, who were walking and rain fell upon them, even though they were squeezing one another, the water that descends from above to below - is pure, for we only consider that they have all left.

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ מִכּוּלָּן – הֲרֵי מַכְשִׁירִין, שֶׁאֵין נֶחְשָׁבִין אֶלָּא לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּצְאוּ מִגּוּפוֹ. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּנִיתָּזִין בְּכׇל כֹּחָן.
human_translation: have emerged from entirely they render susceptible as it is considered only after it has emerged from the body Rav Yosef said: to it is removed with great force.
llm_translation: They all went out - behold they are valid, for they are not considered until they have left his body. Rav Yosef said: They are built with all their strength.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְעוֹד (שָׁאֲלוּ) [שְׁאֵלָן] רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הַשּׁוֹחֵט חֲמִשָּׁה זְבָחִים בַּחוּץ בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] מַהוּ? חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, אוֹ אַחַת עַל כּוּלָּן? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Akiva asked one who slaughters five offerings outside during one lapse of awareness, what is liable for each and every or one for all They said to We have not heard
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And furthermore, they asked Rabbi Akiva: If one slaughters five sacrifices outside the Temple in secret, what is the law? Is he liable for each one individually, or for all of them together? They said to him: We have not heard.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שָׁמַעְתִּי בְּאוֹכֵל מִזֶּבַח אֶחָד מֵחֲמִשָּׁה תַּמְחוּיִין בְּהֶעְלֵם אַחַת שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת מִשּׁוּם מְעִילָה, וְרוֹאֶה אֲנִי שֶׁהַדְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I have heard with regard to one who eats from one offering from five pots during one lapse of awareness, that he is liable for each and every due to misuse And I consider that these matters an a fortiori
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that in eating from one altar out of five, there are five concealments, one of which is liable for each and every one due to misappropriation, and I see that the matters are a fortiori.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לֹא כָּךְ שָׁאַל(ו) רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֶלָּא בְּאוֹכֵל נוֹתָר מֵחֲמִשָּׁה זְבָחִים בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] מַהוּ? חַיָּיב אַחַת עַל כּוּלָּן, אוֹ חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: not that Rabbi Akiva asked Rather, with regard to one who eats notar from five offerings during one lapse of awareness. What is liable one for all or liable for each and every one They said to We have not heard
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: Not thus asked Rabbi Akiva, rather in one who eats from the remains of five sacrifices in concealment, what is the ruling? Is he liable for one of them all, or is he liable for each one individually? They said to him: We have not heard.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שָׁמַעְתִּי בְּאוֹכֵל מִזֶּבַח אֶחָד בַּחֲמִשָּׁה תַּמְחוּיִין בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת מִשּׁוּם מְעִילָה, וְרוֹאֶה אֲנִי שֶׁהַדְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I have heard with regard to one who eats from one offering in five pots, during one lapse of awareness, that he is liable for each and every due to misuse And I consider that these matters an a fortiori
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that in eating from one altar, there are five compensations in concealment, one that is liable for each and every one due to misappropriation, and I see that the matters are a fortiori.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִם הֲלָכָה – נְקַבֵּל, אִם לָדִין – יֵשׁ תְּשׁוּבָה. אָמַר לוֹ: הָשֵׁב.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to If a halakha we will accept if on inference there is a response said to Respond.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: If it is a Halacha - we accept, if it is a judgment - there is repentance. He said to him: Return.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: וְלֹא אִם אָמַרְתָּ בִּמְעִילָה, שֶׁעָשָׂה בָּהּ אֶת הַמַּאֲכִיל כָּאוֹכֵל וְאֶת הַמְהַנֶּה כַּנֶּהֱנֶה,
human_translation: said: And no; If you said with regard to misuse As, with regard to established one who feeds like one who eats and one who gives benefit like one who derives benefit
llm_translation: He said: And not if you said in a cloak, that he made in it the one who eats like one who eats and the one who benefits like one who benefits.

hebrew_text: צֵירֵף אֶת הַמְּעִילָה לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה, תֹּאמַר בְּנוֹתָר, שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַחַת מֵאֵלּוּ.
human_translation: joined the misuse over an extended period, Would you say with regard to notar , which has none of these
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tzeiref et ha-meilah lizman merubeh, tomor b'notar, she'ein bo achas me'elu." English translation: "Burn the leftover robe when the majority of it has been used up, you shall say regarding the remainder, that it does not contain any of these."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? הָכִי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: מָה רְאָיָה לְשׁוֹחֵט מֵאוֹכֵל? מָה לְאוֹכֵל שֶׁכֵּן נֶהֱנֶה!
human_translation: What difficult for Rabbi Shimon this difficult for him: what proof for one who slaughters from one who eats? What about one who eats? in that he derives benefit
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difficulty for Rabbi Shimon? This is the difficulty for him: What is the sight for the one slaughtering compared to the one eating? What for the one eating, that he benefits!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כָּךְ (שָׁאֲלוּ) [שְׁאֵלָן]: הָאוֹכֵל נוֹתָר מֵחֲמִשָּׁה זְבָחִים בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד], מַהוּ? חַיָּיב בְּכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת, אוֹ אַחַת עַל כּוּלָּן? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ.
human_translation: Rather, he asked him this: one who eats notar from five offerings during one lapse of awareness, what is liable for each and every one or one for all of them? They said to We have not heard
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, thus (they asked): One who eats from five sacrifices unknowingly (one), what is the law? Is he liable for each one individually, or for one for all of them? They said to him: We have not heard. English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שָׁמַעְתִּי בְּאוֹכֵל מִזֶּבַח אֶחָד מֵחֲמִשָּׁה תַּמְחוּיִין בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] שֶׁחַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת מִשּׁוּם מְעִילָה, וְרוֹאֶה אֲנִי שֶׁהַדְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר – מָה מִזֶּבַח אֶחָד שֶׁאֵין גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת מִשּׁוּם תַּמְחוּיִין מוּחְלָקִין, חֲמִשָּׁה זְבָחִים דְּגוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I have heard with regard to one who eats from one offering from five pots, during one lapse of awareness, that liable for each and every due to misuse And I consider that these matters an a fortiori Just as from one offering in not differentiated physical entities, liable for each and every because differentiated pots, five offerings, which differentiated physical entities, not all the more so
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that in the case of one who eats from one out of five sacrifices in secret, he is liable for each and every one of them due to misappropriation. And I see that the matter is a fortiori - if in the case of one sacrifice where the bodies are not divided, one is liable for each and every one due to misappropriation, then certainly in the case of five sacrifices where the bodies are divided, is this not all the more so?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לֹא כָּךְ שָׁאַל(ו), אֶלָּא בְּאוֹכֵל (מזבח אחד) נוֹתָר מֵחֲמִשָּׁה זְבָחִים בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד], מַהוּ? חַיָּיב אַחַת עַל כּוּלָּן, אוֹ חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: not that asked Rather, with regard to one who eats notar from five offerings during one lapse of awareness. What is liable one for all or liable for each and every one They said to We have not heard
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: Not like this they asked, rather in eating (from one altar) remains from five sacrifices in concealment (one) one, what? Obligated one for all of them, or obligated for each and every one? They said to him: We did not hear.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: שָׁמַעְתִּי בְּאוֹכֵל מִזֶּבַח אֶחָד בַּחֲמִשָּׁה תַּמְחוּיִין, שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת מִשּׁוּם מְעִילָה, וְרוֹאֶה אֲנִי שֶׁהַדְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִם הֲלָכָה נְקַבֵּל כּוּ׳
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I have heard with regard to one who eats from one offering from five pots that he is liable for each and every due to misuse And I consider that these matters an a fortiori Rabbi Akiva said to If a halakha we will accept
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: I heard regarding one who consumes from one altar among five offerings, that he is liable for each one due to misappropriation, and I see that the matter is a fortiori. Rabbi Akiva said to him: If the halakha is accepted, so be it.

hebrew_text: קַיבְּלַהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְהָא תְּשׁוּבָה מֵרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹ לָא? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: אָכַל חָמֵשׁ חֲתִיכוֹת נוֹתָר מִזֶּבַח אֶחָד בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] בַּחֲמִשָּׁה תַּמְחוּיִין – אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא אֶלָּא חַטָּאת אַחַת, וְעַל לֹא הוֹדַע שֶׁלָּהֶן אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא אֶלָּא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי.
human_translation: Did Rabbi Yehoshua accept that refutation from Rabbi Akiva or not? Come hear as it is taught ate five pieces of notar from one offering during one lapse of awareness, in five pots, he brings only one sin offering. And in not known from them, he brings only one provisional guilt offering,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua received the tradition of repentance from Rabbi Akiva or not? Come and hear, as it was taught: If one ate five pieces remaining from one altar in concealment, one in five concealments - he brings only one sin offering. And if he did not know about them, he brings only a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: מֵחֲמִשָּׁה תַּמְחוּיִין בַּחֲמִשָּׁ[ה] הֶעְלֵמוֹת – מֵבִיא חַטָּאת עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת, וְעַל לֹא הוֹדַע שֶׁלָּהֶן מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. מֵחֲמִשָּׁה זְבָחִים בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: from five pots during five lapses of awareness he brings a sin offering for each and every one, and in not known from them he brings a provisional guilt offering for each and every one. from five offerings during one lapse of awareness liable
llm_translation: From five concealments in the five specified cases - one brings a sin offering for each and every one, and for those not known, one brings a guilt offering for each and every one. From five sacrifices in a concealment (one) one is liable.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אָכַל חָמֵשׁ חֲתִיכוֹת מֵחֲמִשָּׁה זְבָחִים בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] – אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא אֶלָּא חַטָּאת אֶחָת, וְעַל סְפֵיקָן אֵין מֵבִיא אֶלָּא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אֶחָד. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: כֹּל שֶׁחֲלוּקִין בְּחַטָּאוֹת – חֲלוּקִין בַּאֲשָׁמוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even ate five pieces from five offerings during one lapse of awareness he brings only one sin offering, And uncertain them brings only a single provisional guilt offering. The principle of the matter any where differentiated with regard to sin offerings, they are differentiated with regard to guilt offerings
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even if one ate five pieces from five sacrifices unintentionally, he only brings one sin offering. And in cases of doubt, he only brings one suspended guilt offering. The general principle is: anything that is divided in sin offerings is divided in guilt offerings.

hebrew_text: אָכַל חָמֵשׁ חֲתִיכוֹת בַּחֲמִשָּׁה תַּמְחוּיִין מִזֶּבַח אֶחָד לִפְנֵי זְרִיקַת דָּמִים, אֲפִילּוּ בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת מִשּׁוּם מְעִילָה.
human_translation: ate five pieces in five pots from a single offering before sprinkling of the blood even during a single lapse of awareness, liable for each and every due to misuse
llm_translation: He ate five pieces in five portions from one sacrifice before the sprinkling of the blood, even in secret - he is liable for each and every one because of misappropriation.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ עַל סְפֵיקוֹ, מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי לָא קָתָנֵי. מַנִּי הָא? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, לִיתְנֵי נָמֵי סֵיפָא: ״וְעַל סְפֵיקָן מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי״, דְּהָתְנַן: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְחַיֵּיב עַל סְפֵק מְעִילָה אָשָׁם תָּלוּי!
human_translation: And yet does not teach in uncertain it he brings a provisional guilt offering. Whose this? If we say Rabbi Akiva, let him also teach the last clause: For uncertain them he brings a provisional guilt offering, as we learned Rabbi Akiva deems liable a provisional guilt offering for uncertainty misuse
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And if the guilt offering is in doubt, one brings a hanging guilt offering, it does not teach. Who is the author of this teaching? If you say Rabbi Akiva, let the latter clause also be taught: 'And in their doubt, one brings a hanging guilt offering,' as we learned: Rabbi Akiva obligates in the case of a doubtful transgression a hanging guilt offering!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא, וְקָתָנֵי: ״בַּחֲמִשָּׁה הֶעְלֵמוֹת – מֵבִיא חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת״, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: קַיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, isn’t Rabbi Yehoshua, And it teaches during five lapses of awareness brings five sin offerings, And conclude from accepted from
llm_translation: Rather, it is not Rabbi Yehoshua, and it is taught: "With five concealments - one brings five sin offerings," and hear from it: she accepted from them!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַדְּרַבָּה, מִסֵּיפָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: מֵחֲמִשָּׁה זְבָחִים אֲפִילּוּ בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לָא קַיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ!
human_translation: But on the contrary, from the latter clause which teaches: from five offerings, even during one lapse of awareness, liable for each and every one. conclude from did not accept from
llm_translation: Rather, let us expound from the latter part, as it teaches: From five sacrifices, even in secret (one) - one is liable for each and every one. Learn from it: She did not accept from its kind!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי אִית [לָךְ] לְמֵימַר, תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּאִיכָּא תַּנָּא דְּקַיבְּלַהּ וְאִיכָּא תַּנָּא דְּלָא קַיבְּלַהּ?
human_translation: Rather, what is there to say it is tanna’im , that there is a tanna that accepted and there is a tanna that did not accept it.
llm_translation: And rather what is there for you to say, it is a Mishnah, for there is a Mishnah that he received it and there is a Mishnah that he did not receive it?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, וְהַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר לַהּ כְּוָתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא, סָבַר לַהּ כְּוָתֵיהּ בְּהַעֲלָמָה, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בִּמְעִילוֹת.
human_translation: you even say is Rabbi Akiva And this tanna holds in accordance with in one and disagrees with his in one He holds in accordance with with regard to a lapse of awareness, But he disagrees with his with regard to misuse
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Akiva himself, and this Tanna holds according to his opinion in one matter and disputes with him in another matter, he holds according to his opinion in concealment, and disputes with him in mantles.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי חָמֵשׁ מְעִילוֹת? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּאוֹתָהּ שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים בָּעוֹלָה מִצְטָרְפִין: הַבָּשָׂר, וְהֶחָלָב, וְהַיַּיִן, וְהַסֹּלֶת, וְהַשֶּׁמֶן.
human_translation: What are the circumstances five misuse Shmuel says: like that which we learned Five items from a burnt offering combine The meat, and the fat, and the wine and the fine flour and the oil
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How are the values of five garments? Samuel said: Like that which we learned: Five things in the burnt offering combine: the flesh, and the fat, and the wine, and the fine flour, and the oil.

hebrew_text: חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָכַל מֵחֲמִשָּׁה אֵבָרִים. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּאֵבֶר אֶחָד, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּכָתֵף. רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָכַל בַּחֲמִשָּׁה מִינֵי קְדֵירָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָכַל בַּחֲמִשָּׁה טְעָמִים.
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya says: where he ate from five limbs Reish Lakish says: You even say from one limb, you find in the shoulder Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa says: where he ate as five types of cooked dishes. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: where he ate five flavors,
llm_translation: Hezekiah said: For example, if one ate from five limbs. Resh Lakish said: Even if you say from one limb, you forget it in the shoulder. Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha said: For example, if one ate from the five types of pot. Rabbi Yochanan said: For example, if one ate from the five tastes.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: שָׁאַלְתִּי אֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכוֹת הַרְבֵּה בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת הַרְבֵּה מֵעֵין מְלָאכָה אַחַת בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד], מַהוּ? חַיָּיב אַחַת עַל כּוּלָּן, אוֹ חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת?
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: I asked Rabbi Eliezer with regard to performs multiple labors on several Shabbatot , subsumed one labor, during one lapse of awareness. What is liable one for all or liable for each and every one
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Akiva said: I asked Rabbi Eliezer about one who performs many labors on many Sabbaths, each one similar to one labor, in secret, what is the ruling? Is he liable for each one individually, or is he liable for each and every one separately?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמָה נִדָּה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ תּוֹצָאוֹת הַרְבֵּה וְחַטָּאוֹת הַרְבֵּה – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת, שַׁבָּת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ תּוֹצָאוֹת הַרְבֵּה וּמִיתוֹת הַרְבֵּה – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּהֵא חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת?
human_translation: said to liable for each and every one from an a fortiori Just as a menstruating woman, with regard to whom there are not multiple result and multiple sin offerings, one liable for each and every one Shabbat, with regard to which there are multiple result and multiple death is it not right that he will be liable for each and every one
llm_translation: He said to him: "One is liable for each and every one, from a fortiori reasoning. And just as with niddah, which has many consequences and many sins - one is liable for each and every one, Shabbat which has many consequences and many deaths - is it not logical that one should be liable for each and every one?"

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: אִם אָמַרְתָּ בַּנִּדָּה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ שְׁתֵּי אַזְהָרוֹת, שֶׁהוּא מוּזְהָר עַל הַנִּדָּה וְהַנִּדָּה מוּזְהֶרֶת עָלָיו, תֹּאמַר בַּשַּׁבָּת, שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אֶלָּא אַזְהָרָה אֶחָת!
human_translation: I said to If you said in the a menstruating woman, with regard to whom there are two prohibitions, as is prohibited with the menstruating woman and the menstruating woman is prohibited with him, would you say in the Shabbat, with regard to which there is only one prohibition?
llm_translation: I said to him: If you say regarding a woman in menstruation that there are two prohibitions in her, that he is warned about the menstruating woman and the menstruating woman is warned about him, you should say regarding Shabbat, that it only has one prohibition!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לִי: הַבָּא עַל הַקְּטַנּוֹת יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אֶלָּא אַזְהָרָה אַחַת, וְחַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת!
human_translation: said to me: one who engages in intercourse with minor girls will prove as in there is only one prohibition, and liable for each and every one
llm_translation: He said to me: One who engages in relations with minors shall be proven guilty, for it contains only one warning, and he is liable for each and every one!

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: אִם אָמַרְתָּ בַּקְּטַנּוֹת, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן עַכְשָׁיו – יֵשׁ בָּהֶן לְאַחַר זְמַן, תֹּאמַר בַּשַּׁבָּת, שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ עַכְשָׁיו וְלֹא לְאַחַר זְמַן?
human_translation: I said to If you said in the minor girls that although it is not for them at present it is for them after time, would you say in the Shabbat, with regard to which there are neither at present, nor after time?
llm_translation: I said to him: If you say regarding small animals, that even though they do not have wool now, they will have wool later, can you say the same regarding Shabbat, that it does not have wool now and not later?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לִי: הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה יוֹכִיחַ! אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: הַבְּהֵמָה כַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: said to me: one who copulates with an animal will prove I said to the animal is like Shabbat;
llm_translation: He said to me: "The one who comes upon the animal shall prove it!" I said to him: "The animal is like the Sabbath."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי קָבָעֵי מִינֵּיהּ? אִי שַׁבָּתוֹת כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין וְאִי לָא בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ, נִיבְעֵי: הָעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה אַחַת בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת הַרְבֵּה!
human_translation: What dilemma raise If he raised a dilemma whether Shabbatot are comparable to entities or not, let him raise dilemma one performs one labor on several Shabbatot
llm_translation: Gemara: What do they establish from it? If the laws of Shabbat are like their own essence, then they do not establish from it. And if they do not establish from it, it is stated: "One who performs one labor on many Shabbatot!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: וַלְדֵי מְלָאכוֹת אִי כְּאָבוֹת דָּמְיָין וְאִי לָא בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ, נִיבְעֵי מִינֵּיהּ: הָעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכוֹת הַרְבֵּה מֵעֵין מְלָאכָה אַחַת בַּשַּׁבָּת!
human_translation: Rather, he raised a dilemma whether subcategories of labor are comparable primary categories, or not. let him ask raise dilemma one who performs multiple labors, subsumed one labor, on Shabbat,
llm_translation: Rather: And for the purposes of work, whether it is similar to the prohibitions or not, it is derived from the prohibitions: One who performs many types of work similar to one type of work on Shabbat!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב, תַּרְתֵּי בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ: שַׁבָּתוֹת כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין וְאִי לָא בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ, וַלְדֵי מְלָאכוֹת כִּמְלָאכוֹת דָּמְיָין אִי לָא.
human_translation: Rava said: They say the school of Rav [ bei Rav ] raised two dilemmas before him: He raised a dilemma whether Shabbatot are comparable entities or whether not subcategories of labor are comparable labor, whether not.
llm_translation: Rava said: The scholars of the house of Rav said, he requires two things: Shabbats are like their bodies, and if not, and the products of labor are like labor, if not.

hebrew_text: וְשַׁבָּתוֹת, הֵיכִי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ? שִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת – פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דְּיָמִים שֶׁבֵּינְתַיִים הָוְיָין יְדִיעָה לְחַלֵּק,
human_translation: And Shabbatot what raises dilemma? unwitting Shabbat but intentionally labors, obvious to that intervening days an awareness to differentiate
llm_translation: And Sabbaths, how does he require it? Inadvertent violation of the Sabbath and intentional violation of labors - it is obvious to him that the days between them are considered knowledge to differentiate.

hebrew_text: וּזְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת הוּא דְּבָעֵי מִינֵּיהּ, אִי כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין אִי לָא,
human_translation: And it is intentionally Shabbat, but unwittingly labors that raises dilemma. whether are comparable entities, whether not
llm_translation: "And intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional transgression of labor - that is what he requires from him, whether they are similar to the actual actions or not,"

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא, זְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת – פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דִּכְגוּפִין דָּמְיָין, וְשִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת הוּא דְּבָעֵי מִינֵּיהּ, דְּיָמִים שֶׁבֵּינָתַיִם אִי הָוְיָין יְדִיעָה לְחַלֵּק אִי לָא?
human_translation: Or perhaps intentionally Shabbat and unwittingly labors, obvious to that are comparable entities And unwittingly Shabbat, but intentionally labors that raises dilemma. intervening days are awareness to differentiate or not.
llm_translation: Or perhaps, intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional violation of labor - it is obvious to him that they are similar, and unintentional violation of Shabbat and intentional violation of labor is what he requires from it, for if they were both on the same day, would there be knowledge to distinguish or not?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה:
human_translation: Rabba said:
llm_translation: Rabba said:

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא שִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דְּיָמִים שֶׁבֵּינְתַיִים הָוַיִין יְדִיעָה לְחַלֵּק, וּזְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת הוּא דְּבָעֵי מִינֵּיהּ – כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין, אוֹ לָאו.
human_translation: It stands to reason, unwittingly Shabbat, and intentionally labors obvious to that intervening days are awareness to differentiate And it is intentionally Shabbat and unwittingly labors that raises his dilemma, comparable entities or not.
llm_translation: A mistake of Shabbat and intentional acts of labor - it is obvious to him that the days in between serve as a distinguishing factor, and intentional acts of Shabbat and a mistake of labor are what he requires from it - whether they are similar in nature or not.

hebrew_text: וּפְשַׁיט לֵיהּ דִּזְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין, וְלָא קַבֵּיל מִינֵּיהּ. וּפְשַׁט לֵיהּ, דְּוַלְדֵי מְלָאכוֹת כִּמְלָאכוֹת דָּמְיָין, וְלָא קַבֵּיל מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And resolved for him that intentionally Shabbat and unwittingly labors, comparable entities. But did not accept from him. And resolved for him that subcategories of labors comparable labor, But did not accept from him
llm_translation: And it is obvious to him that intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional transgressions of labor are equivalent, and he did not accept from him. And it is obvious to him, that offspring of labor are like labor itself, and he did not accept from him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דִּתְנַן, כְּלָל גָּדוֹל אָמְרוּ בַּשַּׁבָּת: כׇּל הַשּׁוֹכֵחַ עִיקַּר שַׁבָּת, וְעָשָׂה מְלָאכוֹת הַרְבֵּה בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת הַרְבֵּה – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: Rabba said: From where do I say this? As we learned stated a significant principle with regard to Shabbat: anyone who forgets the essence of Shabbat, and performed multiple labors on multiple Shabbatot , he is liable only one
