llm_translation: Rabba said: From where do I say this to her? For it was taught: A great principle they said regarding Shabbat: Anyone who forgets the essence of Shabbat, and performs many labors on many Shabbats - he is liable only for one.

hebrew_text: הַיּוֹדֵעַ עִיקַּר שַׁבָּת, וְעָשָׂה מְלָאכוֹת הַרְבֵּה בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת הַרְבֵּה – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל שַׁבָּת וְשַׁבָּת. הַיּוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהוּא שַׁבָּת וְעָשָׂה מְלָאכוֹת הַרְבֵּה בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת הַרְבֵּה – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַב מְלָאכָה וּמְלָאכָה.
human_translation: one who knows the essence of Shabbat, and performed multiple labors on multiple Shabbatot liable for each and every Shabbat, One who is aware that is Shabbat and performed multiple labors, on multiple Shabbatot , liable for each and every primary category of labor
llm_translation: One who knows the essence of Shabbat, and performs many labors on many Shabbats - is liable for each Shabbat. One who knows that it is Shabbat and performs many labors on many Shabbats - is liable for each primary category of labor and labor.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ ״חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַב מְלָאכָה שֶׁל כׇּל שַׁבָּת וְשַׁבָּת״ לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: But does not teach liable for each a primary category of labor on each and every Shabbat.
llm_translation: And if "one is obligated for every father of labor of every Sabbath and Sabbath," it is not taught.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי הָא? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכוֹת הַרְבֵּה מֵעֵין מְלָאכָה אַחַת – אֵין חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אֶחָת, וְאִי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל וַלְדֵי מְלָאכוֹת כִּמְלָאכוֹת!
human_translation: Whose this? If we say Rabbi Eliezer, say the last clause One who performs multiple labors subsumed, one labor liable only one And if Rabbi Eliezer liable for each of subcategories of labors as labor.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Who is the Tanna that holds this opinion? If you wish, say it is Rabbi Eliezer. Alternatively, consider the latter clause: One who performs many types of labor similar to one type of labor - is liable only for one offense. And if you say it is Rabbi Eliezer - he is liable for each and every type of labor as for the actual labor!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ שִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דְּיָמִים שֶׁבֵּינְתַיִים הָוַיִין יְדִיעָה לְחַלֵּק,
human_translation: Rather, obvious is Rabbi Akiva. And learn from unwittingly Shabbat and intentionally labors obvious to that intervening days are awareness to differentiate
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious that Rabbi Akiva holds, and we learn from it that inadvertent violation of Shabbat and intentional transgressions of labor are obvious to him, for the days in between were a time for distinguishing.

hebrew_text: זְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת הוּא דְּבָעֵי אִי כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין, וּפְשַׁט לֵיהּ דִּכְגוּפִין דָּמְיָין, וַלְדֵי מְלָאכוֹת כִּמְלָאכוֹת דָּמְיָין, וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ לָא קַבֵּיל מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: it is intentionally Shabbat and unwittingly labor, that raises his dilemma, whether comparable entities. And resolved for him comparable entities, subcategories of labors are comparable labor, And did not accept either of these from
llm_translation: Controversy of Shabbat and unintentional labor it is that they require whether like intentional acts they are similar, and it is evident to him that like intentional acts they are similar, and regarding the labors, like labors they are similar, and both of them he does not accept from him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ זְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּשַׁבָּתוֹת לָאו כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין, וְשִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת הוּא דְּבָעֵי מִינֵּיהּ, דְּיָמִים שֶׁבֵּינְתַיִים מִי הָוַיִין יְדִיעָה לְחַלֵּק אוֹ לָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to Actually, I say to you intentionally Shabbat and unwittingly labors, obvious to Rabbi Akiva that Shabbatot are not comparable entities, And it is unwittingly Shabbat and intentionally labors, that raises his dilemma to intervening days are awareness to differentiate or not.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Always say to you intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional violation of labors is obvious to Rabbi Akiva that Shabbats are not like bodies, and unintentional violation of Shabbat and intentional violation of labors is what he requires from it, for the days in between do not have the knowledge to differentiate or not.

hebrew_text: וּפְשַׁיט לֵיהּ דְּיָמִים שֶׁבֵּינְתַיִים [הָוַיִין יְדִיעָה] לְחַלֵּק וְקַבֵּיל מִינֵּיהּ, וּפְשַׁט לֵיהּ וַלְדֵי מְלָאכוֹת כִּמְלָאכוֹת דָּמַיִין וְלָא קַבֵּיל מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And resolved for him that intervening days to differentiate And accepted from him, And resolved for him subcategories of labors are comparable labor but did not accept from him.
llm_translation: And it is clear to him that the days between are considered knowledge to divide and receive from it, and it is clear to him and to the needs of work like the work of blood and not to receive from it.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: זְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת – אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ דִּכְגוּפִין דָּמְיָין, וְכִי בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ, שִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת הוּא דְּבָעֵי מִינֵּיהּ, דְּיָמִים שֶׁבֵּינְתַיִים אִי הָוְיָין יְדִיעָה לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: intentionally Shabbat and unwittingly labors, even Rabbi Akiva holds that are comparable entities; and when he raises the dilemma it is unwittingly Shabbat and intentionally labor. And he raises the dilemma intervening days are awareness to differentiate.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional violation of labor - even Rabbi Akiva would agree that they are considered as if they are of equal severity, and when he requires a distinction, it is in the case where he requires a distinction between intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional violation of labor, for in the case of the days in between, there is no knowledge to differentiate.

hebrew_text: וּפְשַׁיט לֵיהּ יָמִים שֶׁבֵּינְתַיִים הָוַיִין יְדִיעָה לְחַלֵּק, וְקַבֵּיל מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And resolved for him intervening days are awareness to differentiate and accepted from him.
llm_translation: And it is clear to him two days between, wine knowledge to divide, and he accepted from him.

hebrew_text: וּפְשַׁט לֵיהּ דְּוַלְדֵי מְלָאכוֹת כִּמְלָאכוֹת דָּמַיִין, וְלָא קַבֵּיל מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And resolved for him that subcategories of labors comparable labor But did not accept from him,
llm_translation: And he interpreted it that the offspring of angels are like the work of angels, and he did not accept from him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דְּתַנְיָא: הַכּוֹתֵב שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד – חַיָּיב. בִּשְׁתֵּי הֶעְלֵמוֹת – רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מְחַיֵּיב, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין. וּמוֹדֶה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, שֶׁאִם כָּתַב אוֹת אַחַת בְּשַׁבָּת זוֹ וְאוֹת אַחַת בְּשַׁבָּת אַחֶרֶת – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: From where do I say as it is taught One who writes two letters during one lapse of awareness liable, in two lapses of awareness, Rabban Gamliel deems liable and the Rabbis deem exempt. And Rabban Gamliel concedes that if he wrote one letter on this Shabbat and one letter on another Shabbat exempt.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: From where do I say this to her? For it was taught: One who writes two letters in one concealment - is liable. In two concealments - Rabban Gamliel obligates, and the sages exempt. And Rabban Gamliel concedes that if he wrote one letter on this Sabbath and one letter on another Sabbath - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא אַחֲרִיתִי: הַכּוֹתֵב שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת בִּשְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת, אֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת זוֹ וְאֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת זוֹ – רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מְחַיֵּיב, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין. קָא סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ, דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And it is taught a different one who writes two letters on two Shabbatot , one on this Shabbat and one on that Shabbat, Rabban Gamliel deems liable and the Rabbis deem exempt. enters your mind that Rabban Gamliel holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: One who writes two letters on two Sabbaths, one on this Sabbath and one on that Sabbath - Rabban Gamliel obligates, and the Sages exempt. The reason for your opinion is that Rabban Gamliel holds like Rabbi Akiva. English translation:

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי, דְּאָמֵינָא זְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר דְּשַׁבָּתוֹת כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין, הָא דְּתַנְיָא פָּטוּר – בִּזְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת, דְּשַׁבָּתוֹת כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין.
human_translation: Granted, according to my as I say intentionally Shabbat and unwittingly labors, even Rabbi Akiva says that Shabbatot are comparable entities. that which is taught exempt, to intentionally Shabbat but unwittingly labors. Since Shabbatot are comparable entities,
llm_translation: In truth, according to my opinion, for I say, intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional transgressions of labor, even Rabbi Akiva says that Shabbat is like the essence of the body, as it is taught: one is exempt for intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional transgressions of labor, for Shabbat is like the essence of the body.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּתַנְיָא חַיָּיב – בְּשִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת (דְּשַׁבָּתוֹת כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין), דְּקָסָבַר: אֵין יְדִיעָה לַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: And that which is taught liable where unwittingly Shabbat, and intentionally labors. that Shabbatot are comparable entities, as he holds there is no awareness for a half-measure.
llm_translation: The one that it was taught "liable" - for an unwitting violation of Shabbat and intentional labor (of Shabbatot similar to their essence), for he holds: knowledge is not considered half a measure.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר: סְבִירָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּשַׁבָּתוֹת כְּגוּף אֶחָד הֵן,
human_translation: But according to Rava, who says Rabbi Akiva, holds that Shabbatot are as one entity,
llm_translation: Rather, according to Rava, who said: It is reasonable according to Rabbi Akiva that Shabbats are like one body.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא חַיָּיב, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בֵּין בִּזְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת, דְּשַׁבָּתוֹת כְּגוּף אֶחָד הֵן, וּבֵין בְּשִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת, דְּקָסָבַר: אֵין יְדִיעָה לַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: Granted, that which is taught liable, You find both where intentionally Shabbat and unwittingly labors, as Shabbatot are as one entity, and where unwittingly Shabbat and intentionally labors. that he holds there is no awareness for a half-measure,
llm_translation: In truth, this that it was taught: liable, she finds it, whether intentional Shabbat and unintentional labor, for Shabbats are like one body, and whether unintentional Shabbat and intentional labor, for he holds: knowledge is not half a measure.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָדְתַנְיָא פָּטוּר, בְּמַאי מוֹקְמַתְּ לַהּ? לָא בַּחֲדָא וְלָא בַּחֲדָא!
human_translation: But that which is taught exempt, in what can you interpret it, not in this And not in that
llm_translation: And rather, it was taught: he is exempt, with what is she established? Not in this one and not in that one!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סְבִירָא לֵיהּ כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר: שַׁבָּתוֹת כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין.
human_translation: Rava say to you Rabban Gamliel holds in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who says: Shabbatot are comparable entities,
llm_translation: He said to you, Rava: Rabban Gamliel holds like Rabbi Eliezer, who said: "Sabbaths are like their bodies."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי: וּמוֹדֶה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיגִי אַאַחְרָנְיָיתָא. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ – הַיְינוּ דִּפְלִיגִי בְּשִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת, דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: אֵין יְדִיעָה לַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: But from that teaches: And Rabban Gamliel concedes by inference that they disagree about another Granted, if you say holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, this is that they disagree with regard to unwittingly Shabbat and intentionally labors, as Rabban Gamliel holds there is no awareness for a half-measure,
llm_translation: And this is what was taught: And Rabban Gamliel concedes, from the fact that he disagrees in the latter case. If you say it is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, he agrees with him - that is, that he disagrees regarding unintentional Shabbat desecration and intentional labor, for Rabban Gamliel holds: There is no partial knowledge for half the measure.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בִּזְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת שֶׁהוּא פָּטוּר, אַלְמָא שַׁבָּתוֹת כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיגִי. בְּמַאי?
human_translation: And Rabban Gamliel concedes in intentionally Shabbat and unwittingly labors, that he is exempt. Evidently, Shabbatot are comparable entities, But if you say Rabban Gamliel holds in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, by inference that they disagree About what
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabban Gamliel concedes regarding intentional and unintentional violations of Shabbat that one is exempt, implying that Shabbat is like the essence of the body. Rather, if you say that Rabban Gamliel agrees with Rabbi Eliezer, it is logical to him, from the fact that he disputes. With what? English translation: And Rabban Gamliel concedes that intentional and unintentional violations of Shabbat one is exempt, implying that Shabbat is like the essence of the body. Rather, if you say that Rabban Gamliel agrees with Rabbi Eliezer, it is logical to him, from the fact that he disputes. With what?

hebrew_text: אִי בְּשִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת – אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סְבִירָא לֵיהּ דְּאֵין יְדִיעָה לַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר, דְּתַנְיָא: הַכּוֹתֵב שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת בִּשְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת, אוֹת אַחַת בְּשַׁבָּת זוֹ וְאוֹת אַחַת בְּשַׁבָּת זוֹ – רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב!
human_translation: If with regard to unwittingly Shabbat and intentionally labors, even Rabbi Eliezer holds in accordance with Rabban Gamliel that there is no awareness for a half-measure, as it is taught one who writes two letters on two Shabbatot , one letter on this Shabbat and one letter on that Shabbat, Rabbi Eliezer deems liable.
llm_translation: If it was done unintentionally on Shabbat and with intention to violate the prohibitions – even Rabbi Eliezer agrees with Rabban Gamliel that he is of the opinion that there is no knowledge for half the measure, as it was taught: One who writes two letters on two Sabbaths, one letter on this Sabbath and one letter on that Sabbath – Rabbi Eliezer obligates him.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, בְּאַחַת עַל הָאָרִיג – חַיּוֹבֵי מְחַיֵּיב, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הָאוֹרֵג שְׁלֹשָׁה חוּטִין בַּתְּחִלָּה, וְאֶחָד עַל הָאָרִיג – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: But rather, with regard to one to woven fabric. deems liable as we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: One who weaves three threads at the beginning or one to woven fabric, liable.
llm_translation: And rather, in one who weaves upon the warp - those obligated to fulfill the commandments obligate, as we learned: Rabbi Eliezer says: The weaver must use three threads at the beginning, and one upon the warp - he is obligated!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיג בַּחֲדָא, דְּתַנְיָא: הוֹצִיא חֲצִי גְרוֹגֶרֶת וְחָזַר וְהוֹצִיא חֲצִי גְרוֹגֶרֶת בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] – חַיָּיב. בִּשְׁתֵּי הֶעְלֵמוֹת – פָּטוּר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד בִּרְשׁוּת (אֶחָד) [אַחַת] – חַיָּיב, בִּשְׁתֵּי רְשׁוּיוֹת – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rava said: by inference that disagrees about one as it is taught carried out half of a dried fig and then carried out half of a dried fig, in one lapse of awareness, liable; in two lapses of awareness exempt. Rabbi Yosei says: in one lapse of awareness, to one domain liable; to two domains exempt.
llm_translation: Rava said: From the fact that he argues in one case, for it was taught: If one brought out half a dried fig and then brought out another half a dried fig in concealment—one is liable. In two concealments—one is exempt. Rabbi Yosei says: In one concealment in one domain—one is liable, in two domains—one is exempt.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: As Rabban Gamliel in accordance with the first tanna , And Rabbi Eliezer in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel like the first Tanna, and Rabbi Eliezer like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר לוֹ: חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמָה נִדָּה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ תּוֹצָאוֹת הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: Come hear said to liable for each and every one from an a fortiori Just as a menstruating woman, with regard to whom there are not multiple result
llm_translation: Come and hear: he said to him, "One is liable for each and every matter from a fortiori reasoning, and what is the law regarding a menstruating woman who does not have many consequences of impurity."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב חִסְדָּא דְּאָמַר: שִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ, דְּיָמִים שֶׁבֵּינְתַיִם מִי הָוְיָין יְדִיעָה לְחַלֵּק אוֹ לָא – הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״וּמָה נִדָּה״.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rav Ḥisda, who says raises dilemma unwittingly Shabbat and intentionally labors, whether intervening days are awareness to differentiate or not, that is that said to him: Just as a menstruating woman,
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rav Ḥisda who said: Inadvertent violation of Shabbat and intentional transgressions of labor require knowledge between them, for who will have the knowledge to distinguish whether it is intentional or not? That is what he said to him: "And what is nidah."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר: זְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת הוּא דְּבָעֵי מִינֵּיהּ, דְּשַׁבָּתוֹת אִי כְּגוּפִין דָּמְיָין וְאִי לָא – לִיתְנֵי ״נִדּוֹת״!
human_translation: But according to Rava, who says it was intentionally Shabbat and unwittingly labors that raises dilemma, whether Shabbatot comparable to entities or not, let teach Menstruating women.
llm_translation: To Rava, for he said: intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional transgressions of labor is what he requires from it, for if Shabbat is like themselves, then let it not teach "nidot"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: תְּנִי ״נִדּוֹת״. שְׁמוּאֵל תָּנֵי ״נִדָּה״, רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה תָּנֵי ״נִדָּה״. רַב נָתָן בַּר אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר: תָּנֵי ״נִדּוֹת״.
human_translation: Rava say to you: teach menstruating women. Shmuel teaches menstruating woman, Rav Adda bar Ahava teaches menstruating woman; Rav Natan bar Oshaya says: Teach menstruating women.
llm_translation: Rava said to you: Teach "nidot." Shmuel taught "niddah," Rav Adda bar Ahava taught "niddah." Rav Natan bar Oshaya said: Teach "nidot."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב חִסְדָּא דְּאָמַר: שִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת הוּא דְּבָעֵי מִינֵּיהּ, דְּיָמִים שֶׁבֵּינְתַיִם מִי הָוַיִין יְדִיעָה לְחַלֵּק וְאִי לָא, נִדָּה – מַאי יָמִים שֶׁבֵּינְתַיִם הָוַיִין יְדִיעָה לְחַלֵּק אִית בַּהּ?
human_translation: And according to Rav Ḥisda, who says: It was unwitting Shabbat and intentional labors that raises dilemma, whether intervening days are awareness to differentiate or not, a menstruating woman, what intervening days apply to her be awareness to differentiate
llm_translation: And for Rav Ḥisdah who said: Inadvertent violation of Shabbat and intentional violation of labor are what he requires of it, for days that are in between, is there knowledge to differentiate or not, regarding menstruation - what are the days that are in between that have knowledge to differentiate in it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּא עָלֶיהָ וְטָבְלָה, וְרָאֲתָה וְחָזַר וּבָא עָלֶיהָ, וְטָבְלָה, וְחָזַר וּבָא עָלֶיהָ, דִּטְבִילוֹת הָוְיָין כְּיָמִים שֶׁבֵּינְתַיִם.
human_translation: Rava said: where he engaged in intercourse with her and she immersed and she saw and he engaged in intercourse with her again, and she immersed and he engaged in intercourse with her again. As the immersions are like intervening days.
llm_translation: Rava said: For example, if he came upon her and immersed, and she saw and then he returned and came upon her, and she immersed, and he returned and came upon her, the immersions are considered like the days in between.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַבָּא עַל הַקְּטַנּוֹת יוֹכִיחַ. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרָבָא, הַיְינוּ דְקָתָנֵי ״קְטַנּוֹת״.
human_translation: Come hear one who engages in intercourse with minor girls will prove Granted, according to Rava, this that teaches minor girls,
llm_translation: Come and hear: one who comes to the minors should prove. Granted for Rava, that is what is taught as "minors."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב חִסְדָּא, מַאי ״קְטַנּוֹת״? קְטַנּוֹת דְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: But according to Rav Ḥisda, what minor girls? minor girls in general,
llm_translation: Rather, to Rav Ḥisdah, what is "small"? Small of the world.

hebrew_text: דְּלָא כְּהָדֵין תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר לֹא כָּךְ שְׁאֵלוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אֶלָּא כָּךְ שְׁאֵלוֹ: הַבָּא עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד, מַהוּ? חַיָּיב אַחַת עַל כּוּלָּן, אוֹ חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת?
human_translation: the mishna, is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: That is not what Rabbi Akiva asked Rabbi Eliezer. Rather, this is what he asked him: one who engaged in intercourse with his wife menstruating, and then again engaged in intercourse with his wife menstruating, during a single lapse of awareness, what is liable one for all of the or liable for each and every one?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Not like that did a Tanna teach, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Not in this manner did Rabbi Akiva ask Rabbi Elazar, but rather he asked him: If one had relations with his wife while she was in a state of menstruation, and then again had relations with her while she was in a state of menstruation in one concealment, what is the ruling? Is he liable for each one individually, or is he liable for all of them together?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֹיה: חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמָה שַׁבָּת שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אֶלָּא אַזְהָרָה אַחַת, שֶׁהוּא מוּזְהָר עַל הַשַּׁבָּת וְהַשַּׁבָּת אֵינָהּ מוּזְהֶרֶת עָלָיו – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת, נִדָּה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ שְׁתֵּי אַזְהָרוֹת, שֶׁהוּא מוּזְהָר עַל הַנִּדָּה וְנִדָּה מוּזְהֶרֶת עָלָיו – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת?
human_translation: said to him: liable for each and every one, from an a fortiori And just as Shabbat, with regard to which there is only one prohibition because he is prohibited on Shabbat but Shabbat is not prohibited with regard to him, liable for each and every a menstruating woman, with regard to whom there are two prohibitions, as is prohibited with the menstruating woman and the menstruating woman is prohibited with him, is it not right that he be liable for each and every
llm_translation: He said to him: One is obligated for each and every one, from a fortiori reasoning. And just as regarding Shabbat, which has only one warning, that he is warned about Shabbat and Shabbat is not warned about him - he is obligated for each and every one, so too regarding Niddah, which has two warnings, that he is warned about Niddah and Niddah is warned about him - is it not logical that he is obligated for each and every one?

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא, אִם אָמַרְתָּ בַּשַּׁבָּת, שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ תּוֹצָאוֹת הַרְבֵּה לְחַטָּאוֹת הַרְבֵּה, תֹּאמַר בַּנִּדָּה, שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ תּוֹצָאוֹת הַרְבֵּה לְחַטָּאוֹת הַרְבֵּה!
human_translation: said to him: No, if you said in Shabbat, with regard to which there are multiple result in multiple sin offerings, shall you say in a menstruating woman, with regard to whom there are not multiple result multiple multiple sin offerings,
llm_translation: They said to him: No, if you said on Shabbat that it has many consequences for many sins, you should say about Niddah, that it does not have many consequences for many sins!

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הַבָּא עַל הַקְּטַנּוֹת יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ תּוֹצָאוֹת הַרְבֵּה לְחַטָּאוֹת הַרְבֵּה, וְחַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת!
human_translation: said to him: one who engages in intercourse with minor girls will prove as with regard to it there are not multiple result in multiple sin offerings, and liable for each and every one
llm_translation: They said to him: One who engages in relations with minors should be warned, for it leads to many sins and he is liable for each and every one!

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא, אִם אָמַרְתָּ בַּקְּטַנּוֹת שֶׁכֵּן גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁאֵין גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין וְחַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הַבְּהֵמָה כַּנִּדָּה.
human_translation: said to him: No, if you said with regard to minors, who separate entities, said to him: one who copulates with an animal will prove as there are no separate entities, and liable for each and every said to him: the animal is like the menstruating woman,
llm_translation: They said to him: No, if you say in the small ones, are the bodies also divided? They said to him: Let the one who comes upon the animal prove it, that the bodies are not divided and he is liable for each and every one! They said to him: The animal is like a menstruant.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אָמְרוּ לוֹ
llm_translation: We will return to you, they said to him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ סָפֵק אָכַל חֵלֶב, סָפֵק לֹא אָכַל, וַאֲפִילּוּ אָכַל, סָפֵק יֵשׁ בּוֹ כַּשִּׁיעוּר וְסָפֵק
human_translation: uncertainty one ate fat uncertainty one did not eat fat, or even one ate uncertainty there is the measure in and uncertainty
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one is in doubt whether he ate forbidden fat, or in doubt whether he did not eat it, and even if he did eat it, there is a doubt whether he consumed the minimum quantity required by law, and there is a doubt.

hebrew_text: אֵין בּוֹ,
human_translation: there is not in
llm_translation: There is not in it.

hebrew_text: שׁוּמָּן וָחֵלֶב לְפָנָיו, וְאָכַל אֶחָד מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן אָכַל, אִשְׁתּוֹ וַאֲחוֹתוֹ עִמּוֹ בַּבַּיִת, שָׁגַג בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן שָׁגַג, שַׁבָּת וְיוֹם חוֹל, וְעָשָׂה מְלָאכָה בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה מֵהֶן עָשָׂה – מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי.
human_translation: fat and fat before him and he ate one of them and he does not know which of them he ate; his wife and his sister with him in the house he unwittingly with one of them and he does not know with which of them he unwittingly Shabbat and a weekday and he performed labor on one of and he does not know on which of them he performed bring a provisional guilt offering.
llm_translation: Shuman and chelev before him, and he ate one of them and does not know which of them he ate, his wife and his sister with him in the house, he unintentionally transgressed with one of them and does not know with which of them he transgressed, Shabbat and a weekday, and he performed labor with one of them and does not know with which of them he performed – he brings a hanging guilt offering.

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאִם אָכַל חֵלֶב וָחֵלֶב בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא חַטָּאת אַחַת, כֵּן עַל לֹא הוֹדַע שֶׁלָּהֶן אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא אֶלָּא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אֶחָד.
human_translation: Just as where one ate fat and fat in a single lapse of awareness liable only one sin offering, so too, in unknown liable only one provisional guilt offering.
llm_translation: As the same if ate fat and fat unknowingly one not liable except sin-offering one, so too on not known theirs one brings only guilt-offering dependent one.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיְתָה יְדִיעָה בֵּינָתַיִם, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהוּא מֵבִיא חַטָּאת עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת, כָּךְ מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת.
human_translation: if had knowledge between Just as he bring a sin offering for each and every so too, bring a provisional guilt offering for each and every
llm_translation: If there was knowledge in between, as he brings a sin offering for each and every one, so too he brings a guilt offering dependent on each and every one.

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאָכַל חֵלֶב וָדָם וּפִיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר בְּהֶעְלֵם אַחַת חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת, כָּךְ עַל לֹא הוֹדַע שֶׁלָּהֶן מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת.
human_translation: Just as where one ate fat, and blood, and piggul , and notar in one lapse of awareness he is liable for each and every one, so too, with regard their unknown bring a provisional guilt offering for each and every
llm_translation: As he ate fat and blood and pigul and what remains in concealment, one is liable for each and every one, just as for not knowing their status, it brings a guilt offering dependent on each and every one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר, רַב אַסִּי אָמַר: חֲתִיכָה אַחַת שָׁנִינוּ, סָפֵק שֶׁל חֵלֶב סָפֵק שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן. חִיָּיא בַּר רַב אָמַר: חֲתִיכָה מִשְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: was stated Rav Asi says: We learned one piece uncertain of fat uncertain of fat. Ḥiyya bar Rav said: We learned piece out of two pieces,
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: Rav Assi said: One piece we learned, a doubt of fat, a doubt of suet. Hiyya bar Rav said: One piece from two pieces we learned.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? רַב אַסִּי סָבַר: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמָּסוֹרֶת, ״מִצְוַת״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: With regard to what disagree? Rav Asi holds: tradition is authoritative, is written mitzvat ,”
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Rav Assi holds: There is a mother to the tradition, "mitzvah" is written.

hebrew_text: וְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב אָמַר: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא, ״מִצְווֹת״ קָרֵינַן.
human_translation: And Ḥiyya bar Rav says: vocalization is authoritative, we read mitzvot ,
llm_translation: And Ḥiyya son of Rav said: There is a mother to the Scripture, we read "commandments."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַב אַסִּי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ חִיָּיא בַּר רַב לְרַב אַסִּי: חֵלֶב וְשׁוּמָּן לְפָנָיו וְאָכַל אַחַת מֵהֶן מַאי לַָאו מִדְּסֵיפָא שְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי שְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת?
human_translation: Rav Huna raised an objection to Rav Asi, and some say Ḥiyya bar Rav to Rav Asi: fat and fat before him and he ate one of them. What, is it not from the latter clause two pieces the first clause, also two pieces?
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Huna against Rav Assi, and they said to him: "Hiyya bar Rav to Rav Assi: If one places fat and oil before him and eats one of them, what is the law?" Is it not from the end, two pieces; the beginning also, two pieces?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב: לָא תֵּיזְלוּ בָּתַר אִיפְּכָא, דְּיָכוֹל לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי לְכוּ: סֵיפָא בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת רֵישָׁא בַּחֲתִיכָה אַחַת. אִי הָכִי, יֵשׁ לוֹמַר: חֲתִיכָה אַחַת מִחַיַּיב, שְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר? זוֹ וְאֵין צָרִיךְ (לְמֵימַר) [לוֹמַר] זוֹ.
human_translation: Rav said to them: Do not go after the opposite, as can answer you the latter clause to two pieces, the first clause to one piece. If so, one can say one piece renders obligated need to be said two pieces, This, and it is unnecessary to say that,
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav: Do not go after the last one, for he can change his mind: the end in two pieces, the beginning in one piece. If so, one might say: one piece is liable, two pieces need to be said? This and not need to be said.

hebrew_text: וּלְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב דְּאָמַר: מִדְּסֵיפָא בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי בִּשְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת, מִיתְנָא תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי? פָּרוֹשֵׁי קָא מְפָרֵשׁ: סָפֵק אָכַל סָפֵק לֹא אָכַל חֵלֶב – מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, כֵּיצַד? כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה חֵלֶב וְשׁוּמָּן לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: And according to Ḥiyya bar Rav, who says from the latter clause two pieces, the first clause also two pieces, why do I two is explaining uncertainty one ate uncertainty one did not eat fat, bring a provisional guilt offering. How so? For example, where there was fat and fat before him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Ḥiyya bar Rav said: From the end in two pieces, the beginning also in two pieces, why do I need two? He explains: If one ate doubtfully, whether he ate forbidden fat or not, he brings a guilt-offering. How so? For example, if there was fat and oil before him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן וְאַחַת שֶׁל חֵלֶב, אָכַל אַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן אָכַל – חַיָּיב חֲתִיכָה אַחַת, סָפֵק שֶׁל חֵלֶב סָפֵק שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן וַאֲכָלָהּ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: one had two pieces before him, one of fat and one of fat, he ate one of them and he does not know which of them he ate, obligated one piece uncertainty of fat uncertainty of fat, and he ate it, exempt.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If two pieces were before him, one of fat and one of oil, he ate one of them and does not know which one he ate - he is liable for one piece. If it was a doubt of fat or a doubt of oil, and he ate it - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָשָׂה אַחַת מִכׇּל מִצְוֹת ה׳ בִּשְׁגָגָה״ – עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁגּוֹג בִּשְׁתַּיִם, ״מִצְוַת״ כְּתִיב, ״מִצְווֹת״ קָרֵינַן.
human_translation: Rava said: What is the reason of Rav? that the verse states: and do any of the commandments [ mitzvot ] of the Lord though he does not know it; until he is unwitting with regard to two written “ mitzvat ,” We read mitzvot ,
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the reason for Rav's statement? For the verse states: "And if one person sins unintentionally from among all the commandments of the Lord" - until he makes a mistake in two, it is written "mitzvat" (singular), but we read it as "mitzvot" (plural).

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כּוֹי – חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו אָשָׁם תָּלוּי!
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to Rabbi Eliezer says: a koy , one is obligated to a provisional guilt offering for its
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him, Abaye did: Rabbi Eliezer says: "Koi" - one is liable for a hanging guilt-offering upon it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמָּסוֹרֶת, ״מִצְוַת״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: said to Rabbi Eliezer holds tradition is authoritative. “ mitzvat ” is written,
llm_translation: He said to him: Rabbi Eliezer holds: There is a mother to the tradition, "mitzvah" is written.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: סָפֵק בֶּן תִּשְׁעָה לָרִאשׁוֹן אוֹ בֶּן שִׁבְעָה לָאַחֲרוֹן – יוֹצִיא, וְהַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר,
human_translation: raised an objection to uncertainty whether is nine old, of the first whether seven old of the latter he must divorce her. But the offspring is unflawed
llm_translation: He raised an objection: If there is doubt whether the firstborn is nine years old or the lastborn is seven years old - he shall be taken out, and the newborn is valid.

hebrew_text: וְחַיָּיב בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי. הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא.
human_translation: And obligated a provisional guilt offering. whose is this It is Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: "And liable for a hanging guilt offering. Is this a question? It is Rabbi Eliezer."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: נִמְצָא עַל שֶׁלּוֹ – טְמֵאִין, וְחַיָּיבִין בַּקׇּרְבָּן.
human_translation: raised objection to was found on his are ritually impure and they are liable to offering
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: If it is found on his own property - they are impure, and obligated in the offering.

hebrew_text: עַל שֶׁלָּהּ אֹתְיוֹם – טְמֵאִין וְחַיָּיבִין בַּקׇּרְבָּן. נִמְצָא עַל שֶׁלָּהּ לְאַחַר זְמַן – טְמֵאִין מִסָּפֵק וּפְטוּרִין מִן הַקׇּרְבָּן, וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: חַיָּיב מִשּׁוּם אָשָׁם תָּלוּי! הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא.
human_translation: was found on her immediately [ otyom ] ritually impure and are liable to offering. was found on her after time impure due to uncertainty, and they are exempt from the offering. And it is taught with regard to liable to a provisional guilt offering. whose is this It is Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: On its own - impure and obligated in the sacrifice. If found on its own after the time - impure due to doubt and exempt from the sacrifice, and it teaches about it: obligated for a hanging guilt offering! Is it not so? It is Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא אָמַר רַב: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל חֵלֶב וְאַחַת שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן, וְאָכַל אַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן אָכַל – חַיָּיב. חֲתִיכָה, סָפֵק שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן סָפֵק שֶׁל חֵלֶב וַאֲכָלָהּ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya says Rav says: one had two pieces before him, one of fat and one of fat, and he ate one of them and he does not know which of them he ate, obligated piece uncertainty of fat uncertainty of fat, and he ate it, exempt.
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya said in the name of Rav: If there were before him two pieces, one of fat and one of oil, and he ate one of them and does not know which one he ate - he is liable. If he ate a piece, uncertain whether it was of oil or of fat - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב? קָסָבַר: שְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת אֶפְשָׁר לְבָרֵר אִיסּוּרָן, חֲתִיכָה אַחַת אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְבָרֵר אִיסּוּרָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: What is the reason of Rav? He holds two pieces, it is possible to identify its prohibition. one piece, it is impossible to identify its prohibition
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: What is the reason for Rav's opinion? He holds: With two pieces, it is possible to clarify their prohibition, but with one piece, it is not possible to clarify its prohibition.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין טַעְמָא דְּרָבָא לְטַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא? אִיכָּא בֵינַיְיהוּ כְּזַיִת וּמֶחֱצָה.
human_translation: What is there between reason by Rava reason by Rabbi Zeira? between an olive-bulk and one-half
llm_translation: What is the difference between the reasoning of Rava and the reasoning of Rabbi Zeira? There is a difference between them like an olive and half.

hebrew_text: לְרָבָא – לֵיכָּא ״מִצְווֹת״ וּפָטוּר, לְרַבִּי זֵירָא – אֶפְשָׁר לְבָרֵר אִיסּוּרוֹ.
human_translation: According to Rava, is not mitzvot , and exempt. according to Rabbi Zeira, it is possible to identify its prohibition
llm_translation: To Rava - for him "mitzvot" and exempt, to Rabbi Zeira - it is possible to clarify his prohibition.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי זֵירָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כּוֹי, חַיָּיבִין עַל חֶלְבּוֹ אָשָׁם תָּלוּי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: לָא בָּעֵינַן לְבָרֵר אִיסּוּרוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised an objection to Rabbi Zeira Rabbi Eliezer says: a koy , one is obligated a provisional guilt offering for its fat. said to Rabbi Eliezer holds we do not require to identify its prohibition
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rabbi Yirmeya to Rabbi Zeira, Rabbi Eliezer says: "A blind person, is liable for his fat, a guilt offering is pending!" He said to him: "Rabbi Eliezer holds: We do not need to clarify its prohibition."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: סָפֵק בֶּן תִּשְׁעָה לָרִאשׁוֹן אוֹ בֶּן שִׁבְעָה לָאַחֲרוֹן – יוֹצִיא, וְהַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר, וְחַיָּיב בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי. הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא.
human_translation: raised an objection to uncertainty whether is nine old of the first whether seven old of the latter he must divorce her, but the offspring is unflawed And obligated a provisional guilt offering. whose is this It is Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: If there is doubt regarding whether the firstborn is nine years old or the lastborn is seven years old - he is considered a firstborn and the offspring is valid, and he is liable for a hanging guilt-offering. Is this not the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer?

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: נִמְצָא עַל שֶׁלָּהּ אֹתְיוֹם – טְמֵאִין וְחַיָּיבִין בַּקׇּרְבָּן. נִמְצָא עַל שֶׁלָּהּ לְאַחַר זְמַן – טְמֵאִין מִסָּפֵק וּפְטוּרִין מִן הַקׇּרְבָּן. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: וְחַיָּיבִין בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי! הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא.
human_translation: raised objection to was found on her immediately are impure and are liable to offering. was found on her after time impure due to uncertainty and they are exempt from the offering. And it is taught with regard to liable to provisional guilt offering. whose is this It is Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: If it was found on her own wool - they are unclean and obligated in the offering. If it was found on her wool after the time - they are unclean due to doubt and exempt from the offering. And he taught on it: And obligated in a guilt offering! Who is the authority? Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל חֵלֶב וְאַחַת שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן, וְאָכַל אַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן אָכַל – חַיָּיב. חֲתִיכָה, סָפֵק שֶׁל חֵלֶב סָפֵק שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן וַאֲכָלָהּ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says Rav says: one had two pieces before him, one of fat and one of fat, and ate one of them and he does not know which of them he ate, obligated piece uncertain of fat uncertain of fat, and he ate it, exempt.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said, Rav said: If two pieces were before him, one of fat and one of oil, and he ate one of them and does not know which one he ate - he is liable. If he ate a piece, uncertain whether it was fat or oil - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב? קָסָבַר: שְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת – אִיקְּבַע אִיסּוּרָא, חֲתִיכָה אַחַת – לָא (קָבְעָה) [אִיקְּבַע] אִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: What is the reason of Rav? He holds two pieces prohibition was established, one piece, the prohibition was not established.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: What is the reason for Rav's opinion? He holds: with two pieces, the prohibition is established; with one piece, the prohibition is not established.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין אִיקְּבַע אִיסּוּרָא לְשֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לְבָרֵר אִיסּוּרֵיהּ?
human_translation: What is there between prohibition was established, that it is impossible to identify its prohibition?
llm_translation: What is the difference between when the prohibition is established and when it is possible to clarify its prohibitions?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל חֵלֶב וְאַחַת שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן, וּבָא גּוֹי וְאָכַל אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, וּבָא יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה, לְרָבָא – לֵיכָּא ״מִצְווֹת״ בְּעִידָּנָא דַּאֲכַל יִשְׂרָאֵל. לְרַבִּי זֵירָא – אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְבָרֵר אִיסּוּרֵיהּ. לְרַב נַחְמָן – אִיקְּבַע אִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: between them where had two pieces before him, one of fat and one of fat. And a gentile came and ate the first piece, and a Jew came and ate the second According to Rava at the time when the Jew ate not mitzvot According to Rabbi Zeira it is impossible to identify its prohibition, according to Rav Naḥman prohibition was established,
llm_translation: There is a difference between them, such as when there were before him two pieces, one of fat and one of oil, and a non-Jew came and ate the first one, and a Jew came and ate the second one, according to Rava - there are no "mitzvot" at the time when the non-Jew ate. According to Rabbi Zeira - it is impossible to clarify its prohibition. According to Rav Nachman - the prohibition is established.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כּוֹי – חַיָּיבִין עַל חֶלְבּוֹ אָשָׁם תָּלוּי! רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לָא בָּעֵי קְבִיעוּתָא לְאִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman Rabbi Eliezer says: a koy , one is obligated to a provisional guilt offering for its fat. Rabbi Eliezer does not require the prohibition to be established
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Nachman: Rabbi Eliezer says: If one slaughters a koi - he is liable for its forbidden fat! Rabbi Eliezer does not require a fixed measure for prohibition.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: סָפֵק בֶּן תִּשְׁעָה לָרִאשׁוֹן, אוֹ בֶּן שִׁבְעָה לָאַחֲרוֹן – יוֹצִיא וְהַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר, וְחַיָּיבִין בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי! הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא.
human_translation: raised objection to uncertainty whether is nine old of the first whether seven old of the latter he must divorce her; but the offspring is unflawed And they are obligated a provisional guilt offering. whose is this It is Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: If the first one is of uncertain age, being possibly nine years old, or the latter one is possibly seven years old - he may perform halizah and the child is legitimate, but they are obligated in a conditional guilt-offering! Is this not a contradiction? It is Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: נִמְצָא עַל שֶׁלּוֹ – טְמֵאִין וְחַיָּיבִין בַּקׇּרְבָּן, נִמְצָא עַל שֶׁלָּהּ אֹתְיוֹם – טְמֵאִין וְחַיָּיבִין בַּקׇּרְבָּן, נִמְצָא עַל שֶׁלָּהּ לְאַחַר זְמַן – טְמֵאִים מִסָּפֵק וּפְטוּרִין מִן הַקׇּרְבָּן, וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: וְחַיָּיבִין בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי!
human_translation: raised objection to was found on his ritually impure and they are liable offering. was found on her immediately they are impure and are liable offering. was found on her after time impure due to uncertainty and they are exempt from the offering. And is taught with regard to liable to a provisional guilt offering.
llm_translation: He raised an objection: If it is found on its own - they are impure and obligated in the sacrifice; if it is found on hers - they are impure and obligated in the sacrifice; if it is found on hers after the time - they are impure due to doubt and exempt from the sacrifice. And he taught about it: and they are obligated in a guilt offering!

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתִּיק. לְבָתַר דִּנְפַק אֲמַר: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אֲמַרִי לֵיהּ דְּהָא מַנִּי רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּלָא בָּעֵי קְבִיעוּתָא לְאִיסּוּרָא?
human_translation: was silent After left he said: What is the reason I did not say to him, that whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, who does not require the prohibition to be established
llm_translation: The text reads: "Ishtik. Levatar dinpik amar: Mai ta'ama la amari leih de mana Rabbi Meir hi, de lo ba'i k'viusa le'issura?" Translation: "He remained silent. After he left, he said: What is the reason that they did not say to him that it is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, who does not require a fixed prohibition?"

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אָשָׁם תָּלוּי בַּחוּץ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין.
human_translation: As it is taught one slaughters a provisional guilt offering outside Rabbi Meir deems obligated and the Rabbis deem exempt.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who slaughters a guilt-offering outside the Temple - Rabbi Meir obligates him to bring a sacrifice, and the Sages exempt him.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר קָאֵי.
human_translation: But why Let him say to him that is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, this is teaching us: That Rabbi Meir holds in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: And why? Say to him that it is the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer! For behold, it is evident to us, that Rabbi Meir follows the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: חֲתִיכָה, סָפֵק שֶׁל חֵלֶב סָפֵק שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן, וַאֲכָלָהּ – בָּאנוּ לְמַחֲלוֹקֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וַחֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rabba bar Avuh says Rav says: a piece uncertain of fat uncertain of fat, and he ate it, we have arrived at the dispute Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Avuh said in the name of Rav: A piece, uncertain if it is fat or uncertain if it is suet, and one ate it - we come to the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer and the Sages.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, מַאי אִירְיָא כִּי אַכְלַהּ? אֲפִילּוּ לָא אַכְלַהּ נָמֵי! דְּהָתְנַן: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִתְנַדֵּב אָדָם אָשָׁם תָּלוּי בְּכׇל יוֹם!
human_translation: Why specifically where one ate to Rabbi Eliezer? Even not eaten also as we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: A person may volunteer a provisional guilt offering every day.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Eliezer, what is the law if she ate? Even if she did not eat, also! As we have learned: Rabbi Eliezer says: A person may voluntarily bring a guilt-offering every day!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אַלִּיבָּא דְּבָבָא בֶּן בּוּטָא, דִּתְנַן: אֶלָּא אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן עַד שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לְבֵית סָפֵק.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Rabbi Eliezer in accordance with of Bava ben Buta, as we learned But they say to him: Wait until you enter into a situation of potential uncertainty.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Rabbi Eliezer in the house of Baba ben Buta said, as we learned: Rather, they say to him: "Wait until you enter the uncertain house."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן וְאַחַת שֶׁל חֵלֶב, בָּא יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָכַל אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, בָּא גּוֹי וְאָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – חַיָּיב, וְכֵן כֶּלֶב, וְכֵן עוֹרֵב. בָּא גּוֹי וְאָכַל אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, בָּא יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – פָּטוּר. וְרַבִּי מְחַיֵּיב.
human_translation: The Sages taught one had before him two pieces one of fat and one of fat, a Jew came and ate the first a gentile came and ate the second, liable And the same a dog and the same a raven a gentile came and ate the first a Jew came and ate the second exempt, And Rabbi deems obligated
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If there were before him two pieces, one of fat and one of oil, if an Israelite came and ate the first one, and a non-Jew came and ate the second one - he is liable, and the same applies to a dog and a raven. If a non-Jew came and ate the first one, and an Israelite came and ate the second one - he is exempt. And Rabbi Meir obligates.

hebrew_text: אָכַל אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה בְּשׁוֹגֵג, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה בְּמֵזִיד – חַיָּיב. הָרִאשׁוֹנָה בְּמֵזִיד, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה בְּשׁוֹגֵג – פָּטוּר, וְרַבִּי מְחַיֵּיב. אָכַל שְׁתֵּיהֶן בְּמֵזִיד – פָּטוּר מִכְּלוּם.
human_translation: ate the first unwittingly and the second intentionally, liable the first intentionally and the second unwittingly, exempt, Rabbi deems obligated ate both of them intentionally, exempt from anything.
llm_translation: He ate the first portion unintentionally, and the second intentionally - liable. The first intentionally, and the second unintentionally - exempt, and Rabbi obligates him. If he ate both intentionally - exempt from both.

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּיהֶן בְּשׁוֹגֵג – שְׁנֵיהֶן חַיָּיבִין. הַשֵּׁנִי לֹא מִן הַדִּין, אֶלָּא שֶׁאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר פָּטוּר – קָבַעְתָּ אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה בְּחַטָּאת.
human_translation: two of them unwittingly, each of them is liable the second not by law, Rather, that if you say exempt, you have established the first to a sin offering.
llm_translation: Both of them unintentionally - both of them are obligated. The second one is not from the law, but if you say exempt - you have established the first one with a sin offering.

hebrew_text: וּמַנּוּ? אִי רַבִּי – מִן הַדִּין וּמִן הַדִּין הוּא! אִי רַבָּנַן – מִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא נִקְבַּע רִאשׁוֹן בְּחַטָּאת, נֵימָא לֵיהּ לְשֵׁנִי: אַיְיתִי חוּלִּין לָעֲזָרָה?! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: And with whose If Rabbi It is certainly by law If the Rabbis, in order that we do not establish first a sin offering, we would say to the second Bring a non-sacred animal in the courtyard? Rav Ashi said
llm_translation: And they counted? If Rabbi - from the law and from the law he is! If the Rabbis - because the first was not established in the sin offering, let him say to the second: "I brought secular funds to the Temple?!" Rav Ashi said:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מִתְנַדֵּב אָדָם אָשָׁם תָּלוּי בְּכׇל יוֹם. הִילְכָּךְ, אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי אָשָׁם תָּלוּי וְאַתְנִי: אִי אָכַל רִאשׁוֹן שׁוּמָּן, הוּא אָכַל חֵלֶב – לֶיהֱוֵי כַּפָּרָה, וְאִי לָא – לֶיהֱוֵי נְדָבָה.
human_translation: It is Rabbi Eliezer, who says a person may volunteer a provisional guilt offering every day. Therefore, we say to bring a provisional guilt offering, And stipulate: If first ate fat, he ate fat should be an atonement And if not, let it be a gift
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, that is, who said: If a person volunteers a guilt-offering, it is dependent every day. Therefore, we say to him: Bring a dependent guilt-offering and state: If he ate the first portion, he should eat the fat - it will be atonement, and if not - it will be a voluntary offering.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָכַל סְפֵק חֵלֶב וְנוֹדַע לוֹ, סְפֵק חֵלֶב וְנוֹדַע לוֹ – רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמֵּבִיא חַטָּאת עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת – כָּךְ מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת.
human_translation: The Sages taught ate uncertain forbidden fat and he was informed uncertain forbidden fat and he was informed Rabbi says: I say just as he bring a sin offering for each and every one so too, he bring a provisional guilt offering for each and every one.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one ate a doubtful fat and it became known to him, a doubtful fat and it became known to him - Rabbi says: I say, just as one brings a sin offering for each and every one, so too one brings a guilt offering dependent on each and every one.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מֵבִיא אֶלָּא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אֶחָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ אֲשֶׁר שָׁגָג״ – אֲפִילּוּ עַל שְׁגָגוֹת הַרְבֵּה אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אֶחָת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda; Rabbi Elazar; and Rabbi Shimon say: bring only one provisional guilt offering, as it is stated: for him concerning the unwitting error which he committed unwittingly obligated only one even for many unwitting sins,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Elazar, and Rabbi Shimon say: One only brings a guilt offering for a specific unintentional transgression, as it is stated: "For his unwitting transgression that he committed" (Leviticus 5:18) – even for many unintentional transgressions, one is only liable for one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי: יְדִיעוֹת סָפֵק מְחַלְּקוֹת לְחַטָּאוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: Here Rabbi taught Knowledge of an uncertain divides to sin offerings
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Here Rabbi taught: Knowledge, doubt, distinguish between sins.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֵין יְדִיעוֹת סָפֵק מְחַלְּקוֹת לְחַטָּאוֹת, אֶלָּא הָכִי קָתָנֵי: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאִם הָיְתָה לוֹ יְדִיעָה וַדַּאי מֵבִיא חַטָּאת עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, כָּךְ אִם הָיְתָה לוֹ יְדִיעַת סָפֵק מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת.
human_translation: Rava says: Knowledge of uncertainty does not divide into sin offerings. Rather, this is teaching Just as if he had had definite knowledge bring a sin offering for each and every one, so too, if he had knowledge of uncertain bring a provisional guilt offering for each and every one.
llm_translation: Rava said: Knowledge does not divide in cases of doubt for sins, but thus it was taught: Just as if he had definite knowledge, he brings a sin offering for each and every one, so too if he had doubtful knowledge, he brings a guilt offering suspended for each and every one.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְאַתְּ לָא תִּסְבְּרָא דִּידִיעוֹת סָפֵק מְחַלְּקוֹת לְחַטָּאוֹת? דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ יְדִיעוֹת אֵין מְחַלְּקוֹת לְחַטָּאוֹת, וְחַטָּאת אַחַת מֵבִיא, אַמַּאי מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת?
human_translation: Abaye said to And you? Do you not hold that knowledge of uncertainty divides to sin offerings As, if it enters your mind knowledge of uncertainty not divide with regard to sin offerings, and brings one sin offering, why brings a provisional guilt offering for each and every one,
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: And you do not think that regarding matters of uncertainty they divide for sins? For if it were your opinion that regarding matters of knowledge they do not divide for sins, and one sin brings guilt, why then does one bring a guilt-offering dependent upon each and every one sin?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: כֹּל שֶׁחֲלוּקִין בְּחַטָּאוֹת – חֲלוּקִין בַּאֲשָׁמוֹת!
human_translation: isn’t it taught principle with regard to matter any where divided for sin offerings, divided for guilt offerings
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: The general principle of the matter: Anything that they are divided in sins - they are divided in guilt offerings!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: וּלְדִידָךְ, דְּאָמְרַתְּ יְדִיעוֹת סָפֵק מְחַלְּקוֹת לְחַטָּאוֹת, אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, אָכַל כְּזַיִת חֵלֶב לִפְנֵי יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים וּכְזַיִת חֵלֶב אַחַר יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים בִּמְקוֹם אָשָׁם תָּלוּי קָאֵי – הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי חַטָּאוֹת?
human_translation: Rava bar Ḥanan said to Abaye: And according to you, that you said knowledge of uncertainty divides to sin offerings, if that is so, ate an olive-bulk of fat before Yom Kippur and olive-bulk of fat after Yom Kippur. Yom Kippur stands in place of a provisional guilt offering, so too, that bring two sin offerings?
llm_translation: Rava said to Abbaye: And according to your opinion, that you said uncertainties are divided into sins, rather from now on, one should eat an olive-bulk of fat before Yom Kippur and an olive-bulk of fat after Yom Kippur, and on Yom Kippur, where a guilt-offering is pending, is it thus true that one brings two sin-offerings?

hebrew_text: הָא בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] אַכְלִינּוּן! אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּמַאן לֵימָא לַן דְּיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים מְכַפַּר עַל דְּלָא מִתְיְדַע לֵיהּ? דִּילְמָא וְהוּא דְּמִתְיְדַע לֵיהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: הוֹדַע וְלֹא הוֹדַע תְּנַן.
human_translation: But he ate them in a single lapse of awareness Abaye said to Who shall say to us that Yom Kippur atones for that were unknown to him? Perhaps that were known to him. Rava said to him We learned one became aware or did not become aware
llm_translation: The Gemara: "This, by concealing one, they ate!" Abaye said to him: And who will say to us that Yom Kippurim atones for that which is not known to him? Perhaps he does know! Rava said to him: Whether he knows or does not know, we have learned.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: מָה אִילּוּ אָכַל כְּזַיִת חֵלֶב שַׁחֲרִית בְּיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים וּכְזַיִת חֵלֶב בְּמִנְחָה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמִיחַיַּיב שְׁתֵּי חַטָּאוֹת?
human_translation: Some say Rava bar Ḥanan said to Abaye: what If ate an olive-bulk of fat morning of Yom Kippur and an olive-bulk of fat in afternoon of Yom Kippur, so too be obligated two sin offerings?
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rava son of Hanan said to Abbaye: If one were to eat the size of an olive of morning fat on Yom Kippur morning and the size of an olive of fat in the afternoon on Yom Kippur, is it not true that he would be liable for two sin offerings?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּמַאן לֵימָא לַן דְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים כֹּל שַׁעְתָּא מְכַפַּר? דִּילְמָא כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא מֵאוּרְתָּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חַנָּה: תְּרָדָא, תַּנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁבָּא לְיָדוֹ סְפֵק עֲבֵירָה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אֲפִילּוּ עִם חֲשֵׁיכָה – פָּטוּר, שֶׁכׇּל הַיּוֹם מְכַפֵּר!
human_translation: Abaye said to Who shall say to us that Yom Kippur provides atonement at every hour Perhaps the entire day in the evening? Rabba bar bar Ḥana said to him: Fool [ terada ]! It is taught one who encountered uncertainty a sin on Yom Kippur, even if at nightfall exempt, as the entire day atones
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And who should we say that on Yom Kippur all the time atones? Perhaps the entire day is considered as if it were evening! Rabba bar bar Ḥana said to him: Descend, and learn: If one had a doubt of transgression in his hand on Yom Kippur, even in total darkness - he is exempt, for the entire day atones!

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: אָכַל וְשָׁתָה בְּהֶעְלֵם (אַחַת) [אֶחָד] – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא חַטָּאת אַחַת. וְהָא בֵּין אֲכִילָה לִשְׁתִיָּיה אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלֹא הֲוָה שְׁהוּת בַּיּוֹם, דְּמִתְיְידַע לֵיהּ וְכַפַּר לֵיהּ, דְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים בִּמְקוֹם אָשָׁם תָּלוּי קָאֵי, וְקָתָנֵי: ״אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא חַטָּאת אֶחָת״.
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin raises objection one ate and drank in one lapse of awareness, he is liable only one sin offering. But between eating and drinking it is impossible that there was no time during the day. That him to knowledge and atone for him, as Yom Kippur stands in place of a provisional guilt offering. And it is taught He is liable only one sin offering.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Idi bar Avin asked: If one ate and drank in secret - he is only liable for one sin offering. But isn't it impossible for there not to be a pause during the day, for he will recognize it and atone for it, as the Day of Atonement is dependent on the place of the suspended guilt-offering, and it teaches: "He is only liable for one sin offering."

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ יְדִיעוֹת סָפֵק מְחַלְּקוֹת לְחַטָּאוֹת, לִיחַיַּיב שְׁתֵּי חַטָּאוֹת! אָמְרִי: כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא – לְרַבִּי, הָא – רַבָּנַן הִיא.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind knowledge uncertainty divides to sin offerings he should be liable two sin offerings. say When Rabbi Zeira said of Rabbi this is the Rabbis.
llm_translation: "If it enters your mind that knowledge of uncertainties divides into sins, he should be liable for two sins! They said: For Rabbi Zeira said - to Rabbi, this is the teaching of the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבִּי הִיא, דְּקָתָנֵי: שָׁתָה צִיר אוֹ מוּרְיָיס – פָּטוּר. הָא חוֹמֶץ – חַיָּיב,
human_translation: But from the latter clause is Rabbi as teaches drank liquid or fish brine [ morayes ], exempt. But vinegar liable.
llm_translation: And this is from the latter part, it is Rabbi, as it was taught: If one drank vinegar or mustard - he is exempt. But if it is vinegar - he is liable.

hebrew_text: וּמַנִּי? רַבִּי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: חוֹמֶץ אֵין מֵשִׁיב אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי, חוֹמֶץ מֵשִׁיב אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ. וּמִדְּסֵיפָא רַבִּי, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי רַבִּי! אָמְרִי: סֵיפָא – רַבִּי, רֵישָׁא – רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And who is It is Rabbi as it is taught Vinegar does not revive the spirit, Rabbi says: I say vinegar does revive the spirit And from the latter clause Rabbi the first clause also Rabbi say the latter clause Rabbi the first clause the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is the Tanna? It is Rabbi, as it was taught: Chametz does not restore the soul, Rabbi says: I say, chametz restores the soul. And from the latter clause Rabbi, in the beginning, should be Rabbi! They said: In the latter clause - Rabbi, in the beginning - Rabbanan."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא: אָכַל הַיּוֹם אָכַל לְמָחָר, נֶהֱנָה הַיּוֹם נֶהֱנָה לְמָחָר, אָכַל הַיּוֹם נֶהֱנָה לְמָחָר, נֶהֱנָה הַיּוֹם אָכַל לְמָחָר, וַאֲפִילּוּ מִכָּאן וְעַד שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, מִנַּיִן שֶׁהֵן מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה?
human_translation: Rava raised objection ate today ate tomorrow, derived benefit today derived benefit tomorrow, ate today derived benefit tomorrow, derived benefit today ate tomorrow, even from now until three years from where that they combine with each other
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him, Rava: One who eats today, eats for tomorrow; one who benefits today, benefits for tomorrow; one who eats today, benefits for tomorrow; one who benefits today, eats for tomorrow. And even from here until three years, from where do we derive that they combine with each other?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תִּמְעוֹל מַעַל״ – רִיבָּה. וְאַמַּאי, הָא כַּיפַּר עֲלֵיהּ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים!
human_translation: the verse states: commits a misuse [ tim’ol ma’al ]” extended But why isn’t his atoned by Yom Kippur?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Talmud lomar: 'tim'ol ma'al' - ribah. Ve'amai, ha kaipar aleih yom hakippurim!" English translation: The Talmud teaches: "He shall bear his guilt" - an increase. And why? Because he atoned for it on the Day of Atonement!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: כִּי מְכַפַּר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – עַל אִיסּוּרָא, עַל מָמוֹנָא לָא מְכַפַּר.
human_translation: say When Yom Kippur atone with regard to ritual prohibitions. not atone with regard to monetary matters.
llm_translation: They said: "For on Yom Kippur atones - for prohibitions, but not for monetary matters."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כִּי מְכַפַּר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – עַל כּוּלֵּיהּ שִׁיעוּרָא, עַל פַּלְגָא דְּשִׁיעוּרָא לָא מְכַפַּר.
human_translation: If you wish, say When does Yom Kippur atone in their full measure, not atone for half of measure.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "When the Day of Atonement atones" - it atones for all measurements, but for half a measurement it does not atone.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי: יְדִיעוֹת סָפֵק מְחַלְּקוֹת לְחַטָּאוֹת. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵין יְדִיעוֹת סָפֵק מְחַלְּקוֹת לְחַטָּאוֹת,
human_translation: Similarly, Reish Lakish says: Here, Rabbi taught knowledge of uncertain divides to sin offerings Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Knowledge of uncertainty does not divide to sin offerings.
llm_translation: And so said Reish Lakish: Here Rabbi changed his opinion: Knowledge of doubt divides for sins. Rabbi Yochanan said: Knowledge of doubt does not divide for sins.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָתָנֵי: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאִם הָיְתָה לוֹ יְדִיעָה וַדַּאי מֵבִיא עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, כָּךְ אִם הָיְתָה לוֹ יְדִיעַת סָפֵק מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאֶחָת.
human_translation: Rather, this is teaching Just as if he had had definite knowledge he bring for each and every one, so too, if he had had knowledge of uncertainty bring a provisional guilt offering for each and every one.
llm_translation: Rather, thus it was taught: Just as if he had certainty, he certainly brings a guilt-offering for each and every one, so too, if he had uncertain knowledge, he brings a guilt-offering dependent on each and every one.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הַיְינוּ דְּקָא תָלֵי לְאָשָׁם בְּחַטָּאת. אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, חַטָּאת בְּאָשָׁם מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, this is a provisional guilt offering is dependent upon sin offering. But according to Reish Lakish, should have taught a sin offering dependent upon guilt offering, difficult.
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Yochanan, that is what he is hanging the guilt-offering on the sin-offering. Rather, according to Reish Lakish, why does he need a guilt-offering for a sin-offering? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: וְרָמֵי דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְרָמֵי דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. אַדְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁנֵי שְׁבִילִין, אֶחָד טָמֵא וְאֶחָד טָהוֹר, וְהָלַךְ בָּרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא נִכְנַס, בַּשֵּׁנִי וְנִכְנַס – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction from Rabbi Yoḥanan to of Rabbi Yoḥanan, and raises a contradiction from Reish Lakish to of Reish Lakish. As it is taught two paths: one ritually impure and one ritually pure, and walked on the first and did not enter and on the second and entered liable
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection to the statement of Rabbi Yochanan from the statement of Reish Lakish. Reish Lakish taught: It was taught in a Baraita: If there are two paths, one impure and one pure, and a person walked on the first path and did not enter, and then walked on the second path and entered – he is liable.

hebrew_text: הָלַךְ בָּרִאשׁוֹן וְנִכְנַס – פָּטוּר, בַּשֵּׁנִי וְנִכְנַס – חַיָּיב. הָלַךְ בָּרִאשׁוֹן וְנִכְנַס, וְהִזָּה וְשָׁנָה וְטָבַל, וְהָלַךְ בַּשֵּׁנִי וְנִכְנַס – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: walked on the first and entered exempt on the second and entered obligated walked on the first and entered and sprinkling and again and immersed, and walked on the second and entered liable
llm_translation: He who went out first and entered - exempt, in the second and entered - liable. He who went out first and entered, and relieved himself and ate and immersed, and went out second and entered - liable.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר בָּזוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר בְּכוּלָּן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon exempts in this Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda deems exempt from all of those in the name of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon exempts with regard to a zoh. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda exempts with regard to all of them because of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּקַמַּיְיתָא? אָמַר רָבָא: הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָלַךְ בָּרִאשׁוֹן וּבִשְׁעַת הִילּוּכוֹ בַּשֵּׁנִי שָׁכַח שֶׁהָלַךְ בָּרִאשׁוֹן, וּבְהָא פְּלִיגִי, תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: מִקְצָת יְדִיעָה כִּידִיעָה דָּמְיָא, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: מִקְצָת יְדִיעָה לָאו כִּידִיעָה דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: even in the first case? Rava said: What are we dealing with here? where he walked on the first and at the time of his walking on the second he forgot that he walked on the first And with regard to this disagree: The first tanna holds partial knowledge is considered like knowledge, and Rabbi Shimon holds partial knowledge is not considered like knowledge.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even in the case of Kamayta? Rava said: What are we dealing with here? For example, if one walked in the first place, and at the time of his walking in the second place, he forgot that he had walked in the first place, and they dispute here: the first Tanna holds: Partial knowledge is like full knowledge, and Rabbi Shimon holds: Partial knowledge is not like full knowledge.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: הָלַךְ בָּרִאשׁוֹן וְנִכְנַס, וְהִיזָּה וְטָבַל, וְהָלַךְ בַּשֵּׁנִי וְנִכְנַס – חַיָּיב. אַמַּאי חַיָּיב? הָא לָא הֲוַי לֵיהּ יְדִיעָה!
human_translation: The Master said: walked on the first and entered and sprinkling and immersed, and walked on the second and entered liable Why liable? he did not have knowledge
llm_translation: Master said: He walked in first and entered, and urinated and immersed, and walked in second and entered - he is liable. Why is he liable? Because he did not have intent!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא, דְּלָא בָּעֵי יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, כָּאן עָשׂוּ סְפֵק יְדִיעָה כִּידִיעָה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: whose is this It is Rabbi Yishmael, who does not require knowledge at the outset, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: You even say the Rabbis, here they rendered uncertain knowledge like knowledge.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "Ha mani - Rabbi Yishmael hi, de'lo ba'i yedi'ah bat'chilah." Rabbi Yochanan said: "Even if you say they are Rabbanan, here they made a doubt like certainty."

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ: כָּאן עָשׂוּ, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: It enters your mind here they rendered and the same is true for the entire Torah. difficult, of Rabbi Yoḥanan of Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the following Talmudic text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the translation: Talmudic text: "Salka datach: kan asu, vehu hadin lechol hatorah kullah, kashya deRabbi Yochanan adRabbi Yochanan." English translation: "Your mind has arisen: here they did, and it is the same for the entire Torah, the difficulty of Rabbi Yochanan to Rabbi Yochanan."

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אַדְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: And difficult of Reish Lakish of Reish Lakish
llm_translation: The difficulty of Reish Lakish, I will expound Reish Lakish.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן עָשׂוּ, אֲבָל בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ – לָא,
human_translation: Granted, of Rabbi Yoḥanan of Rabbi Yoḥanan not difficult. Here they rendered but with regard to the entire Torah not
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Yochanan, according to Rabbi Yochanan, it is not difficult: here they did, but in the entire Torah - no.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? הָכָא, גַּבֵּי טוּמְאָה כְּתִיב: ״וְנֶעְלַם מִמֶּנּוּ וְהוּא טָמֵא״ – יְדִיעָה דְּאִית בַּהּ נָמֵי סָפֵק חַיָּיב קְרָא, אֲבָל בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ כְּתִיב: ״אוֹ הוֹדַע אֵלָיו חַטָּאתוֹ״ – אִי אִית לֵיהּ יְדִיעָה הוּא דְּמִחַיַּיב.
human_translation: What is the reason Here, with regard to ritual impurity, it is written: and it was concealed from him that he is impure” knowledge that has an uncertainty to it, the verse renders obligated But with regard to the entire Torah it is written: which he has sinned, be known to him” it is if he has knowledge that he is obligated
llm_translation: What is the reason? Here, regarding impurity, it is written: "And it is hidden from him, and he is impure" - the knowledge that there is a doubt in it, the verse obligates. But in the entire Torah it is written: "Or if his sin is made known to him" - if there is no knowledge, it is what obligates.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ קַשְׁיָא, אַדְּמוֹקֵים לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, לוֹקְמַהּ כְּרַבִּי! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל נָמֵי לָא בָּעֵי יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: But of Reish Lakish difficult: Instead of interpreting in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, he should interpret it in accordance with Rabbi This is teaching us That Rabbi Yishmael also does not require knowledge at the outset,
llm_translation: Rather, to Reish Lakish it is difficult, they are establishing for him like Rabbi Yishmael, to establish like Rabbi! This is what he is teaching us, that Rabbi Yishmael also does not require knowledge at the outset.

hebrew_text: הָא מַתְנִיתִין הִיא! דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: ״וְנֶעְלַם מִמֶּנּוּ״ שְׁתֵּי פְּעָמִים – לְחַיֵּיב עַל הֶעְלֵם טוּמְאָה וְעַל הֶעְלֵם מִקְדָּשׁ!
human_translation: But a mishna, as we learned Rabbi Yishmael says: “It was concealed from him” twice. to render one obligated for a lapse of awareness ritual impurity and for a lapse of awareness Temple.
llm_translation: The Mishnah is that which we learned: Rabbi Yishmael says, "And it was hidden from him" two times - to obligate for concealing impurity and for concealing sanctity!

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אֲמִינָא: מִקְרָא לֵית לֵיהּ, מִגְּמָרָא אִית לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: was necessary enter your mind to say: has no verse he has a tradition teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded: there is no Scriptural source, but there is a tradition, and we rely on it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חֵלֶב וְנוֹתָר לְפָנָיו, וְאָכַל אֶחָד מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן אָכַל, אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה וַאֲחוֹתוֹ עִמּוֹ בַּבַּיִת, שָׁגַג בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה מֵהֶן שָׁגַג, שַׁבָּת וְיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, וְעָשָׂה מְלָאכָה בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה מֵהֶן עָשָׂה – רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: fat and notar before him and he ate one of them and he does not know which of them he ate; his menstruating wife and his sister with him in the house he unwittingly with one of them and he does not know with which of them he unwittingly Shabbat and Yom Kippur and he performed labor twilight and he does not know on which of he performed Rabbi Eliezer deems liable a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua deems exempt,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: If one has before him fat and forbidden remnants, and he ate one of them but does not know which one he ate, his wife is prohibited to him and his sister is with him in the house. If he unintentionally violated one of them and does not know which one he violated, on Shabbat and Yom Kippur, and he performed work between the sunsets and does not know which one he performed - Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ עַל הָעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת שֶׁהוּא פָּטוּר, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: מִקְצָת עָשָׂה הַיּוֹם וּמִקְצָת עָשָׂה לְמָחָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: did not disagree with regard to one who performs labor twilight that exempt, as I say: He performed part today, and he performed part the following day.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yosei: They did not dispute regarding one who performs work between sunsets, who is exempt, for I say: Some he did today and some he will do tomorrow.

hebrew_text: עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ? עַל הָעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה בְּתוֹךְ הַיּוֹם וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אִם בְּשַׁבָּת עָשָׂה אִם בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים עָשָׂה, אוֹ עַל הָעוֹשֶׂה וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ מֵעֵין אֵיזוֹ מְלָאכָה עָשָׂה. שֶׁרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: פּוֹטְרוֹ הָיָה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אַף מֵאָשָׁם תָּלוּי.
human_translation: With regard to what did they disagree? With regard to one who performs labor in the midst of the day, and he does not know whether on Shabbat he performed whether on Yom Kippur he performed or with regard to one who performs and he does not know which labor he performed. As, Rabbi Eliezer deems liable a sin offering and Rabbi Yehoshua deems exempt. Rabbi Yehuda said: Rabbi Yehoshua would deem him exempt even from a provisional guilt offering.
llm_translation: On what do they argue? On one who performs labor during the day and does not know whether he did it on Shabbat or on Yom Kippur, or on one who performs labor and does not know what type of labor he did. Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts. Rabbi Yehuda said: Rabbi Yehoshua would even exempt him from a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ עַל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשֵּׁם אֶחָד שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב, עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ – עַל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת, שֶׁרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Shimon Shezuri say: did not disagree with regard to a matter from one category, that he is liable, With regard to what did they disagree? With regard to a matter from two categories, As, Rabbi Eliezer deems liable a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua deems him exempt,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Shimon Shezuri say: They did not argue about a matter that is from one name that is liable, what did they argue about - about a matter that is from two names, that Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֲפִילּוּ נִתְכַּוֵּון לִלְקוֹט תְּאֵנִים וְלִיקֵּט עֲנָבִים, עֲנָבִים וְלִיקֵּט תְּאֵנִים, שְׁחוֹרוֹת וְלִיקֵּט לְבָנוֹת, לְבָנוֹת וְלִיקֵּט שְׁחוֹרוֹת – רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר. תְּמֵיהַנִי אִם פָּטַר בָּהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. אִם כֵּן, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״אֲשֶׁר חָטָא בָּהּ״? פְּרָט לַמִּתְעַסֵּק.
