human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: Even intended to pick figs and he picked grapes, grapes and he picked figs, black and he picked white white and he picked black Rabbi Eliezer deems liable a sin offering and Rabbi Yehoshua deems exempt. I wonder if Rabbi Yehoshua deemed exempt in If so, why is it stated: wherein he has sinned” exclude one who acts unawares
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: Even if one intended to gather figs and pick grapes, grapes and pick figs, black ones and pick white ones, white ones and pick black ones - Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts. I wonder if Rabbi Yehoshua exempts from it. If so, why is it stated "which he sinned with it"? To exclude one who is engaged in a different activity.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מָה נַפְשָׁךְ? אִי חֵלֶב אָכַל – חַיָּיב, אִי נוֹתָר אָכַל – חַיָּיב! אִי אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה בָּעַל – חַיָּיב, אִי אֲחוֹתוֹ בָּעַל – חַיָּיב! אִי בְּשַׁבָּת עָשָׂה מְלָאכָה – חַיָּיב, אִי בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים עָשָׂה מְלָאכָה – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: Whichever way you If fat he ate, liable; if notar he ate, liable. If his menstruating wife he engaged in intercourse, liable; if his sister he engaged in intercourse, liable. If on Shabbat he performed labor, liable; if on Yom Kippur he performed labor, liable.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A teaching was taught: Rabbi Eliezer said: "What is your intention? If one ate forbidden fat - liable, if one left over forbidden fat - liable! If one's wife is a menstruant - liable, if one's sister's husband - liable! If one performed labor on Shabbat - liable, if one performed labor on Yom Kippur - liable!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״אֲשֶׁר חָטָא בָּהּ״ – עַד שֶׁיִּוָּדַע לוֹ בַּמֶּה חָטָא. וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הַאי ״בָּהּ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: פְּרָט לַמִּתְעַסֵּק.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him states: “Wherein he has sinned,” until it becomes known to him with which he sinned. And Rabbi Eliezer, what does he do with this “Which He requires it excludes one who acts unawares
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: Behold he says "which he sinned in it" - until he is made known to him in what he sinned. And Rabbi Eliezer, what does he do with this "in it"? He requires it: to exclude one who is engaged.

hebrew_text: מִתְעַסֵּק דְּמַאי? אִי דַּחֲלָבִים וַעֲרָיוֹת – חַיָּיב, דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמִּתְעַסֵּק בַּחֲלָבִים וַעֲרָיוֹת – חַיָּיב, שֶׁכֵּן נֶהֱנָה!
human_translation: acts unawares in which If of fats and those with whom intercourse is forbidden liable As Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: one who acts unawares of fats or those with whom intercourse is forbidden, liable because he derived pleasure.
llm_translation: Engaged in what? If with forbidden fats and forbidden relationships - liable, as Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: One who engages with forbidden fats and forbidden relationships - liable, for he has derived benefit!

hebrew_text: וְאִי מִתְעַסֵּק בְּשַׁבָּת – פָּטוּר, מַאי טַעְמָא? מְלֶאכֶת מַחְשֶׁבֶת אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה!
human_translation: And if who acts unawares on Shabbat exempt. What is the reason? The Torah prohibited planned, labor
llm_translation: "And if one is engaged on Shabbat - exempt, what is the reason? The Torah prohibited deliberate work!"

hebrew_text: לְרָבָא, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּון לַחְתּוֹךְ אֶת הַתָּלוּשׁ וְחָתַךְ אֶת הַמְחוּבָּר. לְאַבָּיֵי, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּגוֹן דְּנִתְכַּוֵּון לְהַגְבִּיהַּ אֶת הַתָּלוּשׁ וְחָתַךְ אֶת הַמְחוּבָּר.
human_translation: According to Rava, you find where intended to cut a detached and he cut attached. According to Abaye, you find where he intended to lift detached and cut attached
llm_translation: To Rava, she found like this, that he intended to cut the hanging and he cut the attached. To Abbaye, she found like this, that he intended to lift the hanging and he cut the attached.

hebrew_text: דְּאִיתְּמַר: נִתְכַּוֵּון לְהַגְבִּיהַּ אֶת הַתָּלוּשׁ וְחָתַךְ אֶת הַמְחוּבָּר – פָּטוּר, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּהָא לָא אִיכַּוַּון לְשׁוּם חֲתִיכָה. לַחְתּוֹךְ אֶת הַתָּלוּשׁ וְחָתַךְ אֶת הַמְחוּבָּר – אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: חַיָּיב, דְּהָא אִיכַּוַּון לְשׁוּם חֲתִיכָה. רָבָא אָמַר: פָּטוּר, דְּהָא לָא אִיכַּוַּון לַחֲתִיכָה דְּאִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: As it was stated: intended to lift detached and cut attached exempt What is the reason? due to that he did not intend for the sake of cutting, to cut a detached and cut attached, Abaye said liable, due to that he intended for the sake of cutting. Rava said: exempt, due to that he did not intend to a prohibited cutting.
llm_translation: It was taught: If one intends to lift the detached item and cut the attached item - he is exempt. What is the reason? Because it is not intended for any specific piece. If one intends to cut the detached item and cut the attached item - Abbaye said: He is liable, because it is intended for a specific piece. Rava said: He is exempt, because it is not intended for the piece of prohibition.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: דִּקְדַּקְתֶּם אַחֲרַי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: did not disagree is taught Rabbi Yosei said to You were diligent my
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: They did not argue. It was taught: Rabbi Yosei said to them, "You have been meticulous after me."

hebrew_text: מַאי אָמְרִי לֵיהּ דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ דִּקְדַּקְתֶּם אַחֲרַי? הָכִי אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הִגְבִּיהַּ בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: דִּקְדַּקְתֶּם אַחֲרַי.
human_translation: What did they say to him that say to them: You were diligent my this they said to him: What is lifted at twilight said to them: You were diligent my
llm_translation: What did they say to him that he said to them, "Did you scrutinize after me?" Thus they said to him: "He raised it between the suns, what is the law?" He said to them: "Did you scrutinize after me."

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא לְהוּ: מִקְצָת הַגְבָּהָה הָיְתָה מֵהַיּוֹם וּמִקְצָתָהּ לְמָחָר! הָכִי נָמֵי קָאָמַר לְהוּ: דִּקְדַּקְתֶּם אַחֲרַי, וְלֹא הֶעֱלִיתֶם בְּיֶדְכֶם כְּלוּם.
human_translation: But let him say to them: part of the lifting was today and part of it was tomorrow. That is also what he is saying to them: You were diligent my and you have not accomplished anything,
llm_translation: And it was said to them: "Part of the elevation was from today, and part of it was for tomorrow!" Thus he said to them: "You were meticulous after, and you did not bring up anything in your hands."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי גְּמַר מְלָאכָה, לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר פָּטוּר? הָא שָׁמַעְנָא לֵיהּ דִּמְחַיֵּיב! דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הָאוֹרֵג שְׁלֹשָׁה חוּטִין בַּתְּחִלָּה, וְאֶחָד עַל הָאָרִיג – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yosei, completion of labor according to Rabbi Eliezer, exempt? Didn’t we hear that deems liable As we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: One who weaves liable three threads at the beginning or one to woven fabric.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yosei, completing work, to Rabbi Eliezer, exempt? We heard about him that he is liable! For we learned, Rabbi Eliezer says: The weaver starts with three threads, and one on the woven fabric - liable!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָכִי מַתְנֵי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הָאוֹרֵג שְׁלֹשָׁה חוּטִין בַּתְּחִלָּה, וּשְׁנַיִם עַל הָאָרִיג – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said Rabbi Yosei, in accordance with of Rabbi Eliezer, this is teaches: Rabbi Eliezer says: One who weaves liable three threads at the beginning or two to woven fabric.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Eliezer, teaches thus: Rabbi Eliezer says: The weaver begins with three threads, and if two are woven, he is liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: פּוֹטְרוֹ הָיָה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אַף מֵאָשָׁם תָּלוּי. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: פּוֹטְרוֹ הָיָה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אַף מֵאָשָׁם תָּלוּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״כִּי תֶחֱטָא וְלֹא יָדַע״ – פְּרָט לָזֶה שֶׁיָּדַע שֶׁחָטָא. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: זֶהוּ שֶׁמֵּבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעָשָׂה וְלֹא יָדַע״, וְזֶה לֹא יָדַע בַּמֶּה עָשָׂה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: Rabbi Yehoshua would deem exempt even from a provisional guilt offering. is taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Rabbi Yehoshua would deem exempt even from a provisional guilt offering, as it is stated: if sin, though he does not know it; excludes this where he knew that he sinned. Rabbi Shimon said to this he does bring a provisional guilt offering. “and do…though he does not know it” this, he did not know with which he sinned.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: Rabbi Yehoshua would exempt him even from a guilt-offering. It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: Rabbi Yehoshua would exempt him even from a guilt-offering, as it is stated, "If he sins and does not know" - excluding one who knows that he sinned. Rabbi Shimon said to him: This is one who brings a guilt-offering, as it is stated, "And he shall do and not know," and this one does not know in what he sinned.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל סָפֵק אָכַל חֵלֶב סָפֵק לֹא אָכַל – צֵא וּשְׁאַל עָלָיו אִם מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אִם לָאו. מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ?
human_translation: But uncertainty one ate fat uncertainty one did not eat go and ask about it, whether brings a provisional guilt offering or not. What was about it?
llm_translation: However, if one is uncertain whether he ate forbidden fat or not, he should go and inquire whether he brings a guilt-offering or not. What is the ruling in this case?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: חָטָא וְלֹא יָדַע בַּמֶּה חָטָא, אוֹ סָפֵק חָטָא סָפֵק לֹא חָטָא – מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. מַאן שְׁמַעְנָא לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: חָטָא וְאֵין יָדוּעַ בְּמַאי חָטָא מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְקָא תָנֵי: סָפֵק חָטָא סָפֵק לֹא חָטָא – מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: סְבִירָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: סָפֵק חֵטְא סָפֵק לֹא חָטָא – מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי.
human_translation: Come hear one sinned and did not know with what he sinned, or uncertainty he sinned uncertainty he did not sin, brings a provisional guilt offering. Whom did you hear who says one sinned and did not know with what he sinned bring a provisional guilt offering? Rabbi Shimon. and it teaches: uncertainty one sinned uncertainty one did not sin, brings a provisional guilt offering. Conclude from Rabbi Shimon holds: uncertainty one sinned uncertainty one did not sin, brings a provisional guilt offering.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who sinned and does not know what he sinned with, or if he sinned or did not sin - he brings a guilt offering. Who do we listen to that said: One who sinned and does not know with what he sinned brings a guilt offering? Rabbi Shimon, and he teaches: If there is doubt whether he sinned or did not sin - he brings a guilt offering, learn from it: Rabbi Shimon is of the opinion that if there is doubt whether he sinned or did not sin - he brings a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ כּוּ׳ אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ׳אֲשֶׁר חָטָא בָּהּ׳״? פְּרָט לַמִּתְעַסֵּק.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Shimon Shezuri say: did not disagree If so, what the verse states: wherein he has sinned” exclude one who acts unawares
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri and Rabbi Shimon say: They did not argue. If so, what is the teaching to say "whoever sins with it"? To exclude one who is engaged.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִתְעַסֵּק בַּחֲלָבִים וַעֲרָיוֹת – חַיָּיב, שֶׁכֵּן נֶהֱנָה. מִתְעַסֵּק בַּשַּׁבָּת – פָּטוּר, מְלֶאכֶת מַחְשֶׁבֶת אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: one who acts unawares of fats or those with whom intercourse is forbidden, liable because he derived pleasure one who acts unawares on Shabbat exempt, the Torah prohibited planned, labor
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: One who engages in forbidden sexual relations and forbidden fats - is liable, for he derives benefit. One who engages in Shabbat - is exempt, for the Torah prohibited only purposeful work.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וְהָא תִּינוֹקוֹת, דְּכִי מִתְעַסֵּק דָּמֵי, וּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנֵי תִּינוֹקוֹת, אֶחָד לָמוּל בַּשַּׁבָּת וְאֶחָד לָמוּל אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת, וְשָׁכַח וּמָל אֶת שֶׁל אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת בַּשַּׁבָּת – רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: But isn’t babies considered like one acts unawares, and we learned one who had two babies one to circumcise on Shabbat and one to circumcise after Shabbat, and he forgot and circumcised the one after Shabbat on Shabbat, Rabbi Eliezer deems him liable a sin offering, And Rabbi Yehoshua deems exempt
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava to Rav Nachman: But the infants, for when they are engaged in bloodletting. And we learned: If one had two infants, one for circumcision on Shabbat and one for circumcision after Shabbat, and he forgot and circumcised the one for after Shabbat on Shabbat - Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא פָּטַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר: טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִצְוָה וְלֹא עָשָׂה מִצְוָה – פָּטוּר, אֲבָל מִתְעַסֵּק בְּדָבָר דְּלָאו מִצְוָה – אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מְחַיַּיב!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua deemed him exempt only here, because he holds one erred with regard to a mitzva and did not perform the mitzva exempt. But one acts unawares in a matter that not a mitzva, even Rabbi Yehoshua deems liable.
llm_translation: Until here did not exempt Rabbi Yehoshua except because he holds: One who errs in a matter of commandment and does not perform the commandment - is exempt, but one who engages in a matter that is not a commandment - even Rabbi Yehoshua obligates!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: הַנַּח לַתִּינוֹקוֹת, הוֹאִיל וּמְקַלְקֵל בְּחַבּוּרָה – חַיָּיב, מִתְעַסֵּק בְּחַבּוּרָה – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: said to Leave aside of babies. since one who inflicts a destructive wound liable one who acts unawares and inflicts a wound liable.
llm_translation: He said to him: "One who leaves food for the young children, since he is causing a disturbance in the group - he is liable; one who is occupied with the group - he is liable."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לִשְׁמוּאֵל: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ מִתְכַּוֵּין לְלַקֵּט תְּאֵנִים וְלִיקֵּט עֲנָבִים, עֲנָבִים וְלִיקֵּט תְּאֵנִים, שְׁחוֹרוֹת וְלִיקֵּט לְבָנוֹת, לְבָנוֹת וְלִיקֵּט שְׁחוֹרוֹת – רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda raised an objection to Shmuel Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if one intended to pick figs and he picked grapes, grapes and he picked figs, black and he picked white white and he picked black Rabbi Eliezer deems liable a sin offering and Rabbi Yehoshua deems exempt.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rav Yehudah to Shmuel: Rabbi Yehudah says: Even if one intended to gather figs and gathered grapes, grapes and gathered figs, black ones and gathered white ones, white ones and gathered black ones - Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא מִתְעַסֵּק הוּא, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ נָמֵי לָא קָא פָטַר אֶלָּא מִן מִינָא לְמִינָא, אֲבָל בְּחַד מִינָא – אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מְחַיַּיב!
human_translation: And this here is acts unawares, but Rabbi Yehoshua too deemed exempt from only type for type, But within one type, even Rabbi Yehoshua deems liable.
llm_translation: And here he was occupied, and Rabbi Yehoshua indeed did not exempt except from species to species, but in one species - even Rabbi Yehoshua obligates!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שִׁינָּנָא, שְׁבוֹק מַתְנִיתִין וְתָא בָּתְרַאי, הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן: כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָבַד מְלַקֵּט מִלִּבּוֹ, נִתְכַּוֵּון לְלַקֵּט עֲנָבִים, וְשָׁכַח וְסָבוּר תְּאֵנִים בָּעֵינָא, וְהָלְכָה יָדוֹ עַל הָעֲנָבִים, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: הֲרֵי נֶעֶשְׂתָה כַּוּוֹנָתוֹ, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: הֲרֵי לֹא נֶעֶשְׂתָה כַּוּוֹנָתוֹ וּמַחְשַׁבְתּוֹ.
human_translation: said to Large-toothed one [ shinnana ], leave the mishna and follow after me, What are we dealing with here? where the picker lost his thought. intended to pick grapes and he forgot and thought: figs I want. But his hand went among the grapes that Rabbi Eliezer holds his intention was fulfilled. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds his intention and thought not fulfilled,
llm_translation: He said to him: Shinana, leave the Mishnah and come here, what are we dealing with here: for example, if one intended to gather figs and forgot and thought he was gathering grapes, and his hand went to the grapes, Rabbi Eliezer holds: his intention has been fulfilled, and Rabbi Yehoshua holds: his intention has not been fulfilled but his thought.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ עַל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשֵּׁם אֶחָד שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב, אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת, שֶׁרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב חַטָּאת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: Rav Oshaya raises an objection Rabbi Shimon Shezuri and Rabbi Shimon say: did not disagree with regard to a matter from one category, as liable. Rather, with regard to a matter from two categories, as Rabbi Eliezer deems liable a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua deems him exempt.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Oshaya asked: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri and Rabbi Shimon say: They did not disagree on a matter that is from one name, for which one is liable, but rather on a matter that is from two names, for Rabbi Eliezer obligates a sin offering, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַאי קָאָמַר דִּפְלִיגִי? בְּנִתְכַּוֵּין לְלַקֵּט עֲנָבִים וְלִקֵּט תְּאֵנִים, שְׁחוֹרוֹת וְלִקֵּט לְבָנוֹת – עֲנָבִים וּתְאֵנִים, שְׁחוֹרוֹת וּלְבָנוֹת, מַאי נִיהוּ? שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת? הַיְינוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי! רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַאי אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, what is he saying that they disagree? where one intended to pick grapes and he picked figs, black ones and he picked white ones, Grapes and figs, black ones and white ones, what are they? two categories? this is Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Shimon Shezuri, what is Rabbi Yehuda coming to teach us?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, what is he saying that they are arguing about? In regards to gathering grapes and gathering figs, black ones and gathering white ones - grapes and figs, black ones and white ones, what is the difference? Two names? Is that Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Shimon Shezuri? Rabbi Yehuda, what is he coming to teach us?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו מִתְעַסֵּק אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: מִתְעַסֵּק חַיָּיב, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי סָבְרִי: מִתְעַסֵּק פָּטוּר?
human_translation: Rather, is it not between them acting unawares? As Rabbi Yehuda holds acts unawares liable, and Rabbi Shimon Shezuri hold acts unawares exempt.
llm_translation: Rather, is there not a difference between them, for Rabbi Yehuda holds: one who is involved is liable, and Rabbi Shimon Shezuri holds: one who is involved is exempt?

hebrew_text: לָא, מִתְעַסֵּק – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פָּטוּר, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי סָבַר: שָׁכַח מְלַקֵּט מִלִּבּוֹ. בְּשֵׁם אֶחָד – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל חַיָּיב,
human_translation: No, everyone agrees acts unawares is exempt. And here with regard to this they disagree: As Rabbi Shimon Shezuri holds forgot his thought of one category, all agree liable
llm_translation: Not occupied - the words of everyone are exempt, and here in this case they are arguing, for Rabbi Shimon Shezuri holds: he forgot to gather from his heart. In one name - the words of everyone are obligated.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי – בִּשְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: לָא שְׁנָא בְּשֵׁם אֶחָד וְלָא שְׁנָא בִּשְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת – פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: When disagree? with regard to two categories, Rabbi Yehuda holds is no difference of one category and of two categories: they disagree,
llm_translation: When they argue - about two names. Rabbi Yehuda holds: It does not matter if it is in one name or in two names - they argue.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לִיקְדֹּם אִיכָּא בֵינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rava said between with regard to performed first.
llm_translation: Rava said: "To kindle them, there is a difference between them."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת דּוֹלְקוֹת אֲרוּכּוֹת, וְנִתְכַּוֵּין לְכַבּוֹת אֶת זוֹ וְכִיבָּה אֶת זוֹ, לְהַדְלִיק אֶת זוֹ וְהִדְלִיק אֶת זוֹ – פָּטוּר. לְהַדְלִיק וּלְכַבּוֹת, וְכִיבָּה וְהִדְלִיק בִּנְשִׁימָה אַחַת – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And it is taught: had before him two long candles lit, and intended to extinguish this and extinguished that to light this and lit that one, exempt. to light and extinguish and extinguished and lit with one breath, liable.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: If two lamps were burning before him, long lamps, and he intended to extinguish this one and kindle this one, to kindle this one and kindle this one - he is exempt. If he intended to kindle and extinguish, and extinguish and kindle in one breath - he is liable.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לָא אִיתְעֲבִד מַחְשַׁבְתֵּיהּ, דְּהָא לְהַדְלִיק מֵעִיקָּרָא בָּעֵי וּלְבַסּוֹף לְכַבּוֹת, וְכִי עֲבַד מַעֲשֶׂה – כִּיבָּה וּבַסּוֹף הִדְלִיק הוּא, וְאֵימָא פָּטוּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: נְהִי דְּאַקְדּוֹמֵי נָמֵי לָא מַקְדֵּים, אַחוֹרֵי נָמֵי לָא מְאַחַר.
human_translation: obvious? lest you say: He did not perform his thought, as wanted to light initially and ultimately to extinguish but when he performed action, it he extinguished and ultimately lit And say exempt. teaches us although he did not perform first, also did not after
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: it is not done with his intention, for to kindle from the outset he needs and in the end to extinguish, and if he did an action – he kindled and in the end extinguished, and say he is exempt, it is evident to us: in front of those who are ahead, one does not precede, behind those who are behind, one does not delay.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַחוֹתֶה גֶּחָלִים בַּשַּׁבָּת – חַיָּיב חַטָּאת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק: חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מְכַבֶּה אֶת הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת, וּמַבְעִיר אֶת הַתַּחְתּוֹנוֹת. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִי דְּקָא מִיכַּוֵּין לְכַבּוֹת וּלְהַבְעִיר – מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּפָטַר? אֶלָּא דְּלָא קָא מִכַּוֵּין לְהַבְעִיר – מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דִּמְחַיֵּיב תַּרְתֵּי?
human_translation: The Sages taught One who stokes coals on Shabbat liable a sin offering. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok: liable two because he extinguishes the upper and he ignites the bottom What are we dealing with If where he intends to extinguish and kindle, what is the reason of the one who exempts Rather, that does not intend to kindle, what is the reason the one who deems him liable two
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who kindles coals on Shabbat - is liable for a sin offering. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer son of Tzadok: He is liable for two, because he extinguishes the upper coals and ignites the lower coals. With what are we dealing? If it is where he intended to extinguish and ignite - what is the reason of the one who exempts? Rather, it is where he did not intend to ignite - what is the reason of the one who obligates two?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּין לְכַבּוֹת הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת כְּדֵי לְהַבְעִיר אֶת הַתַּחְתּוֹנוֹת, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא קָסָבַר: מְקַלְקֵל בְּהַבְעָרָה פָּטוּר, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק אָמַר: חַיָּיב. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּנַפָּח שָׁנוּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַד כָּאן לֹא נִתְגַּלְּתָה טַעְמָהּ שֶׁל הֲלָכָה זוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Ḥanina both say where he intended to extinguish the upper in order ignite the bottom As, the first tanna holds destructive of kindling exempt, and Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says liable. And similarly, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: taught with regard to a blacksmith. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Until the reason for this halakha was not revealed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Chanina both said: For example, when one intends to kindle the upper lights in order to ignite the lower lights. As the first Tanna taught: One who damages through fire is exempt, and Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: One is liable. So too Rabbi Yochanan said: They disagreed in a case of a draft. Rabbi Yochanan said: Until this point, the reason for this halacha has not been revealed.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּי בַּר אָבִין וְרַב חֲנַנְיָא בַּר אָבִין דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ:
human_translation: Ami bar Avin and Rav Ḥananya bar Avin both say
llm_translation: Ammey bar Avin and Rav Chananya bar Avin who both said together:

hebrew_text: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּין לְכַבּוֹת וּלְהַבְעִיר, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: הַבְעָרָה לְלָאו יָצָאת,
human_translation: where he intended to extinguish and to kindle. As the first tanna holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who says: Kindling was out that prohibition,
llm_translation: For example, when one intends to extinguish and to kindle, as it was taught in the first Tanna's opinion, he holds like Rabbi Yosei, who said: Extinguishing is not a derivative prohibition.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי נָתָן, דְּאָמַר: הַבְעָרָה לְחַלֵּק יָצָאת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, holds in accordance with Rabbi Natan, who says: Kindling was out to divide
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Tzadok holds like Rabbi Natan, for he said: "The burning is for the purpose of dividing."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְהַקְדִּים אִיכָּא בֵינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rava said between them performed first
llm_translation: Rava said: to precede there is between them.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּין לְכַבּוֹת וְהוּבְעֲרוּ מֵאֵילֵיהֶן, וְתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין – פָּטוּר, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said where he intended to extinguish and they ignited by themselves, And the first tanna holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who says: an unintentional act, exempt. And Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who says: an unintentional act liable.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: For example, when they intended to extinguish and they burned from their own accord, and the first Tanna holds like Rabbi Shimon who said: A matter that is not intentional - one is exempt, and Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Tzadok holds like Rabbi Yehuda who said: A matter that is not intentional - one is liable.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַחוֹתֶה גֶּחָלִים בְּשַׁבָּת לְהִתְחַמֵּם בָּהֶם וְהוּבְעֲרוּ מֵאֵילֵיהֶן – תָּנֵי חֲדָא: חַיָּיב, וְתָנֵי אִידַּךְ: פָּטוּר. הָדְתַנְיָא: חַיָּיב, קָסָבַר: מְלָאכָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְגוּפָהּ – חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ. וְהָא דִּתְנָא: פָּטוּר, קָסָבַר: מְלָאכָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְגוּפָהּ פָּטוּר עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who stokes coals on Shabbat to be warmed by them, and they ignited by themselves; it is taught one liable and it is taught another exempt. that which is taught liable, holds a labor not necessary for its own sake, liable for it. And that which is taught exempt, he holds a labor not necessary for its own sake is exempt for it.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One who kindles coals on Shabbat in order to warm oneself with them and then removes them from their place - one teaching states: liable, and another teaching states: exempt. The resolution is: one teaching states: liable, for he holds that a prohibited labor that is not necessary for its object - one is liable for it. And the one teaching states: exempt, for he holds that a prohibited labor that is not necessary for its object - one is exempt from it.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ סָפֵק אָכַל חֵלֶב
llm_translation: We will return to you, uncertainty, he ate fat.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָכַל דַּם שְׁחִיטָה, בַּבְּהֵמָה בְּחַיָּה וּבָעוֹף, בֵּין טְמֵאִין בֵּין טְהוֹרִין, דַּם נְחִירָה, דַּם עִיקּוּר, דַּם הַקָּזָה שֶׁהַנְּשָׁמָה יוֹצְאָה בּוֹ – חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: one consumed blood slaughter of a domesticated animal, an undomesticated animal, or a bird, whether a kosher or non-kosher blood stabbing blood ripping blood bloodletting with which the soul departs, one is liable for it
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: one who consumes the blood of ritual slaughter, whether from a domestic animal, a wild animal, or a bird, whether they are ritually impure or ritually pure, the blood of the windpipe, the blood of the gullet, the blood of the crop, from which the soul departs - one is liable for it.

hebrew_text: דַּם הַטְּחוֹל, דַּם הַלֵּב, דַּם בֵּיצִים, דַּם חֲגָבִים, דַּם הַתַּמְצִית – אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְחַיֵּיב בְּדַם הַתַּמְצִית.
human_translation: blood of the spleen, blood of the heart, blood of eggs, blood of grasshoppers, blood of exudate [ tamtzit ], one is not liable for it. Rabbi Yehuda deems liable in blood of exudate.
llm_translation: Blood of the sand, blood of the heart, blood of the eggs, blood of locusts, blood of the essence - not obligated upon it, Rabbi Yehuda obligates in the blood of the essence.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כָּל דָּם לֹא תֹאכְלוּ״, שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי אֲפִילּוּ דַּם מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם, דַּם בֵּיצִים, דַּם חֲגָבִים, דַּם דָּגִים, הַכֹּל בַּכְּלָל? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְעוֹף וְלִבְהֵמָה״,
human_translation: The Sages taught “And you shall consume no manner of blood” I derive even blood of bipeds, blood of eggs, blood of grasshoppers, blood of fish, all included the verse states: “Whether it is of bird or of animal”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "You shall not eat any blood." I might think this includes even the blood of creatures that walk on two legs, the blood of eggs, the blood of locusts, the blood of fish - are all included? The Talmud teaches us: "For birds and for beasts."

hebrew_text: מָה עוֹף וּבְהֵמָה מְיוּחָדִין, שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן טוּמְאָה קַלָּה וְטוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה, וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶן אִיסּוּר וְהֶיתֵּר, וְהֵן מִין בָּשָׂר – אַף כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן טוּמְאָה קַלָּה.
human_translation: Just as birds and animals are unique that they have a light ritual impurity, and a severe impurity, and they have forbidden or permitted, and they are a type of meat, so too, everything a light impurity
llm_translation: Birds and animals are unique, as they have both a light impurity and a severe impurity, and there are prohibitions and permissions regarding them, and they are a type of flesh - so too, all that have a light impurity.

hebrew_text: אוֹצִיא דַּם מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם – שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה, וְאֵין בָּהֶן טוּמְאָה קַלָּה.
human_translation: I will exclude blood of bipeds, as they have a severe ritual impurity, but they do not have a light ritual impurity,
llm_translation: Bringing forth blood of two walking - that they have impurity severe, and they do not have impurity light.

hebrew_text: אוֹצִיא דַּם שְׁרָצִים – שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶם טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה. אוֹצִיא דַּם בֵּיצִים – שֶׁאֵין מִין בָּשָׂר, דַּם דָּגִים דַּם חֲגָבִים – שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ הֶיתֵּר.
human_translation: I will exclude blood of creeping animals, which do not have a severe ritual impurity. I will exclude the blood of eggs, as are not a type of meat, the blood of fish the blood of grasshoppers, as they are entirely permitted,
llm_translation: The blood of creeping things - that they do not have severe impurity. The blood of eggs - that there is no flesh species, the blood of fish, the blood of locusts - that it is entirely permissible.

hebrew_text: ״לָעוֹף וְלַבְּהֵמָה״? אִי מָה עוֹף שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ כִּלְאַיִם, אַף בְּהֵמָה – שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ כִּלְאַיִם! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְלַבְּהֵמָה״.
human_translation: whether it is of bird or of animal, if just as a bird concerning which diverse kinds not so too, an animal concerning which diverse kinds not the verse states: “Or of animal.”
llm_translation: "To the bird and to the animal"? If what bird that does not have cloven hooves, also animal - that does not have cloven hooves! The Talmud teaches: "And to the animal."

hebrew_text: אִי מָה בְּהֵמָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּאֵם עַל הַבָּנִים, אַף עוֹף שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּאֵם עַל הַבָּנִים! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לָעוֹף וְלַבְּהֵמָה״.
human_translation: if just as an animal is not in mother with young so too, a bird which is not in mother with the young, the verse states: “Whether it is of bird or of animal.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If what in a beast that is not in a mother over the children, also a bird that is not in a mother over the children! The Talmud teaches: "for the bird and for the beast." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: ״כׇּל דָּם״ – כָּלַל, ״עוֹף וּבְהֵמָה״ – פָּרַט, כְּלָל וּפְרָט, אֵין בַּכְּלָל אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁבַּפְּרָט, עוֹף וּבְהֵמָה – אִין, מִידִּי אַחֲרִינָא – לָא!
human_translation: But say “no manner of blood” a generalization, “bird or animal” is a detail. a generalization and a detail, the generalization includes only what in the detail. a bird and an animal, yes, anything else, not
llm_translation: "And why? 'All blood' - this is a generalization, 'of bird and of animal' - this is a specification. Generalization and specification, in the generalization only what is in the specification. Of bird and of animal - no, from another thing - no!"

hebrew_text: ״נֶפֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר תֹּאכַל כׇּל דָּם״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל, כְּלָל וּפְרָט וְכָלַל, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט.
human_translation: “Whoever consumes any blood, it then generalized a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail.
llm_translation: "‘The soul that eats all blood’ – he repeated and included, general and specific and included, you can only judge according to the specific."

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא דָּמֵי כְּלָלָא בָּתְרָא לִכְלָלָא קַמָּא, כְּלָלָא קַמָּא לָאו, כְּלָלָא בָּתְרָא כָּרֵת!
human_translation: But the last generalization is not similar to the first generalization. The first generalization, prohibition, the last generalization, karet .
llm_translation: And this is not similar to a general principle after a specific principle, a specific principle is not, a general principle after a specific principle is a cutting off!

hebrew_text: הַאי תַּנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל [בְּרִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי וּ]כְלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי דָּרְשִׁינַן מִן הָדֵין גַּוְונָא, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא דָּמֵי כְּלָלָא בָּתְרָא לִכְלָלָא קַמָּא.
human_translation: This tanna , the school of Rabbi Yishmael, we expound generalizations and details in a case this, even though the last generalization is not similar to the first generalization.
llm_translation: This is the teaching of the School of Rabbi Ishmael in its combinations, exclusions, generalizations, and particulars that we expound from the same point, and even though the generalization does not resemble the generalization that comes after it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְעֵין הַפְּרָט, מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ – דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ טוּמְאָה קַלָּה וְטוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה, וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶ[ן] אִיסּוּר וְהֶיתֵּר וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִין בָּשָׂר, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ טוּמְאָה קַלָּה וְטוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: The Master said a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail. Just as the detail is explicit an item that has a light impurity and a severe impurity, and it has forbidden or permitted, and it is a type of meat, so too, every item that has a light ritual impurity and a severe form of ritual impurity,
llm_translation: Master said: General, specific, and general. If you judge only according to the specific case, just like the specific case, what is the specific case? Something that has both a light impurity and a severe impurity, and has within it prohibitions and permissions, and has within it a mixture of flesh. So too, any matter that has both a light impurity and a severe impurity, etc.

hebrew_text: ״אַף כֹּל״ דְּקָתָנֵי לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי?
human_translation: What So too every which teaches, to include
llm_translation: "Even 'all' that is taught for what?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אָבִין: לְאֵתוֹיֵי דָּמוֹ שֶׁל כּוֹי. מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר כּוֹי סְפֵיקָא הוּא, אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמֵיסַר סְפֵיקָא? אֶלָּא קָסָבַר כּוֹי בְּרִיָּה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Avin said: to include blood of a koy , What maintain If he maintains a koy is an uncertain is a verse necessary to teach uncertainty? Rather, maintains is a distinct entity,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Avin said: To include the blood of a non-Jew. What does he hold? If he holds that a non-Jew is a doubt, does he need a verse to teach a doubt? Rather, he holds that a non-Jew is a separate creation in and of itself.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן דָּמוֹ, חֶלְבּוֹ מְנָלַן? ״מִכׇּל חֵלֶב״. נִבְלָתוֹ מְנָלַן? ״מִכׇּל נְבֵלָה״.
human_translation: We found blood of From where do we its fat from any [ kol ] fat” From where do we its carcass from any [ kol ] animal carcass”
llm_translation: I have found his blood, where is his fat? "From all his fat." Where is his carcass? "From all carcass."

hebrew_text: גִּיד הַנָּשֶׁה מְנָלַן? בְּכַף הַיָּרֵךְ תַּלְיֵהּ רַחֲמָנָא, וְהָא אִית לֵיהּ כַּף הַיָּרֵךְ.
human_translation: From where do we the sciatic nerve the Merciful One rendered dependent on the spoon of the thigh, and this has a spoon [ kaf ] of the thigh,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Where is the sciatic nerve derived from? It is suspended in the hip socket, as the Merciful One has said, "and the hip socket."

hebrew_text: טוּמְאָתוֹ וּשְׁחִיטָה, מְנָלַן? סְבָרָא, מִדִּלְכֹל מִילֵּי רַבְּיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא כִּבְהֵמָה, טוּמְאָתוֹ וּשְׁחִיטָתוֹ נָמֵי כִּבְהֵמָה.
human_translation: From where do we impurity and slaughter reasoning: From that in all matters the Merciful One included like a domesticated animal, its impurity and its slaughter also like a domesticated animal.
llm_translation: His impurity and slaughtering, from where? One might say, from all matters of his Merciful Masters, like an animal, his impurity and his slaughtering are similar to that of an animal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אוֹצִיא דַּם מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם, שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה וְאֵין בָּהֶן טוּמְאָה קַלָּה. וּרְמִינְהִי: הַחוֹתֵךְ מִן הָאָדָם – צָרִיךְ מַחְשָׁבָה וְהֶכְשֵׁר.
human_translation: The Master said I will exclude blood of bipeds, as they have a severe impurity, but they do not have a light impurity, But raise a contradiction one who cuts from person requires intent and be rendered susceptible
llm_translation: Master said: "One who extracts blood from two walking animals, which have severe impurity but do not have light impurity." And raise a dilemma: "One who cuts from a person - requires intention and qualification."

hebrew_text: וְקַשְׁיָא לַן: מַחְשָׁבָה לְמָה לִי? תֵּעָשֶׂה חֲתִיכָה שֶׁלּוֹ מַחְשָׁבָה! וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בְּחוֹתְכוֹ לַכֶּלֶב, וּמַחְשָׁבָה לַכֶּלֶב לָאו מַחְשָׁבָה הִיא.
human_translation: And difficult for us: Why do I intent? Let his cutting serve as intent And Reish Lakish said: to one who cuts to a dog, and intent to a dog is not intent
llm_translation: Our difficulty is: "Why do I need thought?" A piece of it should be made thought! And Reish Lakish said: In its cutting for a dog, and thought for a dog is not thought.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָתְנַן, כְּלָל אָמְרוּ בְּטוּמְאָה: כֹּל הַמְיוּחָד לֶאֱכוֹל אָדָם – טָמֵא, עַד שֶׁיִּפָּסֵל מֵאֲכִילַת כֶּלֶב!
human_translation: And not But didn’t we learn stated a principle with regard to ritual impurity: any that is food designated a person, impure until it is rendered unfit to be consumed by a dog?
llm_translation: And not? And we learned in a Mishnah, they said a general principle regarding impurity: Anyone who is designated to eat by a person - is impure, until he is disqualified from being fed to a dog!

hebrew_text: הָהוּא לְאַסּוֹקֵי טוּמְאָה מִינֵּיהּ, דְּכֵיוָן דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא הֲוָה חֲזֵי לְאָדָם, לְאַסּוֹקֵי מִטּוּמְאָה עַד שֶׁיִּפָּסֵל מֵאֲכִילַת כֶּלֶב. הָכָא לְאַחוֹתֵי לֵיהּ טוּמְאָה, אִי חֲזֵי לְאָדָם – חֲזֵי לְכֶלֶב, אִי לָא חֲזֵי לְאָדָם – לָא חֲזֵי לְכֶלֶב.
human_translation: That to removing impurity from it. Since was initially fit to a person, impurity removed from until it is rendered unfit to be consumed by a dog. here, to granting it impurity. if fit for a person fit for a dog, if not fit for a person, it is not fit for a dog,
llm_translation: That one who engages in impurity from him, since from the outset he was seen by a person, to engage in impurity until he becomes disqualified from feeding a dog. Here, regarding his sister's impurity, if he is seen by a person - he is seen by a dog, if he is not seen by a person - he is not seen by a dog.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קָתָנֵי מַחְשָׁבָה, וּמַחְשָׁבָה – לְטוּמְאָה קַלָּה הִיא! הָנֵי מִילֵּי מֵחַיִּים, אֲבָל לְאַחַר מִיתָה – טָמֵא הוּא טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: In any case, teaches intent, and intent is for a light ritual impurity, This statement while is alive. But after death is impure a severe impurity
llm_translation: From every place, it teaches about thought, and thought - for impurity it is light! Those words are from the living, but after death - impure it is severe impurity.

hebrew_text: דִּכְווֹתַהּ גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה לְאַחַר מִיתָה, אִי בָּשָׂר – מְטַמֵּא טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה, וְאִם דָּם – מְטַמֵּא טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה,
human_translation: in the corresponding with regard to an animal after death, if meat, transmits impurity a severe impurity, and if blood, transmits impurity a severe ritual impurity,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If its carcass is on top of an animal after its death, if it is flesh - it imparts severe impurity, and if it is blood - it imparts severe impurity."

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: דַּם נְבֵילוֹת – בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מְטַהֲרִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מְטַמְּאִין.
human_translation: As we learned the blood of carcasses, Beit Shammai deem pure, and Beit Hillel deem impure
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: The blood of neveilot (carcasses) - Beit Shammai declares pure, and Beit Hillel declares impure.

hebrew_text: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לִכְדִתְנַן: נִבְלַת בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, נִבְלַת [הָ]עוֹף הַטָּהוֹר בַּכְּפָרִים – צָרִיךְ מַחְשָׁבָה, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ הֶכְשֵׁר.
human_translation: is necessary only for that which we learned A carcass of a non-kosher animal, in any location, carcass of a kosher bird in villages, require intent they are not required rendered susceptible
llm_translation: Not needed except for as we have learned: the carcass of an unclean animal is impure everywhere, the carcass of a clean bird in villages - requires intent, and does not require ritual slaughter.

hebrew_text: נִבְלַת בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, וְנִבְלַת עוֹף טָהוֹר וְחֵלֶב בַּשְּׁוָקִים – אֵין צְרִיכִין לֹא מַחְשָׁבָה וְלֹא הֶכְשֵׁר.
human_translation: the carcass of a kosher animal anywhere, and the unslaughtered carcass of a kosher bird or fat in marketplaces, require neither intent nor rendered susceptible
llm_translation: The carcass of a kosher animal anywhere, and the carcass of a kosher bird and fat in the markets - do not require neither calculation nor inspection.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא: מַחְשָׁבָה, לְמָה לִי לְטוּמְאָה קַלָּה? הִיא גּוּפַהּ טוּמְאָה הִיא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּגוֹן דְּאִיכָּא פָּחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת נְבֵילָה, וְצֵרְפָהּ לְפָחוֹת מִכְּבֵיצָה אוֹכָלִין, דְּהַאי וְהַאי הָוֵי כְּבֵיצָה.
human_translation: And Rav said to Rabbi Ḥiyya: Why do I intent for a light ritual impurity? itself is impurity. said to where there is less than an olive-bulk carcass, and one combined it with less than an egg-bulk food, that this and that are an egg-bulk,
llm_translation: And Rav said to Rabbi Chiya: "Thought, why do I need light impurity? It itself is impure!" He said to him: "For example, if there is less than an olive size of a carcass, and it is burned less than an egg's worth, it is considered like an egg."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לִיבְעֵי נָמֵי הֶכְשֵׁר, דְּהָא תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״עַל כׇּל זֶרַע [זֵרוּעַ] אֲשֶׁר יִזָּרֵעַ״ – מָה זְרָעִים מְיוּחָדִין שֶׁאֵין סוֹפָן לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה וְצָרִיךְ הֶכְשֵׁר, אַף כֹּל שֶׁאֵין סוֹפָן לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה צָרִיךְ הֶכְשֵׁר!
human_translation: If so, it should also require rendered susceptible As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “Upon any sowing seed which is to be sown” Just as seeds are unique that they will not ultimately become impure a severe ritual impurity and require rendered susceptible so too, anything that will not ultimately become impure a severe ritual impurity requires rendered susceptible
llm_translation: So, it was asked: Does it require scrutiny? For the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Ishmael taught: "Upon all seed that is sown" - just as there are specific seeds that do not have the potential to become ritually impure with severe impurity and require scrutiny, so too, all other seeds that do not have the potential to become ritually impure with severe impurity require scrutiny!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בָּאוֹכָלִין דְּעָלְמָא, דְּלֵית בְּהוּ פָּחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת נְבֵלָה, אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּאִיכָּא בְּגַוֵּיהּ פָּחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת נְבֵילָה, כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ מְצָרֵף לֵיהּ כְּזַיִת – לָא בָּעֵי הֶכְשֵׁר.
human_translation: said to This statement to foods in general, which do not contain less than an olive-bulk of an animal carcass. But here, where does contain less than an olive-bulk of an animal carcass, Since if one were to add to olive-bulk, does not require to be rendered susceptible
llm_translation: He said to him: Those matters in food of the world, that do not have in them less than the size of an olive of nevelah, but here, where there is in it less than the size of an olive of neveilah, since if one adds to it the size of an olive - it does not require kashering.

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵת, אַף עַל גַּב דִּמְמַלֵּיא לֵיהּ – לָא מְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין, מִשּׁוּם דְּבָטְלָה דַּעְתּוֹ אֵצֶל כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: to the exclusion of corpse. even if one completes its does not become impure impurity of food, because his intention is irrelevant by all people,
llm_translation: To go out from a corpse, even though his mouth is filled with it - he does not impart impurity of food, because his mind is nullified in the eyes of all people.

hebrew_text: רַב חֲנַנְיָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא דְּהָוֵי כְּזַיִת, הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁחִיפָּהוּ בְּבָצֵק.
human_translation: Rav Ḥananya said: you may even say that is an olive-bulk. What are we dealing with here? where one covered it with dough.
llm_translation: Rav Chananya said: Even if it were like an olive, here with what are we dealing? For example, that he covered it with dough.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הֶכְשֵׁר נָמֵי נִיבְעֵי! הָנֵי מִילֵּי בָּאוֹכָלִין אַחֲרִינֵי, דְּלָא מְטַמּוּ לָא בְּמַגָּע וְלָא בְּמַשָּׂא. אֲבָל הָכָא, נְהִי דְּלָא מְטַמֵּא בְּמַגָּע, דְּקָמְחַפֵּי בְּבָצֵק, בְּמַשָּׂא מִיהַת לִיטַמֵּא, דְּהָא טָעֵון לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If so, let it also require to be rendered susceptible That statement with regard to other food, which do not transmit impurity neither through contact nor through carrying. But here, granted that does not transmit impurity through contact, as it is covered with dough, it should at least transmit impurity through carrying, as it is laden upon him,
llm_translation: Thus, if so, the intestines are considered pure! These words refer to foods that are consumed afterwards, for they do not become impure neither by touch nor by carrying. But here, it is different, as it does not become impure by touch, for it is absorbed in the dough, but by carrying it becomes impure, for it requires it.

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵת, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּחִיפָּהוּ בְּבָצֵק מְטַמֵּא טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה, דְּטוּמְאָה בּוֹקַעַת וְעוֹלָה בּוֹקַעַת וְיוֹרֶדֶת.
human_translation: to the exclusion of corpse, as even if one covered it with dough it transmits a severe ritual impurity, as impurity breaks through and ascends, breaks through and descends,
llm_translation: To go out from a corpse, for even though he pressed it with dough, it imparts severe impurity, for impurity pierces and ascends and descends.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָצְאוּ שְׁרָצִים שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן טוּמְאָה. וְלָא? שֶׁרֶץ מְטַמֵּא בְּמַגָּע! בְּמַשָּׂא לָא מְטַמֵּא.
human_translation: The Master said: creeping animals excluded, as they do not have impurity. And not a creeping animal transmits impurity through contact. it does not transmit impurity through carrying,
llm_translation: Master said: "Creeping things that do not have impurity have gone out." But isn't it so? A creeping thing imparts impurity through contact! Through carrying it does not impart impurity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָצָא דַּם דָּגִים וְדַם חֲגָבִים שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ הֶיתֵּר. מַאי כּוּלּוֹ הֶיתֵּר? אִילֵימָא דְּחֶלְבּוֹ מוּתָּר – הֲרֵי חַיָּה דְּחֶלְבָּהּ מוּתָּר וְדָמָהּ אָסוּר! וְאֶלָּא: מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵית בְּהוּ אִיסּוּר גִּיד הַנָּשֶׁה? וַהֲרֵי עוֹף דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ אִיסּוּר גִּיד הַנָּשֶׁה, וְדָמוֹ אָסוּר!
human_translation: The Master said blood of fish and blood of grasshoppers excluded, as they are entirely permitted. What They are entirely permitted? If we say that fat permitted, fat of an undomesticated animal permitted, and its blood is forbidden.And Rather, because the prohibition of the sciatic nerve does not apply to them, but a bird there is no prohibition the sciatic nerve and its blood forbidden.
llm_translation: The Master said: The blood of fish and the blood of locusts, their entirety is permitted. What is meant by "their entirety is permitted"? If you say it is because their fat is permitted - behold, the fat of a living animal is permitted while its blood is forbidden! Rather, it is because they do not have the prohibition of the sciatic nerve. And behold, with regard to birds that do not have the prohibition of the sciatic nerve, their blood is forbidden!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי כּוּלּוֹ הֶיתֵּר – דְּלָא בָּעֵי שְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: Rather, what are entirely permitted? that do not require slaughter
llm_translation: Rather, what is the meaning of "all of it is permitted"? It means that it does not require ritual slaughter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מָה עוֹף שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ כִּלְאַיִם, אַף בְּהֵמָה – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּהֵמָה״.
human_translation: The Master said just as a bird which diverse kinds does not so too, an animal the verse states: “Of animal.”
llm_translation: The Master said: What bird has no cloven hooves, so too with regard to an animal - the Torah states: "animal."

hebrew_text: כִּלְאַיִם דְּמַאי? אִילֵּימָא כִּלְאַיִם דְּהַרְבָּעָה וְכִלְאַיִם דַּחֲרִישָׁה, וְהָתְנַן: חַיָּה וָעוֹף כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן!
human_translation: To which diverse kinds If we say mating diverse kinds or plowing diverse kinds But didn’t we learn undomesticated animals and birds as them,
llm_translation: "Kil'ayim demai? Ileima kil'ayim deharba'ah ve'kil'ayim dacharisha, ve'hatnan: chaya va'of kayotze bahen!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שֶׁצִּימְרוֹ אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם כִּלְאַיִם.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said that its wool, one is not liable for it due to diverse kinds.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: "When it comes to tzimro, one is not liable for kilayim."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: דַּם שְׁרָצִים לוֹקִין עָלָיו בִּכְזַיִת. מֵיתִיבִי: דַּם הַטְּחוֹל, דַּם הַלֵּב, דַּם הַכְּלָיוֹת, דַּם אֵבָרִים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. דַּם מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם, דַּם שְׁרָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים – אָסוּר, וְאֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו!
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: blood of creeping animals, one is flogged for it in an olive-bulk. raises an objection blood of the spleen, blood of the heart, blood of the kidneys, blood of limbs, these are by prohibition, blood of bipeds, blood of creeping animals and crawling things forbidden but one is not liable for
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The blood of creeping creatures is considered like spilled blood. The question was raised: The blood of a locust, the blood of a heart, the blood of kidneys, the blood of organs - these are all included in the prohibition of "do not do." The blood of creatures that move by hopping, the blood of creeping creatures and reptiles - is forbidden, but one is not liable for it!

hebrew_text: מַאי אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו – כָּרֵת, אֲ[בָל]
human_translation: What One is not liable for karet is liable for a prohibition.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו" - "karet," but

hebrew_text: חֲדָא, דְּהַיְינוּ רֵישָׁא. וְעוֹד, תַּנָּא מִלָּאו נָמֵי קָא מְמַעֵט לֵיהּ, דְּקָתָנֵי: יָצָא דַּם שְׁרָצִים, שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה!
human_translation: One that this is the first clause. And furthermore, a tanna excludes from prohibition as well, as teaches: blood of creeping animals excluded, as it does not have a severe ritual impurity.
llm_translation: One, that is the beginning. And furthermore, it was taught: if the blood of vermin filled it up, it diminishes it, as it is taught: "The blood of vermin, which does not have severe impurity!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הִתְרוּ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שֶׁרֶץ – לוֹקֶה, מִשּׁוּם דָּם – אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: forewarned him due to a creeping animal, he is flogged. due to blood, he is not flogged.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: If one released it because of a creeping thing - he is liable, but if because of blood - he is not liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: דַּם דָּגִים שֶׁכִּינְּסוֹ – אָסוּר. מֵיתִיבִי: דַּם דָּגִים, דַּם חֲגָבִים – מוּתָּר, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְכַתְּחִלָּה! הָהִיא בְּשֶׁלֹּא כִּינְּסוֹ, כִּי קָא אָמַר רַב – בְּשֶׁכִּינְּסוֹ.
human_translation: Rav says: Fish blood that one collected prohibited raises an objection blood of fish blood of grasshoppers are permitted, and even ab initio . That where he did not collect when Rav said where he did collect
llm_translation: Rav said: the blood of fish that has congealed - forbidden. It was asked: the blood of fish, the blood of locusts - permitted, even initially! That case is when it has not congealed, as Rav said - when it has congealed.

hebrew_text: דִּכְווֹתַהּ גַּבֵּי מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם – בְּשֶׁלֹּא כִּינְּסוֹ, מִי אָסוּר? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: דָּם שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי כִּכָּר – גּוֹרְרוֹ וְאוֹכְלוֹ, שֶׁל בֵּין הַשִּׁינַּיִם – מוֹצְצוֹ וּבוֹלְעוֹ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ!
human_translation: In the corresponding with regard to blood of bipeds, where one did not collect is forbidden? But isn’t it taught blood was on a loaf scrapes off and may eat between teeth, he may suck it and swallow it without concern,
llm_translation: The blood on the back of a loaf - one may drag it and eat it; that which is between the teeth - one may suck it and swallow it without concern!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כִּי תַּנְיָא הַהִיא מַתְנִיתָא – דְּאִית בֵּיהּ קַשְׂקַשִּׂים, כִּי קָאָמַר רַב אָסוּר – דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ קַשְׂקַשִּׂים.
human_translation: Rather, when that baraita is taught, where there are scales in it when Rav said prohibited where there are no scales in
llm_translation: Rather: for it was taught in a certain baraita - that it contains thorns, for when Rav said it is forbidden - it does not contain thorns.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: דַּם מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם – אֲפִילּוּ מִצְוַת פְּרוֹשׁ אֵין בּוֹ. מֵיתִיבִי: דַּם הַטְּחוֹל, דַּם הַלֵּב, דַּם הַכְּלָיוֹת, דַּם אֵבָרִים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. דַּם מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם, דַּם שְׁרָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים – אָסוּר וְאֵין חַיָּיבִ[ין] עָלָיו! כִּי תַּנְיָא אָסוּר –
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: blood bipeds, there is not even a command to abstain raises an objection Blood of the spleen, blood of the heart, blood of the kidneys, blood of limbs, these are by prohibition. blood of bipeds, blood of creeping animals and crawling things forbidden but one is not liable for When is taught is forbidden,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Blood that flows in two directions - even the mitzvah of separation is not in it. It was asked: The blood of a mole, the blood of the heart, the blood of the kidneys, the blood of organs - these are without a negative commandment. The blood that flows in two directions, the blood of vermin and creeping things - it is forbidden and one is not liable for it! For it was taught: It is forbidden -

hebrew_text: דְּפֵירַשׁ. כִּי קָאָמַר רַב – בִּדְלָא פֵּירַשׁ, כִּדְתַנְיָא: דָּם שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי כִּכָּר – גּוֹרְרוֹ וְאוֹכְלוֹ, שֶׁל בֵּין הַשִּׁינַּיִם – מוֹצֵץ וּבוֹלֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: where separated when Rav said where not separated As it is taught blood was on a loaf may scrape off and consume was between teeth, he may suck and swallow without concern.
llm_translation: He explained. When Rav said - if he did not explain, as it was taught: blood on a loaf - one may drag it and eat it, that which is between the teeth - one may suck and swallow and is not concerned.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְמַתְנֵי לַהּ לְהָא דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת עַל הָדָא, דְּתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל חֲלֵב מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם יְהֵא אוֹכְלוֹ עוֹבֵר בְּלָאו? וְדִין הוּא: מָה בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה שֶׁהֵקַלְתָּה בְּמַגָּעָהּ, הֶחְמַרְתָּה בַּחֲלָבָהּ, מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֶחְמַרְתָּה בְּמַגָּעָן – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתַּחְמִיר בַּחֲלָבָן?
human_translation: Some teach this of Rav Sheshet with regard to this as it is taught: might one who consumes milk bipeds would violate a prohibition. And a logical inference: Just as a non-kosher animal, where you were lenient with regard to its contact, you were stringent with regard to its milk, bipeds, where you were stringent with regard to their contact, isn’t it logical that you should be stringent with regard to their milk?
llm_translation: There is one who teaches it to him, to that of Rav Sheshet on this, as it was taught: Can the fat of walking animals be eaten in a state of prohibition? And it is just: Just as with an unclean animal, if you lightened it with its touch, you would make it more stringent with its fat, so too with walking animals, if you made it more stringent with their touch - is it not just that you should make it more stringent with their fat?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְזֶה לָכֶם הַטָּמֵא״ – זֶה טָמֵא, וְאֵין חֲלֵב מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם טָמֵא אֶלָּא טָהוֹר.
human_translation: the verse states: “And these are they which are impure to you” these non-kosher but the milk of bipeds is not impure rather pure,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And this shall be unclean to you" - this is unclean, and the milk of non-ruminant animals is unclean only if it is pure.

hebrew_text: אוֹצִיא אֶת הֶחָלָב, שֶׁאֵין שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל, וְלֹא אוֹצִיא הַדָּם שֶׁשָּׁוֶה בַּכֹּל! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְזֶה לָכֶם הַטָּמֵא״ – זֶה טָמֵא, וְאֵין דַּם מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם טָמֵא אֶלָּא טָהוֹר. אָמַר (לה) רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אֲפִילּוּ מִצְוַת פְּרוֹשׁ אֵין בּוֹ.
human_translation: I should exclude the milk does not equally to all I should not exclude blood which equally to all the verse states: “And these are they which are impure to you,” this is impure, but the blood of bipeds is not impure rather pure, Rav Sheshet said: there is not even a command to abstain
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Bring out the fat, which is not equal in all, and do not bring out the blood, which is equal in all! The Torah teaches: 'And this shall be unclean to you' - this is unclean, and the blood that flows in two directions is not unclean but pure. Rav Sheshet said: Even the mitzvah of separation is not in it." English translation: "Bring out the fat, which is not equal in all, and do not bring out the blood, which is equal in all! The Torah teaches: 'And this shall be unclean to you' - this is unclean, and the blood that flows in two directions is not unclean but pure. Rav Sheshet said: Even the mitzvah of separation is not in it."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַלֵּב, קוֹרְעוֹ וּמוֹצִיא אֶת דָּמוֹ, לֹא קְרָעוֹ – אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר עָלָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּלֵב עוֹף, הוֹאִיל וְאֵין בּוֹ כְּזַיִת, אֲבָל לֵב בְּהֵמָה דְּיֵשׁ בּוֹ כְּזַיִת – אָסוּר, וְחַיָּיבִין עָלָיו כָּרֵת.
human_translation: We learned there the heart tears it and removes its blood, he did not tear he does not violate Rabbi Zeira says Rav says: They taught only with regard to the heart of a bird, since it does not contain an olive-bulk But the heart of an animal, which does contain an olive-bulk is forbidden and one is liable karet for its
llm_translation: We learned there: Regarding the heart, if one tears it and extracts its blood, he has not transgressed. Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav: They only taught this regarding the heart of a bird, since it does not have the size of an olive, but the heart of an animal, if it has the size of an olive - it is prohibited, and one is liable to receive the punishment of karet.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: דַּם הַטְּחוֹל, דַּם הַלֵּב, דַּם הַכְּלָיוֹת, דַּם אֵבָרִים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. דַּם מְהַלְּכֵי שְׁתַּיִם, דַּם שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים – אָסוּר, וְאֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו!
human_translation: raises an objection blood of the spleen, blood of the heart, blood of the kidneys, blood of limbs, these are by prohibition, blood of bipeds, blood of repugnant creatures and crawling things forbidden but one is not liable for
llm_translation: Challenger: blood of the spleen, blood of the heart, blood of the kidneys, blood of organs - these are all negative commandments. Blood of those that walk on two legs, blood of abominations and creeping things - prohibited, and one is not liable for it!

hebrew_text: כִּי קָתָנֵי ״אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו״ – עַל דָּם דִּילֵיהּ, כִּי קָאָמַר רַב – דְּאָתֵי לֵיהּ מֵעָלְמָא.
human_translation: when teaches one is not liable for to its blood, when Rav said that comes from the outside,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ki katanai 'ein chayavim alav' – al dam dileih, ki ka'amar Rav – de'atei lei me'alma." English translation: "For it is taught 'he is not liable' – for his own blood, as Rav said – that it comes from the world."

hebrew_text: דָּם דִּילֵיהּ – הַיְינוּ דַּם אֵבָרִים! וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, מִי לָא קָתָנֵי דַּם כְּלָיוֹת וְקָתָנֵי דַּם אֵבָרִים? אֶלָּא: תָּנֵי וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי – הָכָא נָמֵי, תָּנֵי וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי.
human_translation: Its blood is blood of limbs, And according to your reasoning, doesn’t teach the blood of kidneys, and it teaches the blood of limbs? Rather, teaches and then teaches Here too, teaches and then teaches
llm_translation: Blood of its kidneys - that is the blood of the organs! And to taste you, who did not teach that there is blood of kidneys and there is blood of organs? Rather, teach and then teach again - here it is stated, teach and then teach again.

hebrew_text: מֵעָלְמָא מֵהֵיכָא אָתֵי לֵיהּ? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַנְּשָׁמָה יוֹצְאָה מִישְׂרָף שָׂרֵיף.
human_translation: From where does come to from outside? Rabbi Zeira said: At the time when the soul departs, draws [ sharif ]
llm_translation: From where does it come? Rabbi Zeira said: At the moment when the soul departs from the body, it is burned by the burning fire.

hebrew_text: דָּם שֶׁהַנְּשָׁמָה יוֹצְאָה בּוֹ – חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו. אִיתְּמַר: אֵיזֶהוּ דַּם הַקָּזָה שֶׁהַנְּשָׁמָה תְּלוּיָה בּוֹ? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמְּקַלֵּחַ. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִטִּיפָּה הַמַּשְׁחֶרֶת וְאֵילָךְ.
human_translation: blood which the soul departs, one is liable for it It was stated: What blood bloodletting upon which the soul depends, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: As long as it is spurting Reish Lakish says: From the black drop and onward,
llm_translation: Blood from which the soul departs - liable upon it. It was stated: Which is the blood of the locust that the soul is dependent upon? Rabbi Yochanan said: As long as it is still hopping. Resh Lakish said: From the first drop that turns black and onward.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵיזֶהוּ דַּם הַקָּזָה שֶׁהַנְּשָׁמָה יוֹצְאָה בּוֹ? כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמְּקַלֵּחַ. יָצָא דַּם הַתַּמְצִית, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא שׁוֹתֵת. מַאי לַָאו אֲפִילּוּ רִאשׁוֹן וְאַחֲרוֹן, דְּשׁוֹתֵת הוּא – כְּדַם הַתַּמְצִית דָּמֵי? תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ!
human_translation: raises an objection What is blood bloodletting with which the soul departs? As long as it is spurting excludes blood of exudate, because flows What, is it not even first and last it flows it is considered as blood of exudate? a conclusive refutation of Reish Lakish.
llm_translation: The question was raised: What is the blood of the locust from which the soul departs? As long as it is being peeled, the blood of the essence departs, because it is a drink. What is the reason? Even the first and the last, since it is a drink – is it like the blood of the essence of blood? This is the dispute of Reish Lakish!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְמַעוֹטֵי דָּם הַמַּשְׁחִיר, אֲבָל דָּם רִאשׁוֹן וְאַחֲרוֹן, אַף עַל גַּב דְּהוּא שׁוֹתֵת – הַיְינוּ דַּם הַנֶּפֶשׁ.
human_translation: No, to exclude black blood; but first and last blood, even though it flows, this is blood the soul
llm_translation: Not for, for the exclusion of the blood that turns black, but the first and last blood, even though it is poured out - that is the blood of the soul.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵיזֶהוּ דָּם רִאשׁוֹן? כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמְּקַלֵּחַ. יָצָא רִאשׁוֹן וְאַחֲרוֹן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא שׁוֹתֵת. תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ! אָמַר לָךְ: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵיזֶהוּ דַּם הַנֶּפֶשׁ? כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמְּקַלֵּחַ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מִטִּיפָּה הַמַּשְׁחֶרֶת וְאֵילָךְ.
human_translation: raises an objection What is first blood? As long as it is spurting excludes first and last because flows. a conclusive refutation of Reish Lakish. say to you is tanna’im , as it is taught What is the blood the soul As long as it is spurting the statement of Rabbi Elazar. Rabbi Shimon says: From the black drop and onward
llm_translation: The question was raised: What is the first blood? As long as he is shaving. The first and last blood came out because he is shaving. The reasoning of Reish Lakish! He said to you: It is a Mishna, as it was taught: What is the blood of the soul? As long as he is shaving, the words of Rabbi Elazar. Rabbi Shimon says: From the first drop that emerges and onward.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְדַם חֲלָלִים יִשְׁתֶּה״, פְּרָט לְדָם קִילּוּחַ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַכְשִׁיר אֶת הַזְּרָעִים.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “And drinks the blood of the slain” exclude blood spurts does not render seeds susceptible to
llm_translation: Mishnah of the School of Rabbi Ishmael: "And the blood of slain animals shall be consumed," excluding the blood of the gourd, which does not render the seeds fit.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מֵרַבִּי זֵירָא: הִקִּיז דָּם לִבְהֵמָה וְקִיבֵּל דָּמָהּ בִּשְׁנֵי כוֹסוֹת, מַהוּ? עַל הָרִאשׁוֹן – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל חַיָּיב, עַל הָאַחֲרוֹן – מִי מִיחַיַּיב אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised a dilemma before Rabbi Zeira: one performed bloodletting upon an animal and received its blood in two cups, what is With regard to the first everyone agrees liable, With regard to the last is he liable or not?
llm_translation: Requested of him Rabbi Yirmeyah from Rabbi Zeira: He sprinkled blood to an animal and received its blood in two cups, what? On the first - the words of all obligated, on the last - who is obligated or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאִיתְּמַר: הִקִּיז דָּם לִבְהֵמָה וְקִיבֵּל דָּמָהּ בִּשְׁנֵי כוֹסוֹת – רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: חַיָּיב שְׁתֵּי חַטָּאוֹת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: said to him: a dispute Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish, as it was stated: one performed bloodletting upon an animal and received its blood in two cups, Reish Lakish says liable two sin offerings and Rabbi Yoḥanan says he is liable only one
llm_translation: He said to him: The dispute of Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish, as it was stated: If one splashed the blood of an animal and its blood was received in two cups - Reish Lakish said: He is liable for two sin offerings. And Rabbi Yochanan said: He is only liable for one.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְחַיֵּיב בְּדַם הַתַּמְצִית. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְעִנְיַן כַּפָּרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הַדָּם הוּא בַּנֶּפֶשׁ יְכַפֵּר״ – דָּם שֶׁהַנֶּפֶשׁ יוֹצְאָה בּוֹ מְכַפֵּר, וְשֶׁאֵין הַנֶּפֶשׁ יוֹצְאָה בּוֹ אֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda deems liable in blood of exudate. Rabbi Elazar says: Rabbi Yehuda concedes with regard to atonement as it is stated: “For it is the blood that makes atonement by reason of the soul” blood with which the soul departs, atones, but with which the soul does not depart, does not atone.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah obligates with the blood of the tamtzit. Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Yehudah concedes regarding the matter of atonement, as it is stated: "For the blood is the life, and it shall make atonement for the soul" - blood from which the soul departs atones, but if the soul does not depart, it does not atone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״דָּם״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כׇּל דָּם״?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: We learn as well, as it is taught “blood”; what the verse states “any blood”?
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: We also learned in a Baraita, as it was taught: "Blood," what is the teaching when it says "all blood"?

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הַדָּם הוּא בַּנֶּפֶשׁ יְכַפֵּר״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא דַּם קָדָשִׁים שֶׁהַנֶּפֶשׁ יוֹצְאָה בּוֹ, שֶׁהוּא מְכַפֵּר, דַּם חוּלִּין וְדַם הַתַּמְצִית, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כׇּל דָּם״. סְתָם סִיפְרָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא.
human_translation: Since it is stated: “For it is the blood that makes atonement by reason of the soul,” I have nothing other than blood of sacrificial with which the soul departs as atones. From where blood of non-sacred and blood of exudate? The verse states: “Any blood.” Who is unattributed Sifra , It is Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Since it is stated: "For the blood is the life, and it shall make atonement for the soul," I might have only considered the blood of holy offerings from which the soul departs, which effects atonement. But blood of non-holy offerings and blood of the tamtzit, from where do we learn? The verse teaches: "All blood." Is this a mere assembly of verses? It is Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְחַיֵּיב עַל סְפֵק מְעִילָה אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִים. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שֶׁאֵינוֹ מֵבִיא אֶת מְעִילָתוֹ עַד שֶׁיִּתְוַדַּע לוֹ שֶׁיָּבִיא עִמּוֹ אָשָׁם וַדַּאי.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva deems liable a provisional guilt offering for uncertain misuse And the Rabbis deem him exempt, And Rabbi Akiva concedes that one does not bring his misuse until it becomes known to him as he will bring a definite guilt offering with
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Akiva obligates in the case of a doubtful theft a guilt-offering that is dependent, and the Sages exempt. And Rabbi Akiva admits that one does not bring his cloak until it is known to him that he should bring with it a guilt-offering for certain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: מָה לָזֶה מֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי אֲשָׁמוֹת? אֶלָּא מֵבִיא מְעִילָה וְחוּמְשָׁהּ, וְיָבִיא אָשָׁם בִּשְׁנֵי סְלָעִים, וְיֹאמַר: ״אִם וַדַּאי מָעַלְתִּי – זוֹ מְעִילָתִי וְזוֹ אֲשָׁמִי, וְאִם סָפֵק מָעַלְתִּי – הַמָּעוֹת נְדָבָה, וְאָשָׁם תָּלוּי״. שֶׁמִּמִּין שֶׁהוּא מֵבִיא עַל הוֹדַע, מֵבִיא עַל לֹא הוֹדַע.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said: For what does that bring two guilt offerings, Rather, one brings misuse and its one-fifth, and he will bring a guilt offering two sela and say: If certain I misused this is my misuse and this is my guilt offering. And if uncertain I misused the money is a contribution and the guilt offering provisional, as from the type that one brings for known brings for unknown
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said: What does one bring two guilt offerings for? Rather, one brings a cloak and its fifth, and brings a guilt offering with two sela coins, and says: "If I definitely transgressed - this is my cloak and this is my guilt offering, and if I possibly transgressed - the extra money is a donation, and the guilt offering is suspended." From what is known, one brings an offering; from what is not known, one brings an offering.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: נִרְאִין דְּבָרָיו בִּמְעִילָה מְעוּטָה. הֲרֵי שֶׁיָּבוֹא לְיָדוֹ סְפֵק מְעִילָה בְּמֵאָה מָנֶה, לֹא יָפֶה לוֹ שֶׁיָּבִיא אָשָׁם בִּשְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים, וְלֹא יָבִיא סְפֵק מְעִילָה בְּמֵאָה מָנֶה? מוֹדֶה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן בִּמְעִילָה מְעוּטָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: The statement of appears in minimal misuse, where he is confronted with uncertainty misuse ten thousand dinars, would it not be preferable for him that he will bring guilt offering at two sela and he will not bring uncertain misuse at ten thousand dinars? Rabbi Akiva concedes to Rabbi Tarfon in minimal misuse.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: His words appear in a diminished cloak. If a doubt arises in his possession of a cloak worth one hundred mana, it is not proper for him to bring a guilt offering with two sela, and he should not bring a cloak worth one hundred mana? Rabbi Akiva concedes to Rabbi Tarfon in a diminished cloak.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְאִם נֶפֶשׁ״ – לְחַיֵּיב עַל סְפֵק מְעִילוֹת אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִים.
human_translation: the Sages taught “And if anyone to render liable a provisional guilt offering for uncertain misuse the statement of Rabbi Akiva. And the Rabbis deem exempt
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And if a soul" - liable for doubtful guilt-offerings, the words of Rabbi Akiva, and the sages exempt.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: לְמֵדִין עֶלְיוֹן מִתַּחְתּוֹן, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין לְמֵדִין עֶלְיוֹן מִתַּחְתּוֹן?
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about this That Rabbi Akiva holds one learns earlier from later And the Rabbis hold one does not learn earlier from later
llm_translation: Let us say in this case they are in disagreement, for Rabbi Akiva holds: We learn from the upper to the lower, while the Rabbis hold: Do we not learn from the lower to the upper?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְמֵדִין עֶלְיוֹן מִתַּחְתּוֹן, דְּאִם כֵּן, צָפוֹן בְּבֶן בָּקָר לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לְהוּ,
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: everyone one learns earlier from later as if so, you will not find that a young bull north
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: All the people of the world learn from the higher authority to the lower authority, for if not, a cow does not forget its calf.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן דְּפָטְרִי: דִּגְמִירִי ״מִצְוֹת״ ״מִצְוֹת״ מֵחַטָּאת.
human_translation: Rather, here, this is reason that the Rabbis deem exempt because they derive commandments from a sin offering: commandments
llm_translation: Rather, here is the reason of the Rabbis who exempt: for they learn "commandments" "commandments" from sin.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַלָּן דָּבָר שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת, וְעַל סְפֵיקוֹ אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, אַף כֹּל שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְעַל סְפֵקוֹ חַטָּאת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ אָשָׁם תָּלוּי,
human_translation: just as there, an act that renders one liable to karet for its intentional and a sin offering for its unwitting and a provisional guilt offering for its uncertain so too, every for which one is liable to karet for its intentional and a sin offering for its unwitting a provisional guilt offering for its uncertain
llm_translation: There, what is the matter for which liable to intentional sin offering excision and for unintentional sin offering sin, and for doubtful sin offering guilt offering dependent, also all that liable to intentional sin offering excision and for doubtful sin offering sin and for unintentional sin offering guilt offering dependent.

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מְעִילָה, דְּאֵין חַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת, דְּתַנְיָא: הֵזִיד בִּמְעִילָה – רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בְּמִיתָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: to exclude misuse as one is not liable karet for its intentional As it is taught one who intentionally misused Rabbi says death And the Rabbis say: prohibition,
llm_translation: To go out with a cloak, for one is not liable for its intentional violation, as it was taught: If one intentionally violates with a cloak - Rabbi says: with death, and the Sages say: with a warning.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: כִּי יָלְפִינַן ״מִצְוֹת״ ״מִצְוֹת״ מֵחַטַּאת חֵלֶב, לְהָכִי הוּא דְּיָלְפִינַן: מָה לְהַלָּן בִּקְבוּעָה, אַף כָּאן בִּקְבוּעָה,
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva holds When we derive “the commandments of” “the commandments of” a sin offering fat for this that we derive it: Just as there, to a fixed so too here, of a fixed
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds: When we find "mitzvot" "mitzvot" from a sin offering, this is why we say: Just as there it is fixed, so too here it is fixed.

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד, דְּלָא.
human_translation: to exclude a sliding-scale not
llm_translation: To those who go up and come down, for no.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לְמֶחֱצָה. מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: יֵשׁ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לְמֶחֱצָה? אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לְמֶחֱצָה,
human_translation: And the Rabbis hold there is no verbal analogy for half by inference that Rabbi Akiva holds there is a verbal analogy for half Rather, everyone agrees that there is no verbal analogy for half
llm_translation: The sages hold: A decree is not similar to half. From the principle of Rabbi Akiva, does he hold: Is a decree similar to half? Rather, the entire world agrees that a decree is not similar to half.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דַּאֲמַר קְרָא: ״וְאִם נֶפֶשׁ״ – וָיו מוֹסִיף עַל עִנְיָן רִאשׁוֹן, וְיִלְמַד עֶלְיוֹן מִתַּחְתּוֹן.
human_translation: Rather, this is reason of Rabbi Akiva, as the verse states “And if anyone vav , adds to the previous matter. and earlier are learned from the later
llm_translation: Rather, this is the reason of Rabbi Akiva, as the verse states: "And if a soul" - the letter "vav" adds to the first matter, and the higher one learns from the lower.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: תַּחְתּוֹן הוּא דְּגָמַר מֵעֶלְיוֹן לְאָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים.
human_translation: And the Rabbis maintain later are derived from the earlier for guilt offering worth silver shekels,
llm_translation: The sages hold: It is the lower one who completes from the upper one for a guilt offering in silver shekels.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: אֵין הֶיקֵּשׁ לְמֶחֱצָה. מִכְּלָל דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יֵשׁ הֶיקֵּשׁ לְמֶחֱצָה? וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּאֵין הֶיקֵּשׁ לְמֶחֱצָה!
