human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva holds there is no juxtaposition for half by inference that the Rabbis hold there is a juxtaposition for half But we maintain that there is no juxtaposition for half
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds: there is no difficulty for half. From the principle of the Rabbis, do they hold: is there a difficulty for half? But we establish that there is no difficulty for half!

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין הֶיקֵּשׁ לְמֶחֱצָה, וְהָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן: דִּגְמִירִי ״מִצְוֹת״ ״מִצְוֹת״, אַפְּקֵיהּ מֵהֶקֵּישָׁא.
human_translation: everyone there is no juxtaposition for half And here, this is reason of the Rabbis, as they derive “the commandments of “the commandments of excluded from juxtaposition.
llm_translation: The all of the world there is no difficulty to half, and here that is the reason of the Rabbis: for they learned "commandments" "commandments," he derived it from the juxtaposition.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״זֹּאת תּוֹרַת הָאָשָׁם״ – תּוֹרָה אַחַת לְכׇל הָאֲשָׁמוֹת, לְאָשָׁם דִּבְכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva derives guilt offering silver shekels from “This is the law of the guilt offering” one law for all of the guilt offerings, guilt offering worth silver shekels.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, guilt offering in silver shekels came out to him "from this is the law of the guilt offering" - one Torah for all guilt offerings, for a guilt offering of silver shekels.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? אַף עַל גַּב דִּכְתִיב ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הָאָשָׁם״, אִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״וְאִם נֶפֶשׁ״ – וָיו מוֹסִיף עַל עִנְיָן רִאשׁוֹן, וְיִלְמַד תַּחְתּוֹן מֵעֶלְיוֹן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis even though it is written: “This is the law of the guilt offering,” was necessary to write: “And if anyone vav adds to the previous matter and later are learned from the earlier
llm_translation: The Sages? Even though it is written "This is the law of the guilt offering," it was necessary to write "and if a soul" - the vav comes to add to the first matter, and one learns the lower from the higher.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מִ״זֹּאת תּוֹרַת הָאָשָׁם״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כִּי אָמֵינָא תּוֹרָה אַחַת לְכׇל אֲשָׁמוֹת – הָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּשְׁאָר אֲשָׁמוֹת וַדָּאִין,
human_translation: And if from “This is the law of the guilt offering,” I would say: When I say one law for all of the guilt offerings, that statement to other definite guilt offerings.
llm_translation: "And if 'from this is the law of the guilt offering,' I would have said: I would have said, one Torah for all guilt offerings - these words in other guilt offerings are indeed."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, כֵּיוָן דְּעַל סְפֵק חֵלֶב קָאָתֵי, אֵימָא: לָא יְהֵא סְפֵיקוֹ חָמוּר מִוַּדָּאוֹ, מָה וַדָּאוֹ – חַטָּאת בַּת דַּנְקָא, אַף סְפֵיקוֹ – אָשָׁם בַּר דַּנְקָא, אַהָכִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְאִם נֶפֶשׁ״ – וָיו מוֹסִיף עַל עִנְיָן רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: But provisional guilt offering, since it comes for an uncertain fat, say its uncertain should not be stringent than its definite Just as its definite a sin offering worth one-sixth [ danka ] so too, its uncertain a guilt offering worth one-sixth for this the Merciful One wrote: “And if anyone vav adds to the previous matter.
llm_translation: But a guilt offering that is hanging, since it is in a case of doubt of fat, one might say: Let its doubt not be more stringent than its certainty. Just as its certainty is a sin offering of a small animal, so too its doubt is a guilt offering of a small animal. This is what the Merciful One wrote: "But if it is a soul" - the vav adds to the matter of the first case.

hebrew_text: נִיחָא לְמַאן דְּדָרֵישׁ ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הָאָשָׁם״, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּלָא דָּרֵישׁ ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הָאָשָׁם״, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? יָלֵיף ״בְּעֶרְכְּךָ״ ״בְּעֶרְכְּךָ״ מֵאֲשַׁם מְעִילוֹת.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who expounds “This is the law of the guilt offering,” But according to the one who does not expound “This is the law of the guilt offering,” what is there to say? he derives “your valuation” “your valuation” from a guilt offering for misuse
llm_translation: It is preferable for one who expounds "This is the law of the guilt offering" Leviticus 7:1 but not for one who does not expound "This is the law of the guilt offering," what can be said? It compares "according to your valuation" Leviticus 5:15 to "according to your valuation" from guilt offerings.

hebrew_text: אֲשַׁם שִׁפְחָה חֲרוּפָה, לָא כְּתִב בֵּהּ ״בְּעֶרְכְּךָ״! יָלְפִינַן בְּ״אֵיל״
human_translation: guilt offering an espoused maidservant, about which “your valuation” not written We derive from “ram” “ram”
llm_translation: Guilt offering maidservant barren, not written in it "according to your valuation"! We learn from "ram."

hebrew_text: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא כּוּ׳ וְאִם סָפֵק.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva concedes And if uncertain
llm_translation: Rebbe Akiva concedes as follows: "And if it is uncertain."

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רָבָא, תְּנִי: אִם בִּסְפֵיקוֹ עוֹמֵד לְעוֹלָם – יְהֵא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, שֶׁמִּמִּין שֶׁהֵבִיא עַל הוֹדַע, מְבִיאוֹ עַל שֶׁלֹּא הוֹדַע.
human_translation: what is saying? Rava said teach If its uncertainty persists forever, should be a provisional guilt offering, as one brings known from species he brings unknown
llm_translation: What is he saying? Rava said, Teach: If his doubt remains forever - let the guilt offering be pending, for from the right that he brought for the notification, he brings it for the non-notification.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף, כִּי מִתְיְדַע לֵיהּ בָּעֵי לְאֵיתוֹיֵי אָשָׁם וַדַּאי!
human_translation: Ultimately, when it becomes known to him he is required to bring a definite guilt offering.
llm_translation: End, end, when it becomes known to him, he needs to bring a guilt-offering and certainly!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִדִּבְרֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם נִלְמַד – אָשָׁם וַדַּאי לָא בָּעֵי יְדִיעָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: Rava said: From the statement of both of be learned a definite guilt offering does not require knowledge ab initio .
llm_translation: Rava said: From the words of both of them it is learned - guilt offering, and certainly does not require knowledge at the outset.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהֵבִיאָה חַטַּאת הָעוֹף, עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִמְלְקָה נוֹדַע לָהּ שֶׁיָּלְדָה וַדַּאי – תַּעֲשֶׂינָּה וַדַּאי, שֶׁמִּמִּין שֶׁהִיא מְבִיאָה עַל הוֹדַע, מְבִיאָה עַל לֹא הוֹדַע.
human_translation: a woman who brought a bird sin offering before was pinched it became known to her that she certainly gave birth, she should render a definite as from the type that she brings for known she brings for unknown
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A woman who brought a sin offering of a bird, until it is not yet slaughtered, it is known to her that she gave birth for certain - she should definitely perform the required actions, for just as she brings an offering for a known status, she brings an offering for an unknown status.

hebrew_text: חֲתִיכָה שֶׁל חוּלִּין וַחֲתִיכָה שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ, אָכַל אַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן אָכַל – פָּטוּר, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְחַיֵּיב אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. אָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – מֵבִיא אָשָׁם וַדַּאי.
human_translation: a piece of non-sacred and a piece of sacrificial he ate one of them and does not know which of them he ate, exempt Rabbi Akiva deems liable a provisional guilt offering, ate the second he brings a definite guilt offering,
llm_translation: A piece of ordinary food and a piece of consecrated food, he ate one of them and does not know which one he ate - he is exempt. Rabbi Akiva obligates a guilt offering. If he ate the second one - he brings a definite guilt offering.

hebrew_text: אָכַל אֶחָד אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וּבָא אַחֵר וְאָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – זֶה מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי וְזֶה מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵיהֶן מְבִיאִין אָשָׁם אֶחָד. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: one ate the first and another came and ate the second this brings a provisional guilt offering and that brings a provisional guilt offering; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Shimon says: Both of them bring one guilt offering Rabbi Yosei says:
llm_translation: One ate the first and another came and ate the second - this one brings a guilt offering and this one brings a guilt offering, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Shimon says: Both of them bring one guilt offering. Rabbi Yosei says:

hebrew_text: אֵין שְׁנַיִם מְבִיאִין אָשָׁם אֶחָד.
human_translation: Two do not bring one guilt offering,
llm_translation: Two do not bring one guilt offering.

hebrew_text: חֲתִיכַת חֵלֶב וַחֲתִיכַת חוּלִּין, אָכַל אַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן אָכַל – מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. אָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – מֵבִיא חַטָּאת. אָכַל אֶחָד אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וּבָא אַחֵר וְאָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – זֶה מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי וְזֶה מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵיהֶם מְבִיאִין חַטָּאת אַחַת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין שְׁנַיִם מְבִיאִין חַטָּאת אַחַת.
human_translation: a piece of fat and a piece of non-sacred he ate one of them and does not know which of them he ate, he brings a provisional guilt offering, ate the second he brings a sin offering, one ate the first and another came and ate the second this brings a provisional guilt offering and that brings a provisional guilt offering; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Shimon says: Both of them bring one sin offering Rabbi Yosei says: Two do not bring one sin offering.
llm_translation: A piece of fat and a piece of non-sacred meat, if one ate one of them and does not know which one he ate - he brings a guilt offering. If he ate the second one - he brings a sin offering. If one ate the first one and another came and ate the second one - this one brings a guilt offering and that one brings a guilt offering, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Shimon says: Both of them bring one sin offering. Rabbi Yosei says: Two do not bring one sin offering.

hebrew_text: חֲתִיכַת חֵלֶב וַחֲתִיכַת קוֹדֶשׁ, אָכַל אַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן אָכַל – מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. אָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – מֵבִיא חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם וַדַּאי. אָכַל אֶחָד אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וּבָא אַחֵר וְאָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – זֶה מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי וְזֶה מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵיהֶן מְבִיאִין חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין שְׁנַיִם מְבִיאִין חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם אֶחָד.
human_translation: a piece of fat and a piece of sacrificial he ate one of them and does not know which of them he ate, he brings a provisional guilt offering, ate the second he brings a sin offering, and a definite guilt offering one ate the first and another came and ate the second this brings a provisional guilt offering and that brings a provisional guilt offering. Rabbi Shimon says: Both of them bring a sin offering and a guilt offering Rabbi Yosei says: Two do not bring one sin offering and guilt offering.
llm_translation: A piece of fat and a piece of holy meat, he ate one of them and does not know which one he ate - he brings a guilt offering. If he ate the second one - he brings a sin offering and a guilt offering for certain. If one person ate the first one and another came and ate the second one - this one brings a guilt offering and that one brings a guilt offering. Rabbi Shimon says: Both bring a sin offering and a guilt offering. Rabbi Yosei says: Two do not bring one sin offering and one guilt offering.

hebrew_text: חֲתִיכַת חֵלֶב וַחֲתִיכַת חֵלֶב קוֹדֶשׁ, אָכַל אַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן אָכַל – מֵבִיא חַטָּאת, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אַף אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. אָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – מֵבִיא שְׁנֵי חַטָּאוֹת וְאָשָׁם וַדַּאי.
human_translation: a piece of fat and a piece of sacrificial fat he ate one of them and does not know which of them he ate, he brings a sin offering Rabbi Akiva says: also a provisional guilt offering, ate the second he brings two sin offerings, and a definite guilt offering
llm_translation: A piece of fat and a piece of holy fat, he ate one of them and does not know which one he ate - he brings a sin offering. Rabbi Akiva says: Also a guilt offering is suspended. If he ate the second one - he brings two sin offerings and a guilt offering for sure.

hebrew_text: אָכַל אֶחָד אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וּבָא אַחֵר וְאָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – זֶה מֵבִיא חַטָּאת וְזֶה מֵבִיא חַטָּאת. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: זֶה וָזֶה מְבִיאִין אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: זֶה מֵבִיא חַטָּאת וְזֶה מֵבִיא חַטָּאת, וּשְׁנֵיהֶן מְבִיאִין אָשָׁם אֶחָד. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין שְׁנֵיהֶן מְבִיאִין אָשָׁם אֶחָד.
human_translation: one ate the first and another came and ate the second this brings a sin offering and that brings a sin offering. Rabbi Akiva says: This and that bring a provisional guilt offering Rabbi Shimon says: This brings a sin offering and that brings a sin offering and both of them bring one guilt offering Rabbi Yosei says: The two of them do not bring one guilt offering.
llm_translation: One ate the first and another came and ate the second - this one brings a sin offering and this one brings a sin offering. Rabbi Akiva says: Both bring a guilt offering. Rabbi Shimon says: This one brings a sin offering and that one brings a sin offering, and both bring one guilt offering. Rabbi Yosei says: Neither of them brings a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: חֲתִיכַת חֵלֶב וַחֲתִיכַת חֵלֶב נוֹתָר, אָכַל אַחַת מֵהֶן וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן אָכַל – מֵבִיא חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם תָּלוּי. אָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – מֵבִיא שָׁלֹשׁ חַטָּאוֹת.
human_translation: a piece of fat and a piece of fat notar , he ate one of them and does not know which of them he ate, he brings a sin offering, and a provisional guilt offering, ate the second he brings three sin offerings,
llm_translation: A piece of fat and a piece of fat remain, he ate one of them and does not know which one he ate - he brings a sin offering and a guilt offering. If he ate the second one - he brings three sin offerings.

hebrew_text: אָכַל אֶחָד אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וּבָא אַחֵר וְאָכַל אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה – זֶה מֵבִיא חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם תָּלוּי, וְזֶה מֵבִיא חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם תָּלוּי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: זֶה מֵבִיא חַטָּאת וְזֶה מֵבִיא חַטָּאת, וּשְׁנֵיהֶן מְבִיאִין חַטָּאת אַחַת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל חַטָּאת שֶׁהִיא בָּאָה עַל חֵטְא – אֵין שְׁנַיִם מְבִיאִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: one ate the first and another came and ate the second this brings a sin offering and a provisional guilt offering, and that brings a sin offering and a provisional guilt offering. Rabbi Shimon says: This brings a sin offering and that brings a sin offering and both of them bring one sin offering Rabbi Yosei says: Two do not bring any sin offering that comes for a sin.
llm_translation: One ate the first and another came and ate the second - this one brings a sin offering and a guilt offering, and this one brings a sin offering and a guilt offering. Rabbi Shimon says: this one brings a sin offering and this one brings a sin offering, and both of them bring one sin offering. Rabbi Yosei says: any sin offering that comes for a sin - two do not bring it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, חַטָּאת הוּא דְּלָא מַיְיתוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן, הָא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי מַיְיתוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם? הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא!
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: According to Rabbi Yosei, it is a sin offering that they both do not bring, they do both bring a provisional guilt offering. is the first tanna ,
llm_translation: Gemara said to him Rava to Rav Nachman: to Rabbi Yosei, sin offering he is that not bring both, this guilt offering dependent bring both? That is the first Mishnah!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵימָא: חֲתִיכָה מִשְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, וְהָתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי וְזֶה מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּמַאן תַּנָּא קַמָּא – רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: And if you would say between one piece from two pieces, But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei says: This brings a provisional guilt offering and that brings a provisional guilt offering. said to This teaches us, that who is the first tanna ? Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: And if you will say: A piece from two pieces there is between them, and it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: This one brings a guilt offering of uncertainty and this one brings a guilt offering of uncertainty! He said to him: This is what he is teaching us, from whom did the first Tanna teach? - Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: חֲתִיכַת חֵלֶב וַחֲתִיכַת קֹדֶשׁ, חֲתִיכַת חֵלֶב וַחֲתִיכַת חֵלֶב קוֹדֶשׁ כּוּ׳ חֲתִיכַת חֵלֶב וַחֲתִיכַת חֵלֶב נוֹתָר כּוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וְלַיְתֵי נָמֵי אָשָׁם וַדַּאי, דְּנוֹתָר דְּקֹדֶשׁ הוּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: a piece of fat and a piece of sacrificial a piece of fat and a piece of sacrificial fat, a piece of fat and a piece of fat notar . Rava said to Rav Naḥman: And let him also bring a definite guilt offering as notar is sacrificial said to where does not have the value of one peruta ,
llm_translation: A piece of fat and a piece of holy, a piece of fat and a piece of holy, a piece of fat and a piece of fat holy, like... a piece of fat and a piece of fat remaining, like... Rava said to Rav Nachman: And let it come before the guilt offering, for it is a leftover of holy! He said to him: Because it does not have an equal value.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵעִיקָּרָא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה עָסְקִינַן, דְּקָתָנֵי אָשָׁם וַדַּאי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָהִיא חֲתִיכָה דְּלָא נוֹתָר הִיא שָׁוְיָא פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: But at the outset we are dealing with that does have the value of one peruta , as teaches a definite guilt offering said to That is a piece that is not notar , worth one peruta .
llm_translation: The Gemara: And this, from the outset, where there is a similar specific detail, we are dealing with, as it teaches about a guilt-offering, and certainly! He said to him: That piece that did not remain is similar to a specific detail.

hebrew_text: וְהָא יֵשׁ אוֹכֵל אֲכִילָה אַחַת דְּקָתָנֵי בֵּיהּ נוֹתָר, וְקָתָנֵי: מֵבִיא אַרְבַּע חַטָּאוֹת וְאָשָׁם אֶחָד!
human_translation: But There is one performs one eating teaches notar and it teaches brings four sin offerings and one guilt offering.
llm_translation: And this: there is one who eats one olive-bulk and it teaches in it remains, and it teaches: he brings four sin-offerings and one guilt-offering!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָהִיא – בְּגַסָּה, וְהַהִיא – בְּדַקָּה, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָהִיא – בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, הָכָא – בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה.
human_translation: said to That to excessive and this to light and not difficult. that to in the rainy season, this to in the summer,
llm_translation: He said to him: That one - in a coarse manner, and that one - in a fine manner, and it is not difficult: that one - in the days of rain, here - in the days of the sun.

hebrew_text: אָכַל אֶחָד אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה כּוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִיסּוּר חָל אִיסּוּר?
human_translation: one ate the first Rava said to Rav Naḥman: And did Rabbi Shimon say a prohibition takes effect where prohibition
llm_translation: One ate the first, as it is stated. Rava said to Rav Nachman: Did Rabbi Shimon say that one prohibition annuls another prohibition?

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הָאוֹכֵל נְבֵלָה בְּיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים – פָּטוּר!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: One who eats animal carcass on Yom Kippur is exempt
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: Rabbi Shimon says: One who eats nevelah on Yom Kippur - is exempt!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: כְּגוֹן דַּאֲכַל כּוּלְיָא בְּחֶלְבָּהּ. וְכוּלְיָא בְּחֶלְבָּהּ נָמֵי, הָא קָאֵי עֲלַהּ בְּאִיסּוּר עוֹלִין, הֵיכִי אָתֵי אִיסּוּר נוֹתָר חָיֵיל עֲלַהּ?
human_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: where he ate a kidney with its fat. But even a kidney with its fat, the prohibition of ascend applies to it, how does the prohibition of notar come apply to it?
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: For example, if one ate the fat. And if one ate the fat, indeed, he is standing upon it in a state of prohibition. How does the prohibition come upon the remaining fat?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵימָא: סְבִירָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּנוֹתָר אִיסּוּר חָמוּר הוּא, וְחָיֵיל עַל אִיסּוּר קַל דְּעוֹלִין, וְהָא נְבֵלָה, דְּאִיסּוּר קַל הוּא, וְיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, דְּאִיסּוּר חָמוּר הוּא, וְלָא קָאָתֵי אִיסּוּר יוֹם כִּיפּוּרִים דְּחָמוּר וְחָיֵיל עַל נְבֵלָה דְּקַל הוּא!
human_translation: And if you would say Rabbi Shimon maintains that notar is a severe prohibition, and applies where lenient prohibition of ascend But an animal carcass is a lenient prohibition, and Yom Kippur is a severe prohibition, and the prohibition Yom Kippur, which is severe, does not come apply where an animal carcass, which is lenient,
llm_translation: And if you will say: It is reasonable according to Rabbi Shimon that a prohibition of severity remains, and one may be lenient regarding a lighter prohibition, but what about nevelah, which is a lighter prohibition, and Yom Kippur, which is a severe prohibition, and yet one does not override the prohibition of Yom Kippur, which is severe, in favor of nevelah, which is light!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בְּקָדָשִׁים גַּלִּי רַחֲמָנָא דְּאָתֵי אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר,
human_translation: Rather, with regard to sacrificial the Merciful One revealed that a prohibition takes effect where prohibition
llm_translation: Rather: in holy things, reveal the mercy that comes with one prohibition falling upon another prohibition.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״אֲשֶׁר לַה׳״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָאֵימוּרִין.
human_translation: As it is taught “which belong to the Lord” to include the sacrificial portions,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Which belongs to the Lord" - to include the utterances.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימוּרִין קָאֵי עֲלַיְיהוּ בְּאִיסּוּר עוֹלִין, וְחֵלֶב קָאֵי עֲלֵייהּו בְּאִיסּוּר כָּרֵת, וְקָאָתֵי אִיסּוּר טוּמְאָה חָיֵיל עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: sacrificial portions, the prohibition of ascend applies to it, and fat, the prohibition karet , applies to it. And the prohibition of impurity comes and applies
llm_translation: The saying stands regarding them in prohibition of ascending, and fat stands regarding them in prohibition of excision, and the prohibition of impurity militates against them.

hebrew_text: תֵּדַע שֶׁכֵּן הוּא, דְּהָא רַבִּי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר, (וְאֵימָא) וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי אִיסּוּר חָמוּר עַל אִיסּוּר קַל, אֲבָל אִיסּוּר קַל חָל עַל אִיסּוּר וְהוּא אִיסּוּר חָמוּר – לָא. וּבְקׇדָשִׁים שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: אִיסּוּר קַל עַל אִיסּוּר חָמוּר נָמֵי חָיֵיל,
human_translation: Know that it is so, as Rabbi maintains a prohibition takes effect where prohibition but this statement severe prohibition where lenient prohibition But a lenient prohibition taking effect where prohibition, and that prohibition is severe no, And with regard to sacrificial we have heard that says even a lenient prohibition takes effect where a severe prohibition
llm_translation: You should know that this is so, for Rabbi holds that one prohibition takes effect upon another prohibition, and say, these matters, a severe prohibition upon a lenient prohibition, but a lenient prohibition does not take effect upon a severe prohibition. And in regard to holy things, we have heard him say: a lenient prohibition upon a severe prohibition is also effective.

hebrew_text: דְּהָא אִיסּוּר מְעִילָה קַל הוּא – מִיתָה, וְאִיסּוּר קָדָשִׁים אִיסּוּר חָמוּר – כָּרֵת, וְאָתֵי אִיסּוּר מִיתָה חָיֵיל עַל אִיסּוּר כָּרֵת.
human_translation: As the prohibition of misuse is lenient death and the prohibition sacrificial is a severe prohibition, karet ,and prohibition death comes and takes effect where prohibition karet .
llm_translation: The prohibition of wearing a mixture of wool and linen is a light prohibition - death penalty, and the prohibition of sacrificial items is a severe prohibition - excision, and the prohibition of death penalty overrides the prohibition of excision.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב לַה׳״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֵימוּרֵי קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים לִמְעִילָה.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi says: all the fat is the Lord’s” to include the sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity in misuse
llm_translation: Talmudic text: דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב לַה׳״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֵימוּרֵי קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים לִמְעִילָה. English translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says: "All fat belongs to the Lord" - to include the light offerings of consecrated items for burning.

hebrew_text: וּמְעִילָה אִיסּוּר מִיתָה, וְקָא חָיֵיל עַל אִיסּוּר חֵלֶב, דְּאִיסּוּר כָּרֵת הוּא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בְּקָדָשִׁים גַּלִּי קְרָא.
human_translation: And misuse is a prohibition death and it takes effect where prohibition fat, which is a prohibition karet . Conclude from with regard to sacrificial the Merciful One revealed
llm_translation: And me'ilah is a prohibition of death, and it is stringent regarding the prohibition of fat, for the prohibition is karet, learn from it: in holy things, a verse is revealed.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵין פִּיגּוּל בָּעוֹלִין וְאֵין נוֹתָר בָּעוֹלִין!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: an offering that was sacrificed with the intent to consume it after its designated time [ piggul ] does not to ascend and notar does not to ascend
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: There is no Pigul in offerings, and there is no Notar in offerings!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: בְּקָדָשִׁים אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר, וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: בְּקָדָשִׁים נָמֵי אֵין אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר.
human_translation: Rather, is tanna’im with regard to of Rabbi Shimon, as some say with regard to sacrificial a prohibition takes effect where prohibition And some say even with regard to sacrificial a prohibition does not take effect where prohibition
llm_translation: Rather, it is a dispute of the Tannaim, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, for there are those who say: in matters of sanctified items, one prohibition takes effect upon another prohibition, and there are those who say: in matters of sanctified items, one prohibition does not take effect upon another prohibition.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר: בְּקָדָשִׁים נָמֵי אֵין אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר, ״כׇּל חֵלֶב לַה׳״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And according to the one who says even with regard to sacrificial a prohibition does not take effect where prohibition what does he do with “All the fat is the Lord’s”
llm_translation: And for the one who says: In holy things also, one prohibition does not take effect upon another prohibition, "All fat belongs to the Lord," what does he do with it?

hebrew_text: מוֹקֵים לֵיהּ בְּוַלְדֵי קָדָשִׁים, דְּקָסָבְרִי: וַלְדֵי קָדָשִׁים – בַּהֲוָיָיתָן יְהוּ קְדוֹשִׁים, דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ בַּהֲדָדֵי אָתוּ.
human_translation: he interprets it to offspring of sacrificial as he holds offspring of sacrificial sanctified when they exist, both of them, come simultaneously.
llm_translation: He establishes it with the offspring of holy animals, for they hold: "offspring of holy animals - upon their being born they are holy," as it is written in the Scriptures: "they shall be holy to their God" (Leviticus 21:6).

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ דַּם שְׁחִיטָה
llm_translation: We will return to you regarding the blood of slaughter.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמֵּבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, וְנוֹדַע לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא חָטָא, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁחַט – יֵצֵא וְיִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: one who brings a provisional guilt offering and it became known to him that he did not sin, if before was slaughtered, it shall emerge and graze with the flock the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who brings a guilt-offering pending uncertain if he sinned, and it becomes known to him that he did not sin, if it has not yet been slaughtered - he should take it out and let it graze with the flock. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב וְיִמָּכֵר וְיִפְּלוּ דָּמָיו לִנְדָבָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יִקְרַב, שֶׁאִם אֵינוֹ בָּא עַל חֵטְא זֶה – הֲרֵי הוּא בָּא עַל חֵטְא אַחֵר.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: it shall graze until it becomes blemished; and it shall be sold, and money for it shall be allocated for gift Rabbi Eliezer says: It shall be sacrificed as if it does not come for this sin it comes for another sin
llm_translation: The sages say: "He shall graze until he becomes blemished, then he shall be sold, and his proceeds shall be designated as a donation." Rabbi Eliezer says: "He shall be brought near, for if he does not come for this sin, he will come for another sin."

hebrew_text: אִם מִשֶּׁנִּשְׁחַט נוֹדַע לוֹ – יִשָּׁפֵךְ הַדָּם, וְהַבָּשָׂר יֵצֵא לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה. נִזְרַק הַדָּם וְהַבָּשָׂר קַיָּים – יֵאָכֵל. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ הַדָּם בַּכּוֹס – יִזָּרֵק, וְהַבָּשָׂר יֵאָכֵל.
human_translation: If it became known to him after was slaughtered the blood shall be poured and the flesh shall go out to the place of burning, the blood was sprinkled and the meat is intact, may be eaten Rabbi Yosei says: Even if the blood in the cup shall be sprinkled and the meat may be eaten.
llm_translation: If after it was slaughtered it became known to him - the blood shall be poured out, and the flesh shall be taken out to the house of burning. If the blood was thrown and the flesh remains intact - it may be eaten. Rabbi Yosei says: Even if the blood is in a cup - it shall be poured out, and the flesh shall be eaten.

hebrew_text: אָשָׁם וַדַּאי אֵינוֹ כֵּן, עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁחַט – יֵצֵא וְיִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר. מִשֶּׁנִּשְׁחַט – הֲרֵי זֶה יִקָּבֵר. נִזְרַק הַדָּם – הַבָּשָׂר יֵצֵא לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: a definite guilt offering, not so, before was slaughtered, it shall go out and graze among the flock, after was slaughtered, it shall be buried after the blood was sprinkled, the flesh shall go out to the place of burning,
llm_translation: Guilt-offering and certain guilt-offering is not so, until not slaughtered - goes out and grazes in the flock. Once slaughtered - behold, it shall be buried. The blood is sprinkled - the flesh goes out to the house of burning.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל אֵינוֹ כֵּן, עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִסְקָל – יֵצֵא וְיִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר. מִשֶּׁנִּסְקַל – מוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה.
human_translation: an ox that is stoned not so, before it was stoned, it shall go out and graze among the flock after was stoned, deriving benefit is permitted.
llm_translation: A bull that is stoned is not the same, until it is stoned - it should go out and graze with the herd. Once it is stoned - it is permitted for benefit.

hebrew_text: עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה אֵינוֹ כֵּן, עַד שֶׁלֹּא נֶעֶרְפָה – תֵּצֵא וְתִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר, מִשֶּׁנֶּעֶרְפָה – תִּקָּבֵר בִּמְקוֹמָהּ, שֶׁעַל סָפֵק בָּאָה מִתְּחִלָּה, כִּיפְּרָה סְפֵקָהּ וְהָלְכָה לָהּ.
human_translation: a heifer whose neck is broken, not so before neck was broken, it shall go out and graze among the flock, after neck was broken, it shall be buried in its place, that from the outset comes uncertainty. it atoned for its uncertainty and is gone.
llm_translation: A calf that is decapitated is not the same, until it is not decapitated - it should go out and graze with the herd; once it is decapitated - it should be buried in its place, because it came about through doubt from the beginning, its doubt was atoned for, and the law follows it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא צְרִיךְ לֵיהּ, לָא מַקְדֵּישׁ לֵיהּ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלִּבּוֹ נוֹקְפוֹ, גּוֹמֵר וּמַקְדִּישׁ.
human_translation: With regard to what disagree? Rabbi Meir holds: Since that he does not require not consecrate it. And the Rabbis hold: Since his heart struck him [ nokfo ] resolved to consecrate
llm_translation: Gemara: With what do they argue? Rabbi Meir holds: Since he does not need it, he does not sanctify it. And the Rabbis hold: Because his heart is pained, he finishes it and sanctifies it.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: בֵּין שֶׁנּוֹדַע לוֹ שֶׁחָטָא וּבֵין נוֹדַע לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא חָטָא פְּלִיגִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבָּנַן. בְּנוֹדַע לוֹ שֶׁחָטָא – לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּיָדַע דַּחֲטָא, כֵּיוָן דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּאַפְרְשֵׁיהּ [לָא יְדַע – תֵּצֵא וְתִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר.
human_translation: taught Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis disagree whether it became known to him that he sinned, or whether it became known to him that he did not sin. where it became known to him that he sinned, to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Rabbi Meir. that even though he knows that he sinned since at the time that he designated he did not know shall go out and graze among the flock,
llm_translation: The Tanna taught: Whether it is known to him that he sinned, or it is known to him that he did not sin, Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis disagree. When it is known to him that he sinned - to inform you of the strength of Rabbi Meir, for even though he knew that he sinned, since at the time he sinned he did not know, he will go out and graze with the flock.

hebrew_text: וּבְנוֹדַע לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא חָטָא – לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא חֲטָא, כֵּיוָן דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּאַפְרְשֵׁיהּ לָא יְדַע] – לִבּוֹ נוֹקְפוֹ הֲוָה, הִלְכָּךְ גָּמַר וּמַקְדֵּישׁ.
human_translation: And where it became known to him that he did not sin, to convey to you the far-reaching nature of the Rabbis. that even though he that he did not sin, since at the time that he designated he did not know, his heart struck Therefore, resolved to consecrate
llm_translation: And if it is known to him that he did not sin - to inform you of the power of the Rabbis, that even though he did not sin, since at the time that he separated he did not know - his heart was scrutinizing him, therefore he concluded and sanctified.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי מֵאִיר לַחֲכָמִים
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Rabbi Meir concedes to the Rabbis
llm_translation: Said Rav Sheshet: Rabbi Meir concedes to the sages.

hebrew_text: בְּמַפְרִישׁ שְׁנֵי אֲשָׁמוֹת לְאַחְרָיוּת וְנִתְכַּפֵּר בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן, דְּשֵׁנִי יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב וְיִמָּכֵר וְיִפְּלוּ דָּמָיו לִנְדָבָה.
human_translation: where one designates two guilt offerings as a guarantee, and he achieved atonement with one of them. that second shall graze until it becomes blemished and it shall be sold and money for it shall be allocated for gift
llm_translation: In the case where he designates two guilt offerings for future use, and he achieves atonement with one of them, the second one should graze until it becomes blemished, and then it should be sold, and its value should be dedicated as a freewill offering.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר עֲלֵיהוֹן דְּרַבָּנַן אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא גַּלִּי דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּלִבּוֹ נוֹקְפוֹ, אֲבָל הָכָא, מִכְּדִי חַד הוּא דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְאַפְרוֹשֵׁי, מַאי טַעְמָא אַפְרֵישׁ תְּרֵי? דְּסָבַר: אִי מִירְכַס חֲדָא מִיכַּפַּרְנָא בְּאִידַּךְ חַבְרֵיהּ, וְכֵיוָן דְּגַלִּי דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּלִבּוֹ נוֹקְפוֹ הָיָה, הוֹאִיל וְכָךְ הָיָה גָּמַר וְהִקְדִּישׁוֹ.
human_translation: What is the reason Rabbi Meir disagrees with the Rabbis only because that did not reveal that his heart was striking him But here, since he was required to designate one what is the reason he designated two? that he thought: If one is lost, I will achieve atonement with the other one. And as he revealed that his heart was striking him since that was so, he wholeheartedly resolved to consecrate
llm_translation: What is the reason? Until here, Rabbi Meir does not argue with the Sages regarding them, but because his mind did not reveal to him that his heart was troubled. But here, since there is only one who wants to separate from the group, what is the reason to separate two? He thought: If one leans on the other, his friend will atone for him, and once his mind was revealed that his heart was troubled, he decided and sanctified it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ עֵדָיו, דְּיֵצֵא וְיִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: The Rabbis concede to Rabbi Meir in a provisional guilt offering where were rendered conspiring witnesses, that shall go out and graze among the flock
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The sages agree with Rabbi Meir regarding a guilt-offering that is dependent on the testimony of witnesses, that he should go out and tend to the flock.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּאַפְרְשֵׁיהּ עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, וְאָמְרִינַן לִבּוֹ נוֹקְפוֹ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּעַל פִּי עֵדִים אַפְרְשֵׁיהּ – לָא הֲוָה סָמֵיךְ עִילָּוֵי עֵדִים, דְּסָבַר: דִּלְמָא אָתוּ אֲחֵרִים וּמַזְּמִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: What is the reason? the Rabbis disagree only where designated of his own volition, and we say his heart was striking him But where he designated due to witnesses, he was not relying on the witnesses. he thought: Perhaps other will come and render these conspiring witnesses.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Until here, the Rabbis do not argue about it, except where he explains it on his own, and we say his heart is striking him. But where he explains it based on the testimony of witnesses - it was not relying on the testimony of witnesses, for he might come and others will come and plot against them.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל אֵינוֹ כֵּן, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִסְקַל – יֵצֵא וְיִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּאָתוּ בֵּי תְרֵי אָמְרִי ״הָרַג״, וּבֵי תְרֵי אָמְרִי ״לֹא הָרַג״ – מַאי חָזֵית דְּצָיְיתַ[תְּ] לְבָתְרָאֵי? צִיית לְהוּ לְקַמָּאֵי!
human_translation: Rava raises an objection an ox that is stoned is not similar if before it was stoned, it shall go out and graze among the flock. What are the circumstances? If we say that two came said killed and two say did not kill, what did you see that you listen to the latter You listen to the former
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: A bull that is stoned is not the same; if it was not yet stoned - it should go out and graze with the herd. How so? If you say that in one court they said "kill" and in another court they said "do not kill" - what do you see that you decide for the latter? Decide for the former!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו בְּעֵדֵי הֲזָמָה. וְדִכְווֹתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי אָשָׁם תָּלוּי – בְּעֵדֵי הֲזָמָה, וּפְלִיגִי!
human_translation: Rather, isn’t to conspiring witnesses, And in the corresponding with regard to a provisional guilt offering, referring to conspiring witnesses, And disagree
llm_translation: Rather, is it not with witnesses of conspiracy. And its comparison is regarding a guilt offering hanging - with witnesses of conspiracy, and they dispute!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְדִלְמָא שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל הֵיכִי דָמֵי – כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּא הָרוּג בְּרַגְלָיו.
human_translation: Abaye said to Perhaps an ox that is stoned, what are the circumstances? where killed comes on his feet,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And perhaps the ox that is stoned, how is its value - for example, if it came and killed with its foot.

hebrew_text: וְדִכְווֹתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי אָשָׁם תָּלוּי – כְּגוֹן דְּהוּכְּרָה חֲתִיכָה. אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאַפְרְשֵׁיהּ לְאָשָׁם תָּלוּי עַל פִּי עֵדִים – לָא.
human_translation: And in the corresponding of a provisional guilt offering, for example, known piece But where he designated as a provisional guilt offering due to the testimony of witnesses, not
llm_translation: And his stripes above a guilt offering hanging - for example, that he recognized a piece. But here, where he explained it as a guilt offering hanging based on the testimony of witnesses - no.

hebrew_text: בִּפְלוּגְתָּא: אָשָׁם תָּלוּי שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ עֵדָיו – רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּמִנְחַת קְנָאוֹת, דְּתַנְיָא: נִמְצְאוּ עֵדֶיהָ זוֹמְמִין – מִנְחָתָהּ תֵּצֵא לְחוּלִּין.
human_translation: with regard to the dispute a provisional guilt offering witnesses were rendered conspiring witnesses, Rabbi Elazar says: This is similar to a meal offering of jealousy, As it is taught witnesses her were found conspiring, her meal offering is transferred to non-sacred
llm_translation: In the dispute: a guilt offering is pending when its witnesses were found to be conspiring - Rabbi Elazar says: it is like a meal offering of jealousy, as it was taught: if her witnesses are found to be conspiring - her meal offering shall go out for common use.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב וְיִמָּכֵר וְיִפְּלוּ דָּמָיו לִנְדָבָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, נְדַמְּיֵיהּ לְמִנְחַת קְנָאוֹת! לָא דָּמֵי, מִנְחַת קְנָאוֹת לָא לְכַפָּרָה קָאָתְיָיא, אֶלָּא לְבָרֵר עָוֹן. אֲבָל אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, דִּלְכַפָּרָה אָתֵי, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלִּבּוֹ נוֹקְפוֹ גּוֹמֵר וּמַקְדִּישׁוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: shall graze until it becomes blemished; and it shall be sold, and money for it shall be allocated for gift But Rabbi Yoḥanan, let us compare to a meal offering of jealousy, not similar: A meal offering of jealousy does not come for atonement, rather to clarify sin But a provisional guilt offering, which comes for atonement, Since his heart strikes him resolves to consecrate
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One should graze an animal until it becomes blemished, and then sell it, and its proceeds shall be designated as a donation. And Rabbi Yochanan compares it to a Minchat Kena'ot offering! Not the blood of a Minchat Kena'ot offering for atonement, but to clarify sin. However, a guilt offering is dependent, for it comes for atonement, because he completes and sanctifies it from his own heart.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי כְּרוּסְפָּדַאי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ עֵדָיו – כׇּל הַמַּחֲזִיק בּוֹ זָכָה בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Keruspedai says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: an ox that is stoned whose witnesses were rendered conspiring,anyone who takes possession acquires it,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Kruspedai said Rabbi Yochanan: An ox that is stoned whose witnesses were found to be conspiring - anyone who holds onto it, acquires it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, כְּגוֹן דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: נִרְבַּע שׁוֹרוֹ. אֲבָל אָמְרוּ: רָבַע שׁוֹרוֹ, הוּא בְּעַצְמוֹ מִידָּע יָדַיע דְּלָא רְבַע וְלָא מַפְקַר לֵיהּ, וְטָרַח וּמַיְיתֵי עֵדִים.
human_translation: Rava said: The explanation of Rabbi Yoḥanan stands to reason where said to him his ox was the object of bestiality; But said engaged in bestiality with his ox, he knows about himself that he did not engage in bestiality with and he will not relinquish his ownership But he will make an effort and bring witnesses
llm_translation: Rava said: It is reasonable the reasoning of Rabbi Yochanan, for example, that they said to him: "His ox gored." But if they said: "His ox gored a quarter," he himself immediately knows that it did not gore a quarter and was not left ownerless, and he went and brought witnesses.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אִיתַּי אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ עֵדֶיהָ – כׇּל הַמַּחֲזִיק בָּהּ זָכָה בָּהּ?
human_translation: And what is different between that which Rava bar Ittai says Reish Lakish says: an idolatrous city, its witnesses were rendered conspiring witnesses, anyone who takes possession acquires it?
llm_translation: And what is the difference from that which Rabba bar Ittai said in the name of Reish Lakish: "A city of idolatry whose witnesses were found to be conspiring - anyone who holds onto it, has acquired it?"

hebrew_text: עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת, דְּרַבִּים נִינְהוּ, כֹּל חַד אָמַר בְּדַעְתֵּיהּ: אֲנָא לָא חֲטַאי, אַחֲרִינָא חֲטָא, וּמַפְקַר מָמוֹנֵיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא, דִּבְדִידֵיהּ תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא, הוּא בְּעַצְמוֹ מִידָּע יָדַע דְּלָא רְבַע, וְלָא מַפְקַר לֵיהּ, וְטָרַח וּמַיְיתֵי עֵדִים.
human_translation: an idolatrous city, which many each says to himself: I did not sin, others sinned, and he relinquished ownership of his property. But here, where the matter is dependent upon himself, he knows about himself that he did not engage in bestiality with and he does not relinquish his ownership But he will make an effort and bring witnesses
llm_translation: City of the banished, they are many, each one said in his own mind: "I did not sin, another sinned, and its property is ownerless." But here, since the matter depends on himself, he himself immediately knows that he did not sin, and does not declare it ownerless, and he goes and brings witnesses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַנּוֹתֵן מַתָּנָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וְאָמַר הַלָּה: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בָּהּ״ – כׇּל הַמַּחֲזִיק בָּהּ זָכָה בָּהּ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: one who gives a gift to another and that says: I do not want [ ee efshi ] it, anyone who takes possession of acquires it,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: One who gives a gift to his friend, and the recipient says, "If I desire it," - whoever holds onto it, acquires it.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מְקַבֵּל מַתָּנָה שֶׁאָמַר לְאַחַר שֶׁבָּאת מַתָּנָה לְיָדוֹ: ״מַתָּנָה זוֹ תִּיבָּטֵל״ – מְבוּטֶּלֶת, ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בָּהּ״ – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין. ״בְּטֵילָה״, ״אֵינָהּ מַתָּנָה״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: And what is different between that which Rabba bar Avuh says Rav Sheshet says, and some say Rabbi Abbahu says Rav Sheshet says: one who receives a gift who, after the gift entered his possession, said: Let this gift become void, is rendered void, I do not want it, his statement is effective. It is void, It is not a gift, he said nothing.
llm_translation: And what is the difference from what Rabba bar Avuh said in the name of Rav Sheshet, and some say in the name of Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rav Sheshet: One who receives a gift that was said to another after the gift came into his possession, "This gift should be nullified" - it is nullified. "If I wish, it is nullified" - his words stand. "If it is nullified," "it is not a gift" - he did not say anything.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו ״דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין״ – דְּהָדְרָא לְמָרַהּ? לָא, דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין – וְהוּא נָמֵי לָא קָנֵי לַהּ, וְכׇל הַמַּחֲזִיק בָּהּ זָכָה בָּהּ.
human_translation: What, is it not His statement is effective, that returns to its owner? No, His statement is effective, also does not acquire and anyone who takes possession of it acquires it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reason "his words are established" – that he retracted from his ruling? No, his words are established – and he himself did not acquire it, and anyone who holds onto it has acquired it.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי עַל שָׂדֶה זוֹ״, ״אֵין לִי עֵסֶק בָּהּ״, וְ״יָדִי מְסוּלֶּקֶת הֵימֶנָּה״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. וְהָא ״יָדִי מְסוּלֶּקֶת הֵימֶנָּה״ כְּאִי אֶפְשִׁי דָּמֵי, וְקָתָנֵי: לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם!
human_translation: raises an objection one who says to another I have no legal with this field, I have no business with it, or: My hand is removed from it, has not said anything But My hand is removed from it, is like I do not want it, and is taught has not said anything.
llm_translation: The opponent raises an objection: One who says to his fellow, "I have no claim on this field," "I have no business with it," and "my hand is removed from it" - he has not said anything. But isn't "my hand is removed from it" like saying, "I am as innocent as blood"? And the Mishnah teaches: he has not said anything!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר: כִּי סַלֵּיק נַפְשֵׁיהּ מִדִּין וּדְבָרִים, מִגּוּפַהּ דְּשָׂדֶה לָא סַלֵּיק נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: there is different, as he says that he is removing himself, from legal or involvement. He is not removing himself from the field itself.
llm_translation: The matter is different there, for it says: "When a person's soul departs from judgment and words, their soul does not depart from the body of the field."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַכּוֹתֵב נְכָסָיו לַאֲחֵרִים וְהָיוּ בָּהֶן עֲבָדִים, וְאָמַר הַלָּה: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בָּהֶן״, אִם הָיָה רַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי כֹּהֵן – אוֹכְלִין בִּתְרוּמָה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָמַר: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בָּהֶן״ – כְּבָר זָכוּ בָּהֶן יוֹרְשִׁין.
human_translation: raises objection who wrote his property to another, and there were slaves among and the other said: I do not want them, if second master, was a priest, may partake of teruma , Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Once said: I do not want them, heirs have already acquired them.
llm_translation: Challenger: One who writes his possessions to others, and there were slaves among them, and he said: "If I will redeem them." If his master was a second priest - they may eat from the terumah. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Once he said: "If I will redeem them" - the heirs have already acquired them.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, קָסָבַר: כִּי יָהֵיב אִינִישׁ מַתָּנָה אַדַּעְתָּא דִּמְקַבְּלִין לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ, כִּי לָא מְקַבְּלִין לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ הָדְרָא לְמָרַהּ.
human_translation: Granted according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, holds when a person gives a gift, with the intention that accept from him. when does not accept it from him, returns to its owner.
llm_translation: In truth, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: When a person gives a gift with the knowledge that the recipient will not accept it from him, it is considered as if he has not given it to her, and he must return it to him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְתַנָּא קַמָּא, אִי כִּי אָמַר ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בָּהֶן״ – כׇּל הַמַּחֲזִיק בָּהֶן זָכָה בָּהֶן, הָכָא, דְּאָמַר שֵׁנִי ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בָּהֶן״ – הָווּ לְהוּ זָרִים, וְקָאָכְלִי זָרִים תְּרוּמָה! קָסָבַר: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ – יָצָא לְחֵירוּת, וְצָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר מֵרַבּוֹ, וְקָסָבַר: מְעוּכָּב לְגֵט שִׁחְרוּר – אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: But according to the first tanna , if that when one says: I do not want it, anyone who takes possession of acquires it, here, where second said: I do not want them, are non-priests, and non-priests are partaking of teruma . holds one who renounces ownership of his slave, is emancipated but requires a bill of manumission from his master. And he holds detained to a bill of manumission may partake of teruma
llm_translation: Rather, to the first Tanna, if he said, "If I will benefit from them" - whoever holds onto them is deemed to have benefited from them. Here, where he said a second time, "If I will benefit from them" - they become strangers to him, and he is consuming terumah from strangers! He holds: one who emancipates his slave - he goes out to freedom, and he requires a bill of emancipation from his master, and he holds: one who is delayed in receiving a bill of emancipation - he may eat terumah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יִקְרַב כּוּ׳. לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, לְמָה לִי חֵטְא? הָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אָשָׁם תָּלוּי בִּנְדָבָה אָתֵי, דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִתְנַדֵּב אָדָם אָשָׁם תָּלוּי בְּכׇל יוֹם!
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: It shall be sacrificed According to Rabbi Eliezer, why do I sin? Doesn’t Rabbi Eliezer say a provisional guilt offering may come as a gift As we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: A person may volunteer a provisional guilt offering every day.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "Yikrav ku." To Rabbi Eliezer, why do I need sin? For Rabbi Eliezer said: "A guilt offering comes through a voluntary offering," as we learned, Rabbi Eliezer says: "A person's guilt offering comes every day through a voluntary offering!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמְרוּ לוֹ הוּא, דִּתְנַן: אֶלָּא אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן עַד שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לְבֵית הַסָּפֵק.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Rabbi Eliezer is of those who spoke to as we learned But they said to him: Wait until you enter into a situation uncertainty,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Rabbi Eliezer, as they said to him, as we learned: Rather, they say to him: Wait until you enter the house of doubt.

hebrew_text: אִם מִשֶּׁנִּשְׁחַט נוֹדַע כּוּ׳. קָתָנֵי: הַבָּשָׂר יֵצֵא לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵפָה. אַלְמָא: חוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה – בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: after was slaughtered it became known teaches: The flesh shall go out to the place of burning. Evidently, non-sacred animals that were slaughtered in the courtyard, to burned.
llm_translation: If from when slaughtered known. It teaches: the meat goes to the house of burning. It is evident: mundane offerings that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard – to burning.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: אָשָׁם וַדַּאי אֵינוֹ כֵּן, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁחַט – יֵצֵא וְיִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר, מִשֶּׁנִּשְׁחַט – הֲרֵי זֶה יִקָּבֵר! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: תִּבְרַאּ, מִי שֶׁשָּׁנָה זוֹ לֹא שָׁנָה זוֹ.
human_translation: But raise a contradiction a definite guilt offering, not so; if before was slaughtered, it shall go out and graze among the flock. after was slaughtered it shall be buried. Rabbi Elazar said: is disjointed, He who taught this did not teach that
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: A guilt-offering, and certainly it is not so, if it was not slaughtered - it may go out and graze with the flock, once it is slaughtered - it must be buried! Rabbi Elazar said: Let it be created, one who changes this, did not change this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: אָשָׁם וַדַּאי עַל אָשָׁם תָּלוּי קָרָמֵית? אָשָׁם וַדַּאי, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא צְרִיךְ לֵיהּ – לָא מַקְדֵּישׁ לֵיהּ. אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלִּבּוֹ נוֹקְפוֹ – גּוֹמֵר וּמַקְדִּשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Rabba said: Are you raising a contradiction a definite guilt offering with regard to a provisional guilt offering? a definite guilt offering, Since that he does not need he did not consecrate it, a provisional guilt offering, since his heart struck him he resolves to consecrate
llm_translation: Rabah said: "Is a guilt-offering definitely dependent on a guilt-offering of a vineyard? A guilt-offering definitely, since he does not need it - he does not sanctify it. A guilt-offering of a vineyard, since his heart is pained - he completes it and sanctifies it."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי קַשְׁיָא, אָשָׁם וַדַּאי עַל אָשָׁם וַדַּאי קַשְׁיָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: הֲרֵי זֶה יִקָּבֵר, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וְהַבָּשָׂר יֵצֵא לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה! הָא וַדַּאי תִּבְרַאּ, מִי שֶׁשָּׁנָה זוֹ לֹא שָׁנָה זוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, if a difficulty, a definite guilt offering of a definite guilt offering is difficult. As it is taught it shall be buried. say the latter clause the flesh shall go out to the place of burning. is certainly disjointed, he who taught this did not teach that
llm_translation: Rather, if it is difficult, a guilt offering and certainly a guilt offering is difficult, as it is taught: "Here he shall be buried," say the latter part: "And the flesh shall go to the burning place!" This is certainly a contradiction, one who changed this did not change that.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: רֵישָׁא דְּקָתָנֵי בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי: ״וְהַבָּשָׂר יֵצֵא לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה״ – לָא קַשְׁיָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיתְחֲזֵי כְּזֶבַח פָּסוּל.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The first clause, which teaches with regard to a provisional guilt offering: The flesh shall go out to the place of burning, not difficult. because it has the appearance of a disqualified offering,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: The beginning of the Mishnah in the case of a guilt-offering is dependent: "And the flesh shall go to the burning place" – it is not difficult, because it appears like a disqualified sacrifice.

hebrew_text: נִזְרַק הַדָּם – הַבָּשָׂר יֵאָכֵל. וְאַמַּאי? הָא הַוְיָא לֵיהּ יְדִיעָה! אָמַר רָבָא, אֲמַר קְרָא: ״וְהוּא לֹא יָדַע וְנִסְלַח לוֹ״, וְהָא לָא הָוְיָא לֵיהּ יְדִיעָה בִּשְׁעַת סְלִיחָה.
human_translation: the blood was sprinkled the meat may be eaten But why he has knowledge Rava said the verse states: “And he knew it not, and he shall be forgiven” and this did not have knowledge at the time of forgiveness,
llm_translation: The blood was thrown - the flesh shall be eaten. And why? This is necessary for knowledge! Rava said, a verse says: "And he shall not know, and it shall be forgiven him." But this is not necessary for knowledge at the time of forgiveness.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ הַדָּם בַּכּוֹס כּוּ׳. לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אַמַּאי יִזָּרֵק? הָא הָוְיָא לֵיהּ יְדִיעָה בִּשְׁעַת סְלִיחָה! אָמַר רָבָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הָעוֹמֵד לִיזָּרֵק – כְּזָרוּק דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even the blood in the cup According to Rabbi Yosei, why sprinkled? This had knowledge at the moment of forgiveness. Rava said Rabbi Yosei holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who says: any that is ready to be sprinkled is like has been sprinkled.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even if the blood is in the cup. To Rabbi Yosei, why should it be poured out? This is considered as if he had intention at the time of forgiveness! Rava said: Rabbi Yosei holds like Rabbi Shimon, who said: Anyone who stands to pour out - it is as if he poured out blood.

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, בְּמִידֵּי דְּעוֹמֵד לִיזָּרֵק, אֲבָל הַאי, אֵין עוֹמֵד לִיזָּרֵק! אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא, קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת מְקַדְּשִׁין בּוֹ אֶת הַפָּסוּל בַּתְּחִלָּה לִיקְרַב.
human_translation: Say that Rabbi Shimon said with regard to an item that is ready to be sprinkled but this it not ready to be sprinkled. They say in the West, Rabbi Yosei holds: service vessel consecrates disqualified to be sacrificed ab initio .
llm_translation: Statement: Rabbi Shimon said, in the case of one who stands to sprinkle, but this one does not stand to sprinkle! They said in the West, Rabbi Yosei holds: vessels of service sanctify the disqualified offering initially to draw near.

hebrew_text: אָשָׁם וַדַּאי אֵינוֹ כֵּן כּוּ׳. אִיתְּמַר: עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה אֵימָתַי נֶאֱסֶרֶת? רַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר: מֵחַיִּים, רָבָא אָמַר: לְאַחַר עֲרִיפָה.
human_translation: a definite guilt offering, not so, was stated From when prohibited a heifer whose neck is broken? Rav Hamnuna says: from alive. Rava says: after breaking of the neck
llm_translation: Guilt-offering and definite guilt-offering not the same. It was stated: When is a decapitated calf forbidden? Rav Hamnuna said: From when it is alive, Rava said: After decapitation.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרָבָא – מֵעִידָּנָא דְּאִיתְעֲבִיד בַּהּ מַעֲשֶׂה, אֶלָּא לְרַב הַמְנוּנָא, מֵאֵימָתַי?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rava from the moment that an action, was performed on But according to Rav Hamnuna, from when
llm_translation: In truth, to Rava - we testify that he engaged in it, the deed, but to Rav Hamnuna, from when?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: גְּבוּל שָׁמַעְתִּי בָּהּ וְשָׁכַחְתִּי, וְנָסְבִין חַבְרַיָּיא לְמֵימַר: יְרִידָתָהּ לְנַחַל אֵיתָן אוֹסַרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai says: I heard boundary, it but I have forgotten and group were inclined to say its descent to rough, stream, renders it prohibited.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yannai: I heard its boundary and forgot, and my colleagues turned to say: Its descent to Nahal Eitan prohibits it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דִּתְנַן: הַשּׁוֹחֵט פָּרַת חַטָּאת, וְשׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל, וְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר, וַחֲכָמִים מְחַיְּיבִין.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: From where do I say which we learned who slaughters the heifer of purification, or an ox that stoned, or a heifer whose neck is broken, Rabbi Shimon exempts and the Rabbis deem liable.
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: "Should I say to her? For it was taught: One who slaughters the cow of a sin-offering, and the ox that is to be stoned, and the calf whose neck is to be broken - Rabbi Shimon exempts, and the Sages obligate."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי, דְּאָמֵינָא מֵחַיִּים, בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּנַן, דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: שְׁחִיטָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה – לֹא שְׁמָהּ שְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: Granted, according to my that I say from alive, Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis disagree with regard to this Rabbi Shimon holds: Slaughter that does not fit is not considered slaughter.
llm_translation: In truth, according to my opinion, as I hold from the living, in this matter Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis disagree. For Rabbi Shimon holds: if the slaughter is not fitting, it is not considered slaughter.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: שְׁחִיטָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה – שְׁמָהּ שְׁחִיטָה. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְאַחַר עֲרִיפָה, אַמַּאי פָּטַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? שְׁחִיטָה רְאוּיָה הִיא!
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Slaughter that does not fit is considered slaughter, But if you say after the breaking of the neck why does Rabbi Shimon exempt it is a slaughter that fit
llm_translation: The Sages said: A slaughter that is not proper - its name is slaughter. Rather, if you say it is after snapping, why did Rabbi Shimon exempt? It is proper slaughter!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: סָבַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן עֶגְלָה בִּשְׁחִיטָה כְּשֵׁרָה, וְהָתְנַן: כָּשֵׁר בַּפָּרָה פָּסוּל – בְּעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה, פָּסוּל בַּפָּרָה – כָּשֵׁר בְּעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה. פָּרָה, בִּשְׁחִיטָה – כְּשֵׁרָה, בַּעֲרִיפָה – פְּסוּלָה, עֶגְלָה, בַּעֲרִיפָה – כְּשֵׁרָה, בִּשְׁחִיטָה – פְּסוּלָה!
human_translation: And if you would say Rabbi Shimon holds heifer by slaughter a fit Didn’t we learn fit in heifer unfit in a heifer fit in a heifer unfit in heifer. heifer, fit with slaughter; unfit with breaking the neck. heifer fit with breaking the neck; unfit with slaughter.
llm_translation: And if you will say: Rabbi Shimon thought that an Eglah (heifer) is valid through slaughter, yet we have learned: If it is valid in the Parah (red heifer), it is invalid in the Eglah (heifer) whose neck is to be broken; if it is invalid in the Parah (red heifer), it is valid in the Eglah (heifer) whose neck is to be broken. The Parah (red heifer), through slaughter – it is valid; through decapitation – it is invalid. The Eglah (heifer), through decapitation – it is valid; through slaughter – it is invalid!

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתִּיק. לְבָתַר דִּנְפַק, אֲמַר: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמֵינָא לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: עֶגְלָה בִּשְׁחִיטָה כְּשֵׁירָה!
human_translation: was silent, After left said: What is the reason I did not say to him that Rabbi Shimon holds fit by slaughtering?
llm_translation: The text reads: "Ishtik. Le'vatar dinpakh, amar: Mai ta'ama la ameina lei d'Rabbi Shimon savar: Eglah bishchitah k'sheirah!" Translation: "He remained silent. After he left, he said: What is the reason that I did not say to him that Rabbi Shimon holds: an unblemished calf is valid for slaughter!"

hebrew_text: וְרַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר לָךְ: לָא נִשְׁתְּמִיט תַּנָּא דְּנַשְׁמְעִינַן עֶגְלָה בִּשְׁחִיטָה כְּשֵׁרָה, דְּתֵימָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: But Rav Hamnuna said to you not have left out the tanna who teaches us a heifer fit by slaughtering. for saying is Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: And Rav Hamnuna said to you: It was not forgotten, a Tanna that we heard that a calf in slaughter is valid, for you might say it is Rabbi Shimon's opinion.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? מִדִּתְנַן: עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה אֵינָהּ כֵּן, עַד שֶׁלֹּא נֶעֶרְפָה – תֵּצֵא וְתִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מֵחַיִּים, אַמַּאי תֵּצֵא וְתִרְעֶה בָּעֵדֶר? הָא אִיתַּסְרָא לַהּ מֵחַיִּים!
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say from that we learned a heifer whose neck is broken, not so; before neck was broken, it shall go out and graze among the flock, And if you say from alive, why it go out and graze among the flock? Wasn’t prohibited from alive?
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this to her? From what we learned: A decapitated calf is not so, until it is not decapitated - it should go out and graze with the herd. And if you say from the living, why should it go out and graze with the herd? It is forbidden to her from the living!

hebrew_text: תְּנִי: עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִרְאֵית לַעֲרִיפָה. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: מִשֶּׁנֶּעֶרְפָה – תִּקָּבֵר בִּמְקוֹמָהּ! תְּנִי: מִשֶּׁנִּרְאֵית לַעֲרִיפָה.
human_translation: teach before was fit for having neck broken, Say the latter clause after neck was broken, it shall be buried in its place. Teach after was fit for having neck broken
llm_translation: Mishnah: Until it is not visible to the vulture. Say the conclusion: Once it has decomposed - it should be buried in its place! Mishnah: Once it is visible to the vulture.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: שֶׁעַל הַסָּפֵק בָּאָה מִתְּחִלָּה, כִּיפְּרָה סְפֵיקָהּ וְהָלְכָה לָהּ. וְאִי מֵחַיִּים, עֲדַיִין לֹא כִּיפְּרָה סְפֵיקָהּ!
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause that from the outset, comes for uncertainty. it atoned for its uncertainty and is gone. And if where alive, has still not atoned its uncertainty.
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: that regarding a doubt, it came initially, its doubt was atoned for, and the law follows it. And if not, the doubt has not yet been atoned for!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: נֶאֱמַר מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר בִּפְנִים, וְנֶאֱמַר מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר בַּחוּץ.
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it is taught is stated enable and atone, inside And is stated enable and atone, outside
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: It is stated "validating and atoning inside," and it is stated "validating and atoning outside."

hebrew_text: מָה מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר הָאָמוּר בִּפְנִים, עָשָׂה בּוֹ מַכְשִׁיר כִּמְכַפֵּר – אַף מַכְשִׁיר [וּמְכַפֵּר] הָאָמוּר בַּחוּץ, עָשָׂה מַכְשִׁיר כִּמְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: Just as enable or atone which are stated inside made enables like atones, so too, enable or atone which are stated outside made enables, like atones,
llm_translation: What is valid and atones when stated inside, if one made it valid like atoning - also valid and atones when stated outside, if one made it valid like atoning.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִתְנַדֵּב אָדָם אָשָׁם תָּלוּי בְּכׇל יוֹם וּבְכׇל עֵת שֶׁיִּרְצֶה. הוּא הָיָה נִקְרָא אֲשַׁם חֲסִידִים. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל בָּבָא בֶּן בּוּטָא שֶׁהָיָה מִתְנַדֵּב אָשָׁם תָּלוּי בְּכׇל יוֹם, חוּץ מֵאַחַר יוֹם כִּיפּוּרִים יוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: A person may volunteer a provisional guilt offering every day and at any time that he chooses, this was called the guilt offering of the pious, They said about Bava ben Buta that he would volunteer a provisional guilt offering every day except for one day after Yom Kippur,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says: A person's voluntary guilt-offering is dependent every day and at all times that he wishes. He was called the guilt-offering of the pious. They said about Babba ben Buta that he would bring a voluntary guilt-offering every day, except for the day of Yom Kippur, one day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: הַמָּעוֹן הַזֶּה! אִילּוּ הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין לִי הָיִיתִי מֵבִיא, אֶלָּא אוֹמְרִים לִי: הַמְתֵּין עַד שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לְסָפֵק. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אֶלָּא עַל שֶׁזְּדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְשִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת.
human_translation: said: this abode if they would have allowed me, I would have brought But they say to me: Wait until you enter into uncertainty. And the Rabbis say: One brings a provisional guilt offering only whose intentional karet and whose unwitting a sin offering.
llm_translation: He said: this dwelling! If they were allowing me, I would bring, but they say to me: wait until she enters for questioning. And the sages say: one does not bring a guilt offering except for intentional sin that carries the penalty of excision, and for unintentional sin, a sin offering.

hebrew_text: חַיָּיבֵי חַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת וַדָּאִין שֶׁעָבַר עֲלֵיהֶן יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים – חַיָּיבִין לְהָבִיא לְאַחַר יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, וְחַיָּיבֵי אֲשָׁמוֹת תְּלוּיִין – פְּטוּרִין. מִי שֶׁבָּא בְּיָדוֹ סְפֵק עֲבֵירָה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, אֲפִילּוּ עִם חֲשֵׁיכָה – פָּטוּר, שֶׁכׇּל הַיּוֹם מְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: liable sin offerings and definite guilt offerings for whom Yom Kippur has passed are liable to bring after Yom Kippur. liable provisional guilt offerings are exempt one who encountered uncertainty whether a sin on Yom Kippur, even if at nightfall exempt, as the entire day atones
llm_translation: Those liable for sin-offerings and guilt-offerings, and those who transgressed them on Yom Kippur - are obligated to bring their offerings after Yom Kippur, and those liable for guilt-offerings that are dependent on circumstances - are exempt. One who comes with a doubtful transgression in his hand on Yom Kippur, even at nightfall - is exempt, for the entire day atones.

hebrew_text: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלֶיהָ חַטַּאת הָעוֹף סָפֵק, וְעָבַר עָלֶיהָ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – חַיֶּיבֶת לְהָבִיא לְאַחַר יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא מַכְשֶׁרֶת לֶאֱכוֹל בִּזְבָחִים. חַטַּאת הָעוֹף הַבָּאָה עַל הַסָּפֵק, אִם מִשֶּׁנִּמְלְקָה נוֹדַע – תִּקָּבֵר.
human_translation: A woman upon whom a bird sin offering uncertainty, for whom Yom Kippur has passed, is liable to bring after Yom Kippur. because it renders eligible to partake of offerings. bird sin offering that is brought due to uncertainty, if it became known after was pinched, must be buried.
llm_translation: The woman who has a bird sin-offering in doubt, and Yom Kippur passed over her - she is obligated to bring it after Yom Kippur, because it qualifies to be eaten in sacrifices. The bird sin-offering that comes in doubt, if it becomes known - it should be buried.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ חוֹבָה הִיא, [כִּי] מִתְיְידַע לֵיהּ, אַמַּאי מַיְיתֵי חַטָּאת? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינָּה: נְדָבָה הִיא.
human_translation: What is the reason that Rabbi Eliezer If it enters your mind is obligatory, why does he bring a sin offering when it becomes known to him Rather, conclude from this is a gift
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer? If it is because it is an obligation, then he knows it, so why does he bring a sin offering? Rather, learn from it: it is a voluntary offering. English translation:

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: עוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים הוּא דְּאָתוּ בְּנֶדֶר וּנְדָבָה, אֲבָל חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם – חוֹבָה נִינְהוּ. וְאָשָׁם תָּלוּי, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּמַיְיתֵי מִקַּמֵּי דְּמִתְיְידַע לֵיהּ – לְהָגֵן עָלָיו, דְּהַתּוֹרָה חָסָה עַל גּוּפָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And the Rabbis It is a burnt offering and a peace offering that come as a vow and gift but a sin offering and a guilt offering, are obligatory. And a provisional guilt offering, this is the reason that he brings before is known to him: to protect him as the Torah spared the bodies of the Jewish people
llm_translation: The sages: An olah offering and peace offerings are those that come with a vow or as a freewill offering, but a sin offering and guilt offering - they are obligatory. And a guilt offering that is dependent, that is the reason it comes before he becomes aware - to protect him, for the Torah is concerned for the body of Israel.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: דִּילְמָא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי כְּעוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים, מָה עוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים דְּאָתוּ בְּחוֹבָה וְאָתוּ בִּנְדָבָה, אָשָׁם תָּלוּי נָמֵי, דְּאָתֵי בְּחוֹבָה, אָתֵי נָמֵי בִּנְדָבָה!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: perhaps a provisional guilt offering is like a burnt offering and a peace offering: Just as a burnt offering and a peace offering come as obligatory and they come as gift a provisional guilt offering also comes as an obligatory comes as a gift as well.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: Perhaps a guilt offering is suspended like a burnt offering and peace offerings. Just as burnt offerings and peace offerings come through obligation and come through voluntary offering, a guilt offering is also suspended, for it comes through obligation, and it also comes through voluntary offering!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים עִיקָּר בִּנְדָבָה כְּתִיבִי, אָשָׁם תָּלוּי עִיקָּר בְּחוֹבָה כְּתִיב.
human_translation: said to A burnt offering and a peace offering are primarily written, of a gift a provisional guilt offering is primarily written of an obligatory
llm_translation: He said to him: "Burnt offering and peace offerings primarily written as voluntary, guilt offering primarily written as obligatory."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא:
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches before Rava:
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya before Rava:

hebrew_text: אָשָׁם תָּלוּי בָּא עַל הַנְּבֵלָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁזְּדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְשִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת! וְאִי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, בִּנְדָבָה נָמֵי אָתֵי!
human_translation: A provisional guilt offering comes for animal carcass. said to him: But didn’t we learn And the Rabbis say one brings a provisional guilt offering only for a matter whose intentional karet and whose unwitting a sin offering? And if Rabbi Eliezer, comes also as a gift
llm_translation: Guilt offering dependent came upon the carcass. He said to him: And we learned, and the sages say: He does not bring a guilt offering dependent except for a matter that its intentional act is liable to excision and its unintentional act is a sin offering! And if Rabbi Eliezer, it comes only through a voluntary offering!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא מַתְנֵית? זִימְנִין סַגִּיאִין תְּנֵיתַהּ קַמֵּי מָר, וּמַנּוּ – רַבָּה, וְאָמַר לִי: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא דְּאָמְרוּ לוֹ, דִּתְנַן: אֶלָּא אוֹמְרִים לוֹ הַמְתֵּן עַד שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לְבֵית הַסָּפֵק.
human_translation: said to What is the reason you did not learn Many times I taught this before the Master. And who is Rabba. And he said to me: whose is this It is Rabbi Eliezer; of those who spoke to As we learned But they say to him: Wait until you enter into a situation uncertainty.
llm_translation: He said to him: What is the reason that you did not give it to him? Sometimes you should give it to him in front of the master, and he counted - Rabba, and he said to me: Did he count me? It is Rabbi Eliezer who they said to him, as we learned: Rather they say to him, "Wait until you enter the study hall."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּאָמְרוּ לוֹ? אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא תֵעָשֶׂינָה (בִּשְׁגָגָה) וְאָשֵׁם״.
human_translation: Rava said: What is the reason for those who spoke to the verse states: which may not be done, and he is guilty”
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the reason that they said to him? The verse says: "Which shall not be done (unintentionally) and be guilty."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: אֵין מְבִיאִין אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁזְּדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְשִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת? ״מִצְוֹת״ ״מִצְוֹת״, מֵחַטַּאת חֵלֶב,
human_translation: Rava said: What is the reason for the Rabbis, who say: One brings a provisional guilt offering only for a matter for whose intentional karet and whose unwitting a sin offering? “mitzvot” “mitzvot” from a sin offering of fat,
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the reason of the Rabbis who say: One only brings a guilt-offering for a matter where its intentional violation incurs karet and its unintentional violation incurs a sin-offering? "Commandments," "commandments," from a sin-offering of fat.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַלָּן, שֶׁזְּדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְשִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת, אַף כָּאן, דָּבָר שֶׁזְּדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְשִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת.
human_translation: Just as there, for whose intentional karet and whose unwitting a sin offering, so too here, a matter for whose intentional karet and whose unwitting a sin offering.
llm_translation: There, that intentional sin is excision and his unintentional sin is a sin offering, so too here, a matter that its intentional sin is excision and its unintentional sin is a sin offering.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲמִשָּׁה אֲשָׁמוֹת מְכַפְּרִין, אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אֵין מְכַפֵּר כַּפָּרָה גְּמוּרָה. מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, הָכִי קָאָמַר: חֲמִשָּׁה אֲשָׁמוֹת מְכַפְּרִין כַּפָּרָה גְּמוּרָה, וְאָשָׁם תָּלוּי אֵין מְכַפֵּר כַּפָּרָה גְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught Five guilt offerings atone, a provisional guilt offering does not atone a complete atonement. What is saying? Rav Yosef said this is saying: Five guilt offerings atone a complete atonement but a provisional guilt offering does not atone with a complete atonement,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Five guilt offerings atone, a guilt offering of uncertain guilt does not atone for complete atonement. What is it saying? Rav Yosef said, thus it is saying: Five guilt offerings atone for complete atonement, and a guilt offering of uncertain guilt does not atone for complete atonement.

hebrew_text: וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר: אָשָׁם תָּלוּי בָּא עַל הַנְּבֵלָה.
human_translation: And is not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, as say: A provisional guilt offering may come for animal carcass.
llm_translation: And not like Rabbi Eliezer, for he said: "A guilt offering is dependent upon coming upon a carcass."

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: הָכִי קָתָנֵי: חֲמִשָּׁה אֲשָׁמוֹת – אֵין אַחֵר מְכַפֵּר כַּפָּרָתָן, דְּכִי מִתְיְידַע לֵיהּ מַיְיתֵי. אָשָׁם תָּלוּי – אַחֵר מְכַפֵּר כַּפָּרָתוֹ, דִּלְכִי מִתְיְידַע [לֵיהּ] לָא מַיְיתֵי, כְּדִתְנַן: חַיָּיבֵי חַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת וַדָּאִין שֶׁעָבַר עֲלֵיהֶן יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – חַיָּיבִין לְהָבִיא אַחַר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. חַיָּיבֵי אֲשָׁמוֹת תְּלוּיִין – פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: Ravina said this is teaching: five guilt offerings, nothing else achieves the atonement they achieve, as one brings when it becomes known to him a provisional guilt offering, another item achieves the atonement it achieves, as one does not bring when becomes known As we learned liable sin offerings and definite guilt offerings for whom Yom Kippur has passed are liable to bring after Yom Kippur, liable provisional guilt offerings are exempt
llm_translation: Ravina said: Thus it was taught: Five Asham offerings - no other atones like their atonement, for when it becomes known to him, he brings it. A hanging Asham - another atones for his atonement, for when it does not become known to him, he does not bring it, as we learned: Those liable for sin offerings and Asham offerings, and it is certain that Yom Kippur has passed over them - they are obligated to bring after Yom Kippur. Those liable for hanging Asham offerings - they are exempt.

hebrew_text: חַיָּיבֵי חַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת וַדָּאִין כּוּ׳. קָתָנֵי: חַיָּיבֵי חַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת וַדָּאִין שֶׁעָבַר עֲלֵיהֶן יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – חַיָּיבִין לְהָבִיא לְאַחַר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, חַיָּיבֵי אֲשָׁמוֹת תְּלוּיִין – פְּטוּרִין. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: liable sin offerings and definite guilt offerings, teaches: liable sin offerings and definite guilt offerings for whom Yom Kippur has passed are liable to bring after Yom Kippur. liable provisional guilt offerings are exempt From where is this matter
