llm_translation: Those liable for sin offerings and guilt offerings, and those in doubt - as it is taught: Those liable for sin offerings and guilt offerings, and those who transgressed them on Yom Kippur - are obligated to bring their offerings after Yom Kippur, those liable for guilt offerings that are dependent on circumstances - are exempt. What is the practical difference?

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֲמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִפֶּר עַל הַקֹּדֶשׁ מִטּוּמְאֹת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וּמִפִּשְׁעֵיהֶם לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״, חֲטָאִים דּוּמְיָא דִּפְשָׁעִים, מָה פְּשָׁעִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן – אַף חֲטָאִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן – מְכַפֵּר, אֲבָל חֲטָאִים בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן – לָא מְכַפַּר.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Ami says Rabbi Ḥanina says the verse states “And he shall make atonement for the holy place, from the impurity of the children of Israel, and from their transgressions, for all their sins” sins, are similar to transgressions, Just as transgressions, which are not subject to an offering, so too sins, atones that are not subject to an offering, but does not atone sins that are subject to an offering.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Ammi said, Rabbi Chanina said: The verse says, "And he shall make atonement for the Holy from the impurities of the children of Israel and from their transgressions for all their sins." Sins are similar to transgressions. Just as transgressions that are not related to offerings - atone, so too sins that are not related to offerings - atone. But sins related to offerings - do not atone.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא כִּי כְּתִיב הָדֵין קָרָא בְּשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים הוּא דִּכְתִיב, דְּלָא מְכַפַּר עַל עֲבֵירוֹת דְּמִצְוָה יְדוּעָה, אֲבָל שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, דִּמְכַפַּר עַל עֲבֵירוֹת דְּמִצְוָה יְדוּעָה, אֵימָא לָךְ: אֲפִילּוּ עַל חֲטָאִים דִּבְנֵי קׇרְבָּן נִינְהוּ מְכַפַּר!
human_translation: Abaye said to But When that verse is written, it is written with regard to the goat whose performed inside which does not atone for a known violation of a mitzva, but the scapegoat which atones for a known violation of a mitzva, I say to you it atones even for those sins that are subject to an offering.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: But is it not written similarly in the case of the he-goat that is offered inside, as it is written, that it does not atone for transgressions of a known commandment, but the he-goat that is sent away, as it atones for transgressions of a known commandment, I might say to you: Even for sins of the sons of Aaron, it atones!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, מֵהָכָא: ״וְהִתְוַדָּה עָלָיו [אֶת] כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת כׇּל פִּשְׁעֵיהֶם לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״, חֲטָאִים דּוּמְיָא דִּפְשָׁעִים, מָה פְּשָׁעִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן – אַף חֲטָאִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן, אֲבָל חֲטָאִים דִּבְנֵי קׇרְבָּן נִינְהוּ – לָא מְכַפַּר. וּמַיעֲטֵיהּ קְרָא בְּשָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, לְמֵימְרָא דְּעַל חֲטָאִים דִּבְנֵי קׇרְבָּן נִינְהוּ לָא מְכַפַּר.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said from here, “And he shall confess over it all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions, for all their sins” sins are similar to transgressions: Just as transgressions, which are not subject to an offering, so too sins, that are not subject to an offering, but does not atone sins that are subject to an offering. And the verse limited with regard to the scapegoat, to say that it does not atone for sins that are subject to an offering.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said, from here: "And he shall confess upon it all his iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions for all their sins." Sins are similar to transgressions. Just as transgressions that are not related to sacrifices do not atone, so too sins that are not related to sacrifices do not atone. But sins that are related to sacrifices – do not atone. And the verse limits it to the scapegoat, to say that sins related to sacrifices do not atone.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב דִּימִי: מִמַּאי דְּהָנֵי פְּשָׁעִים לָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן נִינְהוּ? דִּלְמָא הָנֵי דִּבְנֵי קׇרְבָּן נִינְהוּ, כְּדִתְנַן: אַרְבָּעָה מְבִיאִין עַל הַזָּדוֹן כִּשְׁגָגָה.
human_translation: Rav Dimi said to From where that those transgressions are not subject to an offering? Perhaps those are subject to an offering, as we learned four bring for an intentional as an unwitting
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Dimi: From what are these transgressions not considered as the children of korban? Perhaps they are considered as the children of korban, as we learned: Four bring for intentional sin as if it were unintentional.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״וְהִתְוַדָּה עָלָיו אֶת כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת כׇּל פִּשְׁעֵיהֶם לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״, חֲטָאִים דּוּמְיָא דִּפְשָׁעִים, מָה פְּשָׁעִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן מְכַפֵּר, אַף חֲטָאִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן מְכַפֵּר, אֲבָל חֲטָאִים דִּבְנֵי קׇרְבָּן – לָא מְכַפַּר.
human_translation: It was also stated when Ravin came Rabbi Yosei says Reish Lakish says: “And he shall confess over it all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions, for all their sins” sins are similar to transgressions: Just as atones which are not subject to an offering, so too sins, atones that are not subject to an offering, but does not atone sins that are subject to an offering.
llm_translation: It was stated: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yosei said in the name of Reish Lakish: "And he shall confess upon it all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions in all their sins." Sins are similar to transgressions. Just as transgressions that are not related to offerings do not atone, so too sins that are not related to offerings do not atone. But sins related to offerings do not atone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲנָא נָמֵי מֵהָדֵין קְרָא אָמְרִי, וְאַקְשִׁי לִי רַב דִּימִי: מִמַּאי דְּהָנֵי פְּשָׁעִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן נִינְהוּ? דִּלְמָא הָנָךְ דִּבְנֵי קׇרְבָּן נִינְהוּ, כְּדִתְנַן: אַרְבָּעָה מְבִיאִין עַל הַזָּדוֹן כִּשְׁגָגָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִין: רוֹב פְּשָׁעִים לָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִידֵי רוֹב כְּתִיב?
human_translation: Abaye said: I also said from that verse, and Rav Dimi raised difficulty me: From where that those transgressions are not subject to an offering? Perhaps those are subject to an offering, as we learned four bring for an intentional as an unwitting Ravin said to The majority of transgressions are not subject to an offering. said to him: Is majority written
llm_translation: Abaye said: I, too, from there, the verse says, and difficult for me Rav Dimi: From what are these transgressions that are not committed by the sons of korban? Perhaps those are the sons of korban, as we learned: Four categories of people bring a sin offering for intentional sins as if they were unintentional! Ravin said to him: Most transgressions are not committed by the sons of korban. He said to him: Is it written according to the majority?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מֵרֵישֵׁיהּ דִּקְרָא: ״וְהִתְוַדָּה עָלָיו אֶת כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְתַנְיָא: ״עֲוֹנוֹת״ – אֵלּוּ זְדוֹנוֹת. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״עֲוֹנָהּ בָּהּ״.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said from the beginning of the verse: “And he shall confess over it all the iniquities of the children of Israel” and it is taught “iniquities” those intentionally. And similarly, states: his iniquity shall be upon him”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, Abaye said: From the beginning of the verse: "And he shall confess upon it all the iniquities of the children of Israel," and it was taught: "iniquities" - these are intentional sins. And so it says: "her iniquity is in her." English translation:

hebrew_text: ״וְאֶת כׇּל פִּשְׁעֵיהֶם לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ – ״כׇּל״ לְמָה לִי? לְאַקְשׁוֹיֵי לִפְשָׁעִים, מָה פְּשָׁעִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן, אַף חֲטָאִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן, אֲבָל חֲטָאִים דִּבְנֵי קׇרְבָּן נִינְהוּ – לָא מְכַפַּר.
human_translation: “And all their transgressions, for all their sins,” why do I “all to juxtapose to transgressions: Just as transgressions, which are not subject to an offering, so too sins, that are not subject to an offering, but does not atone sins that are subject to an offering.
llm_translation: "And for all their transgressions in all their sins" - "All" - why do I need it? To include transgressions for sins, what sins are not related to offerings, also sins that are not related to offerings, but sins that are related to offerings - do not atone."

hebrew_text: חַיָּיבֵי אֲשָׁמוֹת תְּלוּיִין כּוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אֲמַר קְרָא: ״מִכֹּל חַטֹּאתֵיכֶם לִפְנֵי ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״ – חֵטְא שֶׁאֵין מַכִּיר בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם – יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: liable provisional guilt offerings From where is this matter Rabbi Elazar said: the verse states: from all your sins before the Lord” Yom Kippur atones a sin of which only the Omnipresent is aware,
llm_translation: Those liable for guilt offerings are dependent on a certain condition. What is the benefit of words? Rabbi Elazar said, a verse states: "From all your sins before the Lord, etc." - a sin that only the place recognizes - Yom Kippur atones.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב תַּחְלִיפָא אֲבוּהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: קַדְמָיְיתָא נָמֵי לָא תֵּיתֵי
human_translation: Rav Taḥlifa, father of Rav Huna bar Taḥlifa, said in the name of Rava: the first as well: one cannot bring
llm_translation: Rav Tahalifa said, the father of Rav Huna bar Tahalifa, from the name of Rava: The first one does not come.

hebrew_text: לְמִפְשְׁטַיהּ לָא מִדְּרַב דִּימִי וְלָא מִדְּאַבַּיֵּי,
human_translation: to explain neither from of Rav Dimi, nor from that of Abaye,
llm_translation: To its conclusion not from Rav Dimi and not from Abbaye,

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָא: חֵטְא שֶׁאֵין מַכִּיר בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם – יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר, וּמִינַּהּ: חֵטְא שֶׁאֵין מַכִּיר בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם הוּא דְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר, אֲבָל דְּיָדַע בֵּהּ – לָא מְכַפַּר.
human_translation: Rather, from that Yom Kippur atones a sin of which only the Omnipresent is aware, And from that it is a sin of which only the Omnipresent is aware that Yom Kippur atones, but it does not atone about which is aware.
llm_translation: Rather from this: a sin that only recognizes the place - Yom Kippur atones, and the type: a sin that only recognizes the place is that Yom Kippur atones, but if one is aware of it - it does not atone.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב תַּחְלִיפָא אֲבוּהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: חַיָּיבֵי מַלְקִיּוֹת שֶׁעָבַר עֲלֵיהֶן יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – חַיָּיב. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַאי שְׁנָא מֵחַיָּיבֵי חַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת וַדָּאִין?
human_translation: And Rav Taḥlifa, father of Rav Huna, says in the name of Rava: Those liable to lashes for whom Yom Kippur has passed liable obvious? What is difference between those liable to sin offerings and definite guilt offerings,
llm_translation: And Rav Tahalifa said, the father of Rav Huna from the name of Rava: Those liable for lashes that the Day of Atonement has passed over them - are liable. It is obvious! What is the difference from those liable for sin-offerings and guilt-offerings, and so on?

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הָתָם – מָמוֹנָא הוּא, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּגוּפָא הוּא – אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: enter your mind to say: There, is financial But here, where body, say not teaches us
llm_translation: I ascend of your opinion: there - it is money, but here where it is the body - say not, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: הוֹדַע וְלֹא הוֹדַע, עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: But didn’t we learn one became aware or did not become aware positive or prohibitions,
llm_translation: And we learned: To inform and not to inform, to do and not to do!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא – דְּאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ, הָא – דְּלָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: not difficult. This which warned him, That which they did not warn him,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - that it is found in it, this - that it is not found in it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה (סִימָן יוֹלֶדֶת מְצוֹרָע נָזִיר סוֹטָה בְּעֶגְלָה),
human_translation: If that is so, a mnemonic A woman who gave birth; a leper; a nazirite; a sota ; in a heifer.
llm_translation: Rather, from now on (sign of childbirth, leper, Nazirite, suspected adulteress, heifer),

hebrew_text: סָפֵק יוֹלֶדֶת שֶׁעָבַר עָלֶיהָ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לָא תַּיְיתֵי, דְּהָא כַּפַּר עֲלֵיהּ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, דְּחֵטְא שֶׁאֵין מַכִּיר בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם הוּא! אָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: ״לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ – וְלֹא לְכׇל טוּמְאֹתָם.
human_translation: a woman who gave birth who uncertain should not bring Yom Kippur has passed, due to that Yom Kippur atoned for her. As this is a sin of which only the Omnipresent is aware, Rav Hoshaya said: “For all their sins” but not for all their impurity.
llm_translation: Doubtful childbirth that passed upon her Yom Kippur does not delay, for it atoned for her on Yom Kippur, for a sin that only the Omnipresent recognizes! Rav Hoshaya said: "For all their sins" - and not for all their impurities.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי, דְּאָמַר יוֹלֶדֶת חוֹטֵאת הִיא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? יוֹלֶדֶת כִּי קָא מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן – לְאִישְׁתְּרוֹיֵי בַּאֲכִילַת קָדָשִׁים הוּא, וְלָא לְכַפָּרָה מֵתְיָא.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, who says: A woman who gave birth is a sinner, what is there to say? when a woman who gave birth brings an offering, to permit eat sacrificial but she does not bring for atonement.
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, as he said, "A birthing woman is a sinner." What is there to say? A birthing woman, when she brings a sacrifice - it is for the completion of eating holy things, and not for atonement.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלֶיהָ חַטַּאת הָעוֹף סָפֵק, וְעָבַר עָלֶיהָ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – חַיֶּיבֶת לְהָבִיא לְאַחַר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַכְשַׁרְתָּהּ לֶאֱכוֹל בִּזְבָחִים.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said we learn as well: A woman upon whom a bird sin offering uncertainty, whether for whom Yom Kippur has passed, is liable to bring after Yom Kippur. because it renders eligible to partake of offerings.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said, "We also learned: A woman who has a doubtful bird sin offering upon her, and Yom Kippur passed over her - she is obligated to bring it after Yom Kippur, because she renders herself fit to eat sacrifices."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, סְפֵק מְצוֹרָע שֶׁעָבַר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לָא מַיְיתֵי, דְּהָא עֲבַר עֲלֵיהּ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, דְּחֵטְא שֶׁאֵין מַכִּיר בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם הוּא! אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: ״לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ – וְלֹא לְכׇל טוּמְאֹתָם.
human_translation: If that is so, an uncertain leper for Yom Kippur has passed should not bring due to that Yom Kippur has passed for him, as this is a sin of which only the Omnipresent is aware, Rabbi Oshaya said “For all their sins” but not for all their impurity,
llm_translation: Rather from now, doubt leper that passed day Yom Kippur not bring, since passed upon it day Yom Kippur, for sinned that not recognize in it except the place he! Said Rabbi Oshaia: "For all their sins" - and not for all their impurities.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַל שִׁבְעָה דְּבָרִים נְגָעִים בָּאִים! (סִימָן גג״ג ששל״ץ) מְצוֹרָע כִּי מַיְיתֵי לָאו לְכַפָּרָה מַיְיתֵי, אֶלָּא לְאִישְׁתְּרוֹיֵי בַּאֲכִילַת קָדָשִׁים הוּא.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: marks come due to seven matters, a mnemonic Gimmel , gimmel , gimmel , shin , shin , lamed , tzadi . when a leper brings he does not bring for atonement. Rather, it is to permit eat sacrificial
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: On seven matters, negaim come! (Siman Gag Shashlats) A metzora, when he brings a guilt-offering, he brings it not for atonement, but for permission to eat holy things.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, סְפֵק נָזִיר שֶׁעָבַר עָלָיו יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לָא מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן, דְּהָא כַּפַּר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, דְּחֵטְא שֶׁאֵין מַכִּיר בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם הוּא! אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: לְכׇל חַטָּאת״ – וְלֹא לְכׇל טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: If that is so, an uncertain nazirite, for whom Yom Kippur has passed, not bring an offering, due to that Yom Kippur atoned as this is a sin of which only the Omnipresent is aware. Rabbi Oshaya said “for all their sins,” but not for all their impurity.
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, a doubtful Nazirite who has passed his Yom Kippur does not bring a sacrifice, for Yom Kippur atones for a sin that only the Omnipresent recognizes! Rabbi Oshaya said: "For every sin offering" - but not for every impurity.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן הַקַּפָּר, דְּאָמַר: נָזִיר חוֹטֵא הוּא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? נָזִיר כִּי קָא מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן, לָאו לְכַפָּרָה מַיְיתֵי, לְאִשְׁתְּרוֹיֵי בַּאֲכִילַת קָדָשִׁים הוּא.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Elazar ben HaKappar, who says: A nazirite is a sinner, what is there to say? when a nazirite brings an offering, he does not bring for atonement. it to permit eat sacrificial
llm_translation: To Rabbi Elazar ben HaKappar, who said: A Nazirite is a sinner, what is there to say? When a Nazirite brings a sacrifice, he does not bring it for atonement, but rather for indulging in the consumption of holy offerings.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, סְפֵק סוֹטָה, שֶׁעָבַר עָלֶיהָ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לָא תַּיְיתֵי, דְּהָא כַּפַּר עֲלַהּ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, דְּחֵטְא שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַכִּיר בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם! אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: ״לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ – וְלֹא לְכׇל טוּמְאֹתָם.
human_translation: If that is so, an uncertain sota , for whom Yom Kippur has passed, not bring due to that Yom Kippur has atoned for her, as this is a sin of which only the Omnipresent is aware. Rabbi Oshaya said “For all their sins,” but not for all their impurity,
llm_translation: Rather from now, doubt of a Sotah, that passed over her Yom Kippur will not come, for he atoned for her on Yom Kippur, for a sin that only the Omnipresent knows! Rabbi Hoshaya said: "For all their sins" - and not for all their impurities.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בּוֹעֵל מַכִּיר בּוֹ. רָבָא אָמַר: סוֹטָה כִּי מֵתְיָיא – לְבָרֵר עָוֹן (קָא אָתְיָא).
human_translation: Abaye said paramour, knows about Rava said When a sota brings she brings to clarify iniquity,
llm_translation: Abaye said: One who has relations with a recognized woman. Rava said: A sotah, when suspicion arises - to clarify guilt (it comes).

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה שֶׁעָבַר עָלֶיהָ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים! וְכוּ׳ אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הוֹרֵג מַכִּיר. רָבָא אָמַר: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְלָאָרֶץ לֹא יְכוּפַּר לַדָּם אֲשֶׁר שֻׁפַּךְ בָּהּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: If that is so, a heifer whose neck is broken, with regard to which Yom Kippur has passed, Abaye said: murderer knows Rava said the verse states: “And no atonement can be made for the land for the blood that is shed therein,
llm_translation: Rather from now, a calf that was decapitated on the Day of Atonement! And so said Abbaye: One who kills a recognizable person. Rava said: The verse says: "But for the land it shall not be atoned for the blood that is shed in it, etc."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אָמַר קְרָא: ״כַּפֵּר לְעַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״ – רְאוּיָה כַּפָּרָה זוֹ שֶׁתְּכַפֵּר עַל יוֹצְאֵי מִצְרַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said The verse states “Forgive, Your people Israel, this atonement, is fit to atone for those who left Egypt,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The verse says: "Atone for Your people Israel" - this atonement is fitting to atone for those who left Egypt.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ: חֵטְא שֶׁאֵין מַכִּיר בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר, אֵימָא: כִּי מִתְיְידַע לֵיהּ בָּתַר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים נָמֵי לָא מַיְיתֵי חַטָּאת! אָמַר רַבִּי זְעֵירָא: לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, דִּכְתִיב קְרָא יְדִיעָה גַּבֵּי חַטָּאת, וְגַבֵּי נְשִׂיא, וְגַבֵּי צִבּוּר.
human_translation: Now that you said Yom Kippur atones for a sin of which only the Omnipresent is aware, say when becomes known to him after Yom Kippur as well, he should not bring a sin offering. Rabbi Zeira said you cannot say as knowing is written a verse With regard to sin offering and with regard to a Nasi , and with regard to a communal
llm_translation: The matter that you said: a sin that only the Omnipresent recognizes, on Yom Kippur atones, say: when it becomes known to him after Yom Kippur, does he not bring a sin offering! Rabbi Zeira said: You did not find what you said, as it is written, "a matter of knowledge regarding a sin offering," and regarding a leader, and regarding the community.

hebrew_text: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב קְרָא גַּבֵּי יָחִיד, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כּוּלְּהוֹן מִיָּחִיד לָא אָתְאָן, דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְיָחִיד, שֶׁכׇּל קׇרְבָּנוֹ נְקֵבָה.
human_translation: are necessary As, if the verse stated with regard to an individual, I would say all cannot be derived from an individual, as can be refuted: What about an individual? that all of his offerings are female,
llm_translation: I need, for if one wrote a verse regarding an individual, I would say: all of them do not come from an individual, for there is room to differentiate: what is for an individual, that all of his offerings are female.

hebrew_text: נִכְתּוֹב גַּבֵּי נָשִׂיא, וְנַיְיתֵי הָנָךְ מִנָּשִׂיא!
human_translation: Let write with regard to a Nasi , and let these, be derived from a Nasi ,
llm_translation: Written regarding a prince, and there will come from there a prince!

hebrew_text: יָחִיד מִנָּשִׂיא לָא אָתֵי, דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְנָשִׂיא, שֶׁכֵּן אֵין בִּשְׁמִיעַת קוֹל, תֹּאמַר בְּיָחִיד שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנוֹ בִּשְׁמִיעַת קוֹל!
human_translation: an individual cannot be derived from a Nasi , as can be refuted: What about a Nasi ? in that is not included in hearing a voice, you say with regard to an individual, who is included in hearing a voice?
llm_translation: Individual from a prince not comes, for there is to differentiate: What for a prince, that so there is no in hearing of voice, you would say in individual that so there is in hearing of voice!

hebrew_text: וְצִבּוּר מִנָּשִׂיא לָא אָתֵי, דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְנָשִׂיא, שֶׁכֵּן בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹ נְקֵבָה!
human_translation: And a communal cannot be derived from a Nasi , as can be refuted: What about a Nasi ? in that in his offering a female
llm_translation: The community from a prince not comes, for there is to distinguish: What to a prince, that so in his offering female!

hebrew_text: נִכְתּוֹב גַּבֵּי צִבּוּר, [וְנַיְיתֵי] יָחִיד וְנָשִׂיא מִינַּהּ! אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְצִבּוּר, שֶׁכֵּן אֵין חַיָּיבִין אֶלָּא עַל הֶעֱלֵם דָּבָר עִם שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Let write with regard to community, and let an individual and a Nasi be derived from it, can be refuted, What about community? in that there is only for an unwitting accompanied by unwitting action
llm_translation: It is written regarding the community, and yet an individual and a leader are derived from it! There is room to refute: Just as for the community, so too they are only liable for an unwitting transgression involving a matter with unintentional action.

hebrew_text: מֵחֲדָא יְדִיעָה לָא אָתְיָא, תֵּיתֵי חֲדָא יְדִיעָה מִתַּרְתֵּי – לָא נִכְתּוֹב יְדִיעָה גַּבֵּי יָחִיד, וְתֵיתֵי מִנָּשִׂיא וְצִבּוּר.
human_translation: knowing cannot be derived from one knowing. let one knowing be derived from two, Let not write knowing with regard to an individual, and let it be derived from a Nasi and community.
llm_translation: From one knowledge does not come, give one knowledge from two - knowledge is not written regarding an individual, but give from a prince and the community.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְנָשִׂיא וְצִבּוּר, שֶׁכֵּן אֵינָן בִּשְׁמִיעַת קוֹל, תֹּאמַר בְּיָחִיד שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בִּשְׁמִיעַת קוֹל!
human_translation: can be refuted: What about a Nasi and community, in that they are not included in hearing a voice. you say with regard to an individual, who is included in hearing a voice?
llm_translation: There is room to differentiate: what about a leader and the congregation, for they are not in the hearing of the voice, you should say in the case of an individual who is in the hearing of the voice!

hebrew_text: לָא נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא יְדִיעָה גַּבֵּי צִבּוּר, וְתֵיתֵי מִידִיעָה דְּיָחִיד וְנָשִׂיא. אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְיָחִיד וְנָשִׂיא שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ בְּקׇרְבָּ[נָ]ן נְקֵבָה, תֹּאמַר בְּצִבּוּר שֶׁאֵין בְּקׇרְבָּ[נָ]ן נְקֵבָה!
human_translation: Let the verse not write knowing with regard to community, and let it be derived from knowing of an individual and a Nasi . can be refuted: What about an individual and a Nasi ? in that is of a female offering you say community, is no of a female offering
llm_translation: Not written scripture knowledge regarding community, and comes from individual knowledge and leader. There is to differentiate: what for individual and leader that there is in proximity female, you will say for community that there is no in proximity female!

hebrew_text: לָא נִכְתּוֹב גַּבֵּי נָשִׂיא, וְתֵיתֵי מִידִיעָה דְּיָחִיד וְצִבּוּר. מַאי פָּרְכַתְּ? אִי מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵינָן בִּשְׁמִיעַת הַקּוֹל – יָחִיד יוֹכִיחַ, דְּאֵינוֹ בִּשְׁמִיעַת הַקּוֹל,
human_translation: Let not write with regard to a Nasi , and let it be derived from knowing of an individual and community. What refute If due to the fact that it is not included in hearing a voice, an individual, which is included in hearing a voice, proves
llm_translation: Not written regarding a prince, and it is a teaching of an individual and the community. What is the distinction? If it is because they are not in the hearing of the voice - an individual can prove it, that it is not in the hearing of the voice.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מִשּׁוּם דְּיֵשׁ בְּכׇל קׇרְבָּנוֹ נְקֵבָה – צִבּוּר יוֹכִיחַ, דְּאֵין בְּקׇרְבָּנָן נְקֵבָה, עַד דְּאִית לְהוֹן יְדִיעָה לָא מִחַיַּיב, לְמָה לִי דִּכְתִיב יְדִיעָה גַּבֵּי נָשִׂיא?
human_translation: And if due to that all his offerings are female, community, where is no of a female offering, proves there is no obligation until there is knowledge why do I knowing that is written with regard to a Nasi ?
llm_translation: And if because there is in every offering a female - the community shall prove, that in their offerings there is no female, until they have knowledge, not liable. Why do I need it? As it is written, knowledge regarding a leader?

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְגוּפֵיהּ, דְּהָא אָתְיָא מִיָּחִיד וְצִבּוּר, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְהֵיכָא דְּמִתְיְידַע לֵיהּ בָּתַר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, דְּמַיְיתֵי חַטָּאת.
human_translation: If is not matter of itself, as it is derived from an individual and community, apply it matter of where becomes known to him after Yom Kippur, that he brings a sin offering.
llm_translation: If it is not relevant to itself, for it comes from an individual and the public, give it relevance to where it is known to him after Yom Kippur, for it is brought as a sin offering.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אִי דְּלָא כְּתִיב יְדִיעָה גַּבֵּי נָשִׂיא, מִיָּחִיד וְצִבּוּר לָא אָתֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְיָחִיד וְצִבּוּר שֶׁכֵּן אֵין עֲשׂוּיִין לְהִשְׁתַּנּוֹת, תֹּאמַר
human_translation: Abaye said: If had not stated knowing with regard to a Nasi , it not derived from an individual and community, because can be refuted: What about an individual and community? in that are not apt to change. you say
llm_translation: Abaye said: If it were not written "yediah" regarding a prince, it would not come to exclude an individual and the community, because there is room to refute: Just as for an individual and the community, they are not accustomed to change, you would say...

hebrew_text: בְּנָשִׂיא שֶׁעָשׂוּי לְהִשְׁתַּנּוֹת!
human_translation: with regard to a Nasi , whose is apt to change
llm_translation: In a nasi that is fit to be changed!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, מֵהָכָא: מִכְּדֵי ״מִצְוֹת״ ״מִצְוֹת״ יָלְפִי מֵהֲדָדֵי,
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: from here: Since “mitzvot” “mitzvot” are derived from one another.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said, from here: "From the abundance of mitzvot, mitzvot shall be multiplied" according to the needs.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּיָלְפִי מֵהֲדָדֵי, לְמָה לִי דִּכְתִיב שָׁלֹשׁ יְדִיעוֹת גַּבֵּי יָחִיד וְגַבֵּי נָשִׂיא וְגַבֵּי צִבּוּר? אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְגוּפֵיהֶן, דְּהָא גָּמְרִי לְהוֹן ״מִצְוֹת״ ״מִצְוֹת״, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן הֵיכָא דְּמִתְיְידַע לֵיהּ בָּתַר יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים הוּא דְּמַיְיתֵי חַטָּאת.
human_translation: since are derived from one another, why do I knowing to be written three with regard to an individual, and with regard to a Nasi , and with regard to community? If is not matters of themselves, as is derived “mitzvot” “mitzvot,” apply it matter where becomes known to him after Yom Kippur. that he brings a sin offering.
llm_translation: Since Eliyahu is from the descendants of Hadadezer, why is it necessary for it to be written "three types of knowledge" regarding an individual, a leader, and the community? If it is not relevant to themselves, for they have already fulfilled the commandments, give them a matter where he will be recognized after Yom Kippur, which is when the sin offering is brought.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא כִּי מִתְיְידַע לֵיהּ בָּתַר יוֹם כִּפּוּרִים הוּא דְּמַיְיתֵי חַטָּאת, מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לָאו עַל הָדֵין חֵטְא קָא אָתֵי, אֲבָל אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, דְּעַל הָדֵין חֵטְא קָאָתֵי, אֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמִיכַּפַּר, דְּכִי מִתְיְידַע [לֵיהּ] לְבָתַר דְּקָא מַיְיתֵי אָשָׁם תָּלוּי לָא מַיְיתֵי חַטָּאת.
human_translation: say it is when becomes known to him after Yom Kippur that he brings a sin offering, because Yom Kippur did not come for that sin. But a provisional guilt offering, which comes for that sin, say indeed that he has achieved atonement. if becomes known to him after he brought a provisional guilt offering not bring a sin offering.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Perhaps when he becomes aware of it after Yom Kippur, it is as if he brings a sin offering, because on Yom Kippur itself, he is not coming for the same sin. But a guilt offering is pending, for he is coming for the same sin. Perhaps this is also effective for atonement, for when he becomes aware of it after he brings a guilt offering, he does not bring a sin offering.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אֲמַר קְרָא: ״אוֹ הוֹדַע אֵלָיו״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר: כִּי מִתְיְידַע לֵיהּ מַיְיתֵי חַטָּאת, אָשָׁם תָּלוּי לָמָּה בָּא? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: שֶׁאִם מֵת, מֵת בְּלֹא עָוֹן. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: מֵת, מִיתָה מְמָרֶקֶת! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לְהָגֵן עָלָיו מִן הַיִּיסּוּרִים.
human_translation: Rava said the verse states: be known to him” in any case Now that you say when becomes known to him he brings a sin offering, why does a provisional guilt offering come? Rabbi Zeira said: that if dies dies without iniquity. Rava objects to this dies, death absolves Rather, Rava said: to protect him from suffering
llm_translation: Rava said: The verse says: "Or if he is informed of it" - in any case. The question that was asked: When he is already aware, why does he bring a sin offering, why does he bring a guilt offering? Rabbi Zeira said: If he dies, he dies without sin. Rava objected to him: If he dies, it is a bitter death! Rather, Rava said: To protect him from suffering.

hebrew_text: חַטַּאת הָעוֹף הַבָּא עַל הַסָּפֵק. אָמַר רַב: וְכִיפֵּר. אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי תִּקָּבֵר?
human_translation: a bird sin offering that is brought due to uncertainty, Rav says: And atoned If so, Why, it must be buried?
llm_translation: Sin offering of a bird that comes for a doubt. Rav said: and atoned. If so, why should it be buried?

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת. אֵימַת לֹא מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת? אִי מֵעִיקָּרָא – חַיָּה הָוְיָא! אִי לְבַסּוֹף – קָמְנַטַּר לַהּ!
human_translation: Since it unguarded. When it unguarded? If at the outset, was alive, If later, guards it
llm_translation: According to the fact that it does not preserve. When does it not preserve? If from the outset - it is a living creature! If in the end - it is a cemetery for it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַתְנִיתִין בְּנוֹדַע לָהּ דְּלֹא יָלְדָה, וּבְדִין הוּא דְּמוּתֶּרֶת בַּהֲנָאָה, וּמַאי ״תִּקָּבֵר״ – מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rather, the mishna where it became known to her that she did not give birth And by right permitted to derive benefit And what it must be buried? by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: Rather, it is a Mishnah in a case where it is known to her that she did not give birth, and it is a judgment that she is permitted in benefit, and what is "she shall be buried" - it is from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב, עַל הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהֵבִיאָה חַטַּאת הָעוֹף בְּסָפֵק, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִמְלְקָה נוֹדַע לָהּ שֶׁיָּלְדָה וַדַּאי – תַּעֲשֶׂה וַדַּאי, שֶׁמִּמִּין שֶׁהֵבִיאָה עַל לֹא הוֹדַע – מְבִיאָה עַל הוֹדַע.
human_translation: And that of Rav, was stated with regard to a woman who brought a bird sin offering in uncertainty If before was pinched it became known to her that she certainly gave birth she should render a definite as from the type that she brings in unknown she brings in known
llm_translation: And when it was stated that Rav said regarding a woman who brought a sin-offering of a bird in a case of doubt, if it is not yet known to her that she gave birth for sure - she shall definitely bring the offering, for from the type of offering she brought upon not knowing, she brings the offering upon knowing.

hebrew_text: אִם מִשֶּׁנִּמְלְקָה נוֹדַע שֶׁיָּלְדָה – אָמַר רַב: מַזֶּה דָּמָהּ וּמוֹצֶה דָּמָהּ, וְכִפְּרָה, [וּ]מוּתֶּרֶת בַּאֲכִילָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲסוּרָה בַּאֲכִילָה, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ: חַטַּאת הָעוֹף הַבָּאָה עַל הַסָּפֵק נֶאֱכֶלֶת.
human_translation: If after was pinched it became known to her that she gave birth, Rav says: sprinkles its blood and squeezes out its blood and she has achieved atonement permitted in consumption Rabbi Yoḥanan says: prohibited in consumption, decree, lest say: A bird brought a sin offering due to uncertainty is consumed.
llm_translation: If from when she miscarries it is known that she gave birth - Rav said: sprinkle its blood and find its blood, and atonement, and permitted for consumption. Rabbi Yochanan said: forbidden for consumption, a decree lest they say: the sin-offering of fowl that came upon doubt is eaten.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי לֵוִי כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב: חַטַּאת הָעוֹף הַבָּאָה עַל הַסָּפֵק, אִם מִשֶּׁנִּמְלְקָה נוֹדַע שֶׁיָּלְדָה וַדַּאי – מַזֶּה דָּמָהּ וּמוֹצֶה דָּמָהּ, וְכִפְּרָה, [וּ]מוּתֶּרֶת בַּאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: Levi teaches in accordance with of Rav: a bird sin offering that is brought due to uncertainty, if after was pinched it became known that she certainly gave birth, sprinkles its blood and squeezes out its blood, and she has achieved atonement; permitted in consumption.
llm_translation: Levi taught in the name of Rav: The sin-offering of a bird that comes for a doubtful situation, if after it is slaughtered it becomes known that it gave birth, then certainly - its blood is sprinkled and its blood is found, and atones, and is permitted for consumption.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חַטַּאת הָעוֹף הַבָּאָה עַל הַסָּפֵק, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִמְלְקָה נוֹדַע לָהּ שֶׁלֹּא יָלְדָה – תֵּצֵא לְחוּלִּין, אוֹ תִּמָּכֵר לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ. אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִמְלְקָה נוֹדַע לָהּ שֶׁיָּלְדָה וַדַּאי – תַּעֲשֶׂה וַדַּאי, שֶׁמִּמִּין שֶׁמְּבִיאָה עַל לֹא הוֹדַע מְבִיאָה עַל הוֹדַע.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan: a bird sin offering that is brought due to uncertainty, if before was pinched it became known to her that she did not give birth, transferred to non-sacred or is sold to another If before was pinched it became known to her that she certainly gave birth,she should render a definite as from the type that she brings in unknown she brings in known
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan: A sin-offering bird that comes for a doubtful situation, if before it was plucked it was known to her that she did not give birth - it shall go out for common use, or be sold to her fellow. If before it was plucked it was known to her that she gave birth for sure - she shall definitely make a sin-offering, for from the species that she brings upon an unknown situation, she brings upon a known situation.

hebrew_text: אִם מִשֶּׁנִּמְלְקָה נוֹדַע שֶׁיָּלְדָה – אֲסוּרָה אֲפִילּוּ בַּהֲנָאָה. שֶׁעַל הַסָּפֵק בָּאָה מִתְּחִלָּתָהּ, כִּפְּרָה סְפֵיקָהּ וְהָלְכָה לָהּ.
human_translation: If after was pinched it became known that she gave birth, is even prohibited to derive benefit that was initially brought due to uncertainty; it atoned for its uncertainty, and is gone.
llm_translation: If from when she was divorced it is known that she gave birth - she is forbidden even for benefit. Because she came into the marriage in a state of doubt, her doubt is atoned for and the law follows her.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְרִישׁ שְׁנֵי סְלָעִים לְאָשָׁם וְלָקַח בָּהֶן שְׁנֵי אֵילִים לְאָשָׁם, אִם הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן יָפֶה שְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים – יִקְרַב לַאֲשָׁמוֹ, וְהַשֵּׁנִי יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב וְיִמָּכֵר וְיִפְּלוּ דָּמָיו לִנְדָבָה.
human_translation: one who designates two sela , to a guilt offering,and he purchased two rams for a guilt offering with if one of them is worth two sela , he shall sacrifice for his guilt offering. And the second shall graze until it becomes blemished; and it shall be sold, and money for it shall be allocated for gift
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who separates two stones for a guilt-offering and takes with them two rams for a guilt-offering, if one of them was more beautiful than the two stones - he should bring it for his guilt-offering, and the other should graze until it develops a blemish, and then it should be sold, and its value should be designated as a donation.

hebrew_text: לָקַח בָּהֶן שְׁנֵי אֵילִים לְחוּלִּין, אֶחָד יָפֶה שְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים וְאֶחָד יָפֶה עֲשָׂרָה זוּז – הַיָּפֶה שְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים יִקְרַב לַאֲשָׁמוֹ, וְהַשֵּׁנִי – לִמְעִילָתוֹ.
human_translation: he purchased two rams for non-sacred with one is worth two sela , and one is worth ten dinars, the that is worth two sela shall be sacrificed as his guilt offering and the second one for his misuse,
llm_translation: He took with them two rams for guilt-offerings, one beautiful worth two sela and one beautiful worth ten zuz - the beautiful one worth two sela shall be brought for his guilt-offering, and the second one for his burnt-offering.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד לְאָשָׁם וְאֶחָד לְחוּלִּין, אִם הָיָה שֶׁל אָשָׁם יָפֶה שְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים – יִקְרַב לַאֲשָׁמוֹ, וְהַשֵּׁנִי לִמְעִילָתוֹ, וְיָבִיא עִמָּהּ סֶלַע וְחוּמְשָׁהּ.
human_translation: one for a guilt offering and one for non-sacred if for guilt offering is worth two sela , it shall be sacrificed for his guilt offering. And the second his misuse, and he brings with it one sela and one-fifth
llm_translation: One for guilt offering and one for regular offerings, if the one for guilt offering was beautiful two rocks - he shall bring it near for his guilt offering, and the second for his robe, and he shall bring with it a rock and a fifth.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״מְעִילָתוֹ״ דְּקָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא, וְהַשֵּׁנִי לִמְעִילָתוֹ?
human_translation: What His misuse, that is taught the first clause and the second one for his misuse?
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "its cloak" that is taught in the beginning, and the second one for "its cloak"?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא אֵיל אָשָׁם, לְמֵימְרָא דְּחוֹמֶשׁ בַּהֲדֵי אַיִל מַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאֵת אֲשֶׁר חָטָא מִן הַקֹּדֶשׁ יְשַׁלֵּם וְאֶת חֲמִישִׁיתוֹ יוֹסֵף עָלָיו״, אַלְמָא בַּהֲדֵי גְּזֵילוֹ מַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: If we say ram a guilt offering to say that one-fifth is brought together with the ram But isn’t it written: “And he shall make restitution for that which he has done amiss with consecrated property, and he shall add to it one-fifth” apparently he brings together with that which he stole
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Perhaps when one brings a guilt-offering ram, does he bring a ewe as well? But it is written: 'And he shall make restitution for that which he has sinned against the holy thing, and shall add a fifth part thereto.' This implies that he brings it along with the stolen item!"

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, קָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אֶחָד לְאָשָׁם וְאֶחָד לְחוּלִּין, אִם הָיָה שֶׁל אָשָׁם יָפֶה שְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים – יִקְרַב לַאֲשָׁמוֹ, וְהַשֵּׁנִי לִמְעִילָתוֹ, וְיָבִיא עִמָּהּ סֶלַע וְחוּמְשָׁהּ, אַלְמָא חוֹמֶשׁ בַּהֲדֵי גְּזֵילוֹ מַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And furthermore, it is taught in the latter clause one for a guilt offering and one for non-sacred if for guilt offering is worth two sela , it shall be sacrificed for his guilt offering. And the second for his misuse, and he brings with it one sela and one-fifth Evidently, he brings one-fifth together with that which he stole
llm_translation: And furthermore, it is taught in the latter clause: one sacrifice for guilt offering and one sacrifice for common use. If it was originally designated for a guilt offering, if two rocks were beautiful - one should be brought near for his guilt offering, and the second for his mantle, and he should bring with it a rock and its fifth part. This implies that he brings the fifth part with the stolen item!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, ״מְעִילָתוֹ״ – מַאי דְּאִיתְהֲנִי מֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ וְיֶשְׁנוֹ מִשְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים דְּאַפְרֵישִׁנּוּ[ן] לְאָשָׁם וְלָקַח בָּהֶן שְׁנֵי אֵילִים לְחוּלִּין, דְּיָפֶה שְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים מַקְרֵיב לֵיהּ אֵיל אָשָׁם, וְיָפֶה עֲשָׂרָה זוּז יָהֵיב לֵיהּ לְמַאי דְּאִיתְהֲנִי מֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ גְּזֵילוֹ, וְחוּמְשׁוֹ. וּמַאי ״מְעִילָתוֹ״? גְּזֵילוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, for his misuse, that which he derived benefit from consecrated And those are two sela that he designated for a guilt offering and with which he bought two rams as non-sacred that worth two sela he sacrifices for his ram of the guilt offering and worth ten dinars he gives for that which he derived benefit from consecrated which are that which he stole, plus one-fifth, And what is His misuse, that which he stole
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, "his cloak" - what is it that is derived from the consecrated property and remains from two stones that were separated for a guilt-offering, and with them he takes two rams for common use, for he offers one ram from the two stones as a guilt-offering, and he gives ten zuz for what is derived from the consecrated property, which becomes his theft, and a fifth. And what is "his cloak"? His theft.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתַּאּ לִ״מְעִילָתוֹ״ דְּרֵישָׁא – גְּזֵילוֹ. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אֶחָד לְאָשָׁם וְאֶחָד לְחוּלִּין, אִם הָיָה שֶׁל אָשָׁם יָפֶה שְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים – יִקְרַב לַאֲשָׁמוֹ, וְהַשֵּׁנִי לִמְעִילָה וְיָבִיא עִמָּהּ, סֶלַע וְחוּמְשָׁהּ.
human_translation: to what did you interpret His misuse, the first clause that which he stole say the latter clause one for a guilt offering and one for non-sacred if for guilt offering is worth two sela , it shall be sacrificed for his guilt offering. And the second for misuse and he brings with it one sela and one-fifth
llm_translation: With what does one establish the "cloak" of the first part - theft. Say the latter part: one for guilt-offering and one for common use, if it was for a guilt-offering, if two rocks were beautiful - he should bring it close to his guilt-offering, and the second for the cloak and he should bring with it, a rock and its fifth.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא ״מְעִילָתוֹ״ – אֵיל אָשָׁם. רֵישָׁא קָרֵי לֵיהּ לִ״מְעִילָתוֹ״ גְּזֵילוֹ,
human_translation: evidently His misuse, ram a guilt offering. The first clause His misuse, in reference to that which he stole,
llm_translation: The word "me'ilato" - a ram of guilt. In the beginning, it is called "me'ilato" his robe, it is his theft.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ לִ״מְעִילָתוֹ״ אֵיל אָשָׁם!
human_translation: the latter clause His misuse, in reference to the ram a guilt offering.
llm_translation: The latter part calls it "his guilt-offering" - a ram of guilt!

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ אַיִל רוּבָּן קֶרֶן וְחוּמְשׁוֹ – קָרוּ לֵיהּ לִ״מְעִילָתוֹ״ גְּזֵילוֹ. סֵיפָא, דְּלָא הָוֵי אַיִל דִּזְבַן קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ – קָרֵי לֵיהּ אֵיל אָשָׁם ״מְעִילָתוֹ״, וְיָבִיא עִמָּהּ סֶלַע וְחוּמְשָׁהּ.
human_translation: the first clause, where bigger ram is equal to the principal plus its one-fifth His misuse, in reference to that which he stole. the latter clause, where bigger ram is not equal to the principal plus one-fifth. His misuse, in reference to ram a guilt offering, and he brings with it one sela and its one-fifth.
llm_translation: Beginning, that was to him ram majority horn and fifth – called to him "his cloak" his theft. End, that not was to him ram that bought horn and fifth – called to him ram guilt "his cloak", and bring with it rock and its fifth.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר גַּדָּא: בְּכִינּוּס חוּמְשִׁין מַהוּ שֶׁיִּתְכַּפֵּר?
human_translation: Rav Menashya bar Gadda raises a dilemma: What is with regard to accumulation of one-fifths achieve atonement?
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rav Menashiya bar Gadda inquired: In the case of Kinnus Chumashin, what is the atonement?

hebrew_text: מִי אָמְרִינַן: אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר אָדָם מִתְכַּפֵּר בִּשְׁבַח הֶקְדֵּשׁ – מִשּׁוּם דְּקָטָרַח קַמֵּיהּ, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלָא קָטָרַח – לָא מִתְכַּפֵּר.
human_translation: Do we say: If you say a person can achieve atonement with an enhancement of consecrated because he exerted with regard to But here, where he did not exert he cannot achieve atonement.
llm_translation: We say: If you might say, a person atones with the praise of the Holy One - because he offered incense before Him, but here where he did not offer incense - he does not atone.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר אֵין אָדָם מִתְכַּפֵּר בִּשְׁבַח הֶקְדֵּשׁ – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אַפְרְשֵׁיהּ, אֲבָל הָדֵין כִּינּוּס חוּמְשִׁין – דְּאַפְרְשֵׁיהּ, אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר מִתְכַּפֵּר. דְּאִיבְּעִי לְהוּ: [אָדָם] מִתְכַּפֵּר בִּשְׁבַח הֶקְדֵּשׁ, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Or perhaps If you say a person cannot achieve atonement with an enhancement of consecrated because he did not designate But here, the accumulation of one-fifths, where he designated it is to say he can receive atonement that dilemma was raised achieve atonement with an enhancement of consecrated or not?
llm_translation: Or perhaps if you would say, "A person is not atoned for through the praise of the Holy One" - because he does not separate the terumah, but similarly with the tithes of the fifth year - because he separates them, there is room to say he is atoned for. For it is in doubt: Is a person atoned for through the praise of the Holy One, or not?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמַּפְרִישׁ שְׁנֵי סְלָעִים לְאָשָׁם, וְלָקַח בָּהֶן שְׁנֵי אֵילִים לְאָשָׁם, הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן יָפֶה שְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים – יִקְרַב לַאֲשָׁמוֹ, וְהַשֵּׁנִי יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב וְיִמָּכֵר וְיִפְּלוּ דָּמָיו לִנְדָבָה.
human_translation: Come hear one who designates two sela for a guilt offering and he purchased two rams for a guilt offering with one of them was worth two sela , he shall sacrifice for his guilt offering. And the second shall graze until it becomes blemished; and it shall be sold, and money for it shall be allocated for gift
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who separates two stones for a guilt-offering, and takes with them two rams for a guilt-offering, if one of them was beautiful and the other was not beautiful - he should bring the beautiful one for his guilt-offering, and the other should graze until it develops a blemish, and then it should be sold, and its proceeds should be designated as a donation.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, דִּזְבַן בְּאַרְבְּעָה אַיִל, וּשְׁבַח, דְּשָׁוֵי תְּמָנְיָא? וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אָדָם מִתְכַּפֵּר בִּשְׁבַח הֶקְדֵּשׁ! לָא, הָכָא בְמַאי עָסְקִינַן? דְּאוֹזֵיל רוֹעֶה גַּבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: What, is it not where he bought the ram for four and appreciated until worth eight And conclude from this a person can achieve atonement with an enhancement of consecrated No; what are we dealing with here? shepherd reduced for him.
llm_translation: What is the reason that one buys four rams and praises that he has acquired eight? And learn from it that a person is atoned for with the praise of the Holy One! No, what are we dealing with here? That he goes out to tend his flock.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לָקַח אַיִל בְּסֶלַע, וּפִטְּמוֹ וְהֶעֱמִידוֹ עַל שְׁתַּיִם – כָּשֵׁר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אָדָם מִתְכַּפֵּר בִּשְׁבַח הֶקְדֵּשׁ! לָא, פִּטְּמוֹ שָׁאנֵי, דְּהָא חָסַר לֵיהּ תְּמָנְיָא.
human_translation: Come hear purchased a ram for one sela and he fattened and established at two valid Conclude from this a person can achieve atonement with an enhancement of consecrated No; one who fattened is different, as he lost eight
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one took a ram in a basket, and it miscarried and he placed it on two rocks - it is valid. Learn from it that a person can atone through the praise of the Holy One, blessed be He! No, the case of miscarriage is different, for it lacks two years.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לָקַח אַיִל בְּסֶלַע וַהֲרֵי הוּא בִּשְׁתַּיִם – כָּשֵׁר. הָכָא נָמֵי כְּשֶׁפִּטְּמוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear purchased a ram for one sela and it has to two it is valid Here too, where one fattened
llm_translation: "Come and hear: If one took a ram in a basket, and it is found in two baskets - it is valid. Here too, it is valid as he judged."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי הַיְינוּ רֵישָׁא! רֵישָׁא דִּזְבַן בְּאַרְבְּעָה וְאַשְׁבְּחֵיהּ בְּאַרְבְּעָה אַחֲרִינֵא, דְּחָסַר לֵיהּ תְּמָנְיָא. סֵיפָא דִּזְבַן אַיִל בְּאַרְבְּעָה וְאַשְׁבְּחֵיהּ בִּתְלָתָא, וְשָׁוֵי תְּמָנְיָא.
human_translation: If so, this is the first clause The first clause who purchased for four and he increased by another four that he lost eight The latter clause of who purchased a ram for four and he increased by another three and worth eight
llm_translation: So, this is the first case! The first case is where one sells for four and praises for four afterwards, which amounts to a deficiency of two. The latter case is where one sells a ram for four and praises it for three, thus equaling two.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: יְשַׁלֵּם סֶלַע – הָא חֲסַר לֵיהּ שִׁבְעָה! מַאי יְשַׁלֵּם? תַּשְׁלוּם דְּסֶלַע.
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause he shall pay sela Didn’t he lose seven What He shall pay? complete of sela ,
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: "He shall pay a fine" - but he is lacking seven! What does "he shall pay" mean? The payment of a fine.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ דְּאֵין אָדָם מִתְכַּפֵּר בִּשְׁבַח הֶקְדֵּשׁ, כִּי יָהֵיב תַּשְׁלוּם דְּסֶלַע מַאי הָוֵי? אַיִל בֶּן שְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים בָּעֵינַן, וְלֵיכָּא! לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר: אָדָם מִתְכַּפֵּר בִּשְׁבַח הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: But if one maintains that a person cannot achieve atonement with an enhancement of consecrated what is of that he gives completion of sela ? We require a ram that two sela , and there is no Actually, holds a person can achieve atonement with an enhancement of consecrated
llm_translation: And if he holds that one does not achieve atonement through the praise of the Holy One, blessed be He, then when one gives a payment of a rock, what is it? We require a ram of two rocks, and it is not there! Rather, he certainly holds: One achieves atonement through the praise of the Holy One, blessed be He.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תַּשְׁלוּם דְּסֶלַע לֹא יִתֵּן! הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּקָיָהֵיב תַּשְׁלוּמִין דְּסֶלַע – גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ: אַיִל פָּחוּת מִשְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים מְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: If so, he not give completion of sela , This is the reason that he must give the completion of sela : decree, lest say a ram less than two sela atones
llm_translation: If so, the payment of a rock he shall not give! That is the reason for the payment of rocks - a decree lest they say: A ram less than two rocks atones.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: בִּשְׁעַת הַפְרָשָׁה יָפֶה סֶלַע, בִּשְׁעַת כַּפָּרָה יָפֶה שְׁתֵּי סְלָעִים – לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: What was about Come hear worth sela at the time it was designated worth two sela at the time of atonement, not fulfilled his obligation
llm_translation: What is the case of the offering? Come and hear: At the time of separation, one rock is good; at the time of atonement, two rocks are good - he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָדָם מִתְכַּפֵּר בִּשְׁבַח הֶקְדֵּשׁ, אוֹ לֹא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כַּמָּה שָׁנִים גָּדַל זֶה בֵּינֵינוּ, וְלֹא שָׁמַע הֲלָכָה זוֹ מִמֶּנִּי!
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, raised dilemma: Can a person achieve atonement with an enhancement of consecrated or not? Rabbi Yoḥanan said, How many years this grown among us and he did not hear this halakha from me.
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rabbi Elazar: Does a person atone through the praise of the Holy One, or not? Rabbi Yochanan said: How many years has this one grown among us, and he did not hear this law from me!

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּאַמְרַהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? אִין, וְעַל הָדָא אַמְרַהּ, דִּתְנַן: וְלַד תּוֹדָה וּתְמוּרָתָהּ, וְכֵן הַמַּפְרִישׁ תּוֹדָתוֹ וְאָבְדָה וְהִפְרִישׁ אַחֶרֶת תַּחְתֶּיהָ, אֵין טְעוּנָה לֶחֶם.
human_translation: by inference that Rabbi Yoḥanan said Yes, and he said that with regard to this as we learned offspring a thanks offering or its substitute, and likewise one designated his thanks offering and it was lost and he designated another in its stead, does not require loaves
llm_translation: From the premise that Rabbi Yochanan said? No, and regarding this he said, as we learned: "For a thanksgiving offering and its exchange, and similarly one who designates his thanksgiving offering and it gets lost, and he designates another in its place, there is no obligation of bread."

hebrew_text: [רַב חֲנַנְיָה] מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה, דְּוָלָד אֵין טָעוּן לֶחֶם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥanina sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: taught that the offspring does not require loaves only after atonement as offspring does not require loaves.
llm_translation: Rav Chananya from the name of Rabbi Yochanan: They only taught this regarding after atonement, for a newborn does not require bread.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לִפְנֵי כַּפָּרָה – טָעוּן לֶחֶם, אַלְמָא קָסָבַר מִתְכַּפֵּר בִּשְׁבַח הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: But before atonement requires loaves, Evidently, holds can achieve atonement with an enhancement of consecrated
llm_translation: Before the atonement - requires bread, this implies that he holds that atonement is achieved through the praise of the Holy One.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים נִדְחִין אוֹ לֹא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲרֵי כַּמָּה שָׁנִים גָּדַל זֶה בֵּינֵינוּ, וְלֹא שָׁמַע הֲלָכָה זוֹ מִמֶּנִּי!
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises a dilemma: living animals disqualified or not? Rabbi Yoḥanan said, How many years this grown among us and he did not hear this halakha from me.
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rabbi Elazar: Are Ba'alei Chayim rejected or not? Rabbi Yochanan said: Look how many years this one has grown among us, and has not heard this law from me!

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַמְרַהּ? אִין, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּהֵמָה שֶׁל שְׁנֵי שׁוּתָּפִין, הִקְדִּישׁ חֶצְיָהּ, וְחָזַר וְלָקַח חֶצְיָהּ וְהִקְדִּישָׁהּ – קְדוֹשָׁה, וְאֵינָהּ קְרֵיבָה, וְעוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה, וּתְמוּרָתָהּ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ.
human_translation: by inference that Rabbi Yoḥanan said Yes, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: an animal to two partners, consecrated half of it and then acquired its half and consecrated it, consecrated but it may not be sacrificed. And it renders a substitute, and its substitution is like it,
llm_translation: From the principle of Rabbi Yochanan she said? No, as Rabbi Yochanan said: An animal belonging to two partners, one sanctified half of it, then went back and took the other half and sanctified it - it is sanctified, but it is not brought as an offering, and it makes an exchange, and its exchange is like it.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים נִדְחִין. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים מְדַחָה. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ יֵשׁ דִּיחוּי בְּדָמִים.
human_translation: conclude from this three Conclude from it consecrated living animals can be disqualified. And conclude from it sanctity value disqualifies And conclude from it there is disqualification with regard to monetary
llm_translation: Listen to this, three categories: Listen to this, regarding living creatures they are rejected. And listen to this, regarding the sanctity of blood it is rejected. And listen to this, there is a rejection in blood.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הוּזְלוּ טְלָאִים בָּעוֹלָם, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן ״מִבְחַר נִדְרֵיכֶם״ בָּעֵינַן, וְהָא אִיכָּא, אוֹ דִילְמָא ״כֶּסֶף שְׁקָלִים״ בָּעֵינַן, וְלֵיכָּא?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises a dilemma: lambs depreciated in the world what is Do we say we require “Your choice vows” and that is Or perhaps we require “Silver by shekels” and is not
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rabbi Elazar: They sought to annul vows in the world, what? Who said "your chosen vows" do we require, and here it is, or perhaps "silver shekels" do we require, and it is not?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כַּמָּה שָׁנִים גָּדַלְנוּ בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ וְלֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ הֲלָכָה זוֹ. וְלָא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נָתְנָה תּוֹרָה קִצְבָה בִּמְחוּסְּרֵי כַפָּרָה? שֶׁמָּא יוּזְלוּ טְלָאִים, וְאֵין לָהֶן תַּקָּנָה לֶאֱכוֹל בְּקָדָשִׁים. אֵימָא: לֹא לִימַּדְנוּ הֲלָכָה זוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: How many years have we grown in the study hall and we have not heard this halakha . And not But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: For what did the Torah not provide a fixed those lacking atonement, lambs might depreciate and they would have no remedy to eat sacrificial Say have we not taught this halakha
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: How many years have we grown in the study hall and not heard this law. Is it not so? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say that Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai said: Why was the Torah not given to those who are impure? Lest they become pure and have no provision to eat from the holy things. Say: We have not learned this law.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי זֵירָא בַּר אַדָּא מַהְדַּר תַּלְמוּדֵיהּ כֹּל תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין קַמֵּיהּ! אֵימָא: לֹא נִתְבַּקְּשָׁה הֲלָכָה זוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Zeira bar Adda review his studies before every thirty days, Say this halakha was not asked from us in the study hall.
llm_translation: And behold, Rabbi Zeira bar Adda reviewed his studies every thirty days before him! Perhaps: This halakha was not sought from him in the study hall.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נִתְּנָה קִצְבָה בִּמְחוּסְּרֵי כַּפָּרָה? שֶׁמָּא יוּזְלוּ טְלָאִים, וְאֵין לָהֶם תַּקָּנָה לֶאֱכוֹל בְּקָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: the itself: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: For what did the Torah not provide a fixed those lacking atonement? lambs might depreciate and they would have no remedy to eat sacrificial
llm_translation: The body, said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Why was a portion not given to those who are in need of atonement? Lest they become impoverished and have no means to eat from the holy offerings.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, חַטַּאת חֵלֶב, יִנָּתֵן לָהּ קִצְבָה, דִּלְכַפָּרָה אָתְיָא וְלָאו לְאִישְׁתְּרוֹיֵי בַּאֲכִילַת קָדָשִׁים הוּא! מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, אֲשַׁם נָזִיר לֶהֱוֵי לֵיהּ קִצְבָה, דִּלְבַטָּלָה הוּא דְּאָתֵי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: אֵין לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא בָּא לְבַטָּלָה, אֶלָּא אֲשַׁם נָזִיר בִּלְבָד! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Abaye objects to this If that is so, let a fixed be provided for a sin offering fat, as it is brought for atonement and it is not to permit consumption of sacrificial Rava objects to this If that is so, let there be a fixed for a guilt offering nazirite, as it comes for naught, As Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: Nothing comes for naught other than the guilt offering of a nazirite alone. difficult.
llm_translation: Abbaye objects to this: Rather, from now on, the sin offering of fat should be given to her as a portion, for it comes for atonement and not for the benefit of those partaking of the holy offerings! Rava objects to this: Rather, from now on, the guilt offering of a Nazirite should be given to her as a portion, for it is something that comes to be nullified, as Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: There is nothing that comes to be nullified except for the guilt offering of a Nazirite! This remains difficult.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְרִישׁ חַטָּאתוֹ וָמֵת – לֹא יְבִיאֶנּוּ בְּנוֹ תַּחְתָּיו. לֹא יְבִיאֶנּוּ מֵחֵטְא אֶל חֵטְא. אֲפִילּוּ הִפְרִישׁ עַל חֵלֶב שֶׁאָכַל אֶמֶשׁ – לֹא יְבִיאֶנָּה עַל חֵלֶב שֶׁאָכַל הַיּוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קׇרְבָּנוֹ עַל חַטָּאתוֹ״ – עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא קׇרְבָּנוֹ לְשֵׁם חַטָּאתוֹ.
human_translation: one who designates a sin offering his and dies, his son shall not bring it in his stead, one may not bring from sin for sin. Even if he designated for fat that he ate yesterday, he may not bring it for fat that he ate today, as it is stated: his offering, for his sin until his offering is for the sake of sin
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who designates his sin-offering and dies - his son should not bring it in his place. He should not bring it from one sin to another sin. Even if he designated it for eating forbidden fat yesterday - he should not bring it for eating forbidden fat that he ate today, as it is stated: "His offering for his sin" - until his offering is for the sake of his sin.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״קׇרְבָּנוֹ״ – בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹ הוּא יוֹצֵא, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא בְּקׇרְבַּן אָבִיו.
human_translation: From where is this matter, as the Sages taught his offering” one fulfills with his offering, but he does not fulfill with his father’s offering,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of these words? For the Rabbis taught: "His offering" - with his offering he fulfills his obligation, but he does not fulfill his obligation with the offering of his father.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יֵצֵא בְּקׇרְבַּן אָבִיו בִּבְהֵמָה שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו, מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, אוֹ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַקַּלָּה, אֲבָל יוֹצֵא בְּקׇרְבָּן שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַקַּלָּה, אוֹ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קׇרְבָּנוֹ״ – בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹ הוּא יוֹצֵא, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹ שֶׁל אָבִיו.
human_translation: might does not fulfill with his father’s offering by an animal that his father designated, from a lenient for a severe or from a severe for a lenient one But he fulfill with offering that his father designated, from a lenient for a lenient or from a severe for a severe the verse states “His offering” he fulfills with his offering, but he does not fulfill with his father’s offering,
llm_translation: He is able not to go out with the offering of his father in an animal that his father designated, from the lenient to the stringent, or from the stringent to the lenient, but he does go out with the offering that his father designated from the lenient to the lenient, or from the stringent to the stringent? The Talmud teaches: "His offering" - with his offering he goes out, and he does not go out with the offering of his father.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יֵצֵא בְּקׇרְבַּן אָבִיו בִּבְהֵמָה שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ, אֲפִילּוּ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַקַּלָּה, אוֹ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי אֵין מְגַלֵּחַ נְזִירוּתוֹ עַל בְּהֵמָה שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו,
human_translation: might does not fulfill with his father’s offering by an animal designated, even from a lenient for a lenient or from a severe for a severe as cannot shave, his term of naziriteship with an animal that his father designated.
llm_translation: One might have thought that he does not fulfill his obligation with the offering of his father that he consecrated, even if he consecrated from a light animal to a light animal, or from a heavy animal to a heavy animal, for one does not shave his Nazirite vow on an animal that his father consecrated.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל יוֹצֵא בְּמָעוֹת שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו, אֲפִילּוּ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, אוֹ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַקַּלָּה, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָדָם מְגַלֵּחַ נְזִירוֹתָיו עַל מָעוֹת שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ אָבִיו, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵן סְתוּמִים, וְלֹא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵן מְפוֹרָשִׁין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קׇרְבָּנוֹ״ – בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹ הוּא יוֹצֵא, וְאֵין יוֹצֵא בְּקׇרְבַּן אָבִיו.
human_translation: But fulfill with money that his father designated even from a lenient for a severe or from a severe for a lenient as a person can shave his term of naziriteship with the money his father designated when is unallocated but not when it is allocated the verse states “His offering” he fulfills with his offering, but he does not fulfill with his father’s offering.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But one fulfills his obligation with money that his father designated, even if it is designated from something light for something heavy, or from something heavy for something light, for a person shaves his sideburns with money that his father designated, when they are closed, and not when they are open? The Talmud teaches: "His offering" - with his offering he fulfills his obligation, but one does not fulfill his obligation with his father's offering.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יֵצֵא אֲפִילּוּ בְּמָעוֹת שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ, אֲפִילּוּ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַקַּלָּה אוֹ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, אֲבָל יוֹצֵא בְּקׇרְבָּן שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ לְעַצְמוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַקַּלָּה אוֹ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קׇרְבָּנוֹ עַל חַטָּאתוֹ״ – עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא לְשֵׁם חַטָּאת.
human_translation: might does not fulfill even with money that designated, even from a lenient for a lenient or from a severe for a severe but fulfill with offering that he designated for himself, even from a severe for a lenient or from a lenient for a severe the verse states: “His offering for his sin” until is for the sake of sin
llm_translation: Talmudic text: One might have thought that he does not fulfill his obligation even with money that he designated, whether from a light obligation to a light obligation or from a severe obligation to a severe obligation, but he does fulfill his obligation with a sacrifice that he designated for himself, even from a severe obligation to a light obligation or from a light obligation to a severe obligation? The Talmud teaches: "His offering for his sin" - until it is for the sake of a sin. English translation:

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יֵצֵא בְּקׇרְבָּן עַצְמוֹ בִּבְהֵמָה שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ לְעַצְמוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַקַּלָּה, אוֹ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, שֶׁכֵּן אִם הִפְרִישׁ בְּהֵמָה עַל הַחֵלֶב וֶהֱבִיאָהּ עַל הַדָּם, עַל הַדָּם וֶהֱבִיאָהּ עַל הַחֵלֶב – שֶׁהֲרֵי לֹא מָעַל וְלֹא כִּיפֵּר,
human_translation: might has not fulfilled to an offering himself with an animal that he designated for himself, even for a lenient for lenient or from a severe for severe because if he designated an animal for fat and he brought for blood, for blood and brought for fat, as he not misused and does not atone
llm_translation: One might have thought that one does not fulfill his obligation with an offering that he designated for himself from an animal, even if he designated from a lighter one to a lighter one, or from a heavier one to a heavier one. For so too if he designated an animal for its fat and brought it for its blood, or for its blood and brought it for its fat - for he has not transgressed and has not atoned.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל יוֹצֵא בְּמָעוֹת שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ לְעַצְמוֹ מִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַקַּלָּה וּמִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה, אוֹ מִן הַחֲמוּרָה עַל הַקַּלָּה וּמִן הַקַּלָּה עַל הַחֲמוּרָה,
human_translation: But fulfills with money that he designated for himself, for a lenient for lenient or for a severe for severe or from a severe for a lenient or from a lenient one for a severe
llm_translation: But one may go out with coins that he separated for himself from light to light and from heavy to heavy, or from heavy to light and from light to heavy.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכֵּן אִם הִפְרִישׁ לְעַצְמוֹ מָעוֹת עַל הַחֵלֶב וֶהֱבִיאָן עַל הַדָּם, עַל הַדָּם וֶהֱבִיאָן עַל הַחֵלֶב – שֶׁהֲרֵי מָעַל, וְכִיפֵּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קׇרְבָּנוֹ עַל חַטָּאתוֹ״ – עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא קׇרְבָּנוֹ לְשֵׁם חֶטְאוֹ.
human_translation: that if he designated money for himself for fat and he brought for blood; or for blood and brought for fat, has misused and atones the verse states: “His offering for his sin,” until his offering, is for the sake of his sin.
llm_translation: So too, if one separated money for himself for the fat and brought it for the blood, for the blood and brought it for the fat - for he has transgressed, and atoned? The Talmud teaches: "His offering for his sin" - until his offering is for the sake of his sin.

hebrew_text: מַאי לֹא מָעַל וְלֹא כִּיפֵּר? תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁימִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מָצֵי מָעֵיל, כַּפּוֹרֵי נָמֵי לָא מְכַפַּר, הוֹאִיל וְכָךְ לָא מָצֵי מְשַׁנֵּי.
human_translation: What He not misused and does not atone Rav Shmuel bar Shimi interpreted before Rav Pappa: This is saying: Since cannot misuse so too, one cannot achieve atonement Since it is so, unable to convert
llm_translation: What is "not a transgression and not atonement"? Rav Shmuel bar Shimi translated it before Rav Papa, saying thus: Since a cloak is not found, the atonements are also not found, since thus it is not found to change.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מָעוֹת, כֵּיוָן דְּאִי מְשַׁנֵּי מָעֵיל וּמַיְיתֵי קׇרְבַּן מְעִילָה – אֵימָא בַּתְּחִלָּה נָמֵי מַיְיתֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: But money, since if one converted he has misused and bring an offering misuse say from the outset too, bring teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But with regards to ma'ot, since if one changes a ma'il and brings a korban ma'ilah - say at the beginning also he brings, it is teaching us. English translation:

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְבִיאִין מֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ כִּשְׂבָּה – שְׂעִירָה, מֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ שְׂעִירָה – כִּשְׂבָּה, וּמֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ כִּשְׂבָּה וּשְׂעִירָה – תּוֹרִין וּבְנֵי יוֹנָה, וּמֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ תּוֹרִין וּבְנֵי יוֹנָה – עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה.
human_translation: One may bring a female goat from consecrated a female lamb, a female lamb from consecrated a female goat. And doves and pigeons from consecrated a female lamb and a female goat; and one-tenth of an ephah from consecrated doves and pigeons.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One brings from the Sanctuary a female goat (se'irah) as a sin offering, and sanctifies a female goat as a sin offering - as a male goat (sa'ir). And one who sanctifies a male goat and a female goat - they are turtledoves and young pigeons. And one who sanctifies turtledoves and young pigeons - a tenth of an ephah.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? הִפְרִישׁ לְכִשְׂבָּה אוֹ לִשְׂעִירָה, הֶעֱנִי – יָבִיא עוֹף, הֶעֱנִי – יָבִיא עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה. הִפְרִישׁ לַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה, הֶעֱשִׁיר – יָבִיא עוֹף, הֶעֱשִׁיר – יָבִיא כִּשְׂבָּה וּשְׂעִירָה.
human_translation: How so? If designated to a female lamb or for a female goat became poorer, he may bring a bird, he became poorer, he may bring one-tenth of an ephah he designated to one-tenth of an ephah became wealthier, he shall bring a bird. he became wealthier, he shall bring a female lamb or a female goat.
llm_translation: How so? If one designated his offering for a female sheep or for a female goat, the poor person - he shall bring a bird, the poor person - he shall bring a tenth of an ephah. If one designated for a tenth of an ephah, the wealthy person - he shall bring a bird, the wealthy person - he shall bring a female sheep and a female goat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מֵחַטָּאתוֹ״, ״מֵחַטָּאתוֹ״, ״עַל חַטָּאתוֹ״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר?
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught from his sin” from his sin” “Over his sin” What the verse states?
llm_translation: Gemara: What do these words mean? For the Rabbis taught: "From his sin offering," "From his sin offering," "For his sin offering," what is the Talmud to say?

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן אַתָּה אוֹמֵר שֶׁמְּבִיאִין מֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ כִּשְׂבָּה – שְׂעִירָה, וּמֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ שְׂעִירָה – כִּשְׂבָּה, וּמֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ כִּשְׂבָּה וּשְׂעִירָה – תּוֹרִים וּבְנֵי יוֹנָה, וּמֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ תּוֹרִין וּבְנֵי יוֹנָה – עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה,
human_translation: From where you say that one may bring a female goat from consecrated a female lamb, and a female lamb from consecrated a female goat? And doves and pigeons from consecrated a female lamb and a female goat, and one-tenth of an ephah from consecrated doves and pigeons?
llm_translation: From where do you say that they bring from the hekdesh a female goat - a ram, and from the hekdesh a ram - a female goat, and from the hekdesh a ram and a female goat - turtledoves and young pigeons, and from the hekdesh turtledoves and young pigeons - a tenth of an ephah.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? הִפְרִישׁ לְכִשְׂבָּה וְלִשְׂעִירָה וְהֶעֱנִי – יָבִיא עוֹף, הֶעֱנִי – יָבִיא עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה, הִפְרִישׁ עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה וְהֶעֱשִׁיר – יָבִיא עוֹף, הֶעֱשִׁיר – יָבִיא כִּשְׂבָּה אוֹ שְׂעִירָה.
human_translation: How so? If designated to a female lamb or to a female goat and became poorer, he shall bring a bird, he became poorer, he shall bring one-tenth of an ephah he designated one-tenth of an ephah and became wealthier, he shall bring a bird. he became wealthier, he shall bring a female lamb or a female goat.
llm_translation: How so? If one designated his offering for a female lamb and for a male goat, and for the poor - he shall bring a bird; for the poor - he shall bring a tenth of an ephah; if he designated a tenth of an ephah and he is rich - he shall bring a bird; if he is rich - he shall bring a female lamb or a male goat.

hebrew_text: הִפְרִישׁ כִּשְׂבָּה אוֹ שְׂעִירָה וְנִסְתָּאֲבוּ – יָבִיא בִּדְמֵיהֶן עוֹף, הִפְרִישׁ עוֹף וְנִסְתָּאֵב – לֹא יָבִיא בְּדָמָיו עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה, שֶׁאֵין לָעוֹף פִּדְיוֹן.
human_translation: one designated a female lamb or goat and it developed a blemish, he may bring a bird with its money. one designated a bird and it developed a blemish, he may not bring one-tenth of an ephah with its money, as there is no redemption for birds.
llm_translation: He separated a ewe or a she-goat and they were lost - he shall bring a bird with their blood, he separated a bird and they were lost - he shall not bring with its blood a tenth of an ephah, for the bird has no redemption.

hebrew_text: לָכֵן נֶאֱמַר ״מֵחַטָּאתוֹ״ ״עַל חַטָּאתוֹ״.
human_translation: Therefore, it is stated: “From his sin,” “Over his sin,”
llm_translation: Therefore it is stated, "from his sin" "for his sin."

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״מֵחַטָּאתוֹ״ גַּבֵּי כִּשְׂבָּה אוֹ שְׂעִירָה, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב גַּבֵּי עוֹף. דְּאִי כְּתִיב קְרָא גַּבֵּי הֶקְדֵּשׁ כִּשְׂבָּה אוֹ שְׂעִירָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הִפְרִישׁ כִּשְׂבָּה, כִּי מִיעֲנֵי מֵהָלֵין מָעוֹת נַחֲלִינּוּן עַל עוֹף, דְּנַיְיתֵי עוֹף, דְּכִשְׂבָּה וָעוֹף תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מִינֵי דָּמִים נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And it was necessary to write: “From his sin,” with regard to a female lamb or a female goat, and it was necessary to write with regard to a bird. As, if the verse had written with regard to a consecrated female lamb or a female goat, I would say designated a female lamb, when he became poorer he may redeem that money on a bird bring a bird as a female lamb and a bird are both types of blood
llm_translation: And it is necessary to write "from his sin" regarding a female goat or a he-goat, and it is necessary to write regarding a bird. For if the verse were written regarding consecrated animals, a female goat or a he-goat, I would say: Separate a female goat, for they are similar in that they both require a portion of blood for a bird, as both a female goat and a bird are types of blood.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה דְּלָאו מִינֵי דְּדָמִים נִינְהוּ, אִי לָא כְּתִיב קְרָא ״מֵחַטָּאתוֹ״ גַּבֵּי עוֹף, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כִּי מַפְרֵישׁ מָעוֹת לְקִינּוֹ וּמִיעֲנֵי – לָא מַיְיתֵי עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה, דְּלָאו מִינֵי דְּדָמִים הוּא, אֶלָּא מַיְיתֵי עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה מִן בֵּיתֵיהּ, וְהָלֵין מָעוֹת דְּאַפְרֵישׁ יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה – אַהָכִי הֲדַר כְּתִיב קְרָא ״מֵחַטָּאתוֹ״ גַּבֵּי עוֹף, לְמֵימְרָא דְּמֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ דְּעוֹף נָמֵי מַיְיתֵי עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה,
human_translation: But one-tenth of an ephah which is not a type of blood if the verse had not written: “From his sin,” with regard to a bird, I would say if one designates money for his nest, and becomes poorer, he may not bring one-tenth of an ephah as it is not a type of blood Rather, he brings one-tenth of an ephah from his house, and that money that he designated is allocated for gift Therefore, the verse repeats writes: “From his sin,” with regard to a bird, to say that one may also bring one-tenth of an ephah from consecrated of birds.
llm_translation: But a tenth of an ephah that is not from the types of blood, they are. If it is not written in the verse "from his sin offering" regarding a bird, I would say: when he separates coins for his nest and for his young - he does not bring a tenth of an ephah that is not from the types of blood, but he brings a tenth of an ephah from his house, and the coins that he separates will fall as a donation. How then is it written in the verse "from his sin offering" regarding a bird? To say that just as the consecration of a bird is similar, he brings a tenth of an ephah.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: כִּי מַפְרִישׁ לַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה, וְאַדְּמַיְיתֵי הֶעֱשִׁיר – נוֹסֵיף עֲלֵיהוֹן וְנַיְיתֵי עוֹף, הֶעֱשִׁיר – נוֹסֵיף עֲלֵיהוֹן וְנַיְיתֵי כִּשְׂבָּה אוֹ שְׂעִירָה.
human_translation: And this is saying: When one designates for one-tenth of an ephah and before he brought he grew wealthier, he must add to and bring a bird. he grew wealthier, he must add to them and bring a female lamb or a female goat.
llm_translation: And thus he said: When one separates for the tithe of the ephah, and the rich man's measure is similar - he adds upon them and gives fowl, the rich man - he adds upon them and gives a lamb or a goat.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי טַעְמָא כְּתִיב ״עַל חַטָּאתוֹ״ גַּבֵּי עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה? דְּאִי כְּתַיב ״עַל חַטָּאתוֹ״ גַּבֵּי עוֹף, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כִּי מַפְרֵישׁ מָעוֹת לְקִינּוֹ וְהֶעֱשִׁיר – הוּא דְּמוֹסֵיף עֲלֵיהוֹן וּמַיְיתֵי כִּשְׂבָּה אוֹ שְׂעִירָה, דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ מִינֵי דָמִים נִינְהוּ,
human_translation: And what is the reason “Over his sin,” written with regard to the one-tenth of an ephah that if had stated: Over his sin, with regard to a bird, I would say it is when one designates money for his nest and becomes wealthier that one must add and bring a female lamb or a female goat, as they are both types of blood
