llm_translation: And what is the reason that it is written "for his sin offering" regarding the tithe of the ephah? For if it were written "for his sin offering" regarding a bird, I would say: when one separates coins for his nestling and the rich person – it is he who adds to them and brings a ewe or a she-goat, for both of them are types of blood.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הִפְרִישׁ מָעוֹת לַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה וְהֶעֱשִׁיר, הָלֵין דְּמַפְרֵישׁ, אִי לָא הֶעֱשִׁיר טוּבָא – נַיְיתֵי עוֹף, וְאִם הֶעֱשִׁיר טוּבָא – נַיְיתֵי כִּשְׂבָּה אוֹ שְׂעִירָה, וְהָלֵין מָעוֹת דְּאַפְרֵישׁ יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה, אַהָכִי כְּתִיב קְרָא בְּהָדֵין חַטָּאת בַּעֲשִׁירוּת וְדַלּוּת ״מֵחַטָּאתוֹ״, וְגַבֵּי דַּלֵּי דַלּוּת ״עַל חַטָּאתוֹ״ – לְמִדְרַשׁ כִּדְאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: But one designated money to one-tenth of an ephah and became wealthier, that he designated if he did not become much wealthier he brings a bird, and if he became much wealthier he brings a female lamb or a female goat, And that money which he designated is allocated for gift for this the verse states: “From his sin,” with regard to that sin offering rich and poor, and: “Over his sin,” with regard to exceedingly poor, so interpret as we said,
llm_translation: But one who separates coins for the tithe of the ephah and the rich, if he separates, if the rich is not enough - he should bring a bird, and if the rich is enough - he should bring a female lamb or a goat. And the coins that he separates will fall to a voluntary offering. This is as it is written in the verse: "For a sin offering, with the rich and the poor" (Leviticus 5:11), and regarding the poor of the poor, "for his sin" - this is a teaching as we say.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מְטַמֵּא מִקְדָּשׁ עָשִׁיר שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ קֵן
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: A wealthy person who defiles the Temple, he designated a nest,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Oshaya said: He renders impure the rich man's sanctuary who set aside a nest.

hebrew_text: לְכִבְשָׂתוֹ, וְהֶעֱנִי. הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחָה – יִדָּחֶה.
human_translation: of a female lamb, and he became poorer, since was disqualified it is disqualified.
llm_translation: To his lamb, and he shall be afflicted. Since it was rejected - it shall be rejected.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, שְׁמַע מִינָה תְּלָת: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים נִדְחִים. וּקְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים (נִדְחָה).
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: conclude from this three Conclude from it consecrated living animals can be disqualified And sanctity value, disqualified.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said, infer from it three: infer from it animals are disqualified. And the sanctity of blood is disqualified.

hebrew_text: וְדָחוּי מֵעִיקָּרָא הָוֵי דָּחוּי.
human_translation: And a disqualification at the outset, is disqualification.
llm_translation: And rejected from the outset is considered rejected.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא: הַמַּפְרִישׁ נְקֵבָה לְפִסְחוֹ קוֹדֶם הַפֶּסַח – תִּרְעֶה עַד שֶׁתִּסְתָּאֵב, וְתִמָּכֵר וְיָבִיא בְּדָמֶיהָ פֶּסַח. יָלְדָה זָכָר – יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב, וְיִמָּכֵר וְיָבִיא בְּדָמָיו פֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rav Ukva bar Ḥama raises an objection one who designates a female for his Paschal offering before Passover, graze until it becomes blemished, it is sold and one brings a Paschal offering with the money gave birth to a male graze until it becomes blemished, it is sold and one brings a Paschal offering with the money
llm_translation: Rav Ukva bar Ḥama raises an objection: One who designates a female animal for his Paschal offering before the Paschal lamb – it shall graze until it develops a blemish, then he shall sell it and bring a Paschal lamb with its money. If it gives birth to a male – it shall graze until it develops a blemish, then he shall sell it and bring a Paschal lamb with its money.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הוּא עַצְמוֹ יִקְרַב פֶּסַח. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים אֵינָם נִדְחִים!
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: itself is sacrificed a Paschal offering. Conclude from this consecrated living animals are not disqualified,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: He himself shall bring near the Passover. Learn from it, animals are not disqualified!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: כִּי אָמְרִינַן לְרַבָּנַן (דְ)רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים אֵינָן נִדְחִין,
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Oshaya say: When we say according to the Rabbis, that Rabbi Shimon holds living animals are not disqualified.
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Oshaya said: When we say to the Rabbis that Rabbi Shimon holds that living creatures are not disqualified,

hebrew_text: וְהַגְרָלָה אֵינָהּ מְעַכֶּבֶת. דְּתַנְיָא: מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן – מֵבִיא חֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּהַגְרָלָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: And that drawing is not indispensable. As it is taught one of died brings another without drawing the statement of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: The lottery does not delay. For it was taught: If one of them dies, his companion brings another without using the lottery. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא קָסָבַר בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים אֵינָן נִידְחִין, וְהַגְרָלָה אֵינָהּ מְעַכֶּבֶת.
human_translation: Evidently, Rabbi Shimon holds: living animals are not disqualified. And drawing is not indispensable,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Apparently, the Ba'alei Chayim are not considered Nidachim, and a lottery does not invalidate it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֵין הַקִּינִּין מִתְפָּרְשׁוֹת, אֶלָּא אִי בִּלְקִיחַת בְּעָלִים, אִי בַּעֲשִׂיַּית כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: Nests, are designated, only Either owner of purchase or, priest of sacrifice.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: The laws of kinyan are not explained, except either through acquisition by the owner, or through the action of a priest.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלָקְחָה שְׁתֵּי תוֹרִים וְגוֹ׳״, ״וְעָשָׂה הַכֹּהֵן וְגוֹ׳״ – אוֹ בִּלְקִיחַת בְּעָלִים, אוֹ בַּעֲשִׂיַּית כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: What is the reason of Rav Ḥisda? As it is written “And she shall purchase two doves “And the priest shall sacrifice either owner of purchase or priest of sacrifice.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashei said: What is the reason for Rav Chisda's opinion? As it is written: "And he shall take two goats, etc.," "And the kohen shall perform, etc." – either in the taking of owners, or in the actions of the kohen.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וְעָשָׂהוּ חַטָּאת״ – הַגּוֹרָל עוֹשֵׂהוּ חַטָּאת, וְאֵין הַשֵּׁם עוֹשֵׂהוּ חַטָּאת, וְאֵין כֹּהֵן עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת.
human_translation: raises an objection and he shall sacrifice it for a sin offering” the lot renders it a sin offering, but the name does not render it a sin offering, and priest, does not render it a sin offering.
llm_translation: Challenger: "And he shall make it a sin offering" - the lot makes it a sin offering, and the Name does not make it a sin offering, and the priest does not make it a sin offering.

hebrew_text: שֶׁיָּכוֹל: וַהֲלֹא דִין הוּא, וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא קִידֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל – קִידֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם, מְקוֹם שֶׁיקִּדֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּקַדֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם?
human_translation: as might Could this not inference, And if in a case where a lot does not sanctify the name does sanctify is it not logical a case where a lot sanctifies that the name sanctify
llm_translation: He should be able: But isn't it the same law, and what if in a place where he did not sanctify the lot - he sanctified the Name, in a place where he should sanctify the lot - is it not the law that he should sanctify the Name?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָשָׂהוּ חַטָּאת״, הַגּוֹרָל עוֹשֵׂהוּ חַטָּאת, וְאֵין הַשֵּׁם עוֹשֵׂהוּ חַטָּאת.
human_translation: the verse states, “He shall sacrifice it for a sin offering,” the lot renders it a sin offering, but the name does not render it a sin offering.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he shall make it a sin offering," the lot makes it a sin offering, and the Name does not make it a sin offering.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי שֵׁם דּוּמְיָא דְּגוֹרָל: מָה גּוֹרָל לָאו בִּלְקִיחָה וְלָאו בַּעֲשִׂיָּיה, אַף הַשֵּׁם נָמֵי לָאו בִּלְקִיחָה וְלָאו בַּעֲשִׂיָּיה!
human_translation: teaches name is similar to a lot. Just as a lot not at purchase nor at sacrifice, so too the name also not at purchase nor at sacrifice.
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught in the name of Dumeia of Gor'al: Just as the drawing of lots is not in the taking and not in the doing, so too the Name is not in the taking and not in the doing!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב, הָכִי קָאָמַר: וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא קִידֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל בִּלְקִיחַת בְּעָלִים וּבַעֲשִׂיַּית הַכֹּהֵן – קִידֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם, אִי בִּלְקִיחַת בְּעָלִים אִי בַּעֲשִׂיַּית כֹּהֵן. כָּאן שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל שֶׁלֹּא בִּלְקִיחָה וְשֶׁלֹּא בַּעֲשִׂיָּיה – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיקִּדֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם, אִי בִּלְקִיחָה אִי בַּעֲשִׂיָּיה?
human_translation: Rav said this is saying: And if in a place where a lot, owner of purchase or priest of sacrifice, does not sanctify the name, either owner of purchase or priest of sacrifice, does sanctify here, where a lot not at purchase nor at sacrifice sanctifies is it not logical that the name, either at purchase or at sacrifice, sanctify
llm_translation: Rav said, thus he said: And what in a case where the lottery was not sanctified in the taking of the owners and in the action of the priest - he sanctified the Name, whether in the taking of the owners or in the action of the priest. Here, where he sanctified the lottery neither in the taking nor in the action - is it not the law that he sanctified the Name, whether in the taking or in the action?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָשָׂהוּ חַטָּאת״, הַגּוֹרָל עוֹשֵׂהוּ חַטָּאת, וְאֵין הַשֵּׁם עוֹשֵׂהוּ חַטָּאת.
human_translation: the verse states: “He shall sacrifice it for a sin offering,” the lot renders it a sin offering, but the name does not render it a sin offering.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he shall make it a sin offering," the lot makes it a sin offering, and not the Name makes it a sin offering.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מְטַמֵּא מִקְדָּשׁ עָנִי שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ מָעוֹת לְקִינּוֹ, וְהֶעֱשִׁיר.
human_translation: raises objection a poor person who defiles the Temple, who designated money for his nest, and he became wealthier,
llm_translation: Challenger: He renders impure the Temple aniy who separated ma'ot for his kinnu, and he became rich.

hebrew_text: אָמַר ״אֵלּוּ לְחַטָּאתִי וְאֵלּוּ לְעוֹלָתִי״ – מוֹסִיף וּמֵבִיא חוֹבָתוֹ מִדְּמֵי חַטָּאתוֹ, וְאֵין מוֹסִיף וּמֵבִיא מִדְּמֵי עוֹלָתוֹ.
human_translation: says: This is for my sin offering and this is for my burnt offering, he adds and brings his obligation from money for his sin offering. But he may not add and bring his obligation from money for his burnt offering,
llm_translation: He said, "These are for my sin offering and these are for my burnt offering" - he adds and brings his obligation from the money of his sin offering, but he does not add and bring from the money of his burnt offering.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא דְּלֵיכָּא לָא לְקִיחָה וְלָא עֲשִׂיָּיה, וְקָתָנֵי: מֵבִיא חוֹבָתוֹ מִדְּמֵי חַטָּאתוֹ, וְלָא מִדְּמֵי עוֹלָתוֹ!
human_translation: But here, that was not purchase nor sacrifice; and teaches he brings his obligation from money a sin offering but not from money a burnt offering.
llm_translation: And here, where there is no acquisition and no action, and it teaches: "He brings his obligation from the money of his sin offering, and not from the money of his burnt offering!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: וְתִסְבְּרַאּ מַתְנִיתָא מְתַקַּנְתָּא הִיא, דְּקָתָנֵי ״וְהֶעֱשִׁיר״? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מְטַמֵּא מִקְדָּשׁ עָשִׁיר שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָנִי – לֹא יָצָא!
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: And can you understand this baraita is properly as it teaches: He became wealthier But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar say Rabbi Oshaya says: A wealthy person who defiles the Temple, who brought offering a poor person not fulfilled
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: And the Mishnah is considered a correction, for it teaches "and he shall make rich"? But didn't Rabbi Elazar say in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: One who renders impure a rich sanctuary by bringing a poor person's offering - he has not fulfilled his obligation!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר? שֶׁכְּבָר אָמַר מִשְּׁעַת עֲנִיּוּתוֹ, הָכִי נָמֵי שֶׁכְּבָר אָמַר מִשְּׁעַת הַפְרָשָׁתוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say? where he already said: at the time he was poor. So too, where he already said at the time he designated
llm_translation: Rather, what do you have to say? For he already said from the time of his poverty, so too it is said from the time of his separation.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי חַגָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא דְּאָמַר יָצָא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? תְּנִי: וְאַחַר כָּךְ לָקַח וְאָמַר.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Ḥagga, says Rabbi Oshaya says fulfilled what can be said? teach And after he purchased and said
llm_translation: To Rabbi Ḥagga, Rabbi Oshaya said: "He has fulfilled his obligation." What is there to say? It was taught: "And afterwards he took and said."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מְצוֹרָע עָנִי שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָשִׁיר – יָצָא, עָשִׁיר שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָנִי – לֹא יָצָא, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי חַגָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא!
human_translation: raises an objection A poor leper who brought the offering of a wealthy person fulfilled a wealthy who brought the offering of a poor person not fulfilled a conclusive refutation of that Rabbi Ḥagga Rabbi Oshaya says.
llm_translation: Challenger: A poor metzora who brought a rich offering - he has fulfilled his obligation. A rich person who brought a poor offering - he has not fulfilled his obligation. This is the rebuttal of Rabbi Chagga. Rabbi Oshaya said!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: שָׁאנֵי גַּבֵּי מְצוֹרָע, דְּמַיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא ״זֹאת״.
human_translation: said to you: is different with regard to leper, as the Merciful One excluded “This
llm_translation: He said to you: the difference regarding a metzora, the Merciful One diminishes "this."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ מְצוֹרָע עָנִי נָמֵי שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָשִׁיר – לֹא יָצָא! לָאיֵי, הָא אַהְדְּרֵיהּ קְרָא ״תּוֹרַת״. וְהָתַנְיָא: ״תּוֹרַת״ – לְרַבּוֹת מְצוֹרָע עָנִי שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָשִׁיר יָצָא. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ עָשִׁיר שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָנִי, שֶׁיָּצָא? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זֹאת״.
human_translation: If so, even a poor leper who brings the offering of a wealthy person as well, not fulfill not so, the verse returned the law As it is taught “the law to include a poor leper who brought the offering of a wealthy person, has fulfilled might even a wealthy who brought the offering of a poor person, he fulfilled the verse states: “This
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, even a poor leper who brought a rich offering - he did not fulfill his obligation! The Gemara asks: Why? The verse repeats the word "Torat." And it was taught in a Baraita: "Torat" - to include a poor leper who brought a rich offering, he fulfilled his obligation. Could it be that even a rich person who brought a poor offering, that he fulfilled his obligation? The verse teaches: "This."

hebrew_text: וְלֵילַף מִינֵּיהּ! אֲמַר קְרָא: ״וְאִם דַּל הוּא וְאֵין יָדוֹ מַשֶּׂגֶת״. מְצוֹרָע, הוּא דְּעָשִׁיר שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָנִי הוּא דְּלֹא יָצָא, אֲבָל מְטַמֵּא מִקְדָּשׁ עָשִׁיר שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָנִי – יָצָא.
human_translation: But derive from that the verse states: “And if he is poor and cannot afford” it is a leper that a wealthy person who brought a poor person’s offering not fulfilled But one who defiles the Temple, a wealthy person who brought a poor person’s offering fulfilled
llm_translation: And he shall wrap around from it! Said scripture: "But if he is poor and his hand cannot reach" (Leviticus 14:21). A metzora, this refers to a wealthy person who brought a poor person's offering, he has not fulfilled his obligation. But one who renders impure the sanctuary, a wealthy person who brought a poor person's offering – he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כְּבָשִׂים קוֹדְמִין אֶת הָעִזִּים בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, יָכוֹל מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן מוּבְחָרִים מֵהֶם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאִם כֶּבֶשׂ יָבִיא קׇרְבָּנוֹ לְחַטָּאת״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם שְׁקוּלִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Lambs precede goats everywhere might due to that are more select than the verse states: “And if he bring a lamb as his offering for a sin offering” teaches that both of them are equal.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon says: Sheep precede goats in every place. Can it be because they are chosen over them? The verse teaches: "But if he brings a lamb as his offering for a sin" - this teaches that both are equal.

hebrew_text: תּוֹרִין קוֹדְמִין לִבְנֵי יוֹנָה בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, יָכוֹל מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן מוּבְחָרִים מֵהֶן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״(תּוֹר וּבְנֵי) [וּבֵן] יוֹנָה אוֹ תוֹר לְחַטָּאת״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם שְׁקוּלִין.
human_translation: doves precede pigeons everywhere might due to that are more select than the verse states: “And a pigeon or a dove for a sin offering” teaches that both of them are equal.
llm_translation: Torin precede the sons of Yonah in every place, can it be because they are chosen from them? The Talmud teaches: "(Tor and the sons) and the son of Yonah or a tor for a sin offering" – teaching that both are equal.

hebrew_text: הָאָב קוֹדֵם לָאֵם בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, יָכוֹל מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכִּיבּוּד הָאָב קוֹדֵם עַל כִּיבּוּד הָאֵם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ אִמּוֹ וְאָבִיו תִּירָאוּ״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם שְׁקוּלִין, אֲבָל אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: הָאָב קוֹדֵם לָאֵם בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא וְאִמּוֹ חַיָּיבִין בִּכְבוֹד אָבִיו.
human_translation: the father precedes the mother everywhere might due to that the honor of the father takes precedence over the honor of the mother. the verse states: “Every man shall fear his mother and his father” teaches that both of them are equal. But the Sages said: the father takes precedence over the mother everywhere, due to that and his mother are obligated in the honor of his father.
llm_translation: The father precedes the mother in every place, can it be that the honor of the father precedes the honor of the mother? The verse teaches: "Each man shall fear his mother and his father" - this teaches that both are equal. But the sages said: The father precedes the mother in every place, because he and his mother are obligated in honoring his father.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה, אִם זָכָה הַבֵּן לִפְנֵי הָרַב – הָרַב קוֹדֵם אֶת הָאָב בְּכׇל מָקוֹם: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא וְאָבִיו חַיָּיבִין בִּכְבוֹד רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: And likewise with regard to Torah study, if the son was privileged before the teacher, the teacher takes precedence over the father, due to that and his father are obligated in the honor of his teacher,
llm_translation: And so in the Talmud Torah, if the son merits before the teacher - the teacher takes precedence over the father in every place: because he and his father are obligated in honoring their teacher.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַרְבַּע צְווֹחוֹת צָוְוחָה עֲזָרָה. צְווֹחָה רִאשׁוֹנָה: הוֹצִיאוּ מִיכָּן בְנֵי עֵלִי, חׇפְנִי וּפִנְחָס שֶׁטִּימְּאוּ אֶת הַהֵיכָל.
human_translation: the Sages taught courtyard cried four cries. The first cry Remove Ḥofni and Pineḥas the sons of Eli from here, as they have rendered the Sanctuary impure
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Four proclamations were made in the Temple courtyard. The first proclamation: The sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, should be removed from here, as they have desecrated the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: צְווֹחָה שְׁנִיָּה: פִּתְחוּ שְׁעָרִים וְיִכָּנֵס יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נִדְבַּאי תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל פִּינְקַאי וִימַלֵּא כְּרֵסוֹ מִקׇּדְשֵׁי שָׁמַיִם. אָמְרוּ עַל בֶּן נִדְבַּאי שֶׁהָיָה אוֹכֵל אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה גּוֹזָלוֹת
human_translation: The second cry Open gates, and let Yoḥanan ben Nedavai, the student of Pinkai, enter and fill his belly with offerings Heaven, They said about ben Nedavai that he would eat four se’a of doves
llm_translation: A proclamation was made: Open the gates and let Yochanan ben Nidbai, the disciple of Pinchas, enter, and let him fill his cup from the vessels of heaven. They said about Ben Nidbai that he would consume forty se'ah of stolen goods.

hebrew_text: בְּקִינּוּחַ סְעוּדָה. אָמְרוּ, כׇּל יָמָיו לֹא הָיָה נוֹתָר בַּעֲזָרָה.
human_translation: for dessert. They said: all the days there was never left over in the courtyard,
llm_translation: In his establishment of a meal. They said, "All his days he did not remain in the courtyard."

hebrew_text: צְווֹחָה שְׁלִישִׁית: שְׂאוּ שְׁעָרִים רָאשֵׁיכֶם וְיִכָּנֵס אֱלִישָׁמָע בֶּן פִּיכַאי תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל פִּנְחָס וִישַׁמֵּשׁ בִּכְהוּנָּה גְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: The third cry Lift your heads, O gates, and let Elishama ben Pikai, the student of Pineḥas, enter and serve as High Priest,
llm_translation: The third proclamation: "Lift up your heads, O gates, and let Elishama ben Pichai, the disciple of Pinchas, enter and serve in the high priesthood."

hebrew_text: צְווֹחָה רְבִיעִית: פִּתְחוּ שְׁעָרִים וְהוֹצִיאוּ יִשָּׂשכָר אִישׁ כְּפַר בַּרְקַאי, שֶׁמְּכַבֵּד עַצְמוֹ וּמְבַזֶּה קׇדְשֵׁי שָׁמַיִם. מַאי הָוֵי עָבֵיד? הֲוָה כָּרֵיךְ שִׁירָאֵי עַל יְדֵיהּ וְהָוֵה עָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: The fourth cry Open gates and expel Yissakhar from the village of Barkai, as he honors himself and desecrates consecrated Heaven. What would he do wrap silk [ shira’ei ] over his hands and perform the service,
llm_translation: The fourth proclamation: Open the gates and bring out Yissachar Ish Kfar Barkai, who honors himself and disgraces the sanctity of Heaven. What did he do? He would tie bundles of barley on his hands and perform labor.

hebrew_text: מַאי סְלִיקָא לֵיהּ? יַנַּאי מַלְכָּא וּמַלְכְּתָא הֲווֹ יָתְבִין. מַלְכָּא אָמַר: גַּדְיָא יָאֵי, וּמַלְכְּתָא אָמְרָה: אִימְּרָא יָאֵי, אֲמַרוּ: נְשַׁיְּילֵיהּ לְיִשָּׂשׂכָר אִישׁ כְּפַר בַּרְקַאי, דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל הוּא וְקִים לֵיהּ קְדֵירָה.
human_translation: What happened to Yannai the king, and the queen were sitting The king said goat is better and the queen said lamb better They said: Let us ask Yissakhar from the village of Barkai, as he is the High Priest and is very familiar with dishes.
llm_translation: What is the outcome for him? King Yanai and Queen Helene were sitting. The king said: "The kid is a male," and the queen said: "The fetus is a male." They said: "Let us give it to Yissaskar, a man from Barkai village, for he is a great priest and has a pot ready."

hebrew_text: שַׁיְילוּהוּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי גַּדְיָא יָאֵי יִיסַּק לִתְמִידָא. בַּהֲדֵי דְּאָמַר אַחְוִי בִּידֵיהּ, אֲמַר לְהוֹן מַלְכָּא: הוֹאִיל וְאַחְוִי בִּידֵיהּ, קוּצוּ לִידֵיהּ דְּיַמִּינָא. יְהֵיב שׁוּחְדָּא, קַצְיוּהּ לִידֵיהּ שְׂמָאלָא. שְׁמַע מַלְכָּא, אֲמַר: לִיקְצְ[יוּהּ] נָמֵי לִידֵיהּ דְּיַמִּינָא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּרִיךְ רַחֲמָנָא דְּשַׁקְלֵיהּ (לְ)יִשָּׂשׂכָר אִישׁ כְּפַר בַּרְקַאי לְמַטְרַפְסֵיהּ.
human_translation: They asked him, he said to them: If goat were better, sacrificed as the daily offering. As he spoke, he signaled with his hand. The king said to Since he signaled with his hand, sever his right hand. gave a bribe, and severed his left hand The king heard and said: Let sever his right hand as well. Rav Yosef said: Blessed is the Merciful One, who took retribution [ lematrapsei ] on Yissakhar of the village of Barkai.
llm_translation: Ask him, he said to them: If a goat is found, let it be given for a continual offering. While he was saying this, a demon came into his hands. The king said to them: Since a demon has come into his hands, cut off his right hand. He gave a bribe, they cut off his left hand. The king heard, he said: Cut off his right hand as well. Rav Yosef said: Blessed be the Merciful One who took Ish Kefar Barkai for his own benefit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי וְלָא הֲוָה תְּנֵי לֵיהּ. דִּתְנַן: כְּבָשִׂים קוֹדְמִין לָעִזִּים בְּכׇל מָקוֹם. יָכוֹל מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמּוּבְחָרִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאִם כֶּבֶשׂ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶן שְׁקוּלִין כְּאַחַת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said, did not study that which we learned Lambs precede goats everywhere might due to that are more select than the verse states: “And if a lamb teaches that both of them are equal.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said, but it was not taught to him. As we learned: Sheep take precedence over goats in every place. Could it be because they are chosen? The verse teaches: "And if a lamb," indicating that both of them are considered equal.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מִקְרָא נָמֵי לָא קְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם כֶּבֶשׂ״, ״אִם עֵז״.
human_translation: Ravina said: not even read the Torah, as it is written “If a lamb” “If a goat
llm_translation: Ravina said: Even though the verse did not actually read, as it is written: "If a lamb," "if a goat."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מַרְבִּים שָׁלוֹם בָּעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכׇל בָּנַיִךְ לִמּוּדֵי ה׳ וְרַב שְׁלוֹם בָּנָיִךְ״ [אַל תִּקְרֵי בָּנֶיךָ אֶלָּא בּוֹנָיִךְ].
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Ḥanina says: Torah scholars increase peace in the world, as it is stated: “And all your children [ banayikh ] shall be taught of the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children [ banayikh ]”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said: The students of the sages increase peace in the world, as it is stated: "And all your children shall be taught of the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children" (Isaiah 54:13).

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַמֵּבִיא אָשָׁם וּסְלִיקָא לָהּ מַסֶּכֶת כְּרִיתוּת
llm_translation: We will return to you, the one who brings a guilt offering, and the conclusion of the tractate Keritot.
